4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. 1 sc in each of last 14 sts. Join. 19 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 13 sts. Join. 16 sts.
9th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Fasten off.

Arms (make 2)
With MC, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
4th to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
10th to 17th rnds: As 8th rnd.
Fasten off.

Spikes (make 1 each in A, C, D and E, make 2 in B)
Beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 4 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st) twice. Join. 6 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts) twice. Join. 8 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts) twice. Join. 10 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts) twice. Join. 12 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts) twice. Join. 14 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts) twice. Join. 16 sts. Fasten off.

Tail
With MC, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 4 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sts.
3rd and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 10 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 14 sts.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
18th rnd: As 6th rnd. 25 sts.
20th rnd: As 8th rnd. 30 sts.
22nd rnd: As 4th rnd.
23rd rnd: As 3rd rnd. Fasten off.

Body
With MC, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 20 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
7th rnd: As 4th rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sts.
9th to 13th rnds: As 4th rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
15th to 18th rnds: As 4th rnd.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
20th to 22nd rnd: As 4th rnd.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
24th to 29th rnds: As 4th rnd.
30th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
31st to 34th rnds: As 4th rnd.
Fasten off.

Head
With MC, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 20 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts). Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts). Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
8th to 11th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
13th to 15th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
Note: Safety eyes should be placed between 13th and 14th rnd, and should be spaced 10 sts apart as shown in photo. Begin stuffing Head as you work.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
17th to 24th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
25th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
26th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 10 sts.
28th rnd: As 27th rnd. 5 sts. Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

FINISHING
Notes:
• Watch how-to video tutorial here for comprehensive finishing instructions.
• Stuff Body, Tail, Spikes (optional), Arms and Legs. Sew Head onto Body as shown in photo and video. Sew remaining pieces to Head and Body as shown in photo and video.

materials: Anchor® Embroidery Floss™ (9 yds/8 m) 1211 or 1207 2 skeins or 18 yds/16 m for each color
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: Approx 2" [5 cm] long x 1½" [4 cm] around.
instructions:
Note: Legwarmers are worked sideways. 
Ch 20 loosely. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 19 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row 10 times more. 
Joining row: Fold Legwarmer lengthwise and sl st foundation chain and last row tog. Fasten off.

pattern_name: BAA RAM EWE CROCHET SHEEP TOY
materials: Bernat® Sheepy™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 149 yds /136 m)
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 10" long x 8" tall [25.5 x 20.5 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.

BODY
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 8" [20.5 cm].
Next rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
Next rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
Stuff Body firmly.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.

FEET (make 4).
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.
Stuff Feet firmly and sew to bottom of Body as shown in photo.

FACE
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Using length of smooth black yarn, embroider facial features on Face as shown in photo.

EARS AND TAIL (make 3)
With A, ch 4.
1st row:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Fasten off.
Sew Ears and Tail to Body as shown in photo.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz /70.9 oz; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) 1 ball or 39 yds/35 m
Contrast A 1 ball or 6 yds/5 m
Contrast B 1 ball of 3 yds/2 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 4" [10 cm] wide x 8" [20.5 cm] long.
instructions:
Note: When joining colors, work to last loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last loops and proceed.

FISH (make 2)
With MC, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 11 sc at end of 5th row.
6th to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Join A at end of last row. 
9th row: With A, as 3rd row. Join B. 13 sc.
10th and 11th rows: With B, as 6th row. Join MC at end of last row.
12th to 16th rows: With MC, as 6th row. Join A at end of last row.
17th row: With A, as 6th row. Join B.
18th and 19th rows: With B, as 6th row. Join MC at end of last row.
20th row: With MC, as 6th row.
21st to 23rd rows: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. Join A at end of last row. 7 sts rem at end of last row.
24th row: With A, as 21st row. Join B at end of last row. 5 sts rem.
25th row: With B, as 21st row. 3 sts rem.
26th row: As 6th row. Join MC. Turn.
27th to 31st rows: With MC, as 3rd row. Turn. Fasten off after last row. 13 sts at end of last row.

FINISHING
With A, embroider eyes using a French Knot.
With WS tog, sew around edges leaving a large enough opening to stuff. Stuff lightly. Sew rem opening closed.

pattern_name: Petal the Rosy Maple Moth Crochet Plush
materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Sunsoaked (10918) 1 ball or 150 yds/137 m
Contrast B Terracotta Rose (10880) 1 ball or 110 yds/100.5 m
Contrast C Coal (10040) 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m)
Contrast D Saffron (06011) 1 ball or 50 yds/46 m
Contrast E Soft Peach (06006) 1 ball or 45 yds/41 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Length of white worsted weight yarn for embroidery
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: Bernat® Blanket™ 7 sc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Bernat® Maker™ 10 hdc and 8 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: Body, Legs, Eyes and Face all worked in continuous rnds. Do not join at end of rnds. Use stitch marker to keep track of beg of rnds and move up as work progresses. See diagrams on page 4. BODY See diagram on page 4. With A, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM. 6 sc. 2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc. 3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc. 4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. 5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc. 6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc. 7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc. 8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc. 9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 54 sc. 10th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Rep 10th rnd until work from beg measures 10" [25.5 cm]. 1st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 48 sc. 2nd and alt rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 3rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 42 sc. 5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 36 sc. 7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sc. 9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sc. 11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sc. 12th rnd: Work as 2nd rnd. Stuff Body firmly with stuffing. 13th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sc. 14th rnd: Work as 2nd rnd. 15th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Draw tail through rem 6 sc and secure. LEGS (make 6 alike) See diagram on page 4. With B, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM. 6 sc. 2nd to 5th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. 6th rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc. 7th to 9th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Sew Legs to Body as shown in photo. FACE See diagram on page 4. With B, ch 6. 1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 2 sc in last ch. PM. 12 sc. 2nd rnd: 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. 18 sc. 3rd rnd: 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 24 sc. 4th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 30 sc. 5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 6th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. EYES (make 2 alike) See diagram on page 4. With C, ch 4. 1st rnd:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in last ch. PM. 8 sc. 2nd rnd: 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. With length of white worsted weight yarn, embroider highlights on Eyes. Sew Eyes to Face as shown in photo. Stuff Face. Sew Face to Body as shown in photo. RIGHT WING See diagram on page 5. With D, ch 5. 1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 3 hdc. 2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 4 hdc. 3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 5 hdc. 4th to 7th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows twice more. 9 hdc. Break D. Join E. 8th to 17th rows: With E, rep 2nd and 3rd rows 5 times more. 19 hdc. Break E. Join D. 18th and 19th rows: With D, rep 2nd and 3rd rows. 21 hdc. 20th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 21st row: (RS). Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 22nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 23rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off. Right Wing Edging 1st rnd: Join B with sl st at any point of edge of Right Wing. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around Wing, having 3 sc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. LEFT WING See diagram on page 5. With D, ch 5. 1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of last 2 ch. turn. 3 hdc. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 4 hdc. 3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 5 hdc. 4th to 7th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows twice more. 9 hdc. Break D. Join E. 8th to 17th rows: With E, rep 2nd and 3rd rows 5 times more. 19 hdc. Break E. Join D. 18th and 19th rows:  With D, rep 2nd and 3rd rows. 21 hdc. 20th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 21st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 22nd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 23rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Fasten off. Left Wing Edging 1st rnd: Join B with sl st at any point of edge of Right Wing. Ch 1. Work sc evenly around Wing, having 3 sc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Sew Wings to Body along straight edge of Wing, leaving 3" [8.5 cm] unsewn at back end of the Wings. Antennae (make 2 alike) With A, ch 7. 1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. 5 hdc. Fasten off. Sew Antennae to body as seam where Face is attached as shown in photo.

materials: Lily ® Sugar’n Cream (70.9 g/2 .5 oz; 109 m /120 yds)
Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) and 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hooks
Small amount of red embroidery floss for mouth
Small amount of black embroidery floss for eyelashes
Small pearl beads for necklace and bracelet
Length of 1 inch [2.5 cm] wide grosgrain ribbon
instructions:
Head
**With MC and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 10 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2 tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
32 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
24 sts.
Stuff Head.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2 tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
16 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.

Body
With MC and smaller hook, ch 30. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc.
30 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 2 ins [5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
24 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4 ins [10 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
18 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Sew bottom edge of Body closed. Stuff Body.

Arms (make 2).
With MC and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc.
8 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4 ins [10 cm]. Fasten off.
Stuff arms lightly.

Legs (make 2).
**Foot: With MC and smaller hook, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc.
10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
24 sc.**
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (Sc2 tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
21 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2 tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2 tog over last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
17 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2 tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc.
14 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Leg measures 5 ins [12.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Stuff Legs.

Finishing
Sew top of Legs closed using whip st. Sew to bottom of Body as shown in picture. Attach Arms to sides of Body. With black embroidery floss, embroider eyelashes. Sew beads to front of Head for eyes. With red embroidery floss, embroider mouth. Make string of small beads 7 ins [18 cm] long for necklace and tie around neck. Make string of small beads 3 ins [7.5 cm] long for bracelet and tie around wrist.

Hair fringe
Cut a piece of tape 11 ins [28 cm] long and secure onto a flat surface with sticky side up. Cut lengths of B 14 ins [35.5 cm] long and lay them across tape so strip of tape is in center of yarn. Holding tissue paper over top of yarn and using sewing machine, run a line of stitching along length of tape. Remove tape when hair is secure. Remove tissue paper after stitching. Pin fringe to outside of head. Using backstitch and B, sew hair into place along sewn line. Fold hair up and secure at top of Head tightly.

Dress
With A and larger hook, ch 34. Join with sl st to first ch, being careful not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc.
34 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 3 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of last 15 sc. Join with sl st to first st. 32 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 3 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of last 14 sc. Join with sl st to first st. 30 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd once more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.

Bodice
Beg working in rows.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 18 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Rep last row twice more.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Ch 5. Sl st in same sp as last sc. (button loop made). Fasten off.
Sew Button to back to correspond with button loop.
Tie Ribbon around waist.

Shoes (make 2).
With B and larger hook, work from ** to ** as given for Foot. Fasten off.
Front Strap: 1st row: Join B with sl st to back loop of 4th sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in back loop of each of next 2 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.
Rep last row 9 times more. Fasten off. Sew cast off edge to opposite side of Shoe.
Back Strap: With B, ch 10. Fasten off. Sew Back Strap to Front Strap as shown in photo.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz /70.9 oz; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Soft Violet (00093), Hot Green (01712),  Rose Pink (00046), Hot Pink (01740), Tangerine (01699)  1 ball or 65 m/71 yds
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball or 10 m/11 yds
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 8” [20.5 cm] wide, including Claws x 5” [12.5 cm] tall, including Eyes.
instructions:
Body
**With MC, ch 7.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 26 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 38 sc.**
6th to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of 9th rnd.
Base
Work from ** to ** as given for Body. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Trace shape of base onto light cardboard. Cut out shape.
With end, sew last rnd of Base to last rnd of Body, leaving an opening to insert cardboard base and stuff Body. Sew opening closed.
Eyeballs (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made) 6 times. Stuff eyeball. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem loops and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.
Eye Stems (make 2)
***With MC, ch 7. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 7 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.***
Sew Eyeball to top of Stem. Sew Stem to top of Body as shown in picture.
Claws (make 2).
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc at end of 4th rnd.
Fold piece in half. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. Fasten off.
Arms (make 2)
Work from *** to *** as given for Eye Stems.
Rep 2nd rnd 3 times more. Fasten off. Stuff Arms. Sew Claw to end of Arm. Sew Arm to Body as shown in picture.
FINISHING
Cut pupils from black felt. Glue pupils to Eyeballs.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Light Gray (0341) 1 ball or 80 yds/73.5 m
Contrast B Real Teal (0656) 1 ball or 40 yds/37 m
Contrast C Gold (0321) 1 ball or 27.5 yds/25 m
Contrast D Petal Pink (0373) 1 ball or 60 yds/55 m
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
Head and Body
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th to 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 11 times. 1 sc in each of last 10 sc. Join. 53 sc.
13th to 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 11 times. 1 sc in each of last 10 sc. Join. 42 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break A. Join B.
Attach safety eyes (see photo for placement) and stuff Head firmly.
22nd rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
24th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
25th to 28th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
29th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Break B. Join with A.
30th rnd: With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
31st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
32nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
33rd to 37th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
38th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
39th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
40th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc. Do not fasten off.
Separate for Legs:
Right Leg: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Ch 3. Skip next 21 sc. 1 sc in each of last 18 sc. Join. 24 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
***Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break A. Join with D.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off leaving a long end.
Draw end tightly through rem sts.***
Left Leg: Join A with sl st to first skipped sc of 42nd rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Join.
Rep from *** to ***.
Skirt: Join B with sl st to first sc of front loops of 28th rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 1 hdc in same sc as sl st. 1 hdc in next sc. *2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 hdc in last sc. Join.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Break B. Join C.
5th rnd: With C, ch 1. *1 sc in next hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. 1 sc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.
Ears (make 2 alike)
Inside Ear: With D, ch 2.
**1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Do not join. 20 sc.
Fasten off.**
Outside Ear: With A, ch 2.
Rep from ** to ** for Outside Ear.
Ear Assembly:
With WS of Inside Ear and Outside Ear tog, join with sl st through both thicknesses to first sc of 4th row. Next row: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses and in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
Fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
Sew each Ear to Head as shown in photo.
Arms (make 2 alike)
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 4 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 1½" [4 cm]. Break A. Join with D.
Next rnd: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off leaving a long end.
Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Sew Arms to Body as shown in photo.
Sleeves (make 2 alike):
With B, ch 2.
1st row: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 6 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Break B. Join C.
4th row: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Ch 2. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row.
Fasten off.
Sew Sleeves over Arms to Body as shown in photo.
Collar
With C, ch 25.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 2 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 2. Sl st in same ch as last dc. Sl st in next ch. Ch 2. 1 dc in same ch as last sl st. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. (2 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch) twice.
Fasten off leaving long end for sewing.
Sew Collar around neck with 2 dc points in front as shown in photo.
Tail
With D, ch 13.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 12 sc.
Fasten off.
Sew Tail to back of Body under Skirt.
Nose:
With length of D, embroider nose using satin stitch as shown in photo.
SATIN STITCH
Finishing Eyes
With length of A, cinch eyes tog as shown in photo, which helps create slightly pointy nose.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 0312 Black A, 0319 Cherry Red B, 0886 Blue C, 0321 Gold D, 0334 Buff E, 0313 Aran F, 0358 Lavender G, 0512 Turqua H, 0672 Spring Green I.
Yarn needle, stitch marker, fiberfill, one pair 6mm safety eyes.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Each gnome measures 8” tall including cap.
instructions:
PAPA
Legs (make 2)
Beginning at shoe, with A, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1 (Right Side): Work (3 sc, 2 hdc, 3 sc) in ring; join 
with slip st in first sc—8 sts. 
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, 2 hdc in each of next 2 hdc 
(for toe), sc in last 3 sc; join with slip st in first sc—10 sts. 
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in 
first sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, [sc2tog] 2 times, sc in last 
3 sc; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc. Fasten off.

Round 5: With Right Side facing, join B with sc in first sc 
of Round 4, sc in each remaining sc around; do not join, 
work in continuous rounds. Place marker for beginning of 
round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 6 and 7: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 8: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times—10 sc. 
Fasten off. Hold both legs together, with toes facing in the 
same direction. Sew tops of legs together, sewing through 
2 stitches at inside of each leg and leaving 8 stitches on 
each leg unsewn. Stuff legs.
Lower Tunic
With C, ch 24; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in 
first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in each ch around; do not 
join, work in continuous rounds—24 sc. Place marker for 
beginning of round. Move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 4 times—20 sc.
Round 3: Sc in next sc; place tunic around top of 
legs, beginning at back of legs, working through both 
thicknesses, sc in 8 unsewn sts of first leg; working in tunic 
sts only, sc in next 2 sc; working through both thicknesses, 
sc in 8 unsewn sts of 2nd leg; working in last tunic st only, 
sc in last sc—20 sc. Fasten off.
Belt
Round 1: Join A with sc at center back of tunic, sc in each 
remaining sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Upper Tunic
Round 1: Join C with sc at center back of belt, sc in each 
sc around; do not join, work in continuous rounds. Place 
marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as work 
progresses.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: Sc in next 4 sc, [sc2tog] twice, sc in next 6 sc, 
[sc2tog] twice, sc in next 2 sc—16 sc.
Round 5: [Sc2tog] 8 times—8 sc. Stuff tunic. Fasten 
off, leaving a long tail for sewing tunic to head. With D, 
embroider a straight stitch square on center, front of belt 
for buckle.
Arms (make 2)
Beginning at hand, with E, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 8 sc in ring; do not join, work 
in continuous rounds—8 sc. Place marker for beginning of 
round. Move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 2 times—6 sc. Fasten off.
Sleeve
Round 4: Join C with sc in first sc of round 3, sc in next 5 sc.
Rounds 5–8: Sc in each sc around. Do not stuff arm.
Round 9: [Sc2tog] 3 times—3 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing arm to tunic.
Head
With E, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work 
in continuous rounds—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of 
round. Move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 4 and 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: Sc in next 9 sc, 3-hdc popcorn in next sc (for 
nose), sc in last 8 sc.
Round 7: Sc in each sc around.
Attach safety eyes, between Rounds 5 and 6, on either 
side of nose. Note: Push posts of safety eyes between 
strands of a stitch, not in space between stitches, to avoid 
allowing the eye to sink back into the head.
Round 8: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 4 times—8 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Stuff head.
Cap 
With B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 4 sc in ring; do not join, work 
in continuous rounds—4 sc. Place marker for beginning of 
round. Move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: Work 2 sc in each sc around—8 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—12 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—16 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—20 sc.
Rounds 10 and 11: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Hair and Beard
Row 1: With F, [ch 3, working  in back bars, slip st in 2nd 
ch from hook and in next ch] 4 times, [ch 4, working  in 
back bars, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch] 4 
times, [ch 5, working  in back bars, slip st in 2nd ch from 
hook and in next 3 ch] 2 times, [ch 4, working  in back 
bars, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch] 4 times, 
[ch 3, working  in back bars, slip st in 2nd ch from hook 
and in next ch] 4 times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for 
sewing hair and beard to cap and face. 
Front Curl (optional)
With F, ch 5, working in back bars, slip st in 3rd ch from 
hook and in next 2 ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for 
sewing curl to underside of cap.

Mustache
With F, [ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch] 
2 times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing mustache 
to face.
FINISHING
Sew arms to sides of body, near top of tunic. Sew head to 
top of tunic. Sew front curl to underside of center front of 
cap. Sew ends of hair and beard piece together to form a 
ring. Sew piece to underside of cap edge, placing seam 
centered at back of cap, and sewing for about ½” on each 
side of seam (to about where ears would be). Place cap 
on head and sew in place. Arrange beard around chin and 
sides of face and sew in place. Sew mustache beneath 
nose. Weave in all ends.

BOY
Legs (make 2)
Work same as papa’s legs through Round 7, using A for 
shoe and D for legs. Work one more round, as follows, 
before finishing leg.
Round 8: Sc in each sc around.  
Round 9: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times—10 sc. 
Fasten off. Hold both legs together, with toes facing in the 
same direction. Sew tops of legs together, sewing through 
2 stitches at inside of each leg and leaving 8 stitches on 
each leg unsewn. Stuff legs.
Lower Tunic
With I, ch 20; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in 
first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with slip st in 
first sc. Fasten off.
Belt
Round 1: Place tunic around top of legs, join A with sc in 
first sc of belt, beginning at back of legs, working through 
both thicknesses, sc in 8 unsewn sts of first leg, sc in next 
2 sc of belt only, working through both thicknesses, sc in 8 
unsewn sts of 2nd leg, sc in last sc of belt; join with slip st 
in first sc—20 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off.
Upper Tunic
With I, work same as papa’s upper tunic.
Arms (make 2)
Work same as papa’s arm, using E for hand, and I for 
sleeve.
Head
Work same as papa’s head.
Cap 
With C, work same as papa’s cap.
Hair
Row 1: With A, [ch 3, working in back bars, slip st in 2nd 
ch from hook and in next ch] 18 times. Fasten off, leaving 
a long tail for sewing hair to cap. Sew last stitch to first 
stitch. Sew hair to underside of cap edge.
FINISHING
Sew arms to sides of body, near top of tunic. Sew head 
to top of tunic. Sew cap to top of head. With B, embroider 
straight stitch mouth below nose.

GIRL
Legs (make 2)
Work same as boy’s legs, using G for shoe and E for leg.
Skirt
With I, ch 48; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in 
first ch.
Round 1 (ruffle): Taking care not to twist ch, sc in first ch., 
sc in next ch, skip next 2 ch, [sc in next 2 ch, skip next 2 
ch] 11 times; do not join, work in continuous rounds—24 
sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up 
as work progresses.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 10 sc, sc2tog, 
sc in next 5 sc—22 sc.
Round 5: Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog, 
sc in next 4 sc—20 sc. Fasten off.
Waistband
Round 1: Place skirt around top of legs, join H with sc in 
first sc of waistband, beginning at back of legs, working 
through both thicknesses, sc in 8 unsewn sts of first leg, 
sc in next 2 sc of waistband only, working through both 
thicknesses, sc in 8 unsewn sts of 2nd leg, sc in last sc of 
waistband; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc. Fasten off.
Blouse
With G, work same as papa’s upper tunic.
Arms (make 2)
Work same as papa’s arm, using E for hand and G for 
sleeve.

Head
Work same as papa’s head.

Cap
Work same as papa’s cap.

Hair
With D, [ch 10, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 3 sc in each of 
next 4 ch, sc in next 4 ch] 5 times, [ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch 
from hook and next ch] 5 times (for bangs), [ch 10, 3 sc in 
2nd ch from hook, 3 sc in each of next 4 ch, sc in next 4 
ch] 5 times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing hair to 
cap. Sew last stitch to first stitch. Sew hair to underside of cap edge, centering bangs at front of cap.
Finishing
Sew arms to sides of body, near top of blouse. Sew 
head to top of blouse. Sew cap to top of head. With B, 
embroider straight stitch mouth below nose.

materials: RED HEART® “Sport”: Octopus – 1 skein each 585 Purple A, 846 Skipper Blue B, and 12 Black C; Starfish – 1 skein each 230 Yellow D, 254 Pumpkin E, and 12 Black C.
Two 18mm safety eyes per toy (not safe for children under the age of 3; instead, use black embroidery floss)
abbreviations: Sc2tog = [Insert hook in front loop only of next st] twice; yo and draw loop through both sts, yo and draw through both loops on hook.
A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Octopus is 6½” tall; Starfish is 5½” across.
gauge: 20 sc = 4”; 16 rounds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
OCTOPUS
Base
With B, adjustable ring.
Round 1: 6 sc in ring. Tighten ring.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Round 4: * Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 5: * Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 32 sts.
Round 6: * Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 40 sts.
Round 7: * Sc in next st, dc in next 3 sts, sc in next st; repeat from * around.
Round 8: * Sc in next 2 sts, dc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Head & Body
With A, work same as Base through Round 3.
Round 4: Sc in each st around.
Round 5: * Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 6: Repeat Round 4.
Round 7: * Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 8: * Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Rounds 9-14: Repeat Round 4.
Begin Short Row Shaping-Row 15: Sc in next 32 sts, slip st in next st; TURN.
Row 16: Skip first sc, sc in next 30 sts, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 17: Skip first sc, sc in next 28 sts, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 18: Skip first sc, sc in next 26 sts, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 19: Skip first sc, sc in next 24 sts, slip st in next st; turn.
Row 20: Skip first sc, sc in next 22 sts, slip st in next st; turn.
End Short Row Shaping-Round 21: Ch 1, sc in each st around – 36 sts.
Round 22: * Sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 23: * Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 24: * Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Rounds 25 & 26: Sc in each st around.
Round 27: * Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 28: * Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 32 sts.
Round 29: * Sc in next st, 2 dc in next st, dc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around – 40 sts.
Round 30: * Sc in next 2 sts, dc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around.
Attach eyes to the points made by the short rows. Match Round 30 of Head & Body to Round 8 of Base. Round 31 will be worked through both layers.
Joining-Round 31: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times; add stuffing; work directions in brackets 2 more times – 48 sts.
Tentacles-Round 32: * Sc in next 3 sts, ch 32, 2 dc in 3rd ch from hook, [2 dc in next ch] 29 times; sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * around – 8 tentacles.
Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FINISHING
With C, embroider smile according to picture. Weave in ends.

STARFISH
Star
With D, adjustable ring.
Round 1: 10 sc in ring. Tighten ring.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 20 sts.
Round 3: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 4: * Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 40 sts.
Round 5: * Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 50 sts.
Round 6: * Sc in next 2 sts, hdc in next st, dc in next st, 2 dc in next 2 sts, dc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around – 60 sts.
Round 7: * Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts, 2 hdc in next 2 sts, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; repeat around.
Round 8: * Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts, (2 hdc, dc) all in next st, (dc, 2 hdc) all in next st, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 70 sts.
Slip st in next st. Attach eyes according to picture. Fasten off, weave in ends.
Back Star
With E, adjustable ring.
Work same as Front Star through Round 8. With Wrong Sides together, match sts. Round 9 will be worked through both layers.
Joining-Round 9: * Sc in next st, ch 3, slip st in side of next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around. When 4 points have been worked, add fiberfill and finish working around last point. Slip st in first st. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FINISHING
With C, embroider smile according to picture. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364yds/333 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Note: All rnds are joined with a sl st to first st. Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Feet (make 2)
With A, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in each of next 2 sts. Join. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 24 sts.
4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. 1 sc in each of the last 14 sts. Join. 19 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 13 sts. Join. 16 sts.
9th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Arms (make 2)
With A, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
4th to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
10th to 17th rnds: As 8th rnd. Fasten off.
Spikes (make 6)
With B, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 4 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st) twice. Join. 6 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts) twice. Join. 8 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts) twice. Join. 10 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts) twice. Join. 12 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts) twice. Join. 14 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts) twice. Join. 16 sts. Fasten off.
Tail
With A, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 4 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sts.
3rd and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 10 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 14 sts.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
18th rnd: As 6th rnd. 25 sts.
20th rnd: As 8th rnd. 30 sts.
22nd rnd: As 4th rnd.
23rd rnd: As 3rd rnd. Fasten off.
Body
With A, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 20 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
7th rnd: As 4th rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sts.
9th to 13th rnds: As 4th rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
15th to 18th rnds: As 4th rnd.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
20th to 22nd rnd: As 4th rnd.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
24th to 29th rnds: As 4th rnd.
30th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
31st to 34th rnds: As 4th rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff body, leaving top open.
Head
With A, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 20 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
8th to 11th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
13th to 15th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
17th to 24th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
Note: Safety eyes should be placed between 13th and 14th rnd, and should be spaced 10 sts apart as shown in photo. Begin stuffing Head as you work.
25th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
26th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 10 sts.
28th rnd: As 27th rnd. 5 sc.
Finishing
Stuff Arms and Spikes, and sew to Body as shown in photo. Sew Legs and Tail to body as shown in photo, stuffing as you work. Refer to tutorial video here for comprehensive finishing instructions.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 774 Light Raspberry
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 22 sc = 4” (10 cm); 20 rows = 4” (10cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 11: Begin trunk, *sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sts.
Round 12: *Sc, sc2tog; repeat from *around, add post and washer eyes on either side of trunk—8 sts.
Rounds 13-16: Sc in each st around.
Round 17: *2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from *around, 2 times—6 sts.
Rounds 18-19: Sc in each st around.
Fasten off, stuff trunk lightly. Using yarn end at trunk in and out of trunk sides, from trunk tip to where it ends at the face. Pull tightly to gather the trunk causing it to turn upwards. Stuff head firmly.
BODY
Join yarn to first st at neck opening.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each st around—10 sts.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around—20 sts.
Round 3: *4 sc, 2 sc in next st; repeat from *around 4 times—24 sts.
Rounds 4-7: Sc in each st around.
Round 8: *2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from *around—18 sts.
Round 9: Sc in each st around.
Round 10: Divide sts for legs; 4 sc, skip 10 sts, sc in last 4 sts, first leg opening made—8 sc worked. Stuff torso.
Rounds 11-15: Leaving skipped sts unworked, sc in each of the 8 leg sts around. Stuff legs as rounds are completed.
Round 16: 2 sc in each st around—16 sts.
Round 17: Sc in each st around.
Round 18: *Sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around end sc —11 sts. Continue to stuff leg.
Round 19: *3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * twice, end sc—9 sts.
Round 20: *Sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 3 times—6 sts. Fasten off, weaving yarn end through hole and pulling tightly to close.
Round 21: Begin 2nd leg; Skip 1 st from leg just made (these sts will be sewn closed after making 2nd leg), join yarn to next st, ch 1, sc in st and next 7 sts around—8 sts.
Round 22: Repeat Rounds 11-20 for 2nd leg. Fasten off as for first leg. Sew opening closed. Weave in ends.
ARMS (make 2)
Ch 6, join with slip st.
Rounds 1-5: Sc in each st around.
Round 6: 2 sc in each st around—12 sts.
Round 7: Sc in each st around.
Round 8: *Sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 4 times—8 sts.
Stuff arm.
Round 9: *2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 2 times—6 sts. Fasten off, weaving tail through hole and pulling tightly to close.
FINISHING
Sew arms in place. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Light: 1 ball each 3825 Bluie A and 3303 Shell B
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Dino measures 11½" (29 cm) across, 8" (20.3 cm) tall.
gauge: 17 sc = 4" (10 cm); 18 sc rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
BODY (make 2)
With A, ch 52. 
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 51 sc. 
Row 2 (wrong side): Slip st in next 2 sc, sc in each st across, turn – 2 slip sts, 49 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in next 44 sts, slip st in next st, turn – 44 sc, 1 slip st.
Row 4: Slip st in next 3 sts, sc in each st across, turn – 3 slip sts, 42 sc.
Row 5: Slip st in next 6 sts, dc in next st, slip st in next 2 sts, dc in next st, slip st in next 2 sts, sc in next 28 sts, sl st in next st, turn – 11 slip sts, 2 dc, 28 sc. 
Row 6: Slip st in next st, sc in next 26 sts, slip st in next st, turn – 2 slip sts, 26 sc.
Row 7: Sc in next 26 sts, turn – 26 sc. 
Row 8: Slip st in next st, sc to last st, slip st in last st, turn – 2 slip sts, 24 sc.
Row 9: Skip 1st slip st, sc in each st across, skip last slip st, turn – 24 sc. 
Repeat Rows 8-9 until 8 sts remain. 
Cut yarn.
BODY BORDER
With right side of Body facing, attach A with a slip st to the corner edge of Row 5 of Body, to the left of the dc eyes. 
Working along the Back Spine:
Round 1: Ch 1, sc evenly around the outside of the piece to the beginning of Row 5, slip stitching into the dc sts for the eyes.
Cut yarn, leaving a 65" (165 cm) yarn tail on one Body piece for seaming.
LEGS (make 4)
With A, ch 17. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 16 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Cut yarn, leaving a long tail for seaming.
FINISHING
Face
With right side facing and with yarn needle and B, embroider eyes in small U shapes onto the dc sts of Row 5. 
Embroider the teeth in a zig-zag line along the lower half of the mouth.
Assemble Body
Thread the 65” (165 cm) tail from the second Body piece. Place Body pieces together with right sides facing and the embroidered piece on top. Whip st the two pieces together, working up over the eyes and around the piece, leaving a small gap at the bottom. Turn the piece right-side out; stuff and stitch to close the gap.
Legs
Fold Leg in half lengthwise. With yarn needle and A, seam both sides to make tall, skinny rectangles. Sew to Body. 
Repeat for remaining Legs.
Back Spine
With right side of Body facing, attach A to Body about 1" (2.5 cm) from the head. 
Working along the top edge of Body:
Row 1: Slip st in next st, sc in next 4 sts, *ch 5, tr cluster, ch 3, slip st in top of tr cluster, ch 5, slip st in bottom of tr cluster, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * until 7 tr clusters are completed total, slip st in next 3 sts.
Cut yarn.
With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein each Pink B and 310 Black C.
Polyester fiberfill, yarn needle, ½ yard ¾”-wide ribbon, pompom maker.
abbreviations: *or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 16 rounds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEAD & BODY
With A, ch 4; join with a slip st into a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join – 16 sts.
Round 3: Repeat Round 2 – 32 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 40 sts.
Rounds 5-12: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Round 13: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join – 32 sts.
Round 14: Repeat Round 5.
Round 15: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 24 sts.
Round 16: Ch 1, * sc in next st, skip next st; repeat from * around; join – 12 sts. Stuff Head with fiberfill.
Rounds 17-18: Repeat Round 5.
Round 19: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join – 24 sts.
Round 20: Repeat Round 5.
Round 21: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 32 sts.
Round 22: Ch 1, * sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 48 sts.
Round 23: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 64 sts.
Rounds 24-32: Repeat Round 5.
Round 33: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sc, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 48 sts.
Round 34: Repeat Round 5.
Round 35: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 36 sts.
Round 36: Repeat Round 5. Stuff Body with fiberfill.
Round 37: Ch 1, * sc in next st, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 24 sts.
Round 38: Repeat Round 37 – 16 sts.
Round 39: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 12 sts.
Round 40: Repeat Round 39 – 9 sts.
Round 41: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, skip next st; repeat from * around; join – 6 sts.
Round 42: [Slip st in next st, skip next st, slip st in next st] 2 times; fasten off.
MUZZLE
With A, ch 4; join with a slip st into a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join – 16 sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, * sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 24 sts.
Rounds 4-6: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Round 7: Ch 1, * sc in next st, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 16 sts. Fasten off. Stuff Muzzle with fiberfill.
NOSE
With B, ch 3; join with a slip st into a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join. Fasten off. Stuff Nose with fiberfill.

FOOT (Make 2)
With A, ch 4; join with a slip st into a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join – 16 sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, * [2 sc in next st] 2 times; sc in next 6 sts; repeat from * around; join – 20 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, * sc in next st, [2 sc in next st] 2 times; sc in next 7 sts; repeat from * around; join – 24 sts.
Rounds 5-10: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Round 11: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 18 sts.
Rounds 12-13: Repeat Round 5.
Round 14: Ch 1, * sc in next st, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 12 sts.
Round 15: Repeat Round 14 – 8 sts.
Round 16: Ch 1, * sc in next st, skip next st; repeat from * around; join – 4 sts.
Round 17: Slip st in next st, skip next st, slip st in next st. Fasten off. Stuff Foot with fiberfill.
Toes: [With A and yarn needle, sew through top of foot and secure] 2 times.

ARM (Make 2)
With A, ch 4; join with a slip st into ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join – 16 sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, * 2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 24 sts.
Rounds 4-7: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Round 8: Ch 1, * sc in next st, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 16 sts.
Round 9: Repeat Round 4.
Round 10: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 12 sts.
Rounds 11-16: Repeat Round 4.
Round 17: Ch 1, * sc in next st, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 8 sts.
Round 18: Ch 1, * sc in next st, skip next st; repeat from * around; join – 4 sts.
Round 19: Ch 1, sc in next st, skip next st, sc in next st, slip st in next st. Fasten off. Stuff Arm with fiberfill.
Fingers: [With A, sew through top of arm and secure] 2 times.

EAR (Make 2)
With A, ch 6; turn.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 4 ch; rotate Ear to work in unused loops of beginning ch, sc in next 5 ch; join – 10 sts.
Rounds 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join.
Round 4: Ch 1, * 2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 15 sts.
Rounds 5-8: Repeat Round 2.
Round 9: Ch 1, * sc in next st, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 10 sts.
Rounds 10-11: Repeat Round 2.
Round 12: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around; join – 8 sts.
Rounds 13: Repeat Round 2.
Round 14: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, skip next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join – 6 sts.
Round 15: Ch 1, * sc in next 2 sts, skip next st; repeat from * around; join – 4 sts.
Round 16: Ch 1, sc in next st, skip next st, sc in next st, slip st in next st. Fasten off. Stuff Ear with fiberfill.
Inner Ear: With B, embroider the center of Ear. Fasten off.

TAIL
With A, make a 1” pompom.

FINISHING
Sew Arms and Feet to body. Secure Tail to back of body. Sew Ears to top of Head and tack sides of each Ear together at base of each ear. Sew Muzzle to front of Head. Run long stitch from center of Muzzle to base of Muzzle and pull tightly; secure and fasten off to form mouth. Sew Nose at join between top of Muzzle and Head. With C, embroider eyes on Head. Weave in ends.
Tie ribbon in bow around neck and trim ends.

materials: Caron International's Simply Soft (100% Acrylic): 4 oz (A), 4 oz (B) Shown in: #9702 Off White (A) and
Caron International's NaturallyCaron.com Country (75% Microdenier Acrylic/25% Merino Wool; 3 oz/85g, 185yds/169m skein): 4 1/2 oz (B) Shown in: #0016 Charcoal (B)
measurements: Toy measures approximately 9 1/2"/24cm tall x 9 1/2"/24cm long
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SPECIAL STITCHES:
double-loop-st: Wrap yarn around index finger twice and hold behind work, insert hook into indicated stitch and between the yarn wraps and your finger, remove your finger from wraps and draw wraps through stitch (leaving part of each wrap on other side of fabric to form loops), yarn over and draw through all loops on hook. Note: Loops form on side of fabric that is facing away from you.
double-loop-st2tog: [Wrap yarn around index finger twice, insert hook into next stitch and between the yarn wraps and your finger, remove your finger from the wraps and wraps through stitch (leaving part of each wrap on other side of fabric to form loops)] twice, yarn over and draw through all loops on hook.
sc2tog: Single crochet 2 together – Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop, (2 loops on hook), insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

NOTES:
1. Stuff sheep as work progresses, unless otherwise instructed.
2. Pieces are worked in continuous rounds; do not join and do not turn at end of rounds. Place a marker to indicate beginning of round and move marker up as work progresses.
3. Work tightly so stuffing won't show between stitches.

BODY:
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Work 2 double-loop-sts in each st around—12 sts.
Round 3: [Double-loop-st in next st, 2 double-loop-sts in next st] 6 times—18 sts.
Round 4: [Double-loop-st in next 2 sts, 2 double-loop-sts in next st] 6 times—24 sts.
Round 5: [Double-loop-st in next 3 sts, 2 double-loop-sts in next st] 6 times—30 sts.
Round 6: [Double-loop-st in next 4 sts, 2 double-loop-sts in next st] 6 times—36 sts.
Round 7: [Double-loop-st in next 5 sts, 2 double-loop-sts in next st] 6 times—42 sts.
Round 8: [Double-loop-st in next 6 sts, 2 double-loop-sts in next st] 6 times—48 sts.
Rounds 9–25: Double-loop-st in each st around.
Round 26: [Double-loop-st in next 6 sts, double-loop-st2tog] 6 times—42 sts.
Round 27: [Double-loop-st in next 5 sts, double-loop-st2tog] 6 times—36 sts.
Round 28: [Double-loop-st in next 4 sts, double-loop-st2tog] 6 times—30 sts.
Round 29: [Double-loop-st in next 3 sts, double-loop-st2tog] 6 times—24 sts.
Round 30: [Double-loop-st in next 2 sts, double-loop-st2tog] 6 times—18 sts.
Round 31: [Double-loop-st in next st, double-loop-st2tog] 6 times—12 sts.
Round 32: [double-loop-st2tog] 6 times—6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Complete stuffing body. Use tail to sew opening closed.

HEAD:
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 7 and 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Rounds 10–19: Sc in each sc around.
Round 20: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 21: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—54 sc.
Round 22: Sc in each sc around.
Round 23: [Sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—48 sts.
Round 24: [Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—42 sts.
Round 25: [Sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog] 6 times—36 sts.
Round 26: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—30 sts.
Round 27: [Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sts.
Round 28: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sts.
Round 29: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sts.
Round 30: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sts.
Round 31: [Sk next st, sl st in next st] 3 times—3 sts.
Fasten off.

FLEECE ON TOP OF HEAD:
With A, ch 2.
Rounds 1–5: Work Rounds 1–5 of body—30 sc.
Round 6: [Double-loop-st in next 4 sc, 2 double-loop-sts in next st] 4 times; in the following, work double-loop st, but wrap yarn around two fingers instead of one (for longer loops), [double-loop-st in next 4 sc, 2 double-loop-sts in next sc] twice—36 sts. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

LEG (make 4):
With B, ch 2.
Rounds 1–6: Work Rounds 1–6 of head—36 sc.
Round 7: Working in front loops only, sc in each sc around.
Rounds 8 and 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc] 3 times—33 sts.
Round 11: [Sc in next 9 sts, sc2tog] 3 times—30 sts.
Round 12: [Sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts] 3 times—27 sts.
Round 13: [Sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog] 3 times—24 sts.
Round 14: [Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts] 3 times—21 sts.
Rounds 15–24: Sc in each st around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

EAR (make 2):
Note: Do not stuff ears.
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—12 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—15 sc.
Round 6–12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 3 times—12 sts.
Round 14: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 3 times—9 sts.
Round 15: Flatten piece and work through both thicknesses, sc evenly across to seam.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

TAIL:
With A, ch 2.
Rounds 1–3: Work Rounds 1–3 of body—18 sts.
Rounds 4–6: Double-loop-st in each st around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING:
Sew legs to lower side of body. Stack black buttons on top of white buttons and sew to head. Sew hair to top of head, placing longer loops in front for bangs. Sew ears to top of head. Sew head to front of body. Sew tail to back of sheep, near top of body. Using yarn needle, weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 886 Blue A, 316 Soft White B, 321 Gold C, and 885 Delft D
6” x 8½” (15 x 21.5 cm) piece of flexible cardboard
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Menorah measures 10” wide x 10” tall (25.5 x 25.5 cm), not including candles. Center candle (“shamash”) measures 4” (10 cm) tall. Regular candles measure 3” (7.5 cm) tall.
gauge: 12 sts = 4” (10 cm); 15 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet.
instructions:
Base and Main Shaft
With A, form an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Work 5 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—5 sc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—10 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—15 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—25 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, *sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—35 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, *sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—45 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 11: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, working in back loops only, *sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next 6 sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—35 sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, *sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 16: Ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—25 sc.
Round 17: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 18: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc.
Round 19: Ch 1, *sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Rounds 20–33: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 34 (form branch slots): Ch 1, sc in next 2 sc, ch 4, skip next 4 sc (branch slot made), sc in next 4 sc, ch 4, skip next 4 sc, sc in last 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc and 2 ch-4 spaces (branch slots).
Round 35: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 36–41: Repeat Rounds 34 and 35 three more times.
Rounds 42–45: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.

Branches (make 8)
Branch #1
With right side facing and larger hook, working in free loops of first ch-4 space (branch slot) made in Round 34, join A with slip st in first ch.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in same ch, sc in next 3 ch, sc in 4 skipped sc of previous round; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Rounds 2–26: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Branch #2
On same side of main shaft as previously made branch, join A with slip st to branch slot in Round 36 of main shaft; repeat Rounds 1–20 of branch #1. Fasten off.
Branch #3
On same side of main shaft as previously made branch, join A with slip st to branch slot in Round 38 of main shaft; repeat Rounds 1–14 of branch #1. Fasten off.
Branch #4
On same side of main shaft as previously made branch, join A with slip st to branch slot in Round 40 of main shaft; repeat Rounds 1–8 of branch #1. Fasten off.
Repeat branches #1–#4 along opposite side of main shaft.

Horizontal Bar
With A, ch 15.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; join with slip st in first sc—14 sc.
Rounds 2–40: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

Cups (make 9)
With A, make an adjustable ring, ch 1.
Round 1 (right side): Work 4 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—4 sc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.

Candles (make 9: 8 regular and 1 shamash (center candle))
With B, form an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 5 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—5 sc. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Rounds 2–9: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Notes: For shamash only, repeat last round 3 more times. For all candles, proceed in rows. 
Next Row: Skip first 2 sc, sc in next sc, skip next sc, slip st in last sc, turn.
Next Row: Skip slip st, slip st in next sc. Fasten off. 

Flame
Row 1: Join C with slip st in slip st of last row, ch 3, (slip st, sc) in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next ch. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Base and Main Shaft 
Roll the cardboard piece, overlapping edges to create a tube that fits inside main shaft. Tape edges and place tube into shaft. Pour polyester pellets around and inside tube to fill the base and stabilize the tube. Firmly stuff polyester fiberfill inside tube and branches.
Horizontal Bar, Branches, and Cups 
Flatten tube with join centered on underside. Working through both thicknesses, join A with slip st at beginning of one open end, slip st across ends of rounds to close opening. Fasten off. Repeat on other end.
Center bar, with join on underside, over top of main shaft and sew in place. Beginning with each branch #4, gently bend branches up and sew ends to underside of horizontal bar. Sew cups along top of horizontal bar, centering one cup above each branch. Insert candles in cups, placing shamash in center cup.

Embroidery (optional)
Using photograph as a guide, with yarn needle and D, backstitch around base and cups to decorate.
Weave in all ends.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Adobe (04923) 1 ball or 130 yds/119 m
Contrast B Driftwood Dreams (04924) 1 ball or 155 yds/142 yds
Size U.S. K/10½ [6.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
2 yards [1.8 m] of black worsted weight yarn for embroidery
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 8" [20.5 cm] wide x 10" [25.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
Mushroom Cap
Notes: 
• Mushroom Cap is worked as a spiral to ruffled section. Place marker on first st of rnd and move marker each rnd to keep place. 
• Ch 1(2) at beg of rnd does not count as st.
With A, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. 
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Note: Unworked back loops from this rnd will be used to attach Body to Cap. 
5th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 32 sc. 
6th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 

Mushroom Body
Note: All rnds of Body are joined with sl st to first st. 
With B, ch 24. Join in rnd with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist chain. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 24 sc.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 36 hdc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 42 hdc.
10th to 13th rnds: As 6th rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 36 hdc.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
16th rnd: Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 3 dc in each hdc around. Join. 90 dc. Fasten off.
Fold Body in half with seam at back of work. Sew base of Body closed, using unworked back loops from 16th rnd. 

Mushroom Cap Spots (make 2.)
With B, beg using magic loop method. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 5 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail to sew to Cap.
Sew Spots to Cap as shown in photo. 

Cheeks (make 2)
With A, beg using magic loop method. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail to sew to Body.
Sew Cheeks to Body as shown in photo.

Embroider eyes as shown in photo using satin stitch and black  worsted weight yarn.
SATIN STITCH
Using backstitch and black worsted weight yarn, embroider Mouth as shown in photo.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) Blue Monster Contrast A Hot Blue (01742) 2 balls Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball
Pink Monster Contrast A Hot Pink (01740) 2 balls Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball
Orange Monster Contrast A Tangerine (01699) 2 balls Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball
Green Monster Contrast A Hot Green (01712) 2 balls Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
White piece of felt for eyes and teeth
abbreviations: Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in top of dc
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
