measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] tall, excluding legs, ears, eyes and other grown parts.
instructions:
Monster Body
**With A, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
8th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
9th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
10th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sc.
11th rnd: As 9th rnd. 
12th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sc.
13th to 23rd rnds: As 9th rnd. 
24th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sts.
25th rnd: As 9th rnd.
26th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
27th rnd: As 9th rnd. 
28th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sts.
29th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sts.
30th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.
Stuff Body. 
31st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
32nd rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
33rd rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
34th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sts. Break yarn, leaving a long end. 
Thread end through rem sts and pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Legs (make 2). 
With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first sc to form a ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join A with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.  
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 3 dc in each of next 2 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join B with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
Next rnd:  Working in back loops only, with B, ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
Next rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next st. Join with sl st to first st. 
Stuff Leg. 
Next rnd:  Ch 1. Working in both loops only, (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in next st. Join with sl st to first st. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off. 
Sew bottom seam. 
Blue Monster
Ears (make 2).
With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first sc to form a ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join A with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.  
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 3 dc in each of next 2 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join B with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
6th rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last st. Join A with sl st to first sc. 21 sts.
7th rnd: With A, ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 2 dc in next sc. 2 tr in each of next 3 sc. 2 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Sew Ears and Legs in position. 
With white felt cut out eyes and moustache (see Diagrams on page 4). Gather moustache at center and sew in position. 
With sewing thread, sew Eyes in position.
With black yarn, embroider Eyes using satin stitch.
Pink Monster
Eyes (make 3). 
With A, ch 14. Join with sl st to first sc to form a ring. 
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first st. 10 sts.  
4th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 8 times more.  
Next rnd:  Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.  
Next rnd:  Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
Next rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd 3 times more. 
Next rnd:  Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
Next rnd:  Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 sc. 
Fasten off. Break A, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts. 
Pull tightly and fasten securely. 
Stuff eyes. Sew Eyes and Legs in position (see picture). Cut out circles with white felt. Sew in position with sewing thread. With black yarn embroider eyes, using satin stitch and straight stitch for eyelashes.
Using Diagram on page 4, cut out teeth with white felt. Bend in arch and sew in position with sewing thread. 
Orange Monster
Ears (make 2). 
With A, ch 10. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows twice more. 15 sc.
Next 3 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: (RS). Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.   
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows until 5 sts rem. 
Fasten off. 
Fringe: Cut B 2" [5 cm] long. Taking 1 strand for each fringe knot into fringe around ear avoiding foundation chain and spacing fringe evenly between knots. Trim fringe evenly.
Pleat Ear along foundation chain and sew in position (see picture). 
Sew Legs in position.
Cut out circles with white felt (see Diagram). With black yarn, embroider eyes using satin stitch. Sew in position with sewing thread. 
Using Diagram, cut out teeth with white felt. Sew in position with sewing thread.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Baby Shower™ (170 yds/155 m)
Bunny Version - Contrast A Yellow (7330) 1 ball
Bunny Version - Contrast B White (0100) 1 ball
Bear Version - Contrast A Dark Dogwood (8820) 1 ball
Bear Version - Contrast B Natural (8010) 1 ball
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Pink embroidery floss (for Bunny Teether only)
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Bunny: Approx 7" [18 cm] tall, including ring. Bear: Approx 5" [12.5 cm], including ring. Both characters: Head approx 2" [5 cm] diameter.
instructions:
Notes
• Each Teether is made from 8 pieces: Head, Nose, 2 Ears, 2 Eyes, Ring Cover, and Ruff.
• Head, Nose, Ring Cover, and Ruff are worked the same for both Teethers.
• Separate instructions are provided for Bunny Nose, Ears and Eyes and for Bear Nose, Ears, and Eyes.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc/st.

HEAD
With A, make an adjustable ring: Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work stitches of first round in the ring. After the first round of stitches is worked, pull gently on tail to tighten ring.

1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st in first sc. 8 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.

4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.

5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.

6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.

7th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sts.

14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog, *1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.

15th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first st. 12 sts.

Fasten off, leaving a 12-18" [30.5-45.5 cm] long tail. Stuff head firmly. Thread long tail through rem sts and pull to close opening. Secure end but do not cut tail, it will be used later to sew Head to covered ring.

BUNNY NOSE
With A, make an adjustable ring as given for Head.
1st to 4th: As 1st to 4th rnds of Head. 32 sc at end of last rnd.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With yarn tail, sew Nose to Head adding a very small amount of polyfill to Nose as you sew.

BUNNY EARS (make 2)
With A, ch 6, leaving a long tail for sewing Ear to Head.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Turn. 7 sc.

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

4th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 9 sc.

5th row: As 3rd row.

6th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in next st) twice. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 11 sc.

7th to 9th rows: As 3rd row.

10th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 9 sts.

11th and alt rows: As 3rd row.

12th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in first 2 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 7 sts.

14th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in first st. Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 5 sts.

16th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.

17th row: As 3rd row.

Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Using photograph as a guide, sew Ears to Head.

BUNNY EYES (make 2)
Cut two ¾" [19 mm] circles from black felt. Using photograph as a guide, applique Eyes to Head. With white embroidery floss, embroider outline stitch along lower edge of each Eye. With white embroidery floss, embroider a French knot on each Eye as highlight.

BEAR NOSE
With A, make an adjustable ring, as given for Head.
1st to 3rd rnds: As 1st to 3rd rnds of Head. 24 sc at end of last rnd.

4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With yarn tail, sew Nose to Head adding a very small amount of polyfill to Nose as you sew.

BEAR EARS (make 2)
With A, make an adjustable ring, as given for Head.
Row 1: 4 sc in ring. Turn. 4 sc.

Row 2: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 2 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 8 hdc.

Row 3: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Using photograph as a guide, sew Ears to Head.

BEAR EYES (make 2)
Cut two ½" [13 mm] circles from black felt. Using photograph as a guide, applique Eyes to Head. With white embroidery floss, embroider outline stitch along lower edge of each Eye. With white embroidery floss, embroider a French knot on each Eye as highlight.

RING COVER
With B, ch 23.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 21 hdc.

2nd to 5th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.

Joining row: Wrap cover over ring and bring first and last row tog with sts matching. Working through both thicknesses, slip st in each st across to attach cover to ring.

Fasten off and weave in end.

RUFF
With B, ch 16.
1st row: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 sc.

2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 60 sc.

Fasten off at end of last row, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
With yarn tail still attached to Head, sew Head to center of Ring Cover. Place Ruff around base of Head, where it is joined to Ring Cover. With yarn tail still attached to Ruff, sew short ends of Ruff together. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat Maker® Minis Kit includes 10 balls (50 g/1.7 oz each; 500 g/17.6 oz total), yardage (58 m/63 yds each; 560 m/610 yds total)
Contrast A Yellow 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Contrast B Brown 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast C White 1 ball or 7.5 yds/7 m
Contrast A Green 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Contrast B Brown 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast C White 1 ball or 7.5 yds/7 m
Contrast A Blue 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Contrast B Brown 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast C White 1 ball or 7.5 yds/7 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
2 x 5/16" [1 cm] safety eyes for each Bumble Bee
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Note: Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd.
BUMBLE BEE
Body
With A, ch 2. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM on first st. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th and 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Join B at end of 8th rnd.
9th and 10th rnds: With B, 1 sc in each sc around.
11th and 12th rnds: With A, 1 sc in each sc around.
13th and 14th: With B, 1 sc in each sc around.
15th to 17th rnds: With A, 1 sc in each sc around.
18th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
19th rnd: * 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
20th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
Stuff Bumble Bee firmly and attach safety eyes as shown in photo.
21st rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw end through rem sts.
Wings (make 2)
With C, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Turn.
2nd row: Sl st in each of first 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off.
Sew Wings to Body at first B stripe as shown in photo.
Antennae
With B, ch 20. Fasten off and weave in ends.
With crochet hook, draw Antennae through Body above eyes as shown in photo. Tie knots in Antennae as close to Body as possible to secure.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 242 yds/221 m)
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4 black safety eyes ¼" [6 mm] for both Versions.
Susan Bates® Split-Lock Stitch Count Markers.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] from tip of nose to rolled up tail
instructions:
Version 1: Green as Color 1. Purple as Color 2. Turquoise as Color 3. Version 2:  Turquoise is Color 1. Multi is Color 2. Purple is Color 3.
Note: Do not join at end of rnd. 
Work in continuous rnds (spiral). 
Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
VERSION 1
Head: With Color 1, beg at tip of nose, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in last 3 sc. 18 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
7th to 12th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.

VERSION 2
13th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts. Fasten off, leaving long end of yarn. Stuff Head. Do not close opening.

Face Features
Eye (make 2)
With Color 3, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end of yarn. Place a safety eye in center of each eye. Sew eyes in place.
Eyebrow (make 2).
With Color 1, ch 7.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 4 ch. Sl st in last ch. Fasten off, leaving a long end of yarn. Sew Eyebrow in place above eyes.
Crest for Top of Head:  (make 2) 
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st row: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 10 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
With WS facing, sew 2 pieces tog. Sew in place. Set head aside.

Body and Tail
Note: Do not break color not in use. Carry color not in use up side of work.
Beg at front of body with Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
7th to 9th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around, joining Color 2 at end of 9th rnd.
10th and 11th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around, changing to Color 1 at end of 11th rnd.
12th and 13th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around, changing to Color 2 at end of 13th rnd.
14th to 17th rnds: As 10th to 13th rnds.
18th and 19th rnds: As 10th and 11th rnds. Fasten off Color 1. 20th rnd: With Color 2. 1 sc in each sc around.
21st rnd: (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 18 sts. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 24 sts.
22nd rnd: (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 18 sts. Stuff body.
23rd rnd: (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 12 sts.
Stuff Tail lightly as you go.
24th to 27th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
28th rnd:  *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 9 sts.
29th to 35th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
36th rnd: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 7 sts. 8 sts.
37th to 42nd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
43rd rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 6 sc. Do not stuff.
44th and 45th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Leg (make 4).
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
2nd to 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Stuff Legs.
1st row: Fold 6th rnd flat. Working through both thicknesses , work 3 sc across top of folded edge. Turn.
2nd row: *Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch.* Sl st in first sc of 1st row. Rep from * to *. 1 sc in next sc of 1st row. Rep from * to *. 1 sc in last sc of 1st row. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread yarn through from bottom of foot to top of leg. Sew Legs in place. Sew Head in place. Roll up tail and secure.

materials: RED HEART® Soft: One ball each: 4420 Guacamole A, 9440 Light Grey Heather B, 2515 Turquoise C, 4600 White D, 4614 Black E.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5 mm [US I-9], 4.0mm [US G-6]
Three 5⁄8” (15.9 mm) buttons, sewing thread to match buttons, sewing needle, yarn needle, fiberfill stuffing, stitch markers
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Clothes designed for 18” (45.5 cm) doll. Coat measures: 7” (18 cm) wide x 9½” (24 cm) long. Ear Flap Hat measures: 12” (30.5 cm) in diameter. Wristers measure: 2” (5 cm) long. Boots measure: 4” (10 cm) high. Dog measures: 8” (20.5 cm) high x 12” (51 cm) long.
gauge: With 5.5 mm [US I-9] hook, 12 sc = 4” (10 cm); 15 rows sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com 
©2014 Coats & Clark
RedHeart.com
Walking the Dog for Dolls
Crochet the perfect puppy for your doll, and 
then crochet the warm coat and accessories 
to take him on a cool morning or evening 
walk. Pattern includes Coat, Ear Flap Hat, 
Wristers and Boots.

Right Front
Row 20 (Right side): Ch 1, sc 
in next 8 sc; turn—8 sc.
Rows 21-25: Ch 1 sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 26: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in 
next 6 sc; turn—7 sc.
Row 27: Ch 1, sc in next 5 sc, 
sc2tog; turn—6 sc.
Row 28: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in 
next 4 sc; turn—5 sc.
Row 29: Ch 1, sc in next 3 sc, 
sc2tog; turn—4 sc.
Rows 30-32: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; 
turn. At end of Row 32, fasten off, leaving 
a long tail for seaming later to Back.

Left Front
Using 5.5 mm [US I-9] hook, join 
A to beginning of Row 19.
Rows 20-32: Repeat Rows 
21-32 of Right Front.

Back
Skip first 2 sc of unworked middle 
section of Coat. Using 5.5 mm [US I-9] 
hook, join A to next sc of Row 19.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc in next 18 sc, leave 
last two sc unworked; turn—18 sc.
Rows 21-29: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; 
turn. At end of Row 29, fasten off.

Assembly
Using long tails, sew Left Front to first 
4 sc of Back and sew Right Front to 
last 4 sc of Back. Weave in all ends.

Special Stitches
sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next 
st] twice, yarn over and draw 
through all 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog = [draw up a loop in next 
st] 3 times, yarn over and draw 
through all 4 loops on hook.

Notes
1. Unless otherwise noted, always work under
both loops of the stitch in the row below.
2. For sections worked in rounds, place
marker for beginning of round and move
marker up as each round is completed.
3. To change color, work last stitch of old
color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new
color and draw through all loops on hook to
complete stitch. Proceed with new color.

COAT
Using 5.5 mm [US I-9] hook with A, ch 39.
Row 1 (Wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from 
hook and each ch across; turn—38 sc.
Rows 2-19: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.

COLLAR
Using 4.0 mm [US G-6] hook with A, join 
yarn to Right side of Row 26 of Right Front.
Row 1: Ch 1, work 1 sc in the side of each 
Row of Rows 26-32 of Right Front, work 10 
sc across Back, work 1 sc in the side of each 
Row of Rows 32-26 of Left Front; turn—24 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in 
next sc, sc in next 20 sc, 2 sc in next 
sc, sc in last sc; turn—26 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next 
sc, sc in next 10 sc, [2 sc in next sc] 
twice, sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next 
sc, sc in last sc; turn—30 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in 
next sc, sc in next 26 sc, 2 sc in next 
sc, sc in last sc; turn—32 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next 
sc, sc in next 13 sc, [2 sc in next sc] 
twice, sc in next 13 sc, 2 sc in next 
sc, sc in last sc; turn—36 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. 
Fasten off; weave in ends.

Left Placket
Using 5.5 mm [US I-9] hook with A, join yarn 
to Wrong side of Row 1 on left edge of Coat.
Row 1: Ch 1, work 1 sc in the side of each 
Row of Rows 1-25 of Coat; turn—25 sc.
Rows 2-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. 
At end of Row 4, fasten off; weave in ends.

Right Placket
Using 5.5 mm [US I-9] hook with A, join yarn 
to Wrong side of Row 25 on right edge of Coat.
Row 1: Ch 1, work 1 sc in the side of each 
Row of Rows 25-1 of Coat; turn—25 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3 (Buttonholes): Ch 1, sc in next 2 sc, 
ch 2, skip 1 sc, sc in next 9 sc, ch 2, skip 
1 sc, sc in next 9 sc, ch 2, skip 1 sc, sc in 
next 2 sc; turn—22 sc, three ch-2 spaces.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch-2 
space across—25 sc. Fasten off; weave 
in ends. Using thread, sew Buttons to 
Left Placket, making sure they line up 
with Buttonholes in Right Placket.

Arm (Make 2)
Using 5.5 mm [US I-9] hook with A, 
join yarn to 2nd unworked sc of armpit 
on Right side of Row 19 of Coat.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in same sc; work 
23 sc evenly around sides of armhole; 
sc in last unworked sc of armpit; slip 
st in first sc to join; turn—25 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc 
in next 19 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc; slip 
st in first sc to join; turn—23 sc.
Rounds 4-5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc 
in next 17 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc; slip 
st in first sc to join; turn—21 sc.
Rounds 7-8: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc 
in next 15 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc; slip 
st in first sc to join; turn—19 sc.
Rounds 10-15: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn. At end of 
Round 15, fasten off; weave in ends.

WRISTERS (Make 2)
Using 5.5 mm [US I-9] hook with B, ch 12; 
slip st in top of beginning chain to join.
Round 1 (Wrong side): Ch 1, sc in 2nd ch 
from hook and each ch across; turn—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next 5 sc, ch 2, skip 
2 sc, sc in next 5 sc; slip st in first sc to 
join; turn—10 sc, one ch-2 space.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in 
next ch-2 space, sc in next 5 sc; slip 
st in first sc to join; turn—12 sc.
Rounds 4-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn. At end of 
Round 6, fasten off; weave in ends.

BOOTS (Make 2)
Using 5.5 mm [US I-9] hook with E, ch 6.
Round 1 (Right side): Work 3 sc in 2nd 
ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, 3 sc in 
last ch; rotate work so opposite side of 
foundation chain is on top, sc in last 3 ch; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next 3 sc, [2 sc in next 
sc] 3 times, sc in next 3 sc, [2 sc in next sc] 3 
times; slip st in first sc to join; turn—18 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 
3 times, sc in next 3 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in 
next sc] 3 times, sc in next 3 sc; slip st in first 
sc to join; turn—24 sc. Change color to B.
Round 4: With B, ch 1, sc in front loops only 
around; slip st in first sc to join; turn—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, working in both loops, 
sc in next 13 sc, [sc2tog in next sc] 
3 times, sc in next 5 sc; slip st in 
first sc to join; turn—21 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in next 3 sc, [sc2 tog 
in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 12 sc; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn—18 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in next 11 sc, [sc2tog 
in next sc] 3 times, sc in last sc; slip 
st to first sc to join; turn—15 sc.
Rounds 8-17: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn. At end of 
Round 17, fasten off; weave in ends.

EAR FLAP HAT
Using 5.5 mm [US I-9] hook with C, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch 
from hook; slip st to first sc to join; turn—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc] 6 times; 
slip st to first sc to join; turn—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 
6 times; slip st in first sc to join; turn—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 
2 sc in next sc] 6 times; slip st in 
first sc to join; turn—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, 
2 sc in next sc] 6 times; slip st in 
first sc to join; turn—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, 
2 sc in next sc] 6 times; slip st in 
first sc to join; turn—36 sc.
Rounds 7-14: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn. At end of 
Round 14, fasten off; weave in ends.

Right Ear Flap
With Right side facing, skip first 5 sc 
of Round 14 of Ear Flap Hat. Using 5.5 
mm [US I-9] hook, join C in next sc.
Row 1 (Right side): Ch 1, sc in same 
sc and next 7 sc; turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in 
next 6 sc; turn—7 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in 
next 5 sc; turn—6 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in 
next 4 sc; turn—5 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in 
next 3 sc; turn—4 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in 
next 2 sc; turn—3 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next sc; turn—2 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc2tog. Fasten 
off; weave in ends.

Left Ear Flap
With Right side facing, skip next 10 sc 
of Round 14 of Ear Flap Hat. Using 5.5 
mm [US I-9] hook, join C in next sc.
Rows 1-8: Repeat Rows 1-8 of Right Ear Flap.

Hat Border
With Right side facing and using 5.5 
mm [US I-9] hook, join A to first sc 
of Round 14 of Ear Flap Hat.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in next 5 sc, work 1 sc in 
the side of each Row of Rows 1-8 of Right 
Ear Flap, ch 15, slip st in 2nd ch from hook 
and next 13 chs, work 1 sc the side of each 
Row of Rows 8-1 of Right Ear Flap, sc in next 
10 sc, work 1 sc in the side of each Row of 
Rows 1-8 of Left Ear Flap, ch 15, slip st in 
2nd ch from hook and next 13 chs, work 1 
sc the side of each Row of Rows 8-1 of Left 
Ear Flap, sc in last 5 sc; slip st in first sc to 
join—52 sc. Fasten off; weave in ends.

DOG
Gauge is not critical for this item. Work tightly 
so stuffing does not show through stitches. 
Body
Using 4.0 mm [US G-6] hook with B, ch 2.
Round 1 (Wrong side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch 
from hook; slip st in first sc to join; turn—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc] 6 times; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 
6 times; slip st in first sc to join; turn—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 
2 sc in next sc] 6 times; slip st in 
first sc to join; turn—24 sc.
Rounds 5-21: Ch 1, sc in each sc 
around; slip st in first sc to join; turn.
Round 22: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 
times; slip st in first sc to join; turn—18 sc.
Round 23: Ch 1, [sc, sc2tog] 6 times; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn—12 sc.
Round 24: Ch 1, sc2tog 6 times; slip st in first 
sc to join—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long 
tail for sewing. Sew closed; weave in ends.

Legs (Make 4)
Using 4.0 mm [US G-6] hook with D, ch 2.
Round 1 (Wrong side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch 
from hook; slip st in first sc to join; turn—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc] 6 times; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; slip st 
in first sc to join; turn. Change color to B.
Rounds 4-10: Ch 1, sc in each sc 
around; slip st in first sc to join; turn.
Round 11 (Hips): Ch 1, sc in first 
6 sc; do not join; turn—6 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 
2 sc, sc2tog; turn—4 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, [sc2tog] in next 2 sc—2 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff 
Legs lightly; sew all 4 Legs to Body, referring 
to photo for placement. Weave in all ends.

Head
Using 4.0 mm [US G-6] hook with B, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch 
from hook; slip st in first sc to join; turn—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc] 6 times; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 
6 times; slip st in first sc to join; turn—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 
2 sc in next sc] 6 times; slip st in 
first sc to join; turn—24 sc.
Rounds 5-8: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn.
Round 9: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 
times; slip st in first sc to join; turn—18 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 
times; slip st in first sc to join; turn—12 sc.
Rounds 11-12: Ch 1, sc in each sc 
around; slip st in first sc to join; turn.
Round 13: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc] 6 times; 
slip st in first sc to join—24 sc. Fasten 
off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff 
lightly; sew Head to Body, referring to 
photo for placement. Weave in ends.

Snout
Using 4.0 mm [US G-6] hook with D, ch 6.
Round 1 (Right side): Work 3 sc in 2nd 
ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, 3 sc in 
last ch; rotate work so opposite side of 
foundation chain is on top, sc in last 3 ch; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in next 3 sc, [2 dc 
in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 3 sc, 
[2 dc in next sc] 3 times; slip st in 
first sc to join; turn—12 dc, 6 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, dc in next 6 sts, sc in next 
3 sts, dc in next 6 sts, sc in last 3 sts; slip 
st in first dc to join; turn—12 dc, 6 sc.
Rounds 4-5: Ch 1, sc in each st around; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc; 
do not join; turn—4 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, 
sc in last sc; turn—3 sc.
Rounds 8-10: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Round 11: Ch 1, sc3tog—1 st. Fasten 
off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff 
lightly; sew Snout to Head, referring to 
photo for placement. Weave in ends.

Nose
Using 4.0 mm [US G-6] hook with E, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch 
from hook; slip st in first sc to join; turn—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; slip 
st in first sc to join. Fasten off, leaving 
a long tail for sewing. Stuff lightly. 
Referring to photo, sew Nose to Snout 
and embroider Mouth. Weave in ends.

Eyes (Make 2)
Using 4.0 mm [US G-6] hook with E, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, work 4 sc 
in 2nd ch from hook; slip st in first sc to 
join—4 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for 
sewing. Referring to photo for placement, 
embroider a French knot in the center of 
each Eye using D, and sew Eyes to Head.

Ears (Make 2)
Using 4.0 mm [US G-6] hook with B, ch 8.
Round 1 (Wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch 
from hook, sc in next 5 ch, 3 sc in last 
ch; rotate work so opposite side of 
foundation chain is on top, sc in last 6 ch; 
slip st in first sc to join; turn—15 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc, 3 dc in 
each of next 3 sc, sc in next 6 sc—12 
sc, 9 dc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for 
sewing. Sew Ears to Head, referring to 
photo for placement. Weave in ends.

Tail
Using 4.0 mm [US G-6] hook with D, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch 
from hook; slip st in first sc to join; turn—6 sc.
Rounds 2-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; slip 
st in first sc to join; turn. Change color to B.
Round 7: With B, ch 1, sc in each sc 
around; slip st in first sc to join; turn.
Rounds 8-13: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; 
slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off, leaving 
a long tail for sewing. Referring to photo for 
placement, sew Tail to Body. Weave in ends.

Collar
Using 4.0 mm [US G-6] hook with C, ch 21.
Row 1 (Right side): Ch 1, sc in 2nd 
ch from hook and each sc across; 
turn—20 sc. Change color to A.
Row 2: With A, ch 1, sc in each sc 
across; turn. Change color to C.
Row 3: With C, ch 1, sc in each sc 
across; fasten off, leaving a long tail 
for sewing. Place Collar around Neck; 
sew sides together. Weave in ends.

Leash
Using 4.0 mm [US G-6] hook with 
E, join yarn to Collar; ch 50.
Row 1: Slip st in 11th ch from hook 
and remaining 39 chs—10 ch, 40 slip 
sts. Fasten off; weave in ends.

pattern_name: FLORAL FUN CROCHET MOTIF BALL TOY
materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
gauge: 11 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Motif = 5½" [14 cm] at widest point (each side edge measures approx 3½" [9 cm] long).
instructions:
Motif 1: Make 6 using A as Color 1; B as Color 2, C as Color 3.
Motif 2: Make 6 using D as Color 1; E as Color 2, F as Color 3.
MOTIF
With Color 1, ch 4.
1st rnd: 9 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 10 dc). Join with sl st to top of first dc (top of ch-4). Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st in sp between any 2 dc. Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 2 dc. 4 dc in next sp between 2-dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of first ch-3. 20 dc (5 clusters of 4-dc).
3rd rnd:  Sl st in each of next 2 sps (ending in sp at center of 4-dc cluster from 2nd rnd). Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 6 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 4 dc. 7 dc in next sp (center of 4-dc cluster from 2nd rnd). Rep from * to last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of first ch-3. 35 dc (5 clusters of 7-dc). Fasten off.
4th rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st in first dc (top of ch-3). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 scbl in each of next 6 dc. Working around 2nd and 3rd rnds, 1 hdc in next sp 3 rnds below (1st rnd). *1 scbl in each of next 7 dc. Working around 2nd and 3rd rnds, 1 hdc in next sp 3 rnds below. Rep from * to last sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sts.
Note: Hdc in rnds below will cause Motif to cup. Push dc clusters to RS to form slightly raised “petals" of flowers.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 7 sts. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Flat Sl St Joining:  With A and RS facing, sl st Motifs tog to form 2 halves of ball as shown in Assembly Diagram, working through back loops only and keeping yarn to WS to create Flat Sl St ch detail (see diagram). With A and Flat Sl St Joining method established, join 2 halves of Ball tog, inserting stuffing at halfway point. Fasten off.
Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi Prints™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 242 yds/221 m)
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 black safety eyes 1/4" [6 mm] for each toy.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Version 1: Prints as Color 1, Black as Color 2, White as Color 3. 
Version 2: Yellow as Color 1, Black as Color 2, White as Color 3. 
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Body
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th to 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
13th and 14th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
16th to 22th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sts.
24th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
25th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
26th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
Secure safety eyes to Body as shown in photo. Stuff Body firmly.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
28th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join. 6 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Nose
With Color 1, ch 4.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 8 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off at end of 3rd row. Stuff Nose. Sew to Body as shown in picture.
With Color 2, using Stem stitch, embroider eyebrows and using Straight st, embroider Nostrils as shown in picture. See diagrams on page 3.
Ears (make 2)
With Color 2, ch 3, leaving a long end for sewing.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 2. Sl st in each of first 2 sc. Ch 2. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Sl st in same sp as last sl st.
Fasten off. Sew Ears to Body as shown in photo.
Horns (make 2)
With Color 3, ch 4, leaving a long end for sewing. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 4 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Join. 2 sts. Fasten off. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Stuff Horns firmly. Sew Horns to Body as shown in photo.
Arms (make 2)
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 4 sc.
2nd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long end for sewing.
Sew Arms to Body as shown in photo.
Belly
With Color 3, ch 4.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 3 sc in next ch. Working into opposite side of foundation chain, 1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 20 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Sew Belly to Body as shown in photo.
Tail
With Color 1, ch 18, leaving a long end for sewing. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 18 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 3 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Stuff Tail firmly. Sew Tail to Body as shown in photo.
Spikes (make 4)
With Color 3, ch 4, leaving a long end for sewing.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off. Sew Spikes to Body and Tail as shown in photo.
Wings (make 2)
With Color 2, ch 2.
1st row: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. Turn. 6 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. Turn. 8 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. Turn. 10 sc.
6th row: *Ch 2. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Join Color 1. Do not turn. Break Color 2.
Wing edging:1st row: With Color 1, ch 1. Working down straight edge of Wing, work 6 sc evenly across.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Sew Wings to Body as shown in photo.
Straight Stitch Stem Stitch

materials: lily® sugar ‘n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) (00002 Black)
note: 2 balls will make 1 large and 5 small spiders
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: small: Approx 5” [12.5 cm] long; large: Approx 8½” [21.5 cm] long.
instructions:
small spider
Body: **With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.**
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
6th to 10th rnds: As 4th rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc2tog made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
12th rnd: As 4th rnd.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
Stuff Body.
neck: 14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts.
Head: 15th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
17th to 19th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
Stuff Head.
21st rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc. Fasten off.
legs (make 2 sets).
With A, ch 24. *Turn chain up-side down. Sl st in 2nd bump from hook and each bump, created by chain to end of chain.* Ch 28. Rep from * to * once more. Ch 30. Rep from * to * once. Ch 26. Rep from * to * once.
FinisHing
Insert wire into Legs. Sew 2 sets of Legs to bottom of Spider. Shape Legs. Sew 1 bead to top of back for decoration. Glue googly eyes in position.

large spider
Body: Work from ** to ** as given for Small Spider.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
7th rnd: As 5th rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
10th to 14th rnds: As 5th rnd.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sts.
16th and 17th rnds: As 5th rnd.
18th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.
19th and 20th rnds: As 5th rnd.
21st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
22nd and 23rd rnds: As 5th rnd.
24th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
25th and 26th rnds: As 5th rnd.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
28th and 29th rnds: As 5th rnd.
Stuff Body.
Head: 30th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
31st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
32nd to 35th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
36th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sts.
Stuff Head.
37th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 10 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sts.
38th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 sts. Fasten off.
legs (make 2 sets).
With A, ch 30. *Turn chain up-side down. Sl st in 2nd bump from hook and each bump, created by chain to end of chain.* Ch 32. Rep from * to * once more. Ch 34. Rep from * to * once more. Ch 32. Rep from * to * once more.
FinisHing
Insert wire into Legs. Sew 2 sets of Legs to bottom of Spider. Shape legs. Sew beads to top of back for decoration. Glue googly eyes in position.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) or Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) or Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Bright Pink (12042) or Gold (10970) or Bright Lime (12041) or Light Teal (10734) or Baby Lilac (04310) 2 balls or 420 yds/384 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Two 3/4" [2 cm] black safety eyes and one 3/8" [1.5 cm] black safety nose
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Note: Toy is worked in a continuous spiral. Do not join rounds (rnds). There are no chains (ch) worked at beginning (beg) of rnd unless otherwise indicated; simply work directly into next stitch (st), noting marker to indicate end of rnd will move up each rnd.
HEAD
Ch 2.
See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: 6 single crochet (sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker on last st. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Repeat (Rep) from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
8th to 16th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
17th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
18th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
19th to 23rd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
24th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 dc.
25th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
26th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
27th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
28th to 41st rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
42nd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
43rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
44th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
45th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
Remove hook and pull up yarn in last chain to attach eyes, nose and insert stuffing at this point.
Attach safety eyes and nose following manufacturer’s instructions. Stuff Head and Body firmly with polyfill stuffing.
46th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
47th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
48th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts remaining (rem).
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end onto yarn needle and draw tightly through rem sts. With a length of yarn, cinch eyes together to create shape in the face.
ARMS AND LEGS (make 4 alike)
Ch 2.
See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker on last st. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Rep 3rd rnd until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm]. Fasten off.
Stuff Arms and Legs with polyfill stuffing firmly and sew to Body as shown in photo.
EARS (make 2 alike)
Ch 2.
See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker on last st. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 16 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Rep 4th rnd until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm]. Fasten off.
Sew Ears to Head as shown in photo. Fold Ear in half. Using whipstitch, sew 1 Ear to each side of Head.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.5 mm [US E-4]
Optional: Knee high stocking and plastic pellets for weighted stuffing.
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 21 sts = about 4" [10 cm]; 25 rounds = about 4" [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL TO THIS PROJECT. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SKULL
Beginning at top of skull, with A or B, ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: Sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 5 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st—24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 5 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts—36 sc.
Round 7: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: Sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 5 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts—48 sc.
Rounds 9–17: Sc in each st around.
Begin stuffing piece with fiberfill or place optional knee high, filled with plastic pellets, into place. Continue stuffing piece with fiberfill as work progresses.
Round 18: Sc in next 3 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts] 5 times, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts—42 sc.
Round 19: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 20: Sc in next 2 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts] 5 times, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts—30 sc.
Rounds 21–26: Sc in each st around.
Round 27: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times—24 sc.
Stuff piece.
Round 28: Sc in next st, [sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts] 5 times, sc2tog, sc in next st—18 sc.
Round 29: [Sc2tog] 9 times—9 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Secure tail and weave to inside of skull.

FLOWER EYES (make 2 for each skull)
Note: If you are making A-colored skull, work Round 1 with C and Round 2 with D. If you are making B-colored skull, work Round 1 with D and Round 2 with C.
Ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 10 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—10 sc. 
Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, draw up a loop of next color in same sc as joining slip st, [ch 2, 2 dc in next st, ch 2, slip st in next st] 5 times—5 petals. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing flower eye to skull. Weave in beginning tail.

HEAD FLOWERS (make 3 for each skull)
Note: If you are making A-colored skull, make 1 flower each with B, C and D. If you are making B-colored skull, make 1 flower each with A, C and D.
Ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 10 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—10 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 2, 2 dc in same st as joining slip st, ch 2, slip st in next st, [ch 2, 2 dc in next st, ch 2, slip st in next st] 4 times—5 petals.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing flower to skull. Weave in beginning tail.

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, use yarn tails or yarn scraps to sew the following pieces together.
1. Sew flower eyes to front of skull.
2. Sew head flowers to top of skull, positioned as desired. Use contrasting color yarn to embroider a star stitch through the center of flowers and to top of head, leaving petals free.

Facial Features
Note: If you are making A-colored skull, embroider features with B. If you are making B-colored skull, embroider features with A.
Mouth: Using photograph as a guide, embroider straight stitch mouth. Embroider a long horizontal line then embroider short vertical lines evenly spaced over the top of the horizontal line.
Nose: Using photograph as a guide, embroider two chain stitches for nostrils. Position the narrow ends of the chain stitches together at top and between eyes for top of nose. Position the wide ends of the chain stitches about two rounds below and side by side.
Weave in and trim any remaining ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein each 324 Bright Yellow A, 312 Black B, and 311 White C.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 20 rnds = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEAD AND BODY: Begin at top of head with A, ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc. 
Rnd 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 30 sc. 
Rnds 6-12: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 13: [Dec] 15 times – 15 sc.
Neck-Rnd 14: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 3 times – 12 sc. 
Body-Rnd 15: [Inc] 12 times – 24 sc.
Rnds 16 and 17: Sc in each sc around. Cut A. Stuff Head.
Rnds 18-21: With B, sc in each sc around. Cut B.
Rnds 22-24: With A, sc in each sc around.
Rnd 25: [Dec] 12 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 26: [Dec] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off. Finish stuffing. 
Weave yarn tail through remaining 6 sc, draw up firmly to gather; fasten securely.

WING (Make 2): With C, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in next ch, 6 dc in last ch; working on opposite side of ch, dc in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, sc in last 2 ch; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in next 2 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next st, 2 dc in each of next 6 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in last 2 sts; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, slip st in each st around. Fasten off.
Sew in place on back of bee.

LEG (Make 6): With B, ch 7; 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in last 5 ch. Fasten off.
Sew in place.

FEELERS (Make 2): With B, ch 10; slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off.

Sew button eyes in place or embroider black French knot eyes. Embroider red smile.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Main Color (MC) Vintage White (10006) 2 balls
Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (5.3 oz/150 g; 108 yds/98 m) Contrast C Carrot Orange (13002) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 yds (1.8 m) super bulky weight yarn in black for mouth.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
Scfl = Single crochet in front loop only of next stitch
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] wide by 26" [66 cm] tall.
instructions:
Note: All rnds are joined with a sl st to first sc.
Body
With MC, begin using magic loop method, demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
8th rnd: As 6th rnd.
9th rnd:  Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 sc.
10th rnd: As 6th rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 sc.
12th to 33rd rnds: As 6th rnd.
34th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 sc.
35th rnd: As 6th rnd.
36th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 60 sc.
37th rnd: As 6th rnd.
38th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 50 sc.
39th rnd: As 6th rnd.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Sew 3 large buttons to front of Body as shown in photo.
Stuff Body with stuffing. Top should rem open.
Nose
With C, ch 6.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of last 2 ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Head 
With MC, begin using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1.  10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
8th rnd: As 6th rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 70 sc.
10th rnd: As 6th rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 80 sc.
12th to 19th rnds: As 6th rnd.
20th rnd: Break MC. Join B. Ch 1. 1 scfl in each st around. Join.
21st rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 70 sc.
22nd rnd: As 6th rnd.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
24th rnd:  Break B. Join A. Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st around. Join.
25th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sc.
26th rnd: As 6th rnd.
Sew on button eyes and carrot nose. Using black yarn, backstitch on mouth as shown in photo. Begin stuffing Head as you work.
27th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
28th rnd: As 6th rnd.
29th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
30th to 42nd rnds:  As 6th rnd.
43rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
44th rnd: As 6th rnd.
45th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.
46th rnd: As 6th rnd.
47th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sc.
48th rnd: As 6th rnd.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Draw tail through rem sts and draw closed. Rest Head in rem opening of Body and stitch in place.
Pompom
Wind A around 4 fingers approx 40 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to smooth round shape. Attach pompom to Hat as shown in photo.
Scarf
With B, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next 3 ch. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Scarf measures 42" [106.5 cm]. Fasten off. Cut lengths of yarn 6" [15 cm] long. Taking 2 strands tog, knot into fringe evenly across both ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly. Wrap Scarf around Snowman’s neck.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz /170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2(3)tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approximate measurement of items not specified.
instructions:
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as a st.

Maki Roll
With A, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. With B, join with sl st to first hdc. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Rep 8th rnd until work from 7th rnd measures approx 4" [10 cm]. Join A at end of last rnd.
Shape top: Next rnd: With A, ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 50 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 sts. Stuff Maki Roll.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) 10 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

Avocado (make 2)
With E, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
Fasten off.

Salmon (make 2)
With C, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off.

Carrot (make 2)
With D, ch 3.
1st row: 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew 1 each of Avocado, Salmon, and Carrot to top and bottom of Maki Roll. With A, embroider mouth and eyes as shown in picture.

Shrimp Nigiri
Rice
Note: Turn at end of each rnd to work RS and WS rnds.
With A, ch 6.
1st rnd: (RS). 3 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 6 hdc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 3 hdc in last ch. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn. 16 hdc.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
5th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. 3 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
6th rnd: Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
7th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Rep last rnd until work from 6th rnd measures approx 5½" [14 cm], ending on a RS rnd.
Next rnd: (WS). Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. Turn.
Next rnd: Ch 2. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. (Hdc3tog) twice. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc3tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

Shrimp
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last st. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not break C. Join A.
8th and 9th rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 17 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 sl st in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 18 sc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first st. 1 hdc in each of next 17 sts. 1 sc in next st. 1 sl st in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 18 sts. Join with sl st to first hdc. Do not break A, Join C.
11th and 12th rnds: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not break C. Join A.
14th and 15th rnds: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
16th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Do not break A, Join C.
Rep 11th to 16th rnds once more. Break A.
Next 3 rnds: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sts.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 10 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

With A, embroider line down center of Shrimp.

Tail (make 2).
With C, ch 10.
1st rnd: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each of next 6 ch. 6 hdc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation chain, 1 hdc in each of next 7 ch. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Tail to end of Shrimp. With A, chain stitch through both thicknesses down center of Shrimp. Sew Shrimp to Rice as shown in picture. With B, embroider face on Shrimp Nigiri as shown in picture.

Hand Roll
With B, ch 3.
1st rnd: 4 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. 4 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 8 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 4th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 12 hdc.
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
7th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 3 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
9th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 4 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
11th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 5 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 28 hdc.
13th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 6 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 hdc.
15th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
16th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 7 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 36 hdc.
17th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
18th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 8 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc.
19th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
20th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 9 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 44 hdc.
21st rnd: As 3rd rnd.
22nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 10 hdc. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Rep from * to last st. 2 hdc in last hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc. 48 hdc.
Break B.
23rd rnd: Join A. With A, ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc.
24th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 10 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 44 sts.
25th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 9 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 sts.
26th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of first 2 hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * to last 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 30 sts. Stuff Hand Roll.
25th rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 sts.
26th rnd: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) 10 times. Join with sl st to first hdc. 10 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

Cucumber
With E, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Fasten off.

Salmon (make 2)
With C, ch 3.
1st row: 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.

Carrot
With D, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew Avocado, Salmon, and Carrot to top of Hand Roll. With A, embroider mouth and eyes as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each 9401 Elephant A, 9600 White B, and 9200 Baby Yellow C
Small amount of black yarn (for face)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Bear measures 12” (30.5 cm) tall, without crown.
gauge: 10 sc = 2” (5 cm) in pattern; CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Beginning at top of head, with A, ch 6.
Round 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch—12 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in last 2 sc—18 sc.
Round 3: Work 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in last 2 sc—24 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each sc.
Round 11: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—48 sc.
Rounds 12–16: Sc in each sc.
Round 17: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc. Stuff leg with fiberfill.
Round 18: [Sc2tog] 9 times—9 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Second Leg
Round 1 (right side): With wrong side of unworked sts of body facing, join A with sc in front loop of first unworked st after first leg, working in front loops only, sc in each remaining st, turn; working in unworked loops of first 6 sts, sc in each loop—12 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–18: Work same as Rounds 2–18 of first leg.
Arm (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—15 sc.
Rounds 4–17: Sc in each sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff arm with fiberfill. Flatten last round; holding edges together, sew through both thicknesses to close arm.
Ear (make 2) 
Work same as arm through Round 6—15 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 3 times—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Do not stuff. Flatten last round; holding edges together, sew through both thicknesses to close ear.
Snout 
With B, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Crown
With C, ch 26.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—25 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 6, *slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, tr in next ch, skip next 3 sc, slip st in next sc, ch 6; repeat from * 4 times, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, tr in next ch, skip next 3 sc, slip st in last sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew first 2 rows together to form circle.
FINISHING
Stuff snout lightly with fiberfill. Using photograph as a guide for all pieces, sew snout to front of head, ears to sides of head, and arms to sides of body. Place crown off-center between ears and sew to top of head.
With black yarn and satin stitches, embroider eyes and nose; embroider mouth with straight stitches under nose.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Handicrafter Cotton® (1.75 oz/50 gr; 80 yds/73 m)
Size U.S. G or 6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
(Make 2 pieces alike). Ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. Rep last row 3 times more, ending with 18 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last row 6 times more.
Tail: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Fasten off.
Head: With WS of work facing, join yarn with sl st to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn. 7 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 3 sc in first st. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn. 8 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each sc to last st. 2 sc in last st. 10 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 2. Turn.
Next row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last 2 rows twice more. 13 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. Sc3tog over next 3 sts. Fasten off.
Joining Back and Front: Place Back and Front tog. Join yarn with sl st to first ch of foundation ch, working through both thicknesses. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each sp around, stuffing lightly as you work 3 sc in top of Tail and point of nose. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
With blue thread, embroider eye as shown in picture. Tie ribbon around neck.
