materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket Tiny™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 316 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Black embroidery thread for eyes and nose.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Front and Back (make 2 alike)
With B, ch 23.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 22 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece measures approx 3½" [9 cm], ending on a WS row.
Next row: (RS). Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around next sc. Dcbp around next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 hdc in last sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in top of ch 2. Break B. Join A.

Head: 1st row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Shape Head: Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 20 sts.
Rep last row, dec 2 sts every row to 10 sts. Fasten off.

Arms (make 2)
**With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.**
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Break A, join B with sl st to first st. 12 sts.
7th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 6 times more, stuffing very lightly (to maintain floppiness of limbs) as you work. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

Legs (make 2)
Work from ** to ** as given for Arms.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 12 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first st.
Rep last rnd 7 times more, stuffing very lightly as you work. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

Ears (make 2)
With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 4 times. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st to first st. 4 sts.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.

FINISHING
With WS of Front and Back facing each other, sew edges tog, leaving opening for stuffing. Stuff Body. Sew rem edge closed.
Attach Arms and Legs.
Sew Ears to top of Head.
With Black embroidery thread, embroider eyes using French knots and nose using satin st.
French Knots Diagram Satin St Diagram

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m: Ombres: 2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m)
Main Color (MC) Batik Ombre (02446) or Robins Egg (01215) 1 ball
Contrast A Hot Orange (01628) or Hot Green (01712) 1 ball
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Optional: Ball and bell cat toy to replace stuffing.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 3” [7.5 cm] in diameter, excluding fins.
instructions:
BODY
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Work ing in back loops only, (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. Join MC with sl st to first sc. Break A. 6 sc.
3rd rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. Draw up a loop in next st. (Yoh and draw through 1 loop on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook – 1 sc picot (scp) made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. 1 scp in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
6th to 8th rnds: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 1 scp in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. 1 scp in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 18 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 scp in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 12 sts.
Stuff Body lightly. Optional: Insert ball and bell toy.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 6 sts. Fasten off.

Tail
Folding last rnd of Body flat and working through both thicknesses, join A with sl st to first sc.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first sc. 3 dc in each of next 2 sc.
Fasten off.

Fins (make 2)
With A, ch 4.
1st row: 4 dc in 4th ch from hook.
Fasten off.

Eyes (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

Finishing
Sew Fins and Eyes to Body as seen in picture. With MC, embroider pupils in center of Eyes with French knots.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each of 4614 Black A, 4600 White B, 4601 Off White C, 9440 Light Grey Heather D, 4604 Navy E, 9518 Teal F, 1882 Toast G, and 9344 Chocolate H.
RED HEART® Classic™: 1 skein 258 Peachy I.

Yarn needle, stitch markers, 1 pair 9mm safety eyes, 2 pairs 10-11mm safety eyes, stuffing, sewing needle, sewing thread (yellow, brown, and light blue), light blue craft felt (for Prince’s sash), yellow craft felt (for crown on Pram), black craft felt (if not using safety eyes).
abbreviations: A, B, C, … = Color A, B, C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Prince and Princess each measure 10” (25.5cm) tall; Baby measures about 6” (15cm) long; Pram measures 6” long x 4” wide x 5” high, (15 cm long x 10 cm wide x 13.7 cm high)
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2013 Coats & Clark
The Royal Family
Have fun creating your own crochet version of the Royal Family! We’ve included the Prince, Princess, Royal Baby and an elegant Pram so that they can enjoy a family stroll around the palace.

Additional Supplies

Special Stitch
sc2tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

Embroidery Stitches
Running Stitch = Draw the needle and yarn in and out of the fabric in a line, creating a dash pattern.
Back Stitch = Draw needle and yarn through fabric from back side to front side (starting point), draw needle and thread through from front side to back side about ½” (1.5cm) to the right, *draw needle and thread through from back side to front side about ½” (1.5cm) to the left of starting point of previous stitch (starting point of next stitch), draw needle and thread through from front side to back side at starting point of previous stitch; repeat from * to create a solid line of stitches.
French Knot = Draw needle and yarn through fabric from back side to front side, hold yarn close to where it exits the fabric and wind it 3 or 4 times around the needle. Holding yarn down firmly, re-insert the needle close to the yarn’s original exit point and draw the needle through leaving a knot on the surface.

Outer Shell Sides (make 2)
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Row 1: Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work back and forth in rows, turn—6 sc.
Note: Always skip the ch-1 at the beginning of a row. Work the first stitch into the first sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, turn—9 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, turn—12 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times, turn—15 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 3 times, turn—18 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] 3 times, turn—21 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] 3 times, turn—24 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Outer Shell Center
With A, ch 11.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—10 sc.
Rows 2–24: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Inner Lining Sides (make 2)
With C, make an adjustable ring.
Rows 1–6: Work same as Rows 1–6 of Outer Shell Sides—21 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Inner Lining Center
With C, ch 9.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—8 sc.
Rows 2–24: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Hood
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Rows 1–7: Work same as Rows 1–7 of Outer Shell Sides—24 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, [sc2tog, sc in next 6 sc] 3 times, turn—21 sc.
Rows 9–12: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Wheel (make 4)
With B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—5 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–26: Sc in each sc around, firmly stuffing wheel every 5 rounds.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Axles and Handle (make 5)
With D, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—5 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–16: Sc in each sc around, lightly stuffing 3 pieces every 5 rounds (for Axles and Handlebar), leave the other 2 pieces unstuffed (for sides of Handle).
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Assembly
1. Sew long curved edge of one Outer Shell Side to one long edge of Outer Shell Center. Sew long curved edge of other Outer Shell Side to opposite long edge of Outer Shell Center. Sew Inner Shell Lining Sides to Inner Shell Lining Center in same manner.
2. Nest the Inner Lining inside the Outer Shell. Working through both thicknesses, join A with sc in top edge, sc evenly around top edge to join pieces together; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
3. Sew open end of each Wheel to first round to form a tire (donut) shape. Sew two Wheels to each side of Pram. The top of each Wheel should sit about 2 rows below top edge of Pram.
4. Position one Axle so that its ends line up in the center of the front two Wheels. Sew the Axle to the underside of the Pram. Repeat to position and attach the rear Axle. With D, sew 'spokes' between the inside edge of each Wheel and the end of the Axle (see diagram #1: spoke diagram).
5. With last row of Hood forming edge of front opening of Hood, sew lower edge of Hood to back half of Pram.
6. Flatten the two Handle sides and place them parallel to each other. Place the Handlebar across one end of the Handle sides and sew in place. Roll the Handle sides completely around the Handlebar until the first seams are reached. Sew a few more stitches to secure (see diagram #2: handle diagram). Sew remaining ends of Handle sides to the front of the Pram.
7. Using the Pram Crown template, cut two crown patches from yellow felt. With sewing needle and yellow thread, sew one crown to each side of Hood using a running stitch.

PRINCE
Head and Body
Beginning at top of Head with I, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times—12 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Rounds 6–11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Sc2tog, sc in next sc] 8 times—16 sc.
Round 13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 4 times—12 sc.
Change to E to begin body.
Round 15: Working in back loops only, [sc2tog, sc in next sc] 4 times—8 sts.
Round 16: Sc in each sc around.
Round 17: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 4 times—12 sc.
Round 18: Working in front loops only, 2 sc in each sc around—24 sc.
Round 19 (shape shoulders): Sc in next 8 sc, dc in next 4 sc, sc in next 8 sc, dc in next 4 sc.
Rounds 20–23: Sc in each st around.
Round 24: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] 4 times—20 sc.
Round 25: Sc in each sc around.
Round 26: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 5 times—15 sc.
Rounds 27–29: Sc in each sc around.
Round 30: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 5 times—20 sc.
Rounds 31–36: Sc in each sc around.
Round 37: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 4 times—24 sc.
Round 38: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Arm (make 2)
Beginning at Hand with I, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc.
Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc2tog, sc in next sc] 3 times—6 sc.
Change E to begin sleeve.
Round 7: Working in front loops only, 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Rounds 8–12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times—9 sc.
Rounds 14–16: Sc in each sc around.
Stuff sleeve only.
Round 17: [Sc2tog, sc in next sc] 3 times—6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Shoe (make 2)
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times—12 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times—15 sc.
Rounds 5–11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times—12 sc.
Stuff lightly.
Round 13: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Weave in end securely.

Jacket Detail
With A, ch 21.
Row 1 (belt): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—20 sc.
Change to E.
Row 2: Working in front loops only, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 3–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Ear (make 2)
With I, make an adjustable ring.
Row 1: Work 5 sc in ring; do not join, work back and forth in rows, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Nose
With I, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Assembly
1. Attach safety eyes: Determine center front of Head by identifying the shoulders (double crochet stitches of Round 19 of Body). Attach eyes to center front of Head between Rounds 8 and 9 with 4 or 5 stitches between them. You may also use felt circles or embroider French Knots with A instead of using safety eyes.
2. Sew Nose between eyes.
3. Stuff Head and upper Body. With yarn needle and E, beginning at lower edge of Body, sew a running stitch or back stitch line through both thicknesses up the center of the piece to separate the legs, sewing up to Round 31. Stuff each pant leg, leaving the lower edges open (see diagram #3: pant diagram).
4. Sew the edges of the A-colored portion (belt) of the Jacket Detail together, leaving the E-colored section free. Slip Jacket Detail over the legs and sew belt around waist with the free edges of the E-colored section facing the front.
5. With Round 13 of Shoes in the back, sew the lower open edges of the legs to the tops of the Shoes.
6. Flatten and sew the open Arm edges shut and sew each Arm to the double crochet stitches (shoulders) of Round 19 of Body.
7. Coat Details: With yarn needle and A, sew a back stitch line up the center front of the Jacket beginning at the belt and ending at the chin. With yarn needle and B, embroider 3 or 4 French Knots evenly spaced close to the A-colored line for buttons.
8. With right side facing front, sew Ears to sides of Head. With yarn needle and G, embroider lazy daisy stitch above each eye for eyebrows. With yarn needle and A, sew a straight stitch mouth below the Nose.
9. Hair: Cut 60–70 strands of G, each about 4” (10cm) long. Attach strands to Head as if attaching fringe (see Special Techniques). After all strands are attached, use yarn needle to separate the plys. Trim hair to desired length.
10. Using The Prince Sash template, cut a sash from light blue felt. Fold the sash over the shoulder so the ends overlap at the opposite hip. With sewing needle and light blue thread, sew the overlapped ends to the hip to secure.

PRINCESS
Head and Body
Beginning at top of Head with I, make an adjustable ring.
Rounds 1–17: Work same as Rounds 1–17 of Head and Body for Prince, do not change color before Round 15, work all rounds with I—12 sc at the end of Round 17.
Round 18: Work 2 sc in each of next 6 sc; change to F to begin neckline, 2 sc in each of last 6 sc—24 sc.
Round 19: With F, sc in next 2 sc; change to I, sc in next 8 sc; change to F, sc in last 14 sc.
Round 20: With F, sc in next 4 sc; change to I, sc in next 4 sc; change to F, sc in last 16 sc.
Continue with F only for body.
Rounds 21–23: Sc in each sc around.
Round 24: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 25: Sc in each sc around.
Round 26: [Sc2tog, sc in next sc] 6 times—12 sc.
Rounds 27–29: Sc in each sc around.
Round 30: Work 2 sc in each sc around—24 sc.
Round 31: Sc in each sc around.
Change to I.
Round 32: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] 4 times—20 sc.
Rounds 33–38: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Arm (make 2)
Beginning at Hand with I, make an adjustable ring.
Rounds 1–6: Work same as Rounds 1–6 of Arm for Prince—6 sc.
Change F to begin sleeve.
Rounds 7–17: Work same as Rounds 7–17 of Arm for Prince—6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Shoe (make 2)
Make same as Shoes for Prince.

Tops of Feet (make 2)
With I, make an adjustable ring.
Row 1: Work 8 sc in ring; do not join, work back and forth in rows, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Dress Collar
With F, ch 22.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—21 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Hat
With F, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times—12 sc.
Round 4: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Skirt
With F, ch 18.
Round 1: Sc in first ch to form a ring, sc in each remaining ch around; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—18 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] 3 times—21 sc.
Rounds 7–13: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Ear (make 2)
With I, make an adjustable ring.
Row 1: Work 5 sc in ring; do not join, work back and forth in rows, turn—5 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Nose
With I, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Assembly
1. Attach safety eyes: Determine center front of Head by identifying the front neckline. Attach eyes to center front of Head between Rounds 8 and 9 with 4 or 5 stitches between them. You may also use felt circles or embroider French Knots with A instead of using safety eyes.
2. Sew Nose between eyes.
3. Stuff Head and upper Body. With yarn needle and I, beginning at lower edge of Body, sew a running stitch or back stitch line through both thicknesses up the center of the piece to separate the legs, sewing up to Round 31. Stuff each leg, leaving the lower edges open (see diagram #4: pant diagram).
4. Flatten and sew the open Arm edges shut and sew each Arm to the shoulders at Round 19 of Body.
5. Sew the Dress Collar over the neckline taking care to join the ends at the back of the neck. Slip the skirt over the legs and sew to waist. Roll/fold up the skirt hem and sew a few stitches around the skirt to secure the hem in place.
6. Sew Tops of Feet to the front edges of each leg opening. With Round 13 of Shoes in the back, sew the lower open edges of the legs and Tops of Feet to the tops of the Shoes.

materials: Contrast A Whitey White (59005) 2 balls or 160 yds/145 m
Contrast B Blue Ice (59745) or Denim (59114) 2 balls or 160 yds/145 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Notes: Ch 3 at beg of rnd counts as dc. To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed in new color.
Head and Body: With A, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.  
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.  
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. 
4th and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc. 
11th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc. 
13th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sc. Place marker at end of rnd. 
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 2” [5 cm]. Break A. Join B. 
With B, rep last rnd for 3” [7.5 cm] more. 
Stuff Head and Body lightly. 
Shape bottom: 1st rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
Stuff rem of Body.
Ears (Make 2 each with A and B). 
Ch 14. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1.  Skip next sc. Rep from * to last last 2 sts. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. * *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows until work from beg measures approx 6” [15 cm], ending on a 3rd row.
Shape top: 1st row: (WS). Ch 1. Skip first sc. *1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Turn. Leave last sc unworked. 
Rep last row until row: “Next row: Ch 1. Skip first sc. 1 sc in next ch 1-sp. Turn. Leave last sc unworked. ” has been worked. 
Fasten off. 
With WS tog, sew A - Ear and B - Ear tog. 
“Cheeks” (make 2). 
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. Fasten off. 
Tail 
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sts. Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew Ears to top of Head. Sew “Cheeks” in position, stuffing lightly. With B, embroider Nose and Eyes, using satin stitch. Stuff Tail lightly and sew to back of Body.

materials: Red Heart® With Love® (7 oz/198 g; 370 yds/338 m)
Size U.S I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
3 brown buttons ½" (12 mm) for Shirt.
1 decorative button ½" (12 mm) or bead for Hat.
abbreviations: Dc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw a loop through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Dtr = Yoh 4 times. (Yoh and draw up a loop through 2 loops) 4 times
Sc2tog = (Draw up a loop in next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook)
measurements: Clothes fit doll: Approx 18" [45.5 cm] tall. Shirt: Approx 6" [15 cm] long. Skirt: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] long (including Ruffle). Boot: Approx 4" [10 cm] tall.
instructions:
Notes
• Use a stitch marker to keep track of beginnings of rounds.
• Beginning ch-3 counts as a dc unless otherwise noted.
HAT
Note: Do not join rounds.
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd (RS): 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook—8 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc—16 sc.
3rd rnd: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—24 sc.
4th rnd:  *Sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—32 sc. 
5th rnd:  *Sc in each of next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—36 sc.
6th to 17th rnds:  Sc in each sc around. 
18th rnd: Change color to C, do not cut B; sc in each sc around.
19th rnd:  Change color to B; working in front loops only, *sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—54 sc. 
20th rnd:  Working in both loops now and throughout, sc in each sc around. 
21st rnd:  *Sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—72 sc. 
22nd rnd: Sc in each sc around.
23rd rnd:  *Sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—90 sc. 
24th rnd: Sc in each sc around.
25th rnd:  Slip st in each sc around—90 slip sts. Fasten off and weave in ends.
BOOT (Make 2)
With C, ch 7.
1st rnd (RS):  3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 4 ch, 3 sc in last ch; turn piece upside down, working into opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each of next 4 ch; join with slip st in top of first sc—14sc.
Note: Do not turn rounds.
2nd rnd: Ch 1, 2 sc in each of first 3 sc, sc in each of next 4 sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in each of last 4 sc; join—20 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1; working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; join.
4th rnd:  Ch 1; working in both loops now and throughout, sc in each of first 10 sc, [sc2tog] 3 times, sc in each of last 4 sc; join—17 sts.
5th rnd:  Ch 1, sc in each of first 9 sts, [sc2tog], 3 times, sc in each of last 2 sc; join—14 sts.
6th rnd:  Ch 1, sc in each of first 10 sts, sc2tog, sc in each of last 2 sc; join—13 sts.
7th to 11th rnds: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join—13 sc.
12th rnd: Change color to A; ch 1, sc in each sc around; join—13 sc.
13th rnd:  Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Fasten off and weave in ends.
SHIRT 
With B, ch 35.
1st row (RS):  Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across; turn—33 dc. 
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 3, dc in each dc across; turn—33 dc. 
Right Front 
5th row:  Ch 3, dc in next 5 sts; turn—6 dc. 
6th row:  Ch 3, dc in next 4 sts; turn—5 dc. 
7th row:  Ch 3, dc in next 4 sts; turn—5 dc. 
8th row:  Ch 3, dc in next 3 sts; turn—4 dc. 
9th row:  Ch 3, dc2tog, dc; turn—3 sts. 
10th row: Ch 3, dc—2 dc. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Middle of Back
5th row: With RS facing, skip next 6 unworked dc of 4th row. Attach B to next dc; ch 3, dc in next 8 dc; turn—9 dc. 
6th to 8th rows: Ch 3, dc in next 8 dc; turn—9 dc. At end of 8th row, do not turn. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Left Front
5th to 10th rows: Attach B to top of last ch-3 of 4th row; repeat 5th to 10th rows of Right Front.
Shoulders
Sew top of Right Front to top of first 2 sts of Middle of Back; fasten off and weave in ends. Sew top of Left Front to top of last 2 sts of Middle of Back; fasten off and weave in ends.
Front Edging
With RS facing, attach B to side post of 1st row; ch 1, 2 sc in each side post of 1st to 10th rows of Right Front; sc in each of next 5 dc of Back; continuing around, 2 sc in each side post of 10th to 1st rows of Left Front—45 sc. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Left Sleeve
1st rnd: With RS facing, attach B to side post of 5th row of Front; ch 1, 2 sc in each side post of 5th to 10th rows of Front and 8th to 5th rows of Back; working over next 6 dc of 4th row, [sc2tog] 3 times; join in top of first sc—23 sts.
Note: Do not turn rounds.
2nd rnd: Change color to A; ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around; join—23 sc. 
3rd to 4th rnds: Ch 3; working in both loops now and throughout, dc in each sc around; join in top of ch-3—23 dc.
5th rnd:  Ch 1, [sc2tog, sc] 7 times, sc2tog; join in top of first sc2tog—15 sts. 
6th rnd: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join in top of first sc—15 sc. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Right Sleeve
1st rnd: With RS facing, attach B to side post of 5th row of Back; ch 1, 2 sc in each side post of 5th to 8th rows of Back and 10th to 5th rows of Front; working over next 6 dc of 4th row, [sc2tog] 3 times; join in top of first sc—23 sts.
2nd to 6th rnds:  Repeat 2nd to 6th rnds of Left Sleeve, working without turning rounds.
BELT
With C, ch 40; dc in 4th ch from hook and in remaining chs—38 dc. Fasten off and weave in ends.
SKIRT
Note: Do not join rounds.
With D, ch 32; being careful not to twist, join with slip st in first ch to form ring. 
1st rnd (RS): Ch 1, sc in each ch; join with slip st in top of first sc—32 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3, dc in each of next 3 sc, [dtr in next sc, dc in each of next 7 sc] 3 times, dtr in next sc, dc in each of last 3 sc; join—28 dc, 4 dtr Belt Loops. 
3rd to 7th rnds: Ch 3, dc in each st around; join—32 dc.
Front Ruffle
8th rnd: Working in front loops only, ch 3, 3 dc in each st around; join—94 dc. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Back Ruffle
9th rnd:  Join A; working in back loops only, ch 3, 3 dc in each st around; join—94 dc. Fasten off and weave in ends.
KERCHIEF
With E, ch 2.
1st row: Sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn—1 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1, 3 sc in sc; turn—3 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—5 sc.
4th row: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—7 sc.
5th row: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 5 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—9 sc. 
6th row: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 7 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—11 sc. 
7th row: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each of next 9 sc, 2 sc in last sc; turn—13 sc. 
8th row: Ch 21, turn; slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 19 ch, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] 4 times, sc in last sc—29 sts. 
9th row: Ch 21, turn; slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 19 ch—20 slip sts. Fasten off and weave in ends.
FINISHING
Note: Refer to photo for placement of items.
Hat: Push top of Hat inward, then tack Round 3 together. Tack side edges of Brim to sides of Round 16. Sew mini pony beads and decorative button to front of Hat.
Shirt: Sew three ½" (12 mm) brown buttons to Right Front of Shirt.
Belt: Sew 7/8" (22 mm) silver button to end of Row 1 of Belt. Slide Belt through Belt Loops of Skirt.

materials: Bernat® Maker Minis™ Kit includes 10 balls (1.7 oz/50 g each; 17.65 oz/500 g total), (61 yds/56 m; 610 yds/560 m)
Small amount of Yellow for embroidery
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.

Rocketship: Fiberfil stuffing. Hot glue gun with glue sticks. Wooden dowel 1⁄4" [.5 cm] diameter (to support rocket booster frames). 2 small pom-poms 1⁄3" [8 mm] diameter (for alien headphones). 1 toothpick. 2 small black beads 1⁄8" [3 mm] (for alien eyes). One half of a clear fillable plastic ornament 2" [5 cm] diameter (for porthole dome).
Alien: 2 post and washer animal noses (for eyes) 1⁄2” [13 mm]. Fiberfil stuffing. Wooden dowel 1⁄4” [.5 cm] diameter (for rigid insert for top knot/hair). Hot glue gun with glue sticks.
abbreviations: Cross Sc = Single Crochet Cross Stitch.

Joined tr = Insert hook into top horizontal bar of tr just worked and draw up a loop. Insert hook into second horizontal bar of same tr and draw up a loop. Insert hook into next ch and draw up a loop. 4 loops on hook. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. – Joined tr made.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Tr (Treble crochet) = (Yoh) twice. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times
measurements: Rocketship: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] long, excluding flames. Alien: Approx 11" [12.5 cm] tall, excluding top knot hair.
instructions:
ROCKETSHIP
Notes:
1. Booster Rockets and Booster Rocket frames are worked separately and sewn tog. Frames are cylindrical pieces that hold Booster Rockets on Spaceship and are fitted with a small length of wooden dowel to provide rigidity.
2. The clear spaceship dome (porthole), is created from half of a fillable clear plastic ornament. It is connected to Spaceship with crochet edging that is glued around the bottom edge of the dome using strong craft glue. Space features are glued to a toothpick, then inserted and glued in place on Spaceship.
3. To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work.
4. This project includes some optional multi-crafting techniques for finishing and embellishing. Make certain to read through entire pattern before beg.

Beg at nose cone with B, ch 2.
See Diagram on page 4.

1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 5 sc. PM on first st. Do not join at end of rnds, unless otherwise stated. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker up at beg of each rnd.

2nd rnd: 2 cross sc in each of next 5 sc. 10 sc.

3rd rnd: (1 cross sc in next sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 5 times. 15 sc.

4th rnd: 1 cross sc in each sc around.

5th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 3 times. 18 sc.

6th rnd: 1 cross sc in each sc around.

7th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 3 times. 21 sc.

8th rnd: 1 cross sc in each sc around.

9th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 7 times. 28 sc.

10th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 7 times. 35 sc.

11th rnd: 1 cross sc in each sc around. Sl st in first sc of rnd. Fasten off.

Work in joined rnds as follows:

12th rnd: Working in back loops only, join A with sl st in first sc. Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 35 sc.

13th rnd: Ch 1. (1 cross sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc. Fasten off.

14th rnd: Working in back loops only, join C with sl st in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.

15th rnd: Ch 1. (1 cross sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 49 sc.

Work in continuous rnds (spiral):

16th rnd: 1 cross sc in each sc around. PM on first st. Do not join. 49 sc.

17th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. 56 sc.

18th to 32nd rnds: 1 cross sc in each sc around. Sl st in first sc of rnd. Fasten off.

33th rnd: Working in back loops only, join A with sl st in first sc. Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.

34th to 36th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Do not join. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

37th rnd: Working in back loops only, join D with sl st in first sc. Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.

38th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 7 times. 49 sts. PM on first st. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds (spiral).

39th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 7 times. 42 sts.

40th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 19 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 40 sts.

41st rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 10 times. 30 sts.

Stuff piece firmly and cont stuffing piece as work progresses.

42nd rnd: 1 cross sc in each st around.

43rd rnd: (1 cross sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 10 times. 20 sts.

44th to 46th rnds: 1 cross sc in each st around. Fasten off.

47th rnd: Working in back loops only, join A with sc in any st of rnd 46. 1 cross sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.

48th and 49th rnds: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each sc around.

50th rnd: Working in back loops only, (1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 5 times. 15 sts.

51st rnd: Working in back loops only, (1 cross sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog) 3 times. 12 sts.

Sl st in first st of rnd. Fasten off. Finish stuffing Rocketship.

BOOSTER ROCKETS (make 3).
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc. PM on first st. Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds.

2nd rnd: (1 cross sc in next sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 3 times. 9 sc.

3rd rnd: 1 cross sc in each sc around.

4th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 3 times. 12 sc.

5th and 6th rnds: 1 cross sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc at end of 6th rnd. Fasten off.

7th rnd: Join B with sl st to back loop of first sc. Working in back loops only, 1 cross sc in each sc around. PM on first st. Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds.

Begin stuffing lightly and cont stuffing as work progresses. 

Working in both loops:

8th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 10 sts.

9th rnd: 1 cross sc in each st around.

10th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 8 sts. 

Sl st in first sc of rnd. Fasten off. 

Finish stuffing rocket, leaving room for inserting a flame into the end.

BOOSTER ROCKET FRAMES  (make 3).
Casing
With D, ch 2, leaving a long end for sewing.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.

Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Insert piece of wooden dowel into Casing and trim even with edge of piece to make Frame. Sew one Frame to each Booster Rocket. Sew Frames right below edge of last A-colored rnd of Rocket. Sew around Frame to secure.

Flames (make 3 – 1 per rocket).
Wrap A around 2 fingers 5 times. Slip loops off fingers. Tie D securely at one end. Cut across other end. Using photo as reference, glue one Small Flame to opening of each Booster Rocket. 

PLASTIC DOME EDGING
With D, ch 34 (or number of chains needed to fit snuggly around circumference of dome). Join with sl st to first ch to form a circle.

1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 34 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

3rd rnd: Working along opposite side of foundation ch, join A with sc in any ch. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.

Attach Edging to Dome: Carefully break off the hanging tab on the edge of half dome. To keep table clean and prevent dome from sticking to table, work on piece of waxed paper. Run a bead of hot glue around edge of dome. Place glued dome flat on waxed paper. Slip edging down over dome with B-colored side up, pushing it down until A-colored edge is lying flat on the waxed paper. 

Note: A-colored edge will be sewn to Rocketship. Set aside to dry.

ALIEN
Head: With E, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc. PM on first st. Do not join. Work in spiral in continuous rnds.

2nd and 3rd rnds: 1 cross sc in each sc around. 
4th rnd: (Sc2tog) 3 times. Fasten off. Use ends as stuffing. Cut toothpick in half. Glue Head to flat (cut) tip of toothpick. 

Glue 2 beads to upper front of head to form eyes. Glue two small pompoms to upper sides of Head (as if wearing head phones).

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement of features and pieces.
Attach Rockets to Rocketship: Using yarn ends, and with A-end facing up towards the nose of the Rocketship, sew Booster Rockets, evenly spaced around first D-colored rnd of Rocketship approx 14 sc apart. Insert and glue alien toothpick into upper side of Rocketship evenly spaced between 2 Booster Rockets. Place dome over alien and pin edging to Rocketship.  
With long end of A, sew dome to Rocketship. 

SPACE ALIEN
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work.

LEGS/BODY
First Leg
Beg at bottom of leg with A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from ring. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). 6 sc.
PM in last sc worked to for end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
2nd rnd: 2 cross sc in each of next 6 sts. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 cross sc in next sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th to 8th rnds: 1 cross sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Stuff leg.

Second Leg
Work as given for First leg. Do not fasten off.
Cont to stuff leg and body as work progresses.

Join Legs: Remove end of rnd markers for both legs.
9th rnd: Hold first leg and second leg tog and working through both thicknesses, 1 cross sc in next sc to join legs. 1 cross sc in each of next 17 sc of Second leg then 1 cross sc in each of 17 sc of First leg. 34 sc.

PM in last sc worked and move marker up as each rnd is completed.

Body
10th rnd: (2 cross sc in next st. 1 cross sc in each of next 16 sts) twice. 36 sc.
11th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 6 times. 42 sc.
12th rnd: 1 cross sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to back loop of next sc. Do not fasten off A. 

13th rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 cross scbl in same sp as sl st. 1 cross scbl in each sc around. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds.
14th to 16th rnds: Working in both loops,  1 cross sc in each sc around.

17th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 36 sts.

18th rnd: 1 cross scbl in each st around.

19th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 30 sts. Join A with sl st to back loop of next sc. Fasten off B.

20th rnd: Working in back loops only,  with A, 1 cross scbl in each st around. 

21st rnd: Working in both loops,  (1 cross sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 24 sts.

22nd to 24th rnds: 1 cross sc in each st around.

25th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 18 sts.

Neck
26th and 27th rnds: 1 cross sc in each st around.

Finish stuffing piece. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Leave neck open.

HEAD
See diagrams on page 11.

Beg at lower end of head with A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 6 sc. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). PM in last sc worked to for end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.

2nd rnd: 2 cross sc in each of next 6 sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 cross sc in next st. 2 cross sc in next st) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 6 times. 24 sc.
5th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 6 times. 30 sc.
6th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 6 times. 36 sc.
7th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 6 times. 42 sc.
8th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc) 6 times. 48 sc.
9th and 10th rnds: 1 cross sc in each sc around. Join C with sl st to back loop of next sc. Fasten off B.
11th rnd: Working in back loops only,  with C, 1 sc in each st around. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds.

12th rnd: Working in both loops,  (1 cross sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 42 sts.

13th to 15th rnds: 1 cross sc in each st around. 

16th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 36 sts.

Attach post and washer noses (for eyes) between 8th and 9th rnds, approx 6 - 7 sts apart. Play with the angle of the eyes to determine the best position before snapping on washers.

Stuff as work progresses.

17th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 30 sts.

18th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 24 sts.

19th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 18 sts.

20th rnd: (1 cross sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 12 sts.

21st rnd: (1 cross sc in next st. Sc2tog) 4 times. 8 sts.

22nd to 25th rnds: 1 cross sc in each st around. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. 

Cut length of wooden dowel approx 1" [2.5 cm]. Insert dowel in top portion of Head. Thread yarn through sts of last rnd. Pull tightly to close hole around dowel. Fasten securely.

TOPKNOT
Wrap C around 2 fingers 6 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn twice around tassel ¼" [.5 cm] from tied end, and fasten securely. Attach Tassel securely to top of Head. 

ARMS  (make 2).
Beg at top of arm with A, ch 8. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: 1 sc in each ch around. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). 8 sc.
PM in last sc worked for end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
2nd to 4th rnds: 1 cross sc in each sc around. Join C at end of 4th rnd.
5th to 10th rnds: With C, 1 cross sc in each sc around.

Hand: 11th rnd:  2 cross sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
12th rnd: 1 cross sc in each sc around.
13th rnd: (1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 12 sts.

Stuff arm lightly. 

Next row: (Closing row). Hold top edges tog and working through both thicknesses, 6 sl st across top edge to close. 6 sl sts. Do not fasten off.

Fingers
1st row: Ch 5. Turn. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 3 ch (first finger made). Working in sts of Closing row, sl st in each of first 3 sl sts. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 3 ch (second finger made). Sl st in same st of Closing row and each of next 2 sts. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 3 ch (third finger made). Sl st in same st and last st of Closing row.

Fasten off.

BELT
With D, ch 35, leaving a long end for sewing. 1st row: Working in back bumps only, draw up a loop in 2nd, 3rd, 4th chains from hook. Yoh and draw up a loop through 2 loops on hook) 4 times – beg joined tr made.

Working in back bumps only, 1 joined tr in each ch to end of chain. 40 tr. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, sew the pieces tog.

Sew Arms to sides of Body at 25th rnd approx 6 or 7 sts apart.

Sew Head to top of neck. 

Wrap Belt around torso approx 15 rnds down from neck. Sew short edges tog then tack belt around the entire body.

With Yellow embroider Star in middle of belt for buckle (or use button).

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 239 yds/219 m) Monkey (9363) 1 ball makes 2 Monkeys
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Version 1: Brown as Color 1, Beige as Color 2, Teal as Color 3.
Version 2: Beige as Color 1, Brown as Color 2, Purple as Color 3.
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Ears (make 2 alike):
Front Ear: With Color 2, ch 2.
**1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
Fasten off.**
Back Ear: With Color 1, ch 2.
Work from ** to ** as given for Front Ear.
Joining Front and Back Ears:
With WS tog, join Color 1 with sl st to any st.
1st row: Ch 1. Working into back loops only and through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. 
Fasten off leaving long end for sewing.
Face: With Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. *2 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
Fasten off. With Color 1, embroider Nose and Eyebrows onto Face as shown in photo.
Head: With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th to 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
18th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
Sew Ears and Face onto Head as shown in photo. Secure safety eyes through both thicknesses of Face and Head. Stuff Head firmly.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
Fasten off. Cont with Body: 22nd rnd: Join Color 3 with sl st to center back of 21st rnd of Head. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
23rd and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
24th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
26th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
28th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
30th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
32nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
33rd to 36th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
37th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Break Color 3, join with Color 1.
38th rnd: With Color 1, ch 1. Working in back loops of 36th rnd only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
39th and 40th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
41st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
42nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
43rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
44th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
Stuff Body firmly.
45th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
46th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw tightly through rem sts. 
Arms (make 2): With Color 3, ch 17.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row twice more. Do not fasten off.
Fold piece in half lengthwise. Sl st through both thicknesses along edge. Fasten off.
Fingers: Join Color 2 with sl st to end of Arm. *Ch 4. 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each of next 2 ch. 1 sl st in end of Arm. Rep from * 3 times more. 
Fasten off.
Sew Arms to Body as shown in photo.
Legs (make 2): With Color 1, ch 17.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Do not fasten off. Fold piece in half lengthwise. Sl st through both thicknesses along edge. Fasten off.
Toes: Join Color 2 with sl st to end of Leg. *Ch 4. 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each of next 2 ch. 1 sl st in end of Leg. Rep from * 3 times more. 
Fasten off. Sew Legs to Body as shown in photo.
Tail: With Color 1, ch 17.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Do not fasten off. Fold piece in half lengthwise. Sl st through both thicknesses along edge. Fasten off. Sew Tail to Body as shown in photo.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Contrast A Golden (69013) 1 ball or 70 yds/64 m
Contrast B Fuchsia (69023) 1 ball or 33 yds/30 m
Bernat® Softee® Baby Cotton™ (4.2 oz/120 g; 254 yds/232 m) Contrast C Aqua Mist (52010) 1 ball or 56 yds/51 m
Note: 1 ball of Contrast A, B, C will make 3 Toys.
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only of next stitch
instructions:
MOTIF (Make 12)
With A, ch 4.
See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 9 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 10 dc). Join with sl st to top of first dc (top of ch-4). Fasten off.
2nd rnd:  Join B with sl st in sp between any 2 dc. Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 3 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 2 dc. 4 dc in next sp between 2-dc. Rep from * to last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of first ch-3. 20 dc (5 clusters of 4-dc).
3rd rnd:  Sl st in each of next 2 sps (ending in sp at center of 4-dc cluster from 2nd rnd). Ch 3 (counts as 1 dc). 6 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Skip next 4 dc. 7 dc in next sp (center of 4-dc cluster from 2nd rnd). Rep from * to last 2 dc. Join with sl st to top of first ch-3. 35 dc (5 clusters of 7-dc). Fasten off.

4th rnd: Join C with sl st in first dc (top of ch-3). Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 scbl in each of next 6 dc. Working around 2nd and 3rd rnds, 1 hdc in next sp 3 rnds below (1st rnd). *1 scbl in each of next 7 dc. Working around 2nd and 3rd rnds, 1 hdc in next sp 3 rnds below. Rep from * to last sp. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sts.
Note: Hdc in rnds below will cause Motif to cup. Push dc clusters to RS to form slightly raised “petals" of flowers.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 7 sts. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next sc. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Flat Sl St Joining:  With A and RS facing, sl st Motifs tog to form 2 halves of ball as shown in Assembly Diagram, working through back loops only and keeping yarn to WS to create Flat Sl St ch detail (see diagram). With A and Flat Sl St Joining method established, join 2 halves of Ball tog, inserting stuffing at halfway point. Fasten off.
Note: Keep working yarn to WS of work so only flat sl st chain is visible on RS.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.25 mm [US B-1]
Optional: Plastic pellets for weighted stuffing and thin pouch to hold pellets
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 26 sts = about 4" [10 cm]; 22 rounds = about 4" [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL TO THIS PROJECT. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BODY/HEAD
Beginning at bottom of body, with A or B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each of next 6 sts—12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 7–10: Sc in each st around. 
Round 11: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times—30 sc.
Rounds 12–14: Sc in each st around. 
Round 15: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 16: Sc in each st around.
Round 17: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times—18 sc.
Before stuffing piece, if using weighted pellets, fill thin cloth pouch with weighted pellets and place pouch in bottom of piece. Then stuff piece, packing stuffing on top of pouch.
Round 18: [Sc2tog, sc in next st] 6 times—12 sc.
Rounds 19–22: Sc in each st around. 
Begin Head
Round 23: Work 2 sc in each st around—24 sc.
Rounds 24–26: Sc in each st around. 
Round 27: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 28: Sc in each st around.
Attach safety eyes between Rounds 25 and 26, about 4 stitches apart.
Round 29: [Sc2tog, sc in next st] 6 times—12 sc.
If needed, add a little more stuffing to piece.
Round 30: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc. 
Fasten off leaving a long tail. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Weave in and trim ends.
BEAK
With D, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each of next 2 sts, sc in next 4 sts and change to C in last st—8 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: With C, sc in each st around.
Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing beak to head.
LEGS (make 2 for each flamingo)
With C, leaving a long beginning tail for sewing leg to body, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] twice—8 sc.
Rounds 3–14: Sc in each st around.
Foot
Flatten the top of the tube, matching stitches in back and front of last round to make a double layer with 4 stitches in each layer. Work now proceeds back and forth in rows.
Row 15: Working through both thicknesses, skip the first st, sc in next 3 sts.
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, working in front loops only, 2 sc in first st, sc in next st, 2 sc in last st—5 sc. 
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in last st—7 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, hdc in next st, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next st, sc in last st.
Fasten off. Weave in and trim the ending tail. Do not cut the beginning tail, it can be used later to sew leg to body.
WINGS (make 2 for each flamingo)
With same yarn color as used for body, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each of next 6 sts—12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4 (wing tips): Slip st in next st, ch 4, slip st in next st, ch 6, slip st in next st, ch 8, slip st in next st, ch 6, slip st in next st, ch 4, slip st in next st; leave remaining sts unworked.
Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing wing to body. 
FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, use yarn tails or yarn scraps to sew the following pieces together.
1. Sew beak to head between eyes, positioning so that the beak curves downwards.
2. Sew legs to bottom of body, positioning the feet to face forwards with the small ridge at ankle on the front side.
3. Sew wings to sides of body, with about 10 stitches on front belly between the wings Point the wing tips toward the back and sew around the outside of Round 3 leaving wing tips unsewn.
Weave in and trim any remaining ends.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball of 112 Night-Night A and a small amount of 226 Bumble B
RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball of 100 Lily A and a small amount of 112 Night-Night B
RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: A small amount of 691 Grass A, 1 ball of 0261 Tangerine B and a small amount of 112 Night-Night C
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc = Colors A, B, C, etc
( ) = work instructions in parentheses as indicated.
measurements: Finished Size: Bat Puppet 6½” (16.5 cm) circumference; Ghost Puppet 6½” (16.5 cm) circumference; Pumpkin Puppet 7” (18 cm) circumference.
gauge: 22 sc = 4” (10 cm); 26 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BAT PUPPET
Body
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 8 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Round 2: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) around: 12 sc.
Round 3: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc) around: 16 sc.
Round 4: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 20 sc.
Round 5: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around: 24 sc.
Round 6: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc) around: 28 sc.
Rounds 7-13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: (Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog) around: 24 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 11 sc) around: 26 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 12 sc) around: 28 sc.
Round 19: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc) around: 32 sc.
Round 20: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc) around: 36 sc.
Round 21: Sc in next 7 sc, ch 5, skip next 5 sc (wing opening), sc in next 12 sc, ch 5, skip next 5 sc, sc in each sc around.
Round 22: Sc in each sc and ch around: 36 sc.
Rounds 23-40: Sc in each sc around.
Round 41: Sc in each sc around, join with slip st to first sc; fasten off.
Wing (Make 2)
With right side facing, join A with slip st in first ch of any arm opening.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, sc in same ch, sc in next 4 chs, next end of row, next 5 sc and in next end of row, do not join: 12 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 15 sc.
Round 4: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around: 18 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 2 sc: 18 sc.
Round 7: Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 2 sc: 18 sc.
Round 8: Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 2 sc: 18 sc.
Round 9: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc) around: 21 sc.
Round 10: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc) around: 24 sc.
Round 11: Sc in next 18 sc, sc2tog 3 times: 21 sc.

GHOST PUPPET
Body
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 8 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Round 2: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) around: 12 sc.
Round 3: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc) around: 16 sc.
Round 4: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 20 sc.
Round 5: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around: 24 sc.
Round 6: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc) around: 28 sc.
Rounds 7-13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: (Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog) around: 24 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 11 sc) around: 26 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 12 sc) around: 28 sc.
Round 19: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc) around: 32 sc.
Round 20: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc) around: 36 sc.
Round 21: Sc in next 7 sc, ch 5, skip next 5 sc (wing opening), sc in next 12 sc, ch 5, skip next 5 sc, sc in each sc around.
Round 22: Sc in each sc and ch around: 36 sc.
Rounds 23-26: Sc in each sc around.
Round 27: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc) around: 40 sc.
Rounds 28-39: Sc in each sc around.
Round 40: *Slip st in next sc, ch2, dc in next 2 sc, hdc in next sc, slip st in next sc, sc in next sc) around, join with slip st to first slip st; fasten off.
Arm
With right side facing, join A with slip st in first ch of any arm opening.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, sc in same ch, sc in next 4 ch, next end of row, next 5 sc and in next end of row, do not join: 12 sc.
Rounds 2-7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: (Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog) around: 10 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: Sc2tog around, fasten off leaving a long end for sewing: 5 sc.
Thread yarn needle with long end and weave through 5 remaining sc, draw up firmly and fasten securely.
Repeat for second arm opening.
Mouth
With B, ch 3.
Round 1 (Right side): 5 hdc in third ch from hook; fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.

PUMPKIN PUPPET
Body
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 6 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: (Sc in next sc, sc2tog) around: 4 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around, changing to B in last st.
Round 6: With B, 2 sc in each sc around: 8 sc.
Round 7: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) around: 12 sc.
Round 8: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc) around: 16 sc.
Round 9: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 20 sc.
Round 10: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around: 24 sc.
Round 11: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc) around: 28 sc.
Rounds 12-18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: (Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog) around: 24 sc.
Round 20: Sc in each sc around.
Round 21: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 11 sc) around: 26 sc.
Round 22: Sc in each sc around.
Round 23: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 12 sc) around: 28 sc.
Round 24: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc) around: 32 sc.
Round 25: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc) around: 36 sc.
Round 26: Sc in next 7 sc, ch 5, skip next 5 sc (arm opening), sc in next 12 sc, ch 5, skip next 5 sc, sc in each sc around.
Round 27: Sc in each sc and ch around: 36 sc.
Rounds 28-31: Sc in each sc around.
Round 32: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc) around: 40 sc.
Rounds 33-44: Sc in each sc around.
Round 45: (Sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog) around: 36 sc.
Round 46: Sc in each sc around, join with slip st to first sc; fasten off.
Arm
With right side facing, join A with slip st in first ch of any arm opening.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, sc in same ch, sc in next 4 ch, next end of row, next 5 sc and in next end of row, do not join: 12 sc.
Rounds 2-7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: (Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog) around: 10 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: Sc2tog around, fasten off leaving a long end for sewing: 5 sc.
Thread yarn needle with long end and weave through 5 remaining sc, draw up firmly and fasten securely.
Repeat for second arm opening.
Eye (Make 2)
With C, ch 3.
Round 1 (Right side): 2 hdc in third ch from hook; fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
Mouth
With C, ch 3.
Round 1 (Right side): 5 hdc in third ch from hook; fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
FINISHING
Thread yarn needle with Mouth long end. Using photo as a guide, sew Mouth to Puppet. Thread yarn needle with Eye long end. Using photo as a guide, sew Eye to Puppet. Repeat for second Eye. Thread yarn needle with a length of C. Using photo as a guide embroider nose.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m) Café Latte (0360) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Length of smooth black yarn for embroidery.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm], working in rnds.
instructions:
Bear Body (make 2 pieces alike)  
Beg at base, ch 6. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 
Turn. 5 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 7 sc. 
3rd to 12th rows: Rep last row 10 times more. 27 sc. 
13th to 32nd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
33rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 25 sts. 
34th to 40th rows: Rep last row 8 times more. 9 sts rem. Fasten off at end of first piece. Do not fasten off at end of second piece. 
 
Join Pieces: With RS tog, working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc along sides and bottom of Body, leaving top (last row of each piece) unworked. Fasten off. Fold work inside out for RS. Stuff Body, having seams at front and back. 
 
Bear Head (make 2 pieces alike) 
Ch 11. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 10 sc. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 11 sts. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. 
Turn. 13 sc. 
4th to 11th rows: Rep last 2 rows 4 times more. 25 sc at end of last row. 
12th to 14th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. PM at end of last row (nose). 
15th row: Sl st in each of first 7 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc to end of row. 19 sc. 
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 17 sc. 
17th to 21st rows: Rep last row 5 times more. 7 sts rem. Fasten off. 
 
Head Gusset 
Ch 2. 
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc. Turn. 
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 3 sc in next sc. PM on center sc of 3-sc group. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc. 
6th to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to marked sc. 3 sc in marked sc. PM to center sc of 3-sc group. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 7 sc. 
10th to 21st rows: Rep last 4 rows 3 times more. 13 sc at end of last row. 
22nd to 28th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
29th row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 11 sc. 
30th and 31st rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
32nd to 40th rows: Rep last 3 rows 3 times more. 5 sts rem. 
41st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. 
Rep last row until work measures length to fit from marker of Head to beg of foundation ch. Fasten off at end of last row. 
 
Join Gusset to Head: Align foundation ch of Gusset with markers of Head pieces. 
With RS tog, working through both thicknesses, work 1 row of sc along one side of Gusset and one side of Head from marker to foundation ch of Head and Gusset, leaving bottom of Head unworked. Fasten off. 
Rep for joining second piece of Head to Gusset. Turn work inside out for RS. Stuff Head. 
 
Legs (make 2) 
Note: Join all rnds of Legs with sl st to first sc. 
Ch 6. 
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in rem loops along foundation ch . 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 12 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join. 18 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 30 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 36 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 42 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) twice. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 48 sc.  
 
Sides: 8th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.  
 
Shape Instep: 13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. (Sc2tog) 7 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 41 sts. 
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. (Sc2tog) 4 times. Sc3tog. (Sc2tog) 4 times.1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 31 sts. 
15th to 24th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 31 sc. 
 
Shape top of Leg: 1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 28 sts. 
2nd and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join. 24 sts. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join. 20 sts. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join. 16 sts. 
Stuff Legs, leaving space of last 2 rnds unstuffed. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join. 12 sts. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Fold top flat. Sew top seam with long end. 
Place Legs at each side of Body, having Body seams at front and back. 
Thread yarn through Legs and Body 4 times to secure in place (see Diagram). Tie ends of yarn. 
 
Arms (make 2) 
Note: Join all rnds of Arms with sl st to first sc. 
Ch 2. 
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 7 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 14 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 21 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 28 sc. 
5th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts. 
14th to 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts. 
18th to 20th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts. 
22nd to 29th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 
Stuff Arms, leaving space of last 2 rnds unstuffed. 
Fasten off leaving a long end. Fold top flat. Sew top seam with long end. 
 
Sew Arms at each side of Body (see photo). 
 
Ears 
Note: Join all rnds of Ears with sl st to first sc. 
Ch 24. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care to not twist chain. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 24 sc. 
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Sc2tog. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sts. Fasten off. 
Fold Ear flat. Sew top seam. 
Sew Ears to Head as shown in picture. 
With black yarn, embroider eyes and nose using Satin stitch as shown in picture. 
SATIN STITCH

materials: Red Heart® Bunches of Hugs™ (14 oz/397 g; 948 yds/868 m) Capri (5514) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Black embroidery floss for eyes and mouth.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Note: Head of Octopus is worked in continuous rnds. Do not join at end of rnds. Place a st marker to indicate beg of rnds and move marker as each rnd is worked.
Head: Ch 2.
**1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 7 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 21 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 28 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 35 sc.
6th and 7th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
9th and 10th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 49 sc.
12th and 13th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
14th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc.
15th to 20th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
21st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 49 sts.
22nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
23rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 42 sts.
24th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
25th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 35 sts.
26th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
27th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
28th rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Place a marker on last rnd.
29th rnd: Working in both loops, *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
Stuff Head.
30th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 16 sts.
31st rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sts. Cut yarn, leaving a long end. Fasten off. Thread end of yarn through rem 8 sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Divide for 8 Tentacles:
Join yarn with sl st to any rem front loop of marked rnd.
1st Tentacle: Ch 38. 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. *5 dc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Skip next 3 sc of 27th rnd. Sl st in next sc.
2nd to 8th Tentacles: As 1st Tentacle. Fasten off at end of 8th Tentacle.
With black embroidery floss, embroider mouth using straight stitch and eyes, using French knots.
STRAIGHT STITCH
FRENCH KNOT

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn®”: 1 ball each of 4601 Off White A, 4422 Tangerine B, 9528 Lilac C, 6768 Pink D, and 2515 Turquoise E.
Crochet Hook: 3.75mm [US F-5] and 3.25mm [US D-3] (for tooth necklace only)
small amounts of black and red pearl cotton (for facial features)
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, and E = Color a, B, C, D, and e
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 19 sts = 4”; 20 rows = 4” in single crochet using larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
TOOTH NECKLACE
With smaller hook and D, ch 5.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 2 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 2 ch, 2 sc in last ch—10 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–5: Sc in each sc around.
Handle: Ch 45, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, slip st in 4 sc across top of tooth pocket, slip st into 45th ch. FaSTen OFF.
FRONT OF DOLL
Head
With larger hook and A, ch 10.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—9 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—18 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, turn—21 sc.
Rows 5–15: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 16: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 3 times, turn—18 sc.
Row 17: Ch 1, *sc2tog; repeat from * across, turn—9 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; change to E in last sc, turn.
Body
Row 19: With E, ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—18 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 21: Ch 1, *sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—24 sc.
Start a new tradition—instead of leaving a child’s tooth under the pillow, put it in this tooth fairy’s little pouch. It makes the tooth fairy’s job so much easier.

TOOTH FAIRY DOLL | CROCHET
