Round 2: [Inc, sc in next sc] 3 times – 9 sc.  
Rounds 3, 4, 6, 8, 11, 13: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 5: [Inc, sc in next sc] 4 times, sc in last sc – 13 sc.  
Round 7: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 4 times, sc in last sc – 17 sc.  
Round 9: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] 4 times, sc in last sc – 21 sc.  
Round 10: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 7 times – 28 sc.  
Round 12: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] 7 times – 35 sc. 
Round 14: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 7 times – 42 sc.  
Rounds 15-19: With B, sc in each sc around. Attach ears and safety eyes to the head, and embroider the nose with scrap of B and yarn needle. Begin stuffing the head, and continue to stuff until head is fastened off. 
Round 20: [Dec, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times – 36 sc. 
Round 21: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 30 sc. 
Round 22: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 23: [Dec, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 24 sc. 
Round 24: [Dec, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 18 sc. 
Round 25: [Dec, sc in next sc] 6 times – 12 sc. 
Round 26: [Dec] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
Finish stuffing. Weave tail through last round and gather tightly. 
Knot to secure. 
Make one Elmer or two or a fleet of Elmers. He is crocheted in soft natural wool with lots of cuddle appeal.

Body 
Round 1: With A, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.  
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.  
Round 4: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.  
Round 5: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.  
Round 6: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.  
Round 7: [Inc, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times – 42 sc.  
Rounds 8-12: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 13: [Dec, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.  
Round 14: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 15: With B, sc in each sc around. 
Round 16: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.  
Rounds 17-21: Sc in each sc around.
Round 22: [Dec, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 24 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Arms (Make 2)
Round 1: With C, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc. 
Round 3: Sc in each sc around. 
Rounds 4-14: With B, sc in each sc around. Fasten off at end of last round leaving a long tail for sewing.  
Legs (Make 2) 
Round 1: With C, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.  
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 4 times – 16 sc. 
Rounds 4-13: With A, sc in each sc around. Fasten off at end of last round leaving a long tail for sewing. 
FINISHING
Stuff the body. Sew on the head. Stuff arms and legs and sew onto body.

materials: Caron International's Simply Soft (100% acrylic; 6 oz/170 g, 315 yds/288 m): 1 oz (A), 1 oz (C)
Caron International's Simply Soft Brites (100% Acrylic): 1 oz (B)
One size US G-6 (4mm) crochet hook, or size to obtain gauge.
Safety eyes (not recommended for small children)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
SNAKE
Head
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join and do not turn—6 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 4–6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc. Change to B in last st.
Rounds 8–10: Sc in each sc around. Change to C in last st of Round 10.
Round 11: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 12–18: Sc in each st around. Change to B in last st of Round 18.
Do not fasten off.
Body
If using safety eyes, insert them in Round 10 with 5 stitches between them.
You will not be able to add safety eyes after snake is completed.
Rounds 1–3: With B, sc in each sc around—18 sc. Change to A in last st of Round 3.
Rounds 4–11: Sc in each sc around. Change to B in last st of Round 11.
Rounds 12–14: Sc in each sc around. Change to C in last st of Round 14.
Rounds 15–22: Sc in each sc around. Change to B in last st of Round 22.
Repeat Rounds 19–40 eight more times. Do not fasten off.
Shape Tail
Rounds 1–3: With B, sc in each sc around—18 sc. Change to A in last st of Round 3.
Round 4: Sc in each st around.
Round 5: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sts.
Round 6 and 7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sts.
Work a sl st in the next st. Fasten off leaving a long tail. Use the long tail to sew opening closed.

TONGUE
With C, ch 8.
Row 1: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, ch 3, sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, hdc in next 5 ch of beginning ch-8.
Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
Sew tongue to front of head. Using yarn needle, weave in all ends. If desired, embroider eyes onto face.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 672 Spring Green A, 312 Black B, and 316 Soft White C
Cat toy bell – or any other bell that fits
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
dec (decrease) = draw up a loop in next 2 sc, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 18 sts = 4” (10 cm); 20 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
RATTLE
Note: Add stuffing as you go.
With A, create an adjustable ring.
Round 1: 6 sc in ring (pull tail of yarn); do NOT join but work in continuous rounds. Place marker in first sc of next round and move up each round – 6 sc.
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rounds 4-6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 3 times – 9 sc.
Rounds 9-18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: [Inc] 9 times – 18 sc.
Round 20: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 21: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 22: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 23: [Inc, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Rounds 24-28: Sc in each sc around.
Round 29: [Sc in next 5 sc, dec] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 30: [Sc in next 4 sc, dec] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 31: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 32: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 6 times – 18 sc. Add stuffing and bell.
Round 33: Sc in each sc around.
Round 34: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc. Finish stuffing rattle firmly.
Round 35: [dec] 6 times; join with a slip st in next sc – 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With yarn needle, weave tail through remaining sts and pull tight. Weave in ends.

Eye
With B, create an adjustable ring.
Round 1: 6 sc in ring (pull tail of yarn); join with a slip st in first st – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [inc] 6 times; join in first sc – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around changing to C in last sc; join.
Round 4: With C, working back loops only this round, ch 1, [inc] 12 times; join – 24 sc.
Rounds 5-7: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Add stuffing to eye. With yarn needle, sew eye to rattle between Rounds 27 – 35. Weave in ends. With B, embroider a mouth diagonally on Round 23.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Mushroom Cap
With A, ch 2.
See diagrams on page 4.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
11th to 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 66 sc.
17th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 78 sc.
19th to 23rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
24th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Break A.
25th rnd: Join B to back loop of first sc of 23rd rnd. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
26th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 66 sc.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
28th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
Continue for Head:
29th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
30th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
31st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
32nd to 36th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
37th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
38th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
39th and 40th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Continue for Body:
See diagrams on page 5.
41st rnd: Ch 3. Working in front loops only, 1 dc in first sc. 2 dc in each sc around. Join. 96 dc. Fasten off.
42nd rnd: Join B to back loop of first dc of 41st rnd. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each dc around. Join.
43rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
44th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
45th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
46th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
47th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 66 sc.
48th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
49th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 72 sc.
50th to 59th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
60th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 66 sc.
61st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
62nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
63rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Continue and Separate for Legs:
See diagram on page 5.
Right Leg: 64th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. Ch 6. Skip next 30 sc. 1 sc in each of last 26 sc. Join. 36 sts.
**65th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
66th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 28 sc.
67th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
68th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sc.
69th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.
70th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
71st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sc.
72nd rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog 4 times. Join. 4 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.**
Note: Safety eyes cannot be moved once they are properly attached, so it’s best to make sure you like eye placement using stitch markers before inserting them.
Following manufacturer’s instructions, attach Safety Eyes at markers.
Stuff Mushroom Cap, Head, Body and Right Leg firmly.
Left Leg: Join B with sl st to first skipped sc in 63rd rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 29 sc. Ch 6. Join. 36 sts.
Rep from ** to **, making sure to stuff Leg firmly as rnds are worked.
Sew seam between Legs closed.
Mushroom Cap Spots (make 15)
With B, ch 3.
See diagram on page 5.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join. 10 hdc.
Fasten off.
Sew Spots to Mushroom Cap as shown in photo.
Arms (make 2 alike)
With B, ch 2.
See diagram on page 5.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew Arms to Body as shown in photo.
Gill Embroidery: With B, embroider ‘Gills’ with Straight St around underside of Mushroom Cap as shown in photo.
STRAIGHT STITCH

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet”, Size 10: 1 Ball each 493 French Rose A, 422 Golden Yellow B, 12 Black C, 495 Wood Violet D, 119 Violet E, 431 Pumpkin F.
AUNT LYDIA’S® “Metallic Crochet”, Size 10: 1 Ball of 1P White/Pearl G.
Split-ring stitch marker; stuffing, yarn needle; 4 silver beads; sewing needle and thread; 3 alphabet beads: B, U, and G.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: 20 sc = 4”; 24 rounds = 4” with two strands held together. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LOVE BUG
With A, ch 12.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch, 3 sc in last ch; turn to work along opposite side of beginning ch, sc in next 9 ch, 2 sc in next ch – 24 sts.
Round 2: * Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 3: * Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Round 4: Sc in each st around.
Rounds 5-10: Repeat Round 4.
Round 11: * Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 48 sts.
Round 12: Repeat Round 4.
Round 13: * Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 60 sts.
Rounds 14-20: Repeat Round 4.
Round 21: * Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 48 sts.
Round 22: * Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 36 sts. Add stuffing.
Round 23: * Sc in next st, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 24: Sc2tog around – 12 sts. Fasten off. Sew seam parallel to beginning ch.
Fender (Make 4)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Round 4: * Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Rounds 5-6: Sc in each st around.
Round 7: Slip st in each st around. Fasten off.
This darling little bugger will delight all ages. Make this little car as shown then make a few more in other colors for added fun. Crochet thread isn’t just for doilies!
FINISHING
Sew Wheel Flowers to center of each Wheel. Sew 1 silver bead in the center of each flower, pulling thread tightly to indent. Sew each Wheel under a Fender, and sew each Fender to Car as pictured.
With C, embroider a pupil in the center of each Headlight/Eye. Stuff Eye lightly and sew into place onto Car. Embroider mouth and nose as pictured.
Sew Tail Lights into place at back of car. Sew Large Flower in place at top of car, and Small Flowers randomly over roof of car as pictured.
Sew alphabet beads spelling “BUG” in a row on back of Car for license plate. Weave in ends.
Wheel (Make 4)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 18 sts. Change to C in last st. Fasten off B.
Round 4: With C, * sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Rounds 5-6: Sc in each st around.
Round 7: Sc2tog around – 12 sts.
Round 8: Repeat Round 7 – 6 sts. Fasten off. Add stuffing. Draw remaining sts together.
Wheel Flower (Make 4)
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 8 sts.
Round 2: * Slip st in next st, ch 1; repeat from * around. Fasten off.
Headlight/Eye (Make 2)
With G, work same as for Fender through Round 3 – 18 sts.
Round 4: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around.
Round 5: * Sc in next st, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 12 sts. Fasten off.
Petal-Round 6: Working in the front loops from Round 3 only, join E in any st, ch 1, sc in same st as joining, * 3 hdc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around. Fasten off.
Tail Lights (Make 2)
With F, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st. Fasten off.
Large Flower
With D, ch 5; join.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as 1st dc), 11 dc in ring; join – 12 sts. Fasten off D.
Round 2: Working in front loops only, join A in any st, ch 2, * slip st in next st, ch 2; repeat from * around. Fasten off A.
Round 3: Working in back loops of Round 1 only, join B in any st, ch 3, * slip st in next st, ch 3; repeat from * around. Fasten off B.
Small Flowers
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 7 sts.
Round 2: * (Slip st, ch 3, slip st) all in next st; repeat from * around. Fasten off.
Make 1 more Small Flower with D, 2 with B, 1 with G, 1 with E, and 1 with F.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m;
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball or 17 yds/15m
Contrast B Black (00002)  1 ball or 6 yds/5 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and insert hook from back to front around post of next stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dcfp = Yoh and insert hook from front to back around post of next stitch. Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scbp = Insert hook from back to front around post of next stitch and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 4¾" [12 cm] wide x 8" [20.5 cm] long.
instructions:
Note: When joining colors, work to last loops on hook of first color.
Draw new color through last loops and proceed.
• Push picot sts to RS.
FISH (make 2)
With A, ch 4.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc. Turn.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 13 sc at end of 6th row, ending last row with join MC. Break A.
7th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Skip next sc. (2 dc. Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook – picot made. 2 dc) in next sc.
Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * twice more. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. Ch 1. Skip next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. (Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Skip next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc) twice. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
9th row: [Ch 6. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 1 dc and picot). 1 dc] in first sc. *Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 2 sc. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * once more. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 2 sc. (1 dc. Picot. 1 dc) in last sc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Ch 1. Skip next picot. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Skip next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 1. Skip next picot. 1 sc in top of ch 3. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next sc. *(2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * once more. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Skip next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
13th row: Sl st to first ch-1 sp. [Ch 6. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 1 dc and picot). 1 dc] in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 2 sc. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * once more. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 2 sc. (1 dc. Picot. 1 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Turn. Leave rem st unworked.
14th row: As 10th row.
15th row: Sl st to first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Skip next sc. *(2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 2 sc. Rep from * once more. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. PM on 3rd dc. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Fasten off.
16th row: With WS facing, join MC with sl st at marker. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (Ch 1. Skip next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc) twice. Ch 1. Skip next picot. 1 sc in next dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
17th row: Sl st to first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Skip next 2 sc. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 2 dc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * once more. Turn. Leave rem st unworked.
18th row: Sl st in each of first 3 dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. Skip next picot. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. *Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. Skip next picot. 1 sc in next dc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
19th row: Sl st to first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Skip next 2 sc. (2 dc. Picot. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Turn. Leave rem st unworked.
20th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. Ch 1. Skip next picot. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Join A. Break MC. Turn.
21st row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn. 7 sc.
22nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). (Dcbp. 2 dc in next sc) twice. Dcbp. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
23rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first dc (counts as 2 dc). (Dcfp. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc) twice. Dcfp. 2 dc in last dc. Turn.
24th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 dc. (Picot. Scbp. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc) 3 times. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With B embroider eyes using a French Knot.
With WS tog, sew around edges leaving a large enough opening to stuff. Lightly stuff. Sew rem opening closed.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 2½" [6 cm] in diameter x 3½" [9 cm] tall.
instructions:
Note: Each Cupcake uses 3 different shades. Choose any combination from the shades listed.
Beg at base of Cupcake, with smaller hook and Color 1, ch 2. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd:  Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th to 8th rnds:  Ch 3 (does not count as st). (1 dcfp around next st. 1 dcbp around next st) 12 times. Join with sl st to top of 1st dcfp.
9th rnd:  Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sl st in each st around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.
10th rnd:  Join Color 2 with sl st to any rem back loop of 8th rnd. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join color 3 with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
11th rnd:  With Color 3, ch 1. Working in both loops, *2 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to last st. 2 sc in last st. Do not join. 30 sts.
12th rnd:  Working in back loops only, *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Do not join. 24 sts. Stuff Cupcake.
13th rnd:  Working in back loops only, *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Do not join. 18 sts.
14th rnd:  Working in back loops only, *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Do not join. 12 sts.
15th to 17th rnds:  Working in back loops only, *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Do not join. 3 sts at end of 17th rnd.
Fasten off.
Icing Edging
1st rnd:  With larger hook, join Color 3 with sl st to first rem front loop of 12th rnd. Working in front loops only, sl st in each sc around, working in a spiral continuously to top of Cupcake.
Fasten off.
Optional: Sew beads to Icing for 'sprinkles'.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic™ Crochet Thread size 10 (350 yds/320 m)
Aunt Lydia’s® Classic™ Crochet Thread size 3 (150 yds/137 m)
Size U.S. C/2 (2.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in front loops ONLY in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Micro Bear: Approx 2½" x 1¾" x ¾" [6 x 4.5 x 2 cm]; Mini Bear: 3¼" x 2¼" [8.5 x 5.5 cm]
gauge: 36 sc and 40 rows = 4" [10 cm] with U.S. 7 (1.5 mm) crochet hook and Aunt Lydia’s® Classic 10 Crochet Thread; 26 sc and 28 rows = 4" [10 cm] with U.S. C/2 (2.75 mm) crochet hook and Aunt Lydia’s® Classic 3 Crochet Thread
instructions: Note: The instructions are written for both Versions. Designer Tip: Use the trick quilters use to bury their knots when hand quilting. Make a knot close to the surface of the work and pull the knot into the interior and out the other side. Trim thread close to the exit point. Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st. HEAD Make Magic loop. Video here. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in magic loop. Join. PM for beg of rnd. 6 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 18 sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 24 sc. 5th to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 18 sts. 9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 12 sts. Stuff Head. 10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. LEGS (make 2) Make Magic loop. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 4 sc in magic loop. Join. PM for beg of rnd. 4 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 8 sc. 3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long end of First Leg. Do not fasten off at end of Second Leg. Stuff legs. BODY Cont working around legs as follows: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc of Second Leg. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc of First Leg. Join. PM for beg of rnd. 16 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 12 sts. 4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next st. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long end. 9 sts. Stuff Body. ARMS (make 2) Make Magic loop. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 4 sc in magic loop. Join. PM for beg of rnd. 4 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 6 sc. 3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long end. EARS (make 2) Make Magic loop. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in magic loop. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Using a needle with the tail from the center, pull through the SC at the edge opposite of fasten off tail. SNOUT Make Magic loop. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 12 sc in magic loop. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew snout to head using the picture as a guide, make a knot close to the surface and pull to the inside of the head. Embroider nose with black floss. Sew on bead eyes and ears using the picture as a guide for placement. SCARF for Mini Bear Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color. Stripe pat B – 2 rows. A – 2 rows. These 4 rows form Stripe pat. Scarf With B, ch 9. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. First 2 rows of Stripe pat are complete. Cont in Stripe pat, rep last row until work from beg measures approx 4" [10 cm], ending with 2 rows of B. Fasten off.

Mustachio 
Mouse
This playful little mouse looks very dapper 
with his handsome moustache. Crochet 
him to brighten your day, or give him to a 
mustache-loving friend!
Round 7: Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in each of next 
6 sc, sc in next 7 sc—24 sc.
Rounds 8–14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 
times—18 sc. 
Round 16: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times— 
12 sc. Stuff head.
Round 17: Sc2tog 6 times—6 sc. Fasten off, 
leaving tail for sewing.
With yarn needle, weave ending tail in and 
out of sts of Round 17 and draw head closed. 
Fasten off but do not cut tail.
Ear (make 2) 
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 
times—18 sc.
Round 4: Slip st in each sc around. Fasten off, 
leaving tail for sewing. 
Mustache 
With B, ch 12.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc3tog, sc 
in next 3 chs, sc3tog, slip st in last ch—5 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving tail for sewing.
Body
Beginning at bottom, with A, make an 
adjustable ring.
Work same as Rounds 1-3 of ear—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 
times—24 sc.
Round 5: Working in back loops only, sc in 
each sc around.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next 6 sc, sc 
in next 9 sc—18 sc.
Rounds 8–10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: Sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog twice, sc in 
next 4 sc, sc2tog twice, sc in next 9 sc—26 sc.
Mouse measures 6” (15 cm) tall 
Special Stitches
sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over 
and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw 
through all 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over 
and pull up a loop in next st] 3 times, yarn 
over and draw through all 4 loops on hook.
Special Technique
Adjustable ring method—Holding the yarn a 
few inches from the end, wrap around your 
finger. Do not remove wrap from finger, insert 
hook into the wrap and draw up a loop of 
working yarn. Chain one to secure the loop, 
and remove ring from finger. Work stitches of 
first round in the ring. Pull gently, but firmly, on 
tail to tighten ring.
Notes
1. Head, ears, body, legs, and arm are worked
in continuous rounds (spirals). Do not join
and do not turn at ends of rounds.
2. Place a marker for beginning of round and
move marker up as work progresses.
3. Mustache and tail are each worked as a
single row.

Round 4: Sc in each sc around.

next 3 sc—15 sc.

times—18 sc.

Round 12: Sc in next 11 sc, sc2tog twice, sc 
in next 11 sc—24 sc.
Round 13: Sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog 3 times, sc 
in next 9 sc—21 sc.
Round 14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 3 times— 
18 sc.
Round 16: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times— 
12 sc. Stuff body.
Rounds 17 and 18: Sc in each sc around. 
Fasten off.
Leg (make 2) 
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Work same as Rounds 1-3 of ear—18 sc.
Rounds 4–7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times— 
12 sc. Stuff leg.
Round 9: [Slip st in first sc, ch 3, sc in 2nd ch 
from hook and next ch] 3 times (toes made), 
sc2tog 5 times, slip st in last sc. Fasten off, 
leaving tail for sewing. With yarn needle, 
weave ending tail in and out of sts of Round 9 
and draw leg closed with toes in front. 
Arm (make 2)
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring—6 sc.
Round 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 
twice—8 sc.
Rounds 3–8: Sc in each sc around. Stuff arm 
lightly after Round 8.
Round 9: Sc2tog 3 times, slip st in next sc, [ch 
3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, slip 
st in same sc] 3 times (fingers made), slip st in 
last sc. Fasten off, leaving tail for sewing. Sew 
first 3 sts to bottom of fingers to close arm.
Tail
With A, ch 30.
Row 1: Slip st in back bar of 2nd ch from 
hook and in each ch. Fasten off, leaving tail for 
sewing.
FINISHING
With yarn tail, sew ears to top of head between 
Rows 8 and 9, spaced 8 stitches apart. 
Using photograph as a guide for placement, 
embroider mouth, nose, and eyes with black 
floss.
Eyes: Working over one or 2 stitches each, 
embroider eyes with satin stitches on the row 
that is midpoint between the ears and the 
nose.
Nose: Over Round 1 of the nose, embroider an 
upside down triangle of stitches and fill in the 
triangle with satin stitches.
Mouth: Beginning under the bottom center 
of the nose, embroider an upside down “Y”-
shaped mouth with straight stitches. 
Sew head, arms, legs, and tail to body. Sew 
mustache slightly off center to the bottom of 
the nose. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Fur™: 3 balls 9100 Polar A
RED HEART® Super Saver™: 1 skein each of 706 Perfect Pink B, 311 White C, and 341 Light Grey D
Note: Only small quantities of B, C and D are needed
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 16mm [US Q] and 4mm [US G-6]
Polyester fiberfill for stuffing, removable stitch marker (optional), yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Bunny measures about 11" [28 cm] high, not including Ears.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Body
Beginning at front end of Body, with larger hook and A, ch 4.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in each of next 2 ch—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 3 times—9 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 3 times—12 sc.
Rows 6 and 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Fasten off.
Finishing Body: Fold last row (Row 7) in half. Cut a long length of C, and beginning at fold, gather the 12 sc together and pull tightly to shape bottom. Sew back seam, stuffing as you go. At top, gather neck stitches together and fasten off. Weave in ends securely.
Head
With larger hook and A, beginning at top of Head, ch 4.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in each of next 2 ch—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 3 times—9 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Fasten off.
Finishing Head: Weave C through stitches of last row (Row 4) and pull to gather, then sew side edges of piece together, stuffing as you go. Weave C through base of stitches of first row, pull tightly to gather neck stitches together. Fasten off. Referring to photo for placement, securely sew Head to top of Body using C. Weave in ends securely.
Outer Ear (make 2)
With larger hook and A, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch—4 sc.
Fasten off.
Inner Ear (make 2)
With smaller hook and B, ch 15.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 12 ch, 3 sc in last ch. Working on opposite side of ch, sc in last 13 ch—29 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, turn, hdc in next 13 sc, 2 hdc in each of next 3 sc, hdc in last 13 sc, join with slip st in first sc—32 sc.
Fasten off. Using C, sew Inner Ear to Outer Ear. Referring to photo for placement, sew Ears to Head.
Face
With smaller hook and C, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Note: If desired, place a marker in last stitch worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Fasten off. Referring to photo for placement, with B, embroider satin stitches for Nose and straight stitches for Mouth. Using D, embroider French knots for Eyes. Sew Face in place on front of Head.
Leg (make 4)
With larger hook and A, ch 3.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in last ch—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in last sc, ch 1 turn—6 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off.
Finishing Leg: Fold last row (Row 3) in half. With C, beginning at fold, sew halves of Row 3 together, then sew side edges of piece together for inside seam, stuffing as you go, sew opening at end closed. Weave in ends securely. Referring to photo for placement, sew Legs in place.
Foot Pad (make 4)
With smaller hook and B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Note: If desired, place a marker in last stitch worked to indicate end of round.
Round 2: Work 3 sc in next sc, hdc in next sc, 3 dc in next sc, ch 1, sl st in next sc, ch 1, 3 dc in next sc, hdc in next sc; continuing around, sc in first sc of round, sl st in next 2 sc to end—17 sts.
Fasten off, leaving long length of yarn. Referring to photo for placement, sew Pad to Foot.
Tail
With larger hook and A, ch 3.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in last ch—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in last sc—6 sc.
Fasten off. Referring to photo for placement, with C, gather sts together and sew in place.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. H/5 [8 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of worsted weight yarn in dark brown for Nose and Mouth.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] tall x 5" [12.5 cm] wide, including Legs.
instructions:
Notes:  
• All rnds are joined with sl st to first sc.  
• Where instructions indicate to leave a long tail when fastening off, this tail is to be used in seaming.

Snout
With A, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.  
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.  
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With dark brown yarn, stitch on Mouth as shown in photo. Loop yarn between 2 sts approx 10 times to make Nose.  
Body/Head
Note: Body and Head are worked in one piece from the bottom up.  
With B, beg using magic loop method. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th to 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.  
11th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
12th rnd: As 4th rnd.
13th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
14th rnd: As 4th rnd. 
15th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
16th rnd: As 4th rnd. 
17th rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 24 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
19th to 26th rnds: As 4th rnd.
27th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
28th rnd: As 4th rnd.
29th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
Before proceeding to complete Head, stitch Snout to Face between 20th and 24th rnds. Add safety eyes between 24th and 25th rnds, approx 6 sts apart and centered over Snout. Beg stuffing with polyfill. Cont stuffing with polyfill while working rest of Head.
30th rnd: As 4th rnd.
31st rnd: As 13th rnd. 18 sts.
32nd rnd: As 15th rnd. 12 sts.
33rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
Ears (make 2)
With B, beg using magic loop method. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in next st. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc. 
3rd and 4th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts.
Do not stuff. Stitch Ears to Head as shown in photo, approx 4 rnds down from top. 
Mane
With C, join yarn to top of head, on left side of magic loop. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd:  Ch 8. Sl st in same sp as join. *(Sl st. Ch 8. Sl st) all in corresponding st of next rnd of Head. Rep from * around, working in a circle from top of head, behind ears, and down under chin and back to top.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next st, working behind 1st rnd. Ch 10. Sl st in same st. *(Sl st. Ch 10. Sl st) all in corresponding st of next rnd of Head. Rep from * around, working in a circle behind 1st rnd. Join with sl st to base of first chain worked. 
Fasten off. 
Feet (make 2)
With B, beg using magic loop method. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
6th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Stuff Feet with polyfill. Attach Feet to each side at bottom of Body. Note that Feet should stick out sideways to give Lion support to sit up.

Arms (make 2)
With B, beg using magic loop method. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sc.
3rd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
8th to 9th rnds: As 3rd rnd. 
10th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sc.
11th to 15th rnds: As 3rd rnd. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff Arms with polyfill. Stitch to Lion at Neck so Arms hang down in Front of Feet as shown in photo. 
Tail
With C, beg using magic loop method. ( See diagram shown right)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join. 
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
6th rnd:  *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sc.
7th to 12th rnds: As 2nd rnd. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stitch tail to Body at center back.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 373 Petal Pink A, 316 Soft White B, and 312 Black C.
RED HEART® “Pomp-a-Doodle™”: 1 ball 9785 Cotton Candy Pink D.

Yarn needle, stitch marker, black embroidery floss, polyester filler, strong hand-sewing thread and needle, buttons* or plastic safety eyes*; Optional ribbon: plastic pellets and knee-high hose for making pellet packet.
abbreviations: dec (decrease) = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Poodle measures 13” tall x 12” from nose to end (excluding tail).
gauge: 20 sc = 4”; 16 rounds = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
POODLE
Head (Begin at nose)
Work in continuous rounds without joining. Mark beginning of round. Move marker up each round.
Round 1: With C and smaller hook, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: Dec, sc in next 9 sc, slip st in next sc – 11 sts. Fasten off. Stuff with black yarn remnants to prevent stuffing show-through.
Round 6: Join B in any st; ch 1, [inc, sc in next sc] 5 times, inc – 17 sc.
Round 7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: Inc, sc in next 8 sc, inc, sc in next 7 sc – 19 sc.
Round 9: Inc, sc in next 9 sc, inc, sc in next 8 sc – 21 sc.
Round 10: Inc, sc in next 10 sc, inc, sc in next 9 sc – 23 sc.
Round 11: Inc, sc in next 11 sc, inc, sc in next 10 sc – 25 sc.
Round 12: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 5 times – 30 sc.
Round 13: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: [Inc, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Round 16: [Inc, sc in next 6 sc] 6 times – 48 sc.
Round 17: [Inc, sc in next 7 sc] 6 times – 54 sc.
Rounds 18-23: Sc in each sc around.
Round 24: [Inc, sc in next 8 sc] 6 times – 60 sc.
Round 25: Sc in each sc around.
Round 26: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] 10 times – 50 sc.
Round 27: [Dec, sc in next 3 sc] 10 times – 40 sc.
Round 28: [Dec, sc in next 2 sc] 10 times – 30 sc. Stuff head firmly, continuing as rounds are worked.
Round 29: [Dec, sc in next sc] 10 times – 20 sc.
Round 30: Sc in each sc around. Finish stuffing head.
Round 31: [Dec] 10 times – 10 sc.
Round 32: [Dec] 5 times – 5 sc. Fasten off, weaving yarn tail through sc to close hole.

Body (Beginning at rear end)
Round 1: Using A and smaller hook, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 5: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 6: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 7: [Inc, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Round 8: [Inc, sc in next 6 sc] 6 times – 48 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [Inc, sc in next 7 sc] 6 times – 54 sc.
Round 11: [Inc, sc in next 8 sc] 6 times – 60 sc.
Rounds 12 and 13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14-Back Leg Openings: Sc in next 3 sc, ch 8, skip 10 sc, sc in next 2 sc, ch 8, skip 10 sc, sc in next 35 sc – 56 sts.
Rounds 15-23: Sc in each ch and sc around – 56 sc.
Round 24-Front Leg Openings: Sc in next 3 sc, ch 8, skip 10 sc, sc in next 2 sc, ch 8, skip 10 sc, sc in next 31 sc – 52 sts.
Round 25: Inc, sc in next 23 sts, inc, sc in next 27 sc – 54 sc.
Rounds 26: Inc, sc in next 24 sts, inc, sc in next 28 sts – 56 sc.
Round 27: Sc in each sc around.
Round 28-Neck Opening: Sc in next 39 sc, ch 10, skip 10 sc, sc in next 7 sc – 56 sts.
Round 29: Sc in each ch and sc around – 56 sc.
Stuff poodle body as rounds are worked.
Round 30: [Sc in next 6 sc, dec] 7 times – 49 sc.
Round 31: Sc in next sc, [dec, sc in next 4 sc] 8 times – 41 sc.
Round 32: Sc in next sc, [dec] 20 times – 21 sc.
Continue to stuff body.
Round 33: Sc in next sc, [dec] 10 times – 11 sc.
Round 34: Sc in next sc, [dec] 5 times – 6 sc.
Round 35: [Dec] 3 times – 3 sc. Fasten off, weaving yarn tail through sc to close hole.

Legs (Make 4)
Round 1: Join B to any st in leg opening; ch 1, sc in each ch and sc around inc 3 sts evenly spaced – 21 sc.
Rounds 2-14: Sc in each sc around, changing to A in the last st of the last round. Fasten off B.
Round 15: With A, slip st loosely at base of each sc around (this will be the foundation for applying leg pouf).
Round 16: Sc in each sc of Round 14 around – 21 sc.
Stuff upper section of leg. If using plastic pellets to add weight to poodle, place about ¼ cup in the toe of a knee-high stocking, cut and tightly knot. Stuff this into bottom-most parts needing extra weight, finish stuffing with polyester filler.
Round 17: Sc in next sc, [inc, sc in next 4 sc] 4 times – 25 sc.
Round 18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 5 times – 30 sc.
Round 20: [Inc, sc in next 5 sc] 5 times – 35 sc.
Round 21: [Dec, sc in next 5 sc] 5 times – 30 sc.
Round 22: [Dec] 15 times – 15 sc.
Finish stuffing.
Round 23: [Dec] 7 times, sc in next sc – 8 sc.
Round 24: [Dec] 4 times – 4 sc.
Fasten off leaving long tail for sewing. Repeat for other legs.
Pomp-a-Doodle™ yarn is worked in the thread between the pompons. Do not pull pompons through stitches. See Red Heart video tutorial at http://www.redheart.com/ for more information on working with Pomp-a-Doodle™.

Leg Pouf
Round 1: Join D in any slip st of Round 15; sc in each slip st around leg.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.

Neck
Round 1: Attach A to any sc in neck opening; ch 1, sc in each ch and sc around inc 6 sts evenly spaced – 26 sc.
Rounds 2-7: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off leaving yarn tail for attaching head.

Ribbed Sweater Collar
Row 1: Ch 7; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 6 sc.
Rows 2-21: Ch 1, sc in back loops only in each sc across; turn. Fasten off leaving long tail for attaching to neck.
Edging: Join D in end of any row of collar; slip st evenly across row ends (about 12 pompoms). Fasten off.

Tail
With smaller hook and A, ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; do not join; work in continuous rounds.
Rounds 2-12: Work even in sc. Fasten off A in last sc.
Round 13: Join D in any sc; slip st (1 pompom per slip st) in each sc around.
Round 14: * 2 Slip sts in next slip st, slip st in next slip st; repeat from * around.
Round 15: Slip st in every other st around. Fasten off.

Ears (Make 2)
With smaller hook and B, ch 12; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; do not join – 12 sc.
Rounds 2-6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Inc, sc in next 5 sc] twice – 14 sc.
Rounds 8 and 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [Inc, sc in next 6 sc] twice – 16 sc.
Round 11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Inc, sc in next 7 sc] twice – 18 sc.
Round 13: [Inc, sc in next 8 sc] twice – 20 sc.
Round 14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: [Inc, sc in next 9 sc] twice – 22 sc.
Rounds 16 and 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: [Dec, sc in next sc] 7 times, sc in next sc – 15 sc.
Round 19: [Dec, sc in next sc] 5 times – 10 sc.
Round 20: [Dec] 5 times – 5 sc. Fasten off, using long tail to close hole.

Ear Pouf
Round 1: Starting at the tip of the ear at Round 18, slip st D into stitches around the ear tip. 
Round 2: Slip st in each slip st around. Fill in bare spots with D as needed. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew head, tail, and sweater collar to body as in photo, using long yarn tails. Make certain parts are securely attached. Sew ears to head leaving approximately 4” diameter circle free between ears at top of head.
Locate eye placement. Using black embroidery thread, sew 3 lines for eyelashes as shown. Attach buttons securely, overlapping the eyelashes a little OR embroider eyes if toy is to be used for children under 2 years of age.

Head Pouf
Add after ears have been attached and head has been sewn to neck. 
Round 1: Beginning at the crown of the head where the ears are attached, with larger hook and B, loosely work 25 slip sts into the sts of the Head in a circle about 4” diameter. This circle should be placed directly on top of the head, evenly spaced in conjunction with the ears. 
Round 2: With D and larger hook, sc in each st around.
Round 3: Inc, [sc in next sc, inc] 12 times – 38 sc.
Round 4: Sc in next 2 sc, [dec, sc in next 2 sc] 9 times – 29 sc.
Round 5: [Dec, sc in next 3 sc] 5 times, dec, sc in last 2 sc – 23 sc.
Round 6: Sc in next sc, [dec] 11 times – 12 sc.
Round 7: [Dec] 6 times – 6 sc.
Round 8: [Dec] 3 times – 3 sc. Fasten off.

Ribbon is attached by weaving the tip of the ribbon between a few D sts, pulling through with even lengths and tying into a bow. Tighten and trim ends.

Blushed Cheeks
Use dark powder blush and extra large makeup brush or stencil brush. Load makeup onto brush as if to apply to face, tapping off excess. Locate cheek area on Head and apply using a tamping or pouncing motion. To do this, hold the brush straight and perpendicular to the poodles’ face. Tap the brush end onto the desired location; do not use a brushing or sweeping motion. Apply blush in layered stages until desired effect is achieved.

RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 
Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz 
(198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multi color, fleck 
& print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m) skeins.

RED HEART® “Pomp-a-Doodle™” 
Art. E765 available in 3.5 oz (100 g), 
54 yd (50 m) balls.

materials: Contrast C 41554 In Motion Twists 1 ball
Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of red embroidery floss for mouth
Small amount of black embroidery floss for eyelashes
measurements: Doll: Approx 13 ins [33 cm] tall; Dress: Approx 4 ¼ ins [11 cm] long.
gauge: Doll: 16 sc and 20 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]; Dress: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Head: With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd 10 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Stuff Head.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. Stuff rem of Head. Fasten off. 
Body: With MC, ch 30. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 2 ins [5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4 ins [10 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Sew bottom edge of Body closed. Stuff Body. 
Arms (make 2).
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4 ins [10 cm]. Fasten off. Stuff Arms lightly.
Legs (make 2).
Shoe: With A, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn.
Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (Sc2tog over next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join MC with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd. 21 sts.
6th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2tog over next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog over next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until Leg from marker at top of Shoe measures 5 ins [12.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Shoe strap: Join A with sl st to 6th sc of marked rnd. Ch 5. Join with sl st to 13th sc of marked rnd. Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Stuff Legs. Sew top of Legs closed using whip st. Sew to bottom of Body. Attach Arms to sides of Body.
Hair: Cut a piece of tape 11 ins [28 cm] long and secure onto a flat surface with sticky side up. Cut A, 14 ins [35.5 cm] long and lay them across tape so strip of tape is in center of yarn. Holding tissue paper over top of yarn and using sewing machine, run a line of stitching along length of tape. Remove tape when hair is secure. Remove tissue paper after stitching. Pin hair to outside of head. Using backstitch and A, sew hair into place along sewn line. Fold hair up and secure at top of Head tightly. With red and black embroidery floss, embroider mouth and eyelash using straight stitches. Sew head to body.
Dress 
Note: Dress is worked from top down.
With B, ch 30. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in next ch. Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch. 3 sc in next ch. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in next ch. Miss next 2 ch. 1 sc in last ch. 1 sc in first ch (where first 2 sc worked). Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Working in back loops only, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in last sc. 1 sc in first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
3rd rnd: Working in back loops only, ch 1. 3 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 5 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 2 sc in first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th to 7th rnds: Working in back loops only, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 1 sc in first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
8th rnd: Working in back loops only, ch 1. 3 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 5 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 2 sc in first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
9th and 10th rnds: Working in back loops only, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. 1 sc in first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Break B. Join C.
11th rnd: Working in front loops only, with C, ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. 1 sc in first sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.  
12th rnd: Join C with sl st to back loop of first sc of 11th rnd. Working in back loops only, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as sl st. *2 dc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.
Straps: (make 2). With 2 strands of B, ch 8. Fasten off. 
Try dress on Doll. Attach each strap at points of top edge. 
Flower: (make 1 with C, make 2 with B). 
Ch 2. 
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: *Working in back loops only, ch 3. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with ch 3. Join with sl st to first st. (7 petals). Fasten off.
Sew C Flower on Dress and B Flowers at ponytail.

materials: Lily® sugar‘n cream® (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds; Ombres: 56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds)
contrast a (02316 Beach Ball Blue) 1 ball
doll: Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of red and black embroidery floss.
clothing: Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
10" [25.5 cm] satin ribbon ¹⁄₈" [0.3 cm] wide.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
doLL
head: With MC and smaller hook, ch 2.
**1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from *around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.**
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 10 times more.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Stuff Head.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts. 
Stuff rem of Head. Fasten off.
Body: With MC and smaller hook, ch 30. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
30 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm].
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts,
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm].
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Sew bottom edge of Body closed.
Stuff Body.

arms (make 2).
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 
1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4" [10 cm]. Fasten off.
Stuff Arms lightly.

Legs (make 2).
With MC and smaller hook, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 
2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. do not turn. Working in rem loops of 
foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each 
of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each 
of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 
1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker 
at end of rnd. 21 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 
6 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 17 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 
1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Leg from marked rnd measures  
5"  [12.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Stuff Legs lightly.

Finishing
Sew top of Legs closed. Sew to bottom of Body. Attach Head to 
top of Body. Attach Arms to sides of Body. With red and black 
embroidery floss, embroider mouth and eyelashes using straight 
stitch. Attach beads to Head for Eyes.

Flowers: (make 2 for Pants and 3 for Hat). 
With larger hook and A, ch 3. Sl st in first ch. (Ch 2. Sl st in first ch) 
4 times. Fasten off. 
dress: With larger hook and A, ch 22. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *1 dc in next 
ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Turn. 21 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). *1 sc in next dc. 1 dc in next sc. Rep 
from * to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep 
from * to end of row. Turn. 
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next dc. Rep 
from * to end of row. 31 sts.
6th and 7th rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows. 
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 
2 sts. Rep from * to end of row. 41 sc.
9th to 14th rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows 3 times more. Fasten off. 
Flowers on dress bodice: With B and larger hook, ch 3. *Sl st 
in 3rd ch from hook. (Ch 3. Sl st in same sp as last sl st) twice - half 
flower made.** Ch 6. Rep from * 3 times more, then from * to ** 
once. Ch 4. do not turn. Work along foundation ch as follows: 
Miss first ch, ***Sl st in each of next 3 ch. Sl st in next Half Flower. 
(Ch 3. Sl st in same sp as last sl st) twice - Flower complete. Rep 
from *** 4 times more. Fasten off. 
Sew flowers around neck edge.
Pants
note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st. 
With larger hook and B, ch 28. Join with sl st to first ch to form a 
ring, taking care not to twist ch. 
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each ch around. Join with 
sl st to top of ch 3. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first 
hdc. 
divide for legs: 
First Leg: 1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 14 hdc. Join with 
sl st to first hdc. Leave rem 14 hdc unworked. 
**2nd rnd:  Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first 
hdc.
Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Work back and forth in rows as follows: next row: Miss first 
7 hdc. Join B with sl st in next hdc. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 
1 hdc in each hdc around. do not join. Turn. 
next row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row once more. Fasten off.**
second Leg: 1st rnd: Join B with sl st to first missed hdc of 1st 
rnd. Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. 1 hdc in each of next  
13 hdc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
Work from ** to ** as given for First Leg. Sew 1 Flower to each 
side of Pant slits. 
hat 
With B and larger hook, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. 25 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. 35 sc. 
8th and 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join MC with 
sl st to first sc.
10th rnd: With A, ch 2 (does not count as st). 2 hdc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
11th to 14th rnds: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdc in each hdc 
around. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off at end of last rnd. 
Thread B through 9th rnd. Pull slightly to form shape of Hat. 
Sew 3 Flowers to Hat. 
hair
Cut strands of C 7" [18 cm] long. Take 1 strand and fold in half 
and knot into fringe into each sc around 9th rnd of Hat. Trim 
front fringe for bangs. Divide rem strands into 2 groups and tie 
with ribbon into 2 pig-tails. Trim tails.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Pink Dust (10956) 1 ball or 125 yds/114.5 m
Contrast B Misty Green (10878) 1 ball or 75 yds/68.5 m
Contrast C Sand (10014) 1 ball or 75 yds/68.5 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 4 dc into same stitch. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 4 dc group. Pull dropped loop through stitch. Ch 1 to secure popcorn
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
CAKE ICING
With A, ch 3.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 4 sc.
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
6th to 26th rows: Rep 3rd to 5th rows 7 times more. 20 sc.
27th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
28th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
29th to 43rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
44th row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
45th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

46th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 18 sc.
47th and 48th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep 46th to 48th rows until 2 sts rem, ending on a 46th row. Fasten off.

Top Edge Frosting: 1st row: (RS). Join B with sl st to 1st rem front loop of 27th row. Working in front loops only, *Popcorn in next st. Sl st in next st. Rep from * to last st. (Popcorn. Sl st) in last st. Fasten off.

Bottom Edge Frosting: 1st row: (RS). Join B with sl st to 1st rem front loop of 43rd row. Ch 1. Working in front loops only, *1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Fasten off.

CAKE LAYERS
Cake Layers Stripe Pat
With C, 4 rows.
With B, 2 rows.
With C, 4 rows.
With B, 2 rows.
With C, 4 rows.
These 16 rows complete Cake Layers Stripe Pat.
With C, ch 51.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 50 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. First 2 rows of Stripe Pat are complete.
Rep 2nd row until all 16 rows of Stripe Pat have been worked. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Attach safety eyes and embroider cheeks with A on Cake Layers as shown in photo.
Joining Cake Layers and Cake Icing: Referring to diagram, pin Cake Layers and Cake Icing tog to help with joining.
1st rnd: Working through both thicknesses, join A with sl st anywhere along meeting edges of Cake Layers and Cake Icing. Ch 2. Work hdc evenly around all edges. Stuff Cake firmly before completing joining edge. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

Icing Dollop
With B, ch 11.
1st row: Sc2tog over 2nd and 3rd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th to 12th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 4 times more, then 2nd row once. Fasten off, leaving long yarn tail.
Sew ends tog to create tube. Gather top edge of tube. Pull tight and secure. Do not break. Using same yarn tail, gather bottom edge of tube. Pull tight and secure.
Sew Icing Dollop to top of Cake as shown in picture.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.25 mm [US B-1]
Black embroidery floss and embroidery needle for mouth
Scrap of pink felt for cheeks
Regular size drinking straw for leg armature
Optional: Knee high stocking and plastic pellets for weighted stuffing
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Mermaid measures about 5½" [14 cm] tall not including tail, and 7½" [19 cm] tall including tail.
gauge: 32 sts = about 4" [10 cm]; 28 rounds = about 4" [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL TO THIS PROJECT. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BODY
Beginning at top of body with A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each of next 6 sts and change to your choice of yarn color B or C for bikini in last st —12 sc. Fasten off A.

Bikini
Round 3: With bikini color, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 4–6: With bikini color, sc in each st around and change to A in last st. Fasten off bikini color.
Rounds 7–11: With A, sc in each st around and change to bikini color in last st. Fasten off A.
Rounds 12–14: With bikini color, sc in each st around.
Stuff body with stuffing or with optional knee high filled with plastic pellets. Complete piece with bikini color only. Round 15: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Round 16: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Secure tail and weave to inside of body.

ARMS AND LEGS (make 4)
Note: Arms and legs are "stuffed" with drinking straw cut to size. Do not stuff with fiber.
With A, make an adjustable ring. Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–11: Sc in each st around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing limb to body. Insert straw into limb and cut straw even with top opening of limb.

HEAD
Beginning at top of head with A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each of next 6 sts—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 7–12: Sc in each st around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 14: [Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc. Attach safety eyes between Rounds 8 and 9, about 8 sts apart.
Round 15: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Begin stuffing head and continue to stuff until piece is complete.
Round 16: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing head to body.

WIG BASE
With your choice of yarn color B or D, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 8 hdc in ring; join with slip st in first hdc—8 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1 (does not count as a stitch), 2 hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc—16 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [hdc in next st, 2 hdc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first hdc—24 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in first hdc—32 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 1, hdc in each st around; join with slip st in first hdc.
Rounds 6 and 7: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing wig base to head. Note: Hair instructions are found at the end of the pattern. Hair is added very last.

TAIL
Beginning at waist with C, ch 20; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Work 2 sc in same ch as joining slip st, sc in next 9 ch, 2 sc in next ch, sc in next 9 ch; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—22 sc. Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–8: Sc in each st around. Round 9: [Sc2tog, sc in next 9 sts] twice—20 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each st around.
Round 11: [Sc2tog, sc in next 8 sts] twice—18 sc.
Round 12: Sc in each st around.
Round 13: [Sc2tog, sc in next 7 sts] twice—16 sc.
Round 14: Sc in each st around.
Round 15: [Sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts] twice—14 sc.
Rounds 16 and 17: Sc in each st around.
Round 18: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts] twice—12 sc.
Round 19: Sc in each st around.
Round 20: Work 2 sc in each st around—24 sc.
Round 21: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—30 sc.
Fasten off C.

Fins
Flatten piece, with decrease lines at sides. Inserting through both layers, place a marker in the middle stitch on the top and bottom layers so that there are 14 stitches on each side of the marked middle stitches.
First Fin
Working through both layers, join C with slip st in the marked middle sts.
Round 1: Sc in next 14 sts; leave sts on other side of marker unworked for second fin; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—14 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each st around.
Round 4: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts] twice—12 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] 4 times—8 sc.
Round 6: [Sc2tog] 4 times—4 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Weave in and trim ends.

Second Fin
Working through both layers, join C with slip st in the marked middle sts so that you are ready to work over the 14 unworked sts. Repeat Rounds 1–6 of first fin.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Weave in and trim ends.

Waistband
Round 1: With right side facing and working along opposite side of foundation chain at waist, draw up a loop of B in any ch, ch 1, hdc in same ch and in each ch around; join with slip st in first hdc—20 hdc.
If a two-color waistband is desired, fasten off B and draw up a loop of C in any hdc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off. Weave in and trim ends.

TUTU
Beginning at waist edge with B, ch 19.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—18 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, 2 sc in each st across—36 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * across—54 sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With long yarn tail, sew edges together for back seam, leaving about ⅛" [3mm] unsewn at top waist edge. Weave in and trim ends.

Sash
With right side facing, join B with slip st in one top corner of waist edge, ch 22. Fasten off and weave in and trim ends. Join B with slip st in second top corner of waist edge, ch 22. Fasten off and weave in and trim ends.

SKIRT
Beginning at waist edge with C, ch 19.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—18 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, [hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st] 6 times—24 hdc.
Rows 3–5: Ch 1, turn, hdc in each st across and change to B in last st of last row.
Fasten off C, leaving a long tail for sewing edges together.
Row 6: With B, turn, *ch 3, slip st in next st; repeat from * across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Using the long tail, sew the first and last ch-3 loops together. Weave in and trim end. With long C-colored tail from Row 5, whip stitch side edges together for back seam. Weave in and trim ends.

Sash
With B, ch 25, hold skirt with foundation ch at top, sc in each ch along opposite side of foundation ch, ch 25. Fasten off and weave in and trim ends.

FINISHING
