Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, use yarn tails or yarn scraps to sew the following pieces together.
1. Sew head to body, taking care to position face frontwards.
2. Sew arms to upper sides of body at Rounds 3 and 4.
3. Sew legs to lower portion of body.
Bangs: Before sewing wig base to head, embroider bangs as follows: With yarn same color as wig base, begin embroidering bangs about 2 rows above the eyes and make long stitches that will be partially hidden under the wig base. Vary the length of the bang stitches for a tousled look. Place wig base on head, overlapping bangs by a fraction of an inch. Pin in place, for best results, and sew base to head. Weave and trim ends.
Smile: With embroidery needle and 2 strands of black embroidery floss, embroider a smile at Round 13 of head, in the middle of the face, about 3 stitches wide.
Cheeks: Cut small circles from pink felt. Referring to photo for placement, glue cheeks to face directly under and to the sides of the eyes.
Hair Version 1 (side buns)
With B, leaving a long beginning tail, ch 21.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 hdc in next ch, *hdc in next ch, 2 hdc in next ch; repeat from * across—30 hdc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Roll the piece in spiral (jelly roll) fashion. With one yarn tail, sew layers to one another to retain the shape. With the other yarn tail, sew bun to side of head, about level with the eyes. Repeat to make and attach second bun.

Hair Version 2 (long curls)
First Round of Curls: Join D with slip st in any st of last round of wig base; ch 21, slip st in each ch of ch-21 just made, slip st in same st as joining slip st (first curl made), *skip next st, slip st in next st, ch 21, slip st in each ch of ch-21 just made, slip st in same st of wig base as very first slip st of this curl (next curl made); repeat from * around last round of wig base. Fasten off, weave in and trim ends.
Next Round of Curls: Working around Round 4 of wig base (or any round desired), repeat first round of curls.
Notes: There is no need to fill entire wig base with curls as it will become too heavy and may make the head sag. To hide base and style the hair, pull a few lengths of the Round 4 curls to the back of head and tie loosely in back. Slip stitch lengths will curl naturally.
Weave in and trim any remaining ends. Dress mermaid in outfit of your choice.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Whipped Cream (10867) 1 ball
Size U.S. L/11 [8 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
10" [25.5 cm] diameter round microbead pillow or fiberfill stuffing.
measurements: Approx 10" [25.5 cm] in diameter (excluding comb and fins).
instructions:
Note: All Body rnds are worked in a continuous spiral. Do not ch 1 unless directed, and do not join any rnds with a sl st unless directed. Move a stitch marker along first st of each rnd as you work to keep track of your progress.

Bottom Half of Body
See Diagram on page 3.
With A, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here: https://www.yarnspirations.com/video-y-crochet-magic-loop.html
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 hdc in ring. 10 sts.
2nd rnd: 2 hdc in each hdc around. 20 hdc.
3rd rnd: *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 30 hdc.
4th rnd: *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 50 hdc.
6th rnd: *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. 60 hdc.
7th rnd: 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * until 4 hdc rem. 1 hdc in each of last 4 hdc. 66 hdc.
8th rnd: *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Rep from * around. 72 hdc.
9th rnd: 1 hdc in next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. *1 hdc in each of next 17 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * until 9 hdc rem. 1 hdc in each of last 9 hdc. 76 hdc.
10th and 11th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around.
12th rnd: 1 hdc in each of next 17 hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. 3 tr in next hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 35 hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. 3 tr in next hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 18 hdc. 84 sts.
13th rnd: 1 sc in next hdc. Sl st in next hdc. Break yarn. Weave in ends and set piece aside.

Top Half of Body
See Diagram on page 4.
1st to 11th rnds: Rep from 1st to 11th rnds as for Bottom Half of Body.
12th and 13th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around.
14th rnd: 1 hdc in each of next 17 hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. 3 tr in next hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 35 hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. 3 tr in next hdc. 2 dc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of last 18 hdc. 84 sts.
15th rnd: 1 sc in next hdc. Sl st in next hdc. Break yarn leaving a long tail for sewing. Weave in first end at magic loop. Set piece aside.

Tail
With A, beg using magic loop method.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in ring. 1 hdc in ring. 3 dc in ring. Turn. 5 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of first 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Break yarn leaving a long tail for sewing. 8 sts. Set piece aside.

Comb
With B, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (3 dc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch) twice. Turn. 9 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Break yarn leaving a long tail for sewing. Set piece aside.

Beak
With C, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in ring. 6 hdc in ring. 7 sts.
2nd rnd: 2 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 14 hdc.
Break yarn leaving a long tail for sewing. Set piece aside.

Feet (make 2)
With C, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. (Turn. Loosely sl st in each of first 3 sts. Ch 5. Skip first ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sl sts. 1 sl st in next ch) twice. Break yarn leaving a long tail for sewing. Set pieces aside.

Assembly
Sew Comb to center top of Top Half of Body. Be sure to position it perpendicularly to "Wings" on sides as shown in photo.
Add Safety Eyes to Top Half of Body, on opposite side of long tail.
Sew Feet to Bottom Half of Body, leaving toes loose. Be sure to position facing away from 13th rnd. Flip one over so they are mirrored.
Sew Tail to Bottom Half of Body, at end of 2nd row of tail. Be sure to position behind Feet, centered between Wings. Sew around 11th/12th rnd of Body.
Use long tail on Top Half of Body to whipstitch Top and Bottom tog JUST OVER HALFWAY around. Be sure to align Wings, and face Eyes and Feet in same direction. Stop just a few sts past second safety eye.
Sew Beak to front, between Eyes, overlapping seam. Push Beak out a bit while sewing to create a "beaky shape."
Insert pillow ball or fill with fiberfill. Finish using long tail on Top Half of Body to whip stitch Top and Bottom tog.

materials: lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Sizes 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) and 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hooks
Small amount of red embroidery floss for mouth
Small amount of black embroidery floss for eyelashes
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Doll
head
With MC and smaller hook, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd 10 times more.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw 
through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 
Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts. 
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Stuff Head.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sts. Join with sl st 
to first st. Fasten off.
Stuff Head. 
Body
With MC and smaller hook, ch 30. Join in ring with sl st into first 
ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
30 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm]. 
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm]. 
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Sew bottom edge of Body closed. Stuff Body. 
arms (make 2).
With MC and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 
1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 8 sts. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4” [10 cm]. Fasten off.
Stuff Arms lightly.
legs (make 2).
shoe: With A and smaller hook, ch 5. 
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc 
in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc 
in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each 
of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each 
of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 
(Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join MC with sl st 
to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd. 21 sts. 
6th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of 
next 6 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 17 sts. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 
(Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 14 sts. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until Leg from top of Shoe measures 5" [12.5 cm]. 
Fasten off.
shoe strap: Join A with sl st to 6th sc of marked rnd. Ch 5. Join 
with sl st to 13th sc of marked rnd. Fasten off. Stuff Legs.
Finishing
Sew top of Legs closed using whip st. Sew Arms and Leg to 
Body. Attach Head to top of Body. With black embroidery floss, 
embroider eyelashes on Head. Sew beads for eyes to Head. With 
red embroidery floss, embroider mouth.
hair fringe
Cut a piece of tape 6" [15 cm] long and secure onto a flat surface 
with sticky side up. Cut lengths of C 19" [48 cm] long and lay 
them across tape so strip of tape is in center of yarn. Holding 
tissue paper over top of yarn and using sewing machine, run a 
line of stitching along length of tape. Remove tape when hair is 
secure. Remove tissue paper after stitching. Pin fringe to center 
of head. Using backstitch and C, sew hair into place along sewn 
line. Braid Hair and secure at side of Head.
clothing
Dress
With larger hook and A, ch 22.
1st row: 1 sc in 5th ch from hook (button loop). 1 sc in each of 
next 17 ch. Turn. 18 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc each of next 16 sc. 2 sc in last 
sc. Turn. 20 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc each of next 18 sc. 2 sc in last 
sc. Do not turn. Join with sl st to first sc. 22 sc.
Beg working rnds: 1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc 
in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
6th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in each sc around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker on last st. 72 sc.
8th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
Rep last rnd until work measures 4½" [11.5 cm] from marked rnd. 
Fasten off.
sleeves (make 2).
With larger hook and A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first ch to form 
ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
10 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
5th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
7th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 9 sts.
9th to 13th rnds: As 2nd rnd. Fasten off after last rnd.
Put Dress on Doll. Put Sleeves on Arms and mark placement 
on Dress. Sew Sleeves to Dress. Sew button to back of Dress to 
correspond with button loop.
apron
With larger hook and B, ch 101.
1st row: (Waistband/Ties). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each 
ch across. Fasten off. 100 sc.
2nd row: (Apron). Join B with sl st to 46th sc from end. Ch 1. 2 sc 
in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each of next 9 sc. turn. Leave rem 
sts unworked.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 20 sc.
Rep last row until Apron measures 3½" [9 cm] from beg. Fasten 
off.
Tie Apron at Doll’s waist. Wrap remaining Ties over Doll’s 
shoulders from back to front. Tuck ends of Ties into Waistband 
as pictured.
Buckle (make 2).
With smaller hook and D, ch 2. 
1st rnd: (1 sc. Ch 1) 4 times in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st 
to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew one Buckle to side of each Shoe as shown in picture.
Bonnet
With larger hook and B, ch 31.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 
30 sc.
2nd to 11th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. (Sc2tog) 5 times. 1 sc 
in each of next 10 sc. Turn. 25 sts.
13th row: As 2nd row.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (Draw up a loop in each 
of next 3 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc3tog 
made) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Do not turn. Join with sl 
st to first sc. 19 sts.
Beg working in rnds: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 
6 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 15 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of 
next 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 13 sts. Fasten off.
Sew opening at back of Bonnet closed.
Fold Bonnet brim back approx 1½" [4 cm]. Attach 7" [18 cm] 
piece of ribbon to each side at fold as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1201 Daffodil A, 1321 Chocolate B and 1012 Black C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
sc2tog: [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 11 sc = 3” [7.5 cm]; 14 rounds = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEAD
Beginning at top of Head, with A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Working in continuous rounds, 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 36 sc.
Rounds 7-13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: [Sc in next 10 sc, sc2tog] around – 33 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog] around – 30 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: [Sc2tog] 6 times, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next 6 sc, sc in next 6 sc – 30 sc.
Rounds 19-20: Sc in each sc around.
Round 21: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] around – 24 sc.
Round 22: Sc in each sc around.
Round 23: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] around – 18 sc.
Stuff Head with fiberfill.
Round 24: Sc in each sc around.
Round 25: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] around – 12 sc.

EAR
Make 2
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Working in continuous rounds, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 8 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 12 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 18 sc.
Rounds 7-9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [Sc2tog] around – 9 sc.
Round 11: Sc in each sc around. 
Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. 
Flatten and sew an Ear on either side of Head. 

HORN
Make 2
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Working in continuous rounds, 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: Working in back loops only, [sc2tog] around – 6 sc.
Rounds 5-6: Sc in each sc around. 
Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. 
Stuff with fiberfill. Sew Horns on Head in between Ears.

NECK AND BODY
Beginning at top of Neck and leaving a long tail, with A, ch 24, slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in same st as join and each ch around – 24 sc. Place marker for beginning of round.
Rounds 2-24: Working in continuous rounds, sc in each sc around.
Round 25: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 30 sc.
Round 26: Sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in next 6 sc, sc in next 12 sc – 36 sc.
Rounds 27-28: Sc in each sc around.
Round 29: Sc in next 15 sc, 2 sc next 6 sc, sc in next 15 sc – 42 sc.
Rounds 30-31: Sc in each sc around.
Round 32: Sc in next 18 sc, 2 sc in next 6 sc, sc in next 18 sc – 48 sc.
Rounds 33-42: Sc in each sc around.
Round 43: [Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] around – 42 sc.
Round 44: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] around – 36 sc.
Round 45: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] around – 30 sc.
Round 46: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] around – 24 sc. 
Stuff Neck and Body. 
Round 47: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] around – 18 sc.
Round 48: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] around – 12 sc.
Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. 
Insert fiberfill firmly. Using long tail, sew Neck and Body closed. 

LEGS
Make 4
With C, ch 2. 
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Working in continuous rounds, 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 18 sc.
Rounds 4-5: Sc in each sc around. Cut C.
Rounds 6-17: Change to A, sc in each sc around. 
Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. 
Stuff Legs.

FINISHING
Embroider a few loop stitches with A in between Horns on Head. With C, embroider eyes and nostrils in satin stitch. Embroider mouth in couched stitch. Positioning Head to look towards one side, sew Neck to Head.
Sew Legs to Body.

Mane
With B, ch 35. 
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook, skip 3 sts, *7 dc in next st, skip 3 sts; repeat from * to last st, sc in last st.
Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail.
Sew Mane down center of Head and Neck. 

Spots
Make 12
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around, slip st in first st to join. 
Fasten off. 
Sew Spots randomly around Body. 

Tail
With A, ch 9, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across.
Fasten off. Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. 
Cut four lengths of B, each 10” [25 cm] long. 
Thread each length through one end of Tail and center each length. 
Tie an overhand knot in lengths to secure and trim. 
Sew opposite end of tail to Body. 
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps: 1 ball each: 9200 Baby Yellow A and 9505 Aqua B
RED HEART® Boutique® Sashay Mini™: 1 ball 2682 Breezy C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Clothes designed for 18” (45.5 cm) doll. Tee Shirt measures: 8½” (21.5 cm) wide x 7” (18 cm) long. Skirt measures: 9” (23 cm) wide x 6” (15 cm) long. Purse measures: 3” (8 cm) wide x 3” (8 cm) high.
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 20 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc; turn—52 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 13 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc; turn—56 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 14 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc; turn—60 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 13 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 15 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 13 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc; turn—64 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 14 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 16 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 14 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc; turn—68 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 15 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 17 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 15 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc; turn—72 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 16 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 18 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 16 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc; turn—76 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 17 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 19 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 17 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc; turn—80 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 18 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 20 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 18 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc; turn—84 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in next 11 sc, skip 20 sc, sc in next 22 sc, skip 20 sc, sc in next 11 sc; turn—44 sc.
Rows 15-26: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. At the end of Row 26, do not turn.
Buttonhole Placket
Row 1: Rotate work so that side of Row 26 is on top; ch 1, work one sc in the side of each Row; turn—26 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in next 2 sc, ch 1, skip 1 sc, [sc in next 4 sc, ch 1, skip 1 sc] 4 times, sc in next 3 sc; turn—26 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch-1 space across—26 sc. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Assembly
Using white sewing thread, sew Buttons onto Tee Shirt, centering one Button under each Buttonhole.
SKIRT
With B, ch 41.
Row 1 (Right side): Skipping first ½” (12.7 mm) of elastic, hold elastic above foundation ch and loosely sc over elastic, working in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; leave last ½” (12.7 mm) of elastic unworked—40 sc. Place loop on stitch holder. With sewing thread, tack ends of elastic in place; trim excess elastic. Place loop back on hook; turn.
Rows 2-3: Ch 1, sc across; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in next 3 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc] 4 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc; turn—45 sc.
Rows 5-6: Ch 1, sc across; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc] 4 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc; turn—50 sc.
Rows 8-9: Ch 1, sc across; turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in next 4 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc] 4 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc; turn—55 sc.
Row 11 (Attach Ruffle): Ch 1, place C on top of work so cut end is on the right and ball is on the left. Leaving a 2” end to sew to wrong side later, insert hook through a large mesh hole in C and then through the first sc from Row 10, sc together using B; *skip one hole in C and insert hook into the next hole in C and then through the next sc from Row 10, sc together using B; repeat from * across—55 sc. Cut C, leaving a 2” end. Do not fasten off B.
Rows 12-13: With B, ch 1, sc across; turn.
Row 14 (Attach Ruffle): Ch 1, place C behind work so cut end is on the right and ball is on the left. Leaving a 2” (5.1 cm) end to sew to wrong side later, insert hook through first sc from Row 13 and then through a large mesh hole in C, sc together using B; *insert hook into the next sc from Row 13, then skip one hole in C and insert hook into the next hole in C, sc together using B; repeat from * across—55 sc. Cut C, leaving a 2” end. Do not fasten off B.
Rows 15-16: Repeat Rows 12 and 13.
Row 17: Repeat Row 11.
Rows 18-19: Repeat Rows 12 and 13. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.
Assembly
Using B, sew side edges together, matching Rows of sc; fasten off and weave in ends. Using thread, sew matching ends of C together and tack to inside of Skirt.
PURSE
With B, ch 21.
Row 1 (Wrong side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 18 ch, 3 sc in last ch; turn to work in opposite side of foundation ch; sc in next 19 ch; turn—41 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in next 20 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 20 sc; turn—43 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in next 21 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 21 sc; turn—45 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in next 22 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 22 sc; turn—47 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in next 23 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 23 sc, change color to A in last sc; turn—49 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in next 24 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 24 sc; turn—51 sc.
Finishing
For Strap, ch 51, slip st in first sc of Row 6 to join. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing. Using photograph as a guide, fold Purse into thirds and sew sides closed using A. Weave in ends.

pattern_name: I Want a Hippopotamus for Christmas
materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein in each of 512 Turqua A, 316 Soft White B, 319 Cherry Red C, and 706 Perfect Pink D
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.5mm [US E-4], 3.75mm [US F-5], and 4mm [US G-6]
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
Susan Bates® Easy Pom Pon Maker, 1¾" (4.5 cm) diameter
Yarn needle, tapestry needle, 1 pair 8mm post-and-washer safety eyes, plush stuffing, flexible drinking straw for candy cane insert
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
gauge: 22 sc = 4" (10 cm); 20 sc rows = 4" (10 cm) using F hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTES
1. This huggable hippo with removable hat is made of individual parts that are worked in the round and then sewn together.
2. Mark first stitch of first round for each piece, then move marker up as rounds are completed.
3. To change color, work last stitch of old color to last yarn over. Yarn over with new color and draw through all loops on hook to complete stitch. Proceed with new color.
4. Only a small scrap of color D will be used. Any scrap of a similarly colored yarn would work just as well.

SPECIAL TECHNIQUE 
Magic ring: Wrap yarn around your left middle finger twice, leaving a 6" (15 cm) tail. Insert hook under both strands, and pull up a loop. Ch 1, and begin working directly into center of ring. This ring can be tightened later by pulling on the yarn tail.

SPECIAL STITCH
St2tog = Stitch 2 together: This is similar to a sc2tog (single crochet 2 together), but with a small difference that makes it nearly invisible. Insert hook through front loop of 1st st, then 2nd st to be decreased without performing a yarn-over in between, then yarn over and pull up a loop through both front-loops. Yarn over and draw remaining 2 loops on hook.

ARMS (make 2)
With B, create a magic ring.
Round 1: With size F hook, ch 1, 6 sc in ring, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2:  Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, join with slip st in first sc – 12 sc.
Fasten off.
Join A with slip st in back loop of any sc.
From this point, work in unjoined rounds as follows:
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in back loop of same sc and of each sc around.
Rounds 4-9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [Sc in each of next 4 sc, st2tog over next 2 sc] twice – 10 sc.
Rounds 11-16: Sc in each sc around.
Stuff bottom ⅔ of Arm.
Hold top of Arm closed and seam by working sc in each of next 5 sc and going through both layers of fabric.
Fasten off.

BODY
With A, create a magic ring, and work in unjoined rounds as follows:
Round 1: With size F hook, ch 1, 6 sc in ring.
Round 2:  2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3:  * Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Round 4:  * Sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 5:  * Sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 6:  * Sc in each of next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Round 7:  * Sc in each of next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 42 sts.
Rounds 8-18:  Sc in each sc around.
Round 19:  * Sc in each of next 5 sc, st2tog over next 2 sc; repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Round 20:  Sc in each sc around.
Round 21:  * Sc in each of next 4 sc, st2tog over next 2 sc; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 22:  Sc in each sc around.
Round 23:  * Sc in each of next 3 sc, st2tog over next 2 sc; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 24 (arm joining round): Holding first Arm against topmost round, join by working sc in each of next 5 sc and going through both layers of fabric, sc in each of next 8 sc on Body, join second Arm same as first Arm, sc in each of last 6 sc on Body.
Round 25:  Sc in each sc around.
Round 26:  * Sc in each of next 2 sc, st2tog over next 2 sc; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Round 27:  Sc in each sc around.
Round 28: Sc in each of next 2 sts, hdc in the next 9 sts, sc in each of last 7 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing head to neck. Stuff piece firmly and set aside.

HEAD
Note: Head is worked from the snout upwards.
Using A and size F hook, ch 4.
Round 1: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each of next 2 ch, rotate piece 180 degrees, working in unused loops at opposite side of foundation ch work 2 sc in each of next 3 ch, join with slip st in first sc – 12 sc.
From this point, work in unjoined rounds as follows:
Round 2: * Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Round 3: * Sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 4: * Sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Round 5: * Sc in each of next 4 sc, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 36 sts.
Round 6-10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: * Sc in each of next 4 sc, st2tog over next 2 sc; repeat from * around – 30 sc.
Round 12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: * Sc in each of next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 36 sc.
Round 14: * 2 sc in next st, sc in each of next 17 sc; repeat from * once more – 38 sts.
Round 15-19: Sc in each sc around.
Round 20: * St2tog over next 2 sc, sc in each of next 17 sc; repeat from * once more – 36 sc.
Round 21: * Sc in each of next 4 sc, st2tog over next 2 sc; repeat from * around – 30 sc.
Place eyes on or near Round 15, spaced about 7 sts apart, making certain they are parallel to the straight snout seam created by Round 1. Stuff piece firmly. Continue stuffing as further rounds are completed.
Round 22: * Sc in each of next 3 sts, st2tog over next 2 sc; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 23: * Sc in each of next 2 sts, st2tog over next 2 sc; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Rounds 24 and 25:  * Sc in next sc, st2tog over next 2 sc; repeat from * around – 8 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Finish stuffing top of piece. Weave yarn tail through sts of final round and pull tight to close hole.

EARS (make 2)
With A, create a magic ring, and work in unjoined rounds as follows:
Round 1: With size F hook, ch 1, 6 sc in ring.
Round 2:  2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing to head.

LEGS (make 2)
With B, create a magic ring.
Round 1: With size F hook, 6 sc in ring, join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: * Sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around, join with slip st in first sc – 15 sc.
Fasten off B.
Join A with slip st in back loop of any sc. From this point, work in unjoined rounds as follows:
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in back loop of same sc and of each sc around.
Round 5-7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: St2tog over next 2 sc, sc in each of next 13 sc – 14 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: St2tog over next 2 sc, sc in each of next 12 sc – 13 sc.
Round 11-18: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing to body. Stuff piece firmly and set aside.

HAT
Band
Using B and size G hook, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end – 3 sc.
Row 2-28:  Ch 1, sc in back loop of each sc across.
Hold short edges of Band together and seam by working slip st in back loop of each of next 3 sc and going through both layers of fabric. Do not fasten off.
Crown
Round 1: Working in edge sts of Band, ch 1, sc in same st and in each of next 27 edge sts, join with slip st in first sc – 28 sc.
Fasten off.
Join C with slip st in back loop of any sc.
Round 2 (ear hole round): Ch 1, sc in back loop of same sc, [sc in back loop of each of next 6 sc, ch 3, skip 3 sc] twice, sc in back loop of each of last 9 sts, join with slip st in first sc.
From this point, work in unjoined rounds as follows:
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same sc and in each st around including ch sts – 28 sc.
Round 4: * St2tog over next 2 sc, sc in each of next 5 sc; repeat from * around – 24 sc.
Round 5: * St2tog over next 2 sc, sc in each of next 4 sc; repeat from * around – 20 sc.
Round 6: * St2tog over next 2 sc, sc in each of next 3 sc; repeat from * around – 16 sc.
Round 7: * St2tog over next 2 sc, sc in each of next 6 sc; repeat from * once more – 14 sc.
Round 8: * St2tog over next 2 sc, sc in each of next 12 sc – 13 sts.
Rounds 9-17: * St2tog over next 2 sc, sc in each sc to end – 4 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave yarn tail through sts of final round and pull tight to close hole.
Pompom
With B, make a pompom and sew to tip of Hat.

HEART
With C and size E hook, ch 2.
Round 1: Skip 1 ch, working over yarn tail, work (2 dc, 2 hdc, 1 dc, 2 hdc, 2 dc, slip st) in 2nd ch from hook.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing to Body.
Pull beginning yarn tail tight to close hole.

CANDY CANE
With B, create a magic ring, and work in unjoined rounds as follows:
Round 1:  With size F hook, ch 1, 6 sc in ring.
Round 2:  Sc in each sc around.
[Change to C and work 2 rounds evenly in sc, change to B and work 2 rounds evenly in sc] twice.
Change to C.
Next 2 rounds: Sc in each of next 2 sc, hdc in each of next next 2 sc, sc in each of last 2 sc.
Change to B.
Work 6 more rounds evenly in sc, keeping with striping pattern (2 rounds per color).
Fasten off, leaving a long tail of B.
Cut length of straw so that the bendable portion fits inside the bend created by hdc sts. Insert straw and trim excess. Weave yarn tail through sts of final round and pull tight to close hole.

FINISHING
Using yarn end from neck area of body, (round 28) and a tapestry needle, begin sewing at the back of the head on the underside at Round 13. Note: May need to adjust head due to the elongated shape of head. Knot securely and fasten off, trimming yarn end.
Sew Legs to bottom of Body with their tops just touching, making certain that the color change jogs face backwards.
Sew heart to upper midsection of Body.
Sew Candy Cane to end of Arm using yarn scrap.
With D and yarn needle, embroider an X for each nostril, spaced about 7 sts apart.
Fold Ears in half and sew to Head 6 rounds back from eyes, spaced about 10 sts apart.
Place Hat on Head fitting ears through the ear holes. Do not sew Hat to Head.
Weave in all loose ends, working them to inside of Hippo.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein each 313 Aran A, 254 Pumpkin B, 774 Light Raspberry C, 334 Buff D and 365 Coffee E.
abbreviations: sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Saucer measures 4” diameter; Cup measures 2” diameter x 2” tall; Teapot measures 4” tall without lid.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
TEA CUP
Round 1: With smaller hook and A, ch 2, work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, place marker for beginning of round – 6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around – 12 sc.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around.
Round 4: Working in both loops, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] around – 18 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each st around, change to B in last st.
Round 6: *(Hdc, ch 1, hdc) in next st, skip next st; repeat from * around, change to C in last hdc – 18 hdc.
Round 7: [3 hdc in next ch-1 space] around, change to A in last st – 27 hdc.
Round 8: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around.
Round 9: Working in both loops, sc in each st around, slip st in first st.
Fasten off.
CUP HANDLE
With smaller hook and A, ch 13.
Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across.
Fasten off.
Folding ends over to wrong side, sew one end of Handle near Rounds 8-9 and opposite end near Rounds 4-5.
SAUCER
Round 1: With smaller hook and A, ch 2, work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, place marker for beginning of round – 6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around – 12 sc.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] around – 18 sc.
Round 19: Sc in each st around, slip st in first st.
Fasten off.
TEAPOT HANDLE
With A and smaller hook, ch 21.
Working in back loops only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across.
Fasten off.
Folding ends over to wrong side, sew one end of Handle near Rounds 18-19 and opposite end near Rounds 8-9.
TEAPOT SPOUT
With smaller hook and A, ch 9, sc in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Sc in each ch around – 9 sc.
Round 2: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] around – 6 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each st around.
Round 4: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] around – 9 sc.
Rounds 5-7: Hdc in next 6 sts, slip st in last 3 sts.
Round 8: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] around – 12 sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] around – 15 sc.
Fasten off.
Sew last round of Spout to opposite side of Teapot from handle between Rounds 12-16.
TEAPOT LID
Round 1: With smaller hook and A, ch 2, work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, place marker for beginning of round – 6 sc.
Round 2: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around.
Round 3: Working in both loops only, sc in each st around.
Round 4: Working in back loops only, 2 sc in each st around – 12 sc.
Round 5: Working in both loops only, sc in each st around.
Round 6: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] around, change to B in last st – 18 sc.
Round 7: *(Hdc, ch 1, hdc) in next st, skip next st; repeat from * around, change to C in last hdc – 18 hdc.
Round 8: [3 hdc in next ch-1 space] around, change to A in last st – 27 hdc.
Round 9: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around, slip st in first st.
Fasten off.
THUMBPRINT COOKIE
Round 1: With larger hook and C, ch 2, work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, place marker for beginning of round – 6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around, change to D in last st – 12 sc.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] around – 18 sc.
Round 4: Working in both loops, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] around – 24 sc.
Round 4: Working in both loops, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] around, change to B in last st – 24 sc.
Round 5: *(Hdc, ch 1, hdc) in next st, skip next st; repeat from * around, change to C in last hdc – 24 hdc.
Round 6: [3 hdc in next ch-1 space] around, change to A in last st – 36 hdc.
Round 7: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around, slip st in first st.
Fasten off.
PLATE
Round 1: With smaller hook and A, ch 2, 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, place marker for beginning of round – 6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] around – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] around – 24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] around – 30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] around, change to B in last st – 36 sc.
Round 7: *(Hdc, ch 1, hdc) in next st, skip next st; repeat from * around, change to C in last hdc – 36 hdc.
Round 8: [3 hdc in next ch-1 space] around, change to A in last st – 54 hdc.
Round 9: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around, slip st in first st.
Fasten off.
TEAPOT
Round 1: With smaller hook and A, ch 2, work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, place marker for beginning of round – 6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] around – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] around – 24 sc.
Round 5: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around.
Round 6: Working in both loops, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] around – 30 sc.
Round 7: Sc in each st around.
Round 8: [Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] around – 36 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each st around, change to B in last st.
Round 10: *(Hdc, ch 1, hdc) in next st, skip next st; repeat from * around, change to C in last hdc – 36 hdc.
Round 11: [3 hdc in next ch-1 space] around, change to A in last st – 54 hdc.
Round 12: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around.
Round 13: Working in both loops, sc in each st around.
Round 14: [Sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog] around – 48 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each st around.
Round 16: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] around – 36 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each st around.
Round 18: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] around – 24 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each st around.
Round 6: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] around – 18 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] around – 12 sc.
Round 8: [Sc2tog] around – 6 sc.
Fasten off.
CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIE
Round 1: With larger hook and D, ch 2, work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, place marker for beginning of round – 6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, change to E and work tr in same st, change to D and work 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 4 times, change to E and tr in next st, change to D and 2 sc in next st, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, change to E and tr in last st – 18 sts.
Round 4: With E, tr in next st, change to D and sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice, change to E and tr in next st, change to D and sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] twice – 24 sc.
Round 5: With D, sc in each st around.
Round 6: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] around – 18 sc.
Round 7: Sc in next st, sc2tog, sc in next st, change to E and sc2tog, change to D and [sc in next st, sc2tog] twice, sc in next st, change to E and sc2tog, change to D and sc in next st, sc2tog – 12 sc.
Round 8: [Sc2tog] around – 6 sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi Textures™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 242 yds/221 m) Alien/Rocketship (9278) 1 ball
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.

Rocketship: Stitch marker. Fiberfil stuffing. Yarn needle. Strong craft glue or cement. Drinking straw (to support rocket booster frames). 1 medium pompom ¾" [19 mm] diameter (for alien head). 3 small pompoms 1/3" [8 mm] diameter (2 for alien headphones and 1 for nosecone embellishment). 1 toothpick. 2 small black beads 1/8" [3 mm] (for alien eyes)
Optional: One half of a clear fillable plastic ornament 2" [5 cm] diameter (for porthole dome)
Alien: 2 post and washer animal noses (for eyes) ½" [13 mm]. Stitch marker. Fiberfil stuffing. Yarn needle. Small length of plastic drinking straw (rigid insert for top knot/hair).
Optional: Knee high stockings and weighted stuffing (such as aquarium gravel, plastic pellets or rice), small red glitter foam star and craft glue (for belt buckle)
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Rocketship: Approx 6½" [16.5 cm] long. Alien: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
Rocketship: Green is A. Yellow is B. Blue is C. Fuzzy Pink is D. Alien: Green is A. Yellow is B. Fuzzy Pink is C. Blue is not used in this design.
Notes
• Booster Rockets and Booster Rocket frames are worked separately and sewn tog. Frames are cylindrical pieces that hold Booster Rockets on Rocketship and are fitted with a small length of plastic drinking straw to provide rigidity.
• The clear spaceship dome (porthole), is created from half of a fillable clear plastic ornament. It is connected to Spaceship with crochet edging that is glued around the bottom edge of the dome using strong craft glue or cement. Space alien and nose cone feature are glued to a toothpick, then inserted and glued in place on Rocketship.
• Before beg, separate different color sections of the yarn as follows: Pop center color out by pushing gently on the center of ball so that it comes out intact. Find point where color changes and cut yarn. Rep this process for rem yarn colors by carefully pushing rings of color out of larger ring and cutting. Roll each color into a ball to prevent tangling.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work.
• This project includes some optional multi-crafting techniques for finishing and embellishing. Make certain to read through entire pattern before beg.
• Designs may not be suitable for babies and very young children as the fuzzy hair yarn and post and washer eyes could come off and pose a choking hazard.

ROCKETSHIP
Beg at nosecone with B, make an adjustable ring as follows: Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work sts of first rnd in the ring. After the first rnd of sts is worked, pull gently on tail to tighten ring.
1st rnd: 5 sc in ring. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). 5 sc. PM in last sc worked to indicate end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
2nd rnd: Work 2 sc in each of next 5 sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. 15 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
5th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 18 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
7th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 21 sc.
8th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
9th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. 28 sc.
10th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. 35 sc.
11th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Sl st in next st. Fasten off.
Work in joined rnds as follows:
12th rnd: Working in back loops only, join A with sc in any sc of 11th rnd. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st in first sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with sl st in first sc. 42 sc. Fasten off.
14th rnd: Working in back loops only, join C with sc in any st of 13th rnd. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st in first sc.
15th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. Join with sl st in first sc. 49 sc.
Work in continuous rnds (spiral):
16th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). 49 sc. PM in the last sc worked to indicate end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
17th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 7 times. 56 sc.
18th to 37th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
38th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 7 times. 49 sts.
39th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 7 times. 42 sts.
40th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 19 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 40 sts.
41st rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 10 times. 30 sts.
Stuff piece firmly and cont stuffing piece as work progresses.
42nd rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
43rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 10 times. 20 sts.
44th to 46th rnds: 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off.
47th rnd: Working in back loops only, join A with sc in any st of rnd 46. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st in first sc.
48th rnd: 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off.
Work in joined rnds as follows:
49th rnd: Working in back loops only, join B with sc in any st. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st in first sc.
50th rnd: Working in back loops only, (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 5 times. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). 15 sts.
51st rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog) 3 times. 12 sts.
Sl st in next st. Fasten off. Finish stuffing Rocketship, leaving room for inserting a flame into the end.

BOOSTER ROCKETS (make 3)
With A, make an adjustable ring as given for Rocketship.
1st rnd:  6 sc in ring. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). 6 sc. PM in last sc worked to indicate end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
2nd rnd: (1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join C. 9 sc.
3rd rnd:  With C, 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join B. 12 sc.
5th to 7th rnds:  With B, 1 sc in each sc around.
Begin stuffing lightly and cont stuffing as work progresses. 
8th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 10 sts.
9th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
10th rnd:  (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 8 sts. Fasten off. 
Finish stuffing rocket, leaving room for inserting a flame into the end.

BOOSTER ROCKET FRAMES (make 3)
With C, ch 2, leaving a long end for sewing.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc. 6 sc.
2nd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Insert piece of plastic drinking straw into frame and trim even with edge of piece. Sew one frame to each Booster Rocket. Sew Frame right below edge of last C-colored rnd of Rocket. Sew around frame to secure. 

PLASTIC DOME (PORTHOLE) EDGING 
With B, ch 39 (or number of chains needed to fit snuggly around circumference of dome). Join with sl st in first ch to form a circle.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st in first sc. 39 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
3rd rnd:  Working along opposite side of foundation ch, join A with sc in any ch. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
Attach Edging to Dome: Carefully break off the hanging tab on the edge of half dome. To keep table clean and prevent dome from sticking to table, work on piece of waxed paper. Sew short ends of edging tog to form a circle. Run a bead of strong craft glue around edge of dome. Place glued dome flat on waxed paper. Slip edging down over dome with B-colored side up, pushing it down until A-colored edge is lying flat on the surface. 
Note: A-colored edge will be sewn to Spaceship. Set aside to dry.

POMPOM ALIEN
Cut toothpick in half (save second half for nosecone embellishment). Glue medium-sized pompom to flat (cut) tip of toothpick and allow glue to dry. Glue 2 beads to upper front of pompom head to form eyes. Glue two small pompoms to upper sides of pompom head (as if wearing headphones) and allow glue to dry for several hours.

POMPOM NOSECONE
Glue one small pompom to flat tip of second half of toothpick and allow glue to dry.

FLAMES
Large Flame
Wrap D around 4 fingers 5 times. Slip loops off fingers. Tie yarn securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel ½" [1.5 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. 
Small Flames (make 3 – 1 per rocket)
Wrap D around 3 fingers 4 times. Slip loops off fingers. Tie yarn securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel ½" [1.5 cm] from tied end and fasten securely. 

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement of features and pieces.
Attach Rockets to Rocketship:  Using yarn ends, with A-colored rnd 1 of Booster Rockets facing up towards the nose of the Spaceship. Sew Booster Rockets, evenly spaced around rnds 38 and 39 of Rocketship approx 14 - 15 sts apart.

Attach and Embellish Alien:  Insert the pompom alien toothpick into upper side of spaceship evenly spaced between 2 Booster Rockets. Check position by placing dome over alien to make certain placement is as desired and that face is looking in desired direction. Remove toothpick, place a small amount of glue on toothpick and reinsert. Allow glue to dry for several hours. Likewise, glue nose cone embellishment in middle of top of nosecone and allow glue to dry.

Attach Dome/Porthole:  Place porthole dome over pompom alien and pin edging to Rocketship. For nearly invisible results, use hand-sewing thread to attach the dome to the Rocketship. 

Attach Large Flame to Rocketship:  Stuff tied end of large flame into end of Rocketship, making certain to stuff all yarn ties inside. With yarn tail still attached to spaceship, sew through the stitches of last rnd, and top portion of flame to anchor it, then cinch tightly. Knot yarn securely, weave and trim excess. Trim the flame into a point (resembling the flame of a candle). Twist newly trimmed ends of flame several times between thumb and pointer finger to felt the ends tog, thus maintaining the pointed shaping.

Attach Flames to Rockets: Attach one small flame to each rocket booster in the same manner as large flame was attached to Rocketship. If desired, attach thread or fishing line to Rocketship for hanging loop.

ALIEN

LEGS/BODY
First Leg
Beg at bottom of leg with A, make an adjustable ring as given for Rocketship.
1st rnd:  6 sc in ring. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). 6 sc. PM in last sc worked to form end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each of next 6 sts. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th to 8th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off. 
Stuff Leg, beg by placing some optional weighted stuffing in the toe of a knee high and placing inside leg.

Second Leg
Work as given for First Leg. Do not fasten off.
Cont to stuff Leg and body as work progresses.

Join Legs:  Remove end of rnd markers for both legs.
9th rnd: Hold First Leg and Second Leg tog and working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in next sc to join legs. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc of Second Leg then 1 sc in each of 17 sc of First leg. 34 sc.
PM in last sc worked and move marker up as each rnd is completed.

Body
10th rnd:  (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 16 sts) twice. 36 sc.
11th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 42 sc.
12th to 16th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
17th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 36 sts.
18th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
19th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 30 sts.
20th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
21st rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 24 sts.
22nd to 24th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
25th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 18 sts.

Neck
26th and 27th rnds:  1 sc in each st around.
Finish stuffing piece. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Leave neck open.

Head
Beg at lower end of head with A, make an adjustable ring.
1st rnd:  6 sc in ring. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). 6 sc. PM in last sc worked to form end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
2nd rnd: Work 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 24 sc.
5th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 30 sc.
6th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 36 sc.
7th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 42 sc.
8th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 48 sc.
9th to 11th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 42 sts.
13th to 15th rnds:  1 sc in each st around.
16th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 36 sts.
Attach post and washer noses (for eyes) between 8th and 9th rnds, approx 6 - 7 sts apart. Play with the angle of the eyes to determine the best position before snapping on washers.
Stuff as work progresses.
17th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 30 sts.
18th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 24 sts.
19th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 18 sts.
20th rnd: (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 12 sts.
21st rnd: (1 sc in next st. Sc2tog) 4 times. 8 sts.
22nd to 25th rnds: 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. 
Cut length of plastic drinking straw approx 1" [2.5 cm]. Insert drinking straw in top potion of Head. Thread yarn through sts of last rnd. Pull tightly to close hole around straw. Fasten securely.

TOPKNOT
Pompom: Wind C around 4 fingers 6 times. Tie tightly in the middle and leave a long end for attaching to Head. Cut loops at both ends and trim to smooth shape. Sew securely to top of Head. 

ARMS (make 2)
Beg at top of arm with A, ch 8. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: 1 sc in each ch around. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). 8 sc.
PM in last sc worked for end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
2nd to 9th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Join B at end of 9th rnd.
Hand: 10th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
11th rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
12th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
13th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 12 sts.
Stuff arm lightly. 
Next row: (Closing row). Hold top edges tog and working through both thicknesses, 6 sl st across top edge to close. 6 sl sts. Do not fasten off.

Fingers
1st row:  Ch 5. Turn. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 3 ch (first finger made). Working in sts of Closing row, sl st in each of first 3 sl sts. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 3 ch (second finger made). Sl st in same st of Closing row and each of next 2 sts. Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 3 ch (third finger made). Sl st in same st and last st of Closing row. Fasten off.

BELT
With B, ch 31.
1st row:  Working in back bumps only, 1 hdc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 30 hdc. Turn. 
2nd row:  Ch. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.
3rd row:  Working along opposite side of foundation ch,  join B with sl st in first ch. Sl st in each ch to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, sew the pieces tog.
1. Sew Arms to sides of Body at 25th rnd approx 6 or 7 sts apart.
2. Sew Head to top of neck. 
3. Wrap Belt around torso approx 15 rnds down from neck. Sew short edges tog then tack belt around entire body.
Glue glitter foam star in middle of belt for buckle (or use button, bead, rhinestone, etc.)

materials: Lily® Sugar n’ Cream(70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
VERSION 2 (SIX BUGS) Main Color (MC) 01740 (Hot Pink) 1 ball
VERSION 3 (SIX BUGS) Main Color (MC) 00046 (Rose Pink) 1 ball
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of black yarn for embroidery of mouth.
measurements: Approx 3 ins [7.5 cm] high x 3 ins [7.5 cm] wide, excluding Legs and Antennae.
instructions:
With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd:6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd:Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
4th rnd:As 2nd rnd.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
6th rnd:As 2nd rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
8th rnd:As 2nd rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
First Hump: 1st rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Leave rem sts unworked.
**2nd rnd: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first st.
3rd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd:Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off, leaving long end. Pull end through rem loops and fasten securely.**
Stuff Heart. 
Second Hump: 1st rnd: Join MC with sl st to first unworked sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
Work from ** to ** as given for First Hump, stuffing as you work. Sew opening between Humps closed.
Legs (make 4)
With A, ch 9. Sl st in 4th ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of ch. Fasten off.
Antennae (make 2)
Work as given for Legs.
FINISHING
Attach Legs and Antennae to Heart as shown in picture.
With black yarn, embroider mouth. Sew on beads for eyes.

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6 oz; 288 m/315 yds)
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Finished Measurements Approximately 21"/53.5 cm long from head to toe, 23"/58.5 cm from tail to head.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: NOTES 1. Work stitches tightly so that the stuffing will not show through. 2. Firmly stuff the pieces of the monkey as you crochet. 3 . Work in continuous rounds. Do not join nor turn at end of rounds. Place marker to indicate beg of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. HEAD & BODY—With B, ch 2. Rnd 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sts. Rnd 2: 2 sc in each st around—12 sts. Rnds 3–5 (inc): Sc in each st around, working 2 sc in 6 sts evenly spaced around—30 sts. Rnd 6: Sc in each st around. Rnd 7: Rep Rnd 3—36 sts. Rnds 8 and 9: Rep Rnds 6 and 7—42 sts. Rnds 10–13: Rep Rnds 5–8; change to A in last sc of Rnd 13—54 sts. Fasten off B. Rnd 14–27: With A, sc in each st around. Rnd 28: *Sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog; rep from * around—48 sts. Rnds 29 and 30 (dec): Sc in each st around, working sc2tog 6 times evenly spaced around—36 sts. Rnds 31–33: Sc in each st around. Rnd 34–43: Rep Rnds 5 and 6 five times—66 sts. Rnd 44–69: Sc in each st around. Rnds 70–78: Rep Rnd 29 nine times—12 sts. Rnd 79 and 80: (Sc2tog) around—3 sts. Fasten off. MUZZLE—With B, ch 8. Rnd 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 5 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working along opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 5 ch—16 sc. Rnd 2: (2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in next 5 sc) twice—22 sts. Rnd 3: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next 2 sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc) twice—30 sts. Rnd 4: Sc in each st around. Rnd 5: *Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; rep from * around—40 sts. Rnds 6–8: Sc in each st around. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. EARS (make 2)—With B, ch 2. Rnds 1–4: Work Rnds 1–4 of Head—24 sts. Fasten off B. Fold ear in half. Row 5: Working through both thicknesses along outer curve, join A with sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; rep from * along outer curve. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. ARMS AND LEGS (make 4)—With B, ch 2. Rnds 1–4: Work Rnds 1–4 of Body—24 sts. Rnds 5–13: Sc in each st around; change to A in last sc of Rnd 13. Fasten off B. Rnds 14–58: With A, sc in each st around. Rnd 59: Ch 1, flatten top of piece; working through both thicknesses; sc across to close. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. TAIL—With B, ch 2. Rnd 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook—5 sts. Rnd 2: 2 sc in each st around—10 sts. Rnd 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; rep from * around—15 sts. Rnds 4–13: Sc in next 7 sts, hdc in next 8 sts; change to A in last st of Rnd 13. Fasten off B. Rnds 14–32: With A, sc in next 7 sts, hdc in next 8 sts. Rnds 33–70: Sc in each st around. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. EYE (make 2)—With D, ch 2. Rnd 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. FINISHING—With C, embroider mouth on muzzle. With D, embroider nostrils on muzzle. Sew eyes on face. Cut four 4"/10 cm lengths of C and attach to head between sts of Round 1 (for hair). Sew muzzle to front of head. Sew ears to sides of head. Sew legs to bottom of body and arms to sides of body. Sew tail to lower back of body. Weave in all ends.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi Prints™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 242 yds/221 m)
Size B/1 (2.25 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook for smooth yarn or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Version 1: Yellow is Color 1. Orange is Color 2. Purple is Color 3.
Version 2: Purple is Color 1. Multi is Color 2. Yellow is Color 3.
Note: Do not join at end of rnd. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
Back of eye (make 2) 
With Color 3, ch 4.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Version 1 
Head
Beg at tip of nose with Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in every sc around. (12 sc).
3rd rnd: Sl sl in front loop of each sc around.
4th rnd: *1 sc in next unworked back loop of 3rd rnd. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 9 sts.
6th to 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
9th rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 18 sc.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
12th to 18th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
Note: At end of 16th rnd, sew back of eyes in place between 12th and 14th rnds with 8 sc between. Insert safety eyes in center of back of eye and thru Head. Snap into place inside head.
19th rnd: *1 sc in next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
20th rnd: *1 sc in next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
21st rnd: *1 sc in each sc around. Stuff nose and head.
22nd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
23rd rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. Finish stuffing. Fasten off, leaving a long for sewing. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Body and Tail
Note: Do not break color not in use. Carry color not in use up side of work. 
Beg at neck edge with Color 2, ch 15
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 14 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join Color 1. Turn. 
3rd row: With Color 1, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. (16 sc).
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join Color 2. Turn.
5th row: With Color 2, ch 1. 1 sc each of first 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Turn. (18 sc).
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join Color 1. Turn.
Last 4 rows form Stripe pat: 2 rows – Color 2. 2 rows – Color 1.
Keeping cont of Stripe pat, proceed as follows:
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn. 20 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc each of first 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 22 sc.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Turn. 24 sc.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Turn. 26 sc.
14th to 22nd rows: Cont in Stripe pat, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
23rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 26 sts.
24th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
25th row: As 23rd row.
26th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
27th row: As 23rd row.
28th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 24 sts. 
29th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
30th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Turn. 22 sts.
31st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 20 sts.
32nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn. 18 sts.
33rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Turn. 16 sts.
34th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. 14 sts.
35th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sts.
36th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sts.
37th to 42nd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
43rd row: As 36th row.
44th to 48th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
49th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 8 sts.
50th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 10 sts.
51st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
52nd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Turn. 5 sts.
53rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
54th row: Draw up a loop in each of first 3 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Fasten off, leaving along end for sewing. Sew back seam, stuffing as you go. Sew head firmly in place above neck. Curl up end of tail and secure.
Spine
With Color 2, ch 37.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of row. Turn. 36 sc.
2nd row: Ch 4.*(Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. Skip next sc. Sl st next sc. Ch 4. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Sew Spine in place.
Fin (make 2) 
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. 
With Color 2, ch 7.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc next ch. 1 sc in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 6 sts. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each of first 3 dc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
4th and 5th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Sew in place.
Version 2
Outer eye is made with Color 3.
Make same as Version 1 with following color changes: Nose and Head are made with Color 1. Body and Tail are made with Color 2 and there are no color changes. Spine is made with Color 2. Fins are made with Color 3.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 324 Bright Yellow A, 512 Turqua B, 722 Pretty ‘n Pink C, 672 Spring Green D, and 356 Amethyst E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 5 mm [US H-8]
Susan Bates® split lock stitch markers
15 buttons ⅝" buttons (8 for girl’s outfit, 7 for boy’s outfit)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Girl’s Dress measures 11" (27.5 cm) around chest, and 9½" (24 cm) in length. Boy’s Pant Suit measures 11" (27.5 cm) around chest, and 13" (33 cm) in length. Both outfits designed to fit an 18" (45.5 cm) doll.
gauge: 16 sts = 4" (10 cm); 16½ rows = 4" (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
GIRL’S DRESS
Body
With A, ch 37.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn – 36 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sc, ch 2 for buttonhole, skip next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc, 3 sc in next sc, mark center sc of 3 sc just made, sc in each of next 6 sc, 3 sc in next sc, mark center sc of 3 sc just made, sc in each of next 8 sc, 3 sc in next sc, mark center sc of 3 sc just made, sc in each of next 6 sc, 3 sc in next sc, mark center sc of 3 sc just made, sc in each of next 6 sc, turn – 43 sc, 1 ch-2 space.
Row 3: Ch 1, * sc in each sc to marked sc, 3 sc in marked sc and move marker to center sc of 3 sc just made; repeat from * 3 more times, sc in each sc to ch-2 space, sc in ch-2 space, sc in each of last 2 sc, turn – 52 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, * sc in each sc to marked sc, 3 sc in marked sc and move marker to center sc of 3 sc just made; repeat from * 3 more times, sc in each sc to end, turn – 60 sc.
Row 5: Repeat Row 4 – 68 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sc, ch 2 for buttonhole, skip next sc, * sc in each sc to marked sc, 3 sc in marked sc and move marker to center sc of 3 sc just made; repeat from * 3 more times, sc in each sc to end, turn – 76 sc.
Row 7: Repeat Row 3 – 84 sc.
Remove all markers.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in each of first 12 sc, skip 19 sc for armhole, sc in each of next 22 sc, skip 19 sc for other armhole, sc in each of next 12 sc, turn – 46 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in each of first 2 sc, ch 2, skip next sc, sc in each sc to end, turn.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in each sc to ch-2 space, sc in ch-2 space, sc in each of last 2 sc, turn.
Rows 12 and 13: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn.
Row 14: Repeat Row 10.
Row 15: Repeat Row 11.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn.
Change to B.
Row 17: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn.
Row 18: Repeat Row 10.
Rows 19: Repeat Row 11.
Fasten off.
Skirt
With right side facing, join C with a slip st in first st.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 2 (does not count as a st now and throughout), 2 dc in each sc to end, turn – 92 dc.
Row 2: Ch 2, dc in each of first 2 dc, ch 1 for buttonhole, skip next dc, dc in each dc to end, turn – 91 dc and 1 ch-1 space.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc in each dc to ch-1 space, dc in ch-1 space, dc in each of last 2 dc, turn.
Rows 4-7: Ch 2, dc in each dc to end, turn.
Fasten off.
Sleeves (make both the same)
With wrong side facing, join A with slip st in second underarm sc.
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining slip st, sc in each of next 19 armhole sc, sc in first underarm sc, turn – 21 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sc, sc in each of next 17 sc, sc2tog over last 2 sc, turn – 19 sc.
Rows 4-10: Repeat Row 2.
Change to B.
Rows 11 and 12: Repeat Row 2.
Fasten off.
EMBLEM 
With C, ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn – 3 sc.
Rows 2-7: Ch 1, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn – 9 sc.
Fasten off.
Edging
With right side facing, join B with slip st in any corner, ch 1, [2 sc in corner, 7 sc evenly spaced to next corner] 3 times, join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
With A, embroider a chain st "S" on emblem.
CAPE
With B, ch 51.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end, turn – 50 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Row 3: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), dc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, turn.
Rows 5-24: Repeat Rows 3 and 4 alternately.
Row 25: Repeat Row 3.
Row 26: Ch 1, sc in each of first 4 dc, sc2tog over next 2 dc, [sc in each of next 8 dc, sc2tog over next 2 dc] 4 times, sc in each of last 4 dc, turn – 45 sc.
Row 27: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), dc in each of first 3 sc, dc2tog over next 2 sc, [dc in each of next 7 sc, dc2tog over next 2 sc] 4 times, dc in each of last 4 dc, turn – 40 dc.
Row 28: Ch 1, sc in first dc, * sc2tog over next 2 dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * to end, turn – 27 sc.
Row 29: Ch 16 for button loop, sc in each sc to end.
Fasten off. 
ARM BAND
With C, ch 3.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, turn – 2 sc.
Rows 2-14: Ch 1, sc in each of 2 sc, turn. 
Row 15: Ch 4 for button loop, skip first sc, join with slip st in 2nd sc.
Fasten off.
BOOTS
With B, ch 6.
Round 1: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 3 ch, 3 sc in next ch, working in back loops of foundation ch, sc in each of next 4 ch; join with slip st in first sc – 12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice; join with slip st in first sc – 16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc] twice; join with slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 5-7: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each of next 8 sc, [sc2tog over next 2 sc] 4 times, sc in each of next 8 sc; join with slip st in first sc – 20 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each of next 8 sc, [sc2tog over next 2 sc] twice, sc in each of next 8 sc; join with slip st in first sc – 18 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in each of next 8 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc, sc in each of next 8 sc, join with slip st in first sc – 17 sc. 
Rounds 11-18: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
BOY’S PANT SUIT
Shirt
With D, ch 37, and work Rows 1-12 same as Girl’s Dress.
Change to A, and work Rows 13-15 same as Girl’s Dress.
Pants
Change to E, and work Rows 16-19 same as Girl’s Dress.
Rows 20-24: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn.
First Leg
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Slip st in each of first 4 sc for button flap, ch 1, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 19 sc, 2 sc in next sc, mark next sc for beginning of opposite leg, turn – 23 sc.
Change to D.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc to last sc, 2 sc in next sc, turn – 27 sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc2tog over first 2 sc, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog over last 2 sc, turn – 25 sc.
Rows 7-28: Ch 1, sc in each sc to end, turn.
Fasten off.
Second Leg
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Join E with slip st in marked sc, remove marker, ch 1, 2 sc in same sc as joining slip st, sc in each of next 19 sts, 2 sc in next sc, turn – 23 sc.
Change to D, and work Rows 2-28 same as first leg.
Fasten off.
Sleeves (make 2)
Work same as sleeves of Girl’s Dress, using the following colors:
Rows 1-10: D.
Rows 11-12: E.
Fasten off.
EMBLEM
With E, work same as emblem of girl’s outfit.
Edging 
With A, work same as emblem edging of girl’s outfit.
With D, embroider a chain st "S" on emblem.
CAPE
With A, work same as cape of girl’s outfit.
ARM BAND
With A, work same as arm band of girl’s outfit.
BOOTS
With A, ch 6, and work Rounds 1-11 same as girl’s Boots.
