Round 12: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, [sc in each of next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice, sc in each of last 4 sc; join with slip st in first sc – 20 sc.
Round 13-18: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Using photo as a guide, sew emblem to center of each shirt.
Sew 5 buttons to back of Boy’s Pant Suit and 6 buttons to back of Girl’s Dress, corresponding with buttonholes.
Sew 1 button to end of each armband and 1 button to top corner of each cape, corresponding with button loops.
Sew sleeve seams of both outfits.
Sew leg seams of Boy’s Pant Suit, and sew down bottom of button flap. Weave in all loose ends.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.75 mm [US C-2]
four 20 mm safety eyes (two for each bee)
Optional: Knee high stocking and plastic pellets for weighted stuffing
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 28 sts = about 4" [10 cm]; 32 rounds = about 4" [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL TO THIS PROJECT. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEAD/BODY
Note: Before beginning, choose a colorway and refer to colorway lists to determine when to change yarn color.
Colorway #1: Work Rounds 1-11 with A, Rounds 12-14 with B, Rounds 15-20 with A, and Rounds 21-31 with B.
Colorway #2: Work Rounds 1-11 with B, Rounds 12-15 with A, Rounds 16-18 with B, Rounds 19-27 with A, and Rounds 28-31 with B.
Beginning at top of head, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each of next 6 sts—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 7–24: Sc in each st around. Using photograph as a guide to placement, attach safety eyes between Rnds 8 and 9 on opposite sides of head.
Round 25: [Sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 26: [Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Begin filling body with stuffing or a combination of optional knee high filled with plastic pellets, and stuffing. Continue stuffing as work progresses.
Round 27: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 28: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Rounds 29 and 30: Sc in each st around.
Round 31: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving an 18" [45.5 cm] tail. Weave tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Do not weave in or trim yarn tail.
Stinger: Using attached long yarn tail as working yarn, insert hook through end of bee and draw up a loop of the yarn tail, ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, slip st into end of bee. Fasten off.
WINGS (make 2 for each bee)
Use C for colorway #1 bee and use D for colorway #2 bee.
Ch 2.
Rounds 1–4: Work same as Rounds 1–4 of head and body—24 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each st around.
Round 6: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—30 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing wing to body.
LEGS (make 6 for each bee)
With B, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 3rd ch from hook and in next 3 ch.
Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing leg to body.
FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, sew the following pieces together.
1. Sew wings to top of bee.
2. Sew legs to underside of bee, sewing 3 legs along each side.
Weave in and trim any remaining ends.

pattern_name: Mother and Baby Koala Bears to Crochet
materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi Textures™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 242 yds/221 m) Koala (9470) 1 ball makes 2
Sizes U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook for smooth yarn
U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook for fur yarn or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Mother: Approx 5 ½" [14 cm] tall. Baby: Approx 3 ½" [9 cm] tall.
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook and smooth yarn.
instructions:
Mother: Dark gray fur is Color 1. Light gray is Color 2. Pink is Color 3. Black is Color 4.
Baby: Same numbers apply. You don’t need any Color 2.
Notes: 
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
• Do not join at end of rnd. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
MOTHER
Head
Beg at top of head with smaller hook and Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. (18 sc).
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
7th to 11th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
13th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Insert safety eyes between 9th and 10th rnds 7 sts apart. With Color 4 embroider a triangle satin st for nose, making a long st along each of the 3 sides to shape. (See Diagram on page 3.)
14th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
15th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc 2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts. Stuff head.
16th rnd:  *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw yarn through rem sts. Pull tightly, fasten securely, leaving a long end of yarn.
Body 
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 2.
1st to 11th rnds: Work as given for Head. 30 sc.
12th to 14th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
15th to 19th rnds: Work as given for Head for rnds 12 to 16.
Sew Head to Body.
Leg: (make 2) 
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. (12sc).
3rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. (15 sc).
4th to 8th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long for sewing. Stuff Legs and sew in place. With Color 4 embroider 3 little straight sts on each leg for claws. (See Diagram on page 3.)
Arm (make 2) 
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd to 6th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long for sewing. Stuff Arms. Sew in place. With Color 4 embroider 3 little straight sts on each arm for claws.
Ear (make 2) 
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 3.
1st row: 9 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn. 9 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 sc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off. (12 sc).
Inner Ear (make 2) 
With smaller hook and Color 3, ch 2
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. (12 sc).
3rd rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Sew in place to outer ear. 
BABY 
Body
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. (12 sc).
3rd to 6th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Stuff lightly. Thread yarn through rem sts and gather slightly.
Head
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. (9 sc).
3rd and 4th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Stuff lightly. Thread yarn through rem sts and gather neck slightly. 
Sew Head to Body.
Leg (Make 4) 
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Stuff lightly. Thread yarn through rem sts and gather slightly. Sew in place.

materials: lily® sugar’n cream® (Solids: 70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) main color (mc) (01004 Soft Ecru) 1 ball
lily® sugar’n cream® (Ombres: 56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds) contrast e (02446 Batik) 1 ball
Sizes 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) and 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of red embroidery floss for mouth.
Small amount of black embroidery floss for eyelashes.
gauge: 16 sc and 18 rows = 4” [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
Doll head
With MC and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 10 times more.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Stuff Head.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
Stuff Head.
Body leggings: With B and smaller hook, ch 30. Join in ring with sl st into first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 1½" [4 cm]. Join A with sl st to first sc. Break B.
t-shirt: With A, rep last rnd twice more.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm].
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Sew bottom edge of Body closed. Stuff Body.
arms (make 2).
With MC and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Arm measures 3” [7.5 cm]. Join A with sl st to first sc. Break MC.
t-shirt sleeves: With A, rep last rnd 4 times more. Fasten off.
Stuff Arms lightly.
legs (make 2).
Foot: With MC and smaller hook, ch 5.
**1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.**
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd. 21 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1.  1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with  sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Leg measures 2" [5 cm], joining B with sl st to first sc at end of last rnd. Break MC.
leggings: With B, rep last rnd until Leg measures 5" [12.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Stuff Legs.
Finishing
Sew top of Legs closed using whip st. Sew to bottom of Body as shown in picture. Attach Arms to sides of Body. Attach Head to top of Body. With black embroidery floss, embroider eyelashes. Sew beads to front of Head for eyes. With red embroidery floss, embroider mouth. With B, embroider flower on T-shirt front with Lazy Daisy stitch (see diagram).
hair fringe: Cut a piece of tape 5" [12.5 cm] long and secure onto a flat surface with sticky side up. Cut lengths of D 16" [40.5 cm] long and lay them across tape so strip of tape is in center of yarn. Holding tissue paper over top of yarn and using sewing machine, run a line of stitching along length of tape. Remove tape and tissue paper when hair is secure. Pin fringe to center of head. Using backstitch and D, sew hair into place along sewn line. Rep previous steps with 2" [5 cm] piece of tape and 20" [51 cm] lengths of yarn. Pin to front of hair line to create bangs. Secure Hair into place with ribbon with short lengths of B.
hooDie
Back: With E and larger hook, ch 18.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 17 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 16 sts.
5th and 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 14 sts.
8th and 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 12 sts.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 10 sts.
13th row: Sl st in each of next 2 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. turn. Leave rem sc unworked. 8 sts.
14th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
15th and 16th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
17th row: (shape neck). Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 2 hdc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 3 hdc in last sc. Fasten off.
right and left Fronts: (make alike).
With E and larger hook, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Turn. 7 sts.
5th and 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
8th and 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Turn. 5 sts.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 4 sts.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. turn. Leave rem sc unworked.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
15th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
16th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn.
17th row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first st. Fasten off.
sleeve: (make 2). With E and larger hook, ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 11 sc.
2nd to 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 7 sts.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Leave rem st unworked. Fasten off.
hood: (make 2 pieces alike).
With E and larger hook, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 9 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 10 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 11 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc.  Turn. 12 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 13 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc.  Turn. 14 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc.  Turn. 15 sc.
10th to 12th rows: As 8th row.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc.  Turn. 16 sc.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 15 sts.
15th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Turn. 14 sts.
16th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 13 sts.
17th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Turn. 12 sts.
18th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Leave rem st unworked. Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew shoulder seams. Sew in sleeves. Sew sleeve and side seams. Sew hood around neck edge. With E, add string detail to hood as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Fur™: 3 balls 9100 Polar A, 1 ball 9012 Slate B
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 312 Black C, 706 Perfect Pink D, and 316 Soft White E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 16mm [US Q] and 4mm [US G-6]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Puppy measures about 13” [33 cm] long (from end of nose to tip of tail).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
BODY
Beginning at front end of body, with larger hook and A, ch 4.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in each of next 2 ch—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 3 times—9 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 3 times—12 sc.
Rows 6 and 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 3 times—9 sc.
Fasten off.
Finishing Body: Fold last row (Row 8) in half. With E, beginning at fold, sew halves of Row 8 together for back end of body, then sew side edges of piece together for bottom seam, stuffing as you go. Weave E through base of stitches of first row, pull tight to gather. Weave in end securely.

HEAD
With larger hook and A, ch 4.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in each of next 2 ch—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 3 times—9 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, [sc2tog] 4 times, sc in last st—5 sc.
Fasten off.
Finishing Head: Weave E through stitches of last row (Row 5) and pull to gather, then sew side edges of piece together, stuffing as you go. Weave E through base of stitches of first row, pull tight to gather. Weave in end securely.

LEGS (make 4)
With larger hook and A, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch—4 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Fasten off.
Finishing Leg: Fold last row (Row 3) in half. With E, beginning at fold, sew halves of Row 3 together, then sew side edges of piece together for inside seam, stuffing as you go, then sew opening at end closed. Weave in end securely.

TAIL
With larger hook and A, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch—3 sc.
Fasten off.

EAR (make 2)
With larger hook and B, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch—3 sc.
Fasten off.

SPOT
With larger hook and B, ch 3.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch—2 sc.
Fasten off.

SNOUT
Beginning at tip of snout, with smaller hook and E, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Note: If desired, place a marker in last stitch worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each st around.
Round 4: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each st around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff and sew in place on front of head.

NOSE
With smaller hook and C, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Note: If desired, place a marker in last stitch worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each st around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Weave tail through stitches of last round and pull to gather slightly (leaving a small opening). Stuff nose lightly. Sew in place on tip of snout. With C, using photograph as a guide, embroider straight stitches for mouth, below nose.

TONGUE
With smaller hook and D, ch 2. 
Row 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook—3 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew tongue to snout at embroidered mouth.

EYE (make 2)
With smaller hook and C, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each st around; slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail onto yarn needle and weave tail in and out of outer edge, pull to gather. Sew eyes to front of head above snout. To help eyes show up, trim a little of the fur around eyes, if desired.

FINISHING 
Assembly: Refer to photograph for placement of all pieces. With E, sew head to top of front end of body, sewing around head a couple of times and making sure that you sew through the stitches (not just the outer layer of fur). Sew front legs forward as if puppy is lying down, sewing firmly in place. Sew back legs along side the front legs, sewing firmly in place. Sew tail to back end of body. With yarn needle and C, sew ears to top of head. Sew spot to one side of body. Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Overcast (01042) 2 balls or 149 yds/136.5 m
Contrast B Red (00095) 1 ball or 37.5 yds/34.5 m
Contrast C Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 20.5 yds/19 m
Contrast D Blueberry (01725) 1 ball or 25.5 yds/23.5 m
Anchor® Embroidery Floss in China Rose Med Dk (0025) and Black (0403).
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.
Head and Body:
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th to 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 11 times. 1 sc in each of last 10 sc. Join. 53 sc.
13th to 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 11 times. 1 sc in each of last 10 sc. Join. 42 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break A. Join with B.
Stuff Head Firmly.
22nd rnd: With B, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
24th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
25th to 28th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
29th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Break B. Join with A.
30th rnd: With A, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
31st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
32nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
33rd to 37th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
38th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
39th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
40th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc. Do not fasten off.
Separate for Legs:
Right Leg: Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Ch 3. Skip next 21 sc. 1 sc in each of last 18 sc. Join. 24 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
**Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off leaving a long end.
Draw end tightly through rem sts.**
Left Leg: Join A with sl st to first skipped sc of 42nd rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Join.
Rep from ** to ** as given for Right Leg.
Shirt Edge
Join B with sl st to first sc of front loops of 28th rnd. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. Working in front loops only, *1 hdc in each of next 6 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Fasten off.
Ears (make 2)
Inside Ear: With C, ch 5.
***1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 3rd row until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm].
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice.
Fasten off.***
Outside Ear: With A, ch 5.
Rep from *** to *** for Inside Ear.
Ear Assembly
With WS of Inside Ear and Outside Ear tog, join A with sl st through both thicknesses to bottom right corner of foundation row. 
Next row: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses and in back loops only, 1 sc evenly around sides of Ears, leaving foundation rows unworked. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Sew each Ear to Head as shown in photo.
Arms (make 2)
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 4 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 1½" [4 cm].
Fasten off leaving a long end.
Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Sew Arms to Body as shown in photo.
Sleeves (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
1st row: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 6 sc.
3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
Sew Sleeves over Arms to Body as shown in photo.
Collar
With B, ch 25.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 2 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 2. Sl st in same ch as last dc. Sl st in next ch. Ch 2. 1 dc in same ch as last sl st. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. (2 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch) twice.
Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.
Sew Collar around neck with 2 dc points in front as shown in photo.
Tail
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
Stuff Tail firmly.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Sew Tail to Body at back as shown in photo.
Pencil
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with C. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: With C, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Break C. Join with D. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: With D, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 4th rnd until work from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm]. Join C.
Next row: With C, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Break C. Join with D. 6 sc.
Next row: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Nose 
With length of China Rose Med Dk embroidery floss, embroider nose using satin stitch as shown in photo.
Eyes
With length of A, cinch eyes tog as shown in photo to create indents. With length of Black embroidery floss, embroider eyes using satin stitch as shown in photo.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic™ Crochet Thread size 10 (White: 400 yds/365.8 m; Colors: 350 yds/320 m)
Size U.S. 7 (1.5 mm) Susan Bates® Steelite® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Optional: You can also use black Floss for the eyes
abbreviations: Hdcbl = Half double crochet through back loop only
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in front loops ONLY in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scfl = Single crochet in front loop only
measurements: Approx 1¾" x 1" x 4" [4.5 x 2.5 x 10 cm]
instructions:
Designer Tip: Use the trick quilters use to bury their knots when hand quilting. Make a knot close to the surface of the work and pull the knot into the interior and out the other side. Trim thread close to the exit point.
Designer Tip:  Do not fully tighten the Magic Loop until after working Rnd 2. It will make it easier to get your hook into the stitches.
Notes:  
• The Elephant is worked from the tip of the nose to the back end.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
With MC, make Magic Loop.
Video here. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in Magic loop. Join. 6 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 scfl in each sc around. Join. 
3rd to 5th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sc.
7th and 8th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each 1 sc around. Join. 
Coil and stuff beg tail into trunk. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 18 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join. 24 sc. 
Lightly stuff trunk with fiberfill.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next 1 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next 1 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc. 
14th to 25th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each 1 sc around. Join. 
26th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
28th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
29th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
Stuff Elephant firmly
30th rnd:  Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join. 6 sts. Fasten off, leaving a 12" [30.5 cm] tail.  
Tail
Use the tail at the bottom center back to make the elephant’s tail.  
With MC, ch 8. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. Trim approx ¼" [6 mm] from the end.
Legs (Make 4) 
With MC, make Magic Loop.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 8 sc in Magic Loop. Join. 8 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as st). 1 hdcbl in each sc around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long end to sew Legs to the Body. 
Ears (Make 2) 
With MC, ch 5. 
1st row:  1 sc in the 2nd ch from the hook and each ch to the end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 1. Turn. 8 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 hdc in the next sc. (1 dc. 1 tr) in the next sc. (1 tr. 1 dc) in the next sc. 1 hdc in the next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 10 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. 2 sc in each of next 2 tr. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Turn. 12 sts. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail to sew Ears to Head. 
Sew Ears to Head using the picture as a guide for placement. Using Sewing thread, sew on eyes.
Hair Bow/ Bow Tie (Make 1) 
With A, ch 6. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 2 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn. 1 st.
6th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in sc. Turn. 2 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. 3 sc.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each 1 sc to end of row. Turn. 
9th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long tail to sew Bow to Elephant.  
Sew Bow in front of an ear for a girlish look or under the trunk for a boyish look.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Note: All rnds are joined with a sl st to first st.
Body
Beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 30 sc.
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 40 sc.
7th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 50 sc.
9th to 12th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
14th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
16th to 18th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 27 sc.
20th and 21st rnds: As 3rd rnd.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
23rd rnd: As 3rd rnd.
24th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 21 sc.
25th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
26th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
27th to 30th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
Fasten off. Stuff with polyfill, leaving end open.
Snout
Beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sc.
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Add safety nose as shown in photo. Stuff before stitching to Head.
Ears (make 2)
Beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 5 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 10 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
Head
Beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
7th to 11th rnds: As 5th rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 32 sc. 
13th rnd: As 5th rnd. 
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 24 sc.
15th rnd: As 5th rnd.
Note: Now is a good time to stitch Snout to Head, and stuff Head.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. 16 sc.
17th rnd: As 5th rnd.
18th to 20th rnds: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 2 sc. 
Fasten off.
Sew Ears to Head as shown in photo.  Stuff Snout and sew to Head as shown in photo, with top of Snout placed below 4th rnd of Head.
Attach safety eyes to 4th round of head, just above Snout and spaced approx 4 sts apart. Sew Head to Body as shown in photo.
Arms (make 2)
Beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in  back loops only, 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 12 sc.
7th and 8th rnds: As 5th rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. 8 sc.
10th rnd:  As 5th rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff with polyfill.
Feet (make 2)
Beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 18 sc
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working in  back loops only, 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
6th and 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 18 sc.
9th to 11th rnds: As 6th and 7th rnds.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 12 sc. 
13th and 14th rnds: As 6th and 7th rnds.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff with polyfill.
Sew Arms and Feet to Body as shown in photo.
Tail
Beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 12 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 8 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff with polyfill and sew to Body as shown in photo.
Scarf
With B, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row.  Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 10” [25.5 cm]. Fasten off. Cut lengths of B 4” [10 cm] long.
Knot into fringe across ends of Scarf. Trim fringe evenly.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each: 358 Lavender A, 672 Spring Green B, 656 Real Teal C, 505 Aruba Sea D.
RED HEART® “Stripes™”: 1 skein 944 Breezy Stripe E.
RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each: 378 Claret A, 376 Burgundy B, 389 Hunter Green C, 373 Petal Pink D.
RED HEART® “Stripes™”: 1 skein 930 Posh Stripe E.

Stitch markers, yarn needle, embroidery thread and sharp needle, sharp scissors, small piece of felt, black buttons for eyes (do not use buttons for children under 2 years of age), approximately 2½ large bags polyester fiberfill for large version, 1 large bag for small version.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
measurements: Large Plumpkin measures 24” tall. Small Plumpkin measures 16” tall.
instructions:
PLUMPKIN
Large Body
With A held double and larger hook, ch 4 and join with a slip st in a ring.
Round 1: Work 12 sc in ring, join. Pull yarn tail to tighten center hole (12 sts).
Round 2: [2 sc in same sc, sc] around (18 sts).
Round 3: [2 sc in same sc, 2 sc] around (24 sts).
Round 4: [2 sc in same sc, 3 sc] around (30 sts).
Round 5: [2 sc in same sc, 4 sc] around (36 sts).
Round 6: [2 sc in same sc, 5 sc] around (42 sts).
Round 7: [2 sc in same sc, 6 sc] around (48 sts).
Round 8: [2 sc in same sc, 7 sc] around (54 sts).
Round 9: [2 sc in same sc, 8 sc] around (60 sts).
Round 10: [2 sc in same sc, 9 sc] around (66 sts).
Round 11: [2 sc in same sc, 10 sc] around (72 sts).
Round 12: [2 sc in same sc, 11 sc] around, changing to B in last st (78 sts).
Round 13: [2 sc in same sc, 12 sc] around (84 sts).
Round 14: [13 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around (90 sts).
Round 15: [14 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around (96 sts).
Round 16: [15 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, changing to E in last st (102 sts).
Rounds 17-19: Sc in each sc around, changing to A in last st of last round.
Round 20: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 21: [Sc2tog, sc in next 15 sc] around, changing to C in last stitch (96 sts).
Round 22: [Sc in next 14 sc, sc2tog] around (90 sts).
Rounds 23-25: Sc in each sc around, changing to B in last st of last round (90 sts).
Round 26: [13 sc, sc2tog] around (84 sts).
Rounds 27-37: Sc in each sc around, in the following stripe pattern: B 1 round; E 7 rounds; B 2 rounds; C 1 round
Round 38: [12 sc, sc2tog] around (78 sts).
Rounds 39-44: Sc in each sc around, in the following stripe pattern: C 1 round; B 3 rounds; E 2 rounds, decreasing 6 sts evenly in last round (72 sts).
Round 45: [7 sc, sc2tog] around (64 sts).
Round 46: [6 sc, sc2tog] around (56 sts).
Round 47: [2 sc, sc2tog] around (42 sts).
Round 48: [5 sc, sc2tog] around (36 sts).
Set aside and begin arms.
Small Body
Work through Round 12 as for Large Body, changing to B at end of Round 11.
Round 13: Sc in each sc around, changing to C in last st (78 sts). 
Round 14: [Sc2tog, 11 sc] around (72 sts).
Round 15: [Sc2tog, 10 sc] around, changing to E in last st (66 sts).
Rounds 16-18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: [9 sc, sc2tog] around, changing to A in last st (60 sts).
Rounds 20-29: Sc in each sc around in the following stripe pattern: A 2 rounds; B 2 rounds; C 1 round; E 1 round
Round 30: [8 sc, sc2tog] around (54 sts).
Rounds 31-32: Sc in each sc around.
Round 33: [7 sc, sc2tog] around (48 sts).
Round 34: [6 sc, sc2tog] around, changing to A in last st (42 sts).
Round 35: [Sc2tog, 5 sc] around (36 sts).
Round 36: [Sc2tog, 4 sc] around (30 sts).
Set aside and begin arms.
Large Arms (make 2)
With E held double and larger hook, ch 12 and join with a slip st in a ring. 
Rounds 1-4: Sc in each ch around changing to A in last st of last round (12 sts).
Round 5: [2 sc in same sc, sc] around (18 sts).
Round 6: Sc around changing to B in last st.
Rounds 7-20: Sc in each sc around in the following pattern: B 3 rounds; C 1 round; E 4 rounds; A 3 rounds; B 2 rounds; C 1 round, changing to E at the end of round.
Round 21: Ch 1, slip st in each st around, fasten off (18 sts).
Hands
Round 22: Change to smaller hook. Locate last round of sc before slip st round, join a single strand of D in any st, ch 1, 2 sc in each st around (36 sts).
Round 23: [2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around (48 sts). Rounds 24-30:  Sc in each sc around.
Round 31: [Sc2tog, 2 sc] around (36 sts).
Round 32: [Sc2tog, 2 sc] around (27 sts).
Round 33: [Sc2tog, sc] around (18 sts).
Round 34: [Sc2tog] around (9 sts).
Round 35: [Sc2tog] to last st, sc (5 sts). Fasten off.
Repeat for other arm. Stuff arms. Locate arm placement and pin arms in place at neck opening. Slip st arms to neck opening, closing top of arm. Proceed to head instructions.
Small Arms (make 2)
With E held double and larger hook, work as for large arms through Round 4, changing to A at end of last round (12 sts).
Rounds 5-13: Sc in each sc around in the following pattern: A 2 rounds; B 1 round; C 2 rounds; E 4 rounds
Round 14: Ch 1, slip st in each st around, fasten off (12 sts).
Hands
Round 15: Change to smaller hook. Locate last round of sc before slip st round, join a single strand of D in any st, ch 1, 2 sc in each st around (24 sts).
Round 16: [2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around (32 sts).
Rounds 17-19: Sc in each sc around.
Round 20: [Sc2tog, 2 sc] around (24 sts). 
Round 21: [Sc2tog, 2 sc] around (18 sts). 
Round 22: [Sc2tog, sc] around (12 sts). 
Round 23: [Sc2tog] around (6 sts).
Fasten off, using yarn tail to weave hole closed.
Attach to body as for large arms.
Head
Round 1: Locate last round of sc before slip st round at neck opening of body. Using smaller hook and single strand of D, join yarn in any st. 2 sc in each st around [72 (60) sts].
Round 2: [2 sc in same sc, 2 sc] around [96 (80) sts].
Round 3: [2 sc in same sc, 3 sc] around [120 (100) sts].
Sc in each sc around for 25 (12) rounds.
Next round: [Sc2tog, 3 sc] around [96 (80) sts].
Next round: Sc in each sc around.
Next round: [Sc2tog, 2 sc] around [72 (60) sts].
Sc in each sc around for 4 (2) rounds.
Antennae
Lay piece face upwards and flatten head, making certain to smooth the layers. Locate the sts on the rightmost edge. Count 10 sts in from the edge and place marker. Likewise, count in 10 sts on back layer so that there are 20 sts between the markers (wrapping around the side of the head). Repeat for the left antenna. Sc in each of the 20 sts around for 12 (3) rounds.
Next round: [Sc, 2 sc in next sc] around (30 sts).
Next round: Sc in each sc around.
Next round: [4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around (36 sts). 
Next round: [5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around (42 sts).
Next round: Sc in each sc around.
Next round: [5 sc, sc2tog] around (36 sts).
Next round: [4 sc, sc2tog] around (30 sts).
Next round: [3 sc, sc2tog] around (24 sts).
Next round: [2 sc, sc2tog] around (18 sts).
Next round: [Sc2tog] around (9 sts).
Next round: [Sc2tog] around to last st, sc (5 sts).
Fasten off, weaving yarn tail through sts to close hole. Repeat for other antenna.
FINISHING 
Embellish face before stuffing toy as follows: 
Using a lid from a small jar or other small round shape, trace out 2 circles onto felt for eyes. Cut out, pin onto face in desired location and attach using embroidery floss and a whipstitch.
If using buttons, attach with strong thread, making certain to knot the thread securely. Experiment with button placement, which can change the expression of the toy. Embroider the mouth with a running or outline stitch. Likewise, make small upward slanting dashes for eyebrows. 
Stuff toy firmly, making certain to smooth out lumps. Using long tail from antenna, sew top of head closed, knotting securely. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Dried Flowers (10981) 1 ball or 129 yds/140 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn for embroidery.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Notes: 
• Do not join in rounds (rnds). 
Work in spiral. Move marker for beginning (beg) of rnd as work progresses.
• When Body is complete, turn work inside out. WS of work is facing you.
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 single crochet (sc) in 2nd chain (ch) from hook. Place marker (PM) in first sc for beg of rnd. 6 sc in rnd. Do not join. Work in spiral (see note).
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. Replace marker to first sc. 12 sc in rnd.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in first sc. Move marker. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Repeat (rep) from * around. 18 sc in rnd.
Continue (cont) working in spiral rnds, moving marker to indicate first sc as follows:
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
8th to 12th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
13th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops - single crochet 2 together (sc2tog) made. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
14th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
15th to 17th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
18th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from* around. 24 sts.
19th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
20th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
21st and 22nd rnds: 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off, leaving long tail for seaming.
Turn work inside out, so WS of work becomes RS.
With black worsted weight yarn, embroider eyes at 20th rnd, using Satin Stitch. Locate position for nose 1 rnd below and embroider using Satin Stitch. Embroider whiskers using Straight Stitch as shown in photo.
Paws (make 2).
Ch 5, leaving a long tail for sewing.
1st row: [Right side (RS).] 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 3 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. Fasten off and weave in last end.
Using yarn needle, with WS down, sew 1st row of each Paw into 14th rnd of Body, on same side as eyes as shown in photo, using Whip Stitch.
Tail
Ch 4, leaving long tail for sewing.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off and weave in last end.
Sew 1st row of Tail into 7th rnd of Body, centered on opposite side from face and Paws, using Whip Stitch.
FINISHING
Add stuffing. Fold top of Body flat and sew top of head seam using Whip Stitch, being sure to center eyes and nose.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi Textures™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 242 yds/221 m)
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
2 black safety eyes ¼" [6 mm] for each toy
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] tall, including eye balls.
instructions:
Version 1: Blue as Color 1, Green as Color 2, White as Color 3, Pink Texture as Color 4. 
Version 2: Green as Color 1, Blue as Color 2, White as Color 3, Pink Texture as Color 4. 
Note:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
Body
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
9th to 20th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
21st rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sts.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
24th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
Stuff Body firmly.
25th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. Join. 8 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Horns (make 2)
With Color 2, ch 6, leaving a long end for sewing. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 6 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 3 sts. Fasten off. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Sew Horns to Body as shown in photo.
Feet (make 2)
With Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew Feet to Body as shown in photo, stuffing Feet firmly before they are completely sewn on.
Arms (make 2)
With Color 2, ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 6 sc.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog 6 times. Join. 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Sew Arms to Body as shown in photo.
Eyes (make 2)
With Color 3, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with Color 4 at end of 4th rnd. Break Color 3.
6th rnd: With Color 4, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Using Color 3, sew Eyes to Body as shown in photo.
Mouth
Using stem stitch with Color 2, embroider mouth as shown in photo.
Tooth
With Color 3, ch 3.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 2 sc.
2nd row: 1 sc in each of next 2 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Sew Tooth to Body as shown in photo.
Stem Stitch
Stem Stitch

materials: RED HEART® With Love™: 1 skein each 1302 Caramel A
two ½” diameter black shank style buttons
optional plastic pellets and 1 knee-high stocking
optional dental floss for attaching eyes
abbreviations: Dec (decrease) = draw up a loop in next 2 sc, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook
gauge: 18 sts = 4”; 20 rows = 4” in sc with larger hook. Gauge is not important with this project as long as tightly crocheted stitches are achieved to prevent stuffing showing through.
instructions:
LEGS (Make 4)
Round 1: With A (B) and larger hook, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook working over yarn tail – 6 sc. Pull yarn tail to close hole.
Round 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, inc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rounds 4-6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 8: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] twice – 10 sc. Stuff paw firmly.
Round 9: [Dec, sc in next 3 sc] twice – 8 sc.
Rounds 10-18: If making light colored puppy change to C, otherwise continue with A. Sc in each sc around. Stuff leg very lightly as rounds are completed.
Next Step: Hold the layers flat to close the top. Ch 1, sc through both layers in each sc across – 4 sc. Fasten off.

BODY
Begin at bottom.
Rounds 1-3: With A (C) and larger hook, repeat Rounds 1-3 same as for Legs – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, inc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, inc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 7-Attach 2 Legs: Sc in 27 sc, then holding first leg flush with edge, sc through all layers in next 4 sc, sc in next sc of body, attach 2nd leg sc through all layers in next 4 sts – 36 sc.
Rounds 8-12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 4 sc, dec] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 14: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 6 times – 18 sc. Stuff firmly beginning with optional plastic pellet packet first. Continue stuffing as rounds are made.
Round 17-Attach 2 Legs: Sc in next 4 sc, holding first leg flush with edge, sc through all layers in next 4 sc, sc in next 5 sc of body, attach 2nd leg sc through all layers in next 4 sc, sc in last sc of body – 18 sc.
Round 18: Sc in each sc around. Do not stuff remaining rounds.
Round 19: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc.
Rounds 20-21: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off leaving yarn tail for attaching head.

HEAD
Begin at muzzle.
Rounds 1-6: With A (C) and larger hook, work same as Body Rounds 1-6 – 36 sc.
Rounds 7-9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [Sc in next 4 sc, dec] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rounds 13-16: Sc in each sc around.
Round 17: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 6 times – 18 sc. Stuff head firmly.
Round 18: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc. Continue stuffing as rounds are completed.
Round 19: [Sc in next sc, dec] 4 times – 8 sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

Ears (Make 2)
Begin at base of ear.
Round 1: With A (B) and larger hook, leaving a 6” yarn tail before slip knot, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sc.
Rounds 2-7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc in next sc, dec] twice – 4 sc. Thread yarn needle with yarn end and weave yarn through last round of sts to close hole. Weave in end from needle but leave long tail from beginning round for attaching ears to head. Do not stuff.

Tail
With A (B) and larger hook, ch 7; working in back bumps of beginning ch, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 6 sc. Fasten off leaving yarn end for sewing tail to body.

Heart Shaped Nose Patch/Eye Appliqué
Row 1: With smaller hook and E (D), ch 2; 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, 3 sc in next sc, [2 sc in next sc] twice; do not turn – 11 sc.
Row 3: Working across row ends at the top of the heart shape, 2 sc in first row end, slip st between rows, 2 sc in next row end, slip st to next st. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

FINISHING
The head is designed with the smaller end as the crown of the head and the larger end as the muzzle. Using yarn tail from neck of body sew head to neck securely.
Pin heart shaped nose to muzzle end. Using matching sewing thread and needle, attach securely by sewing. Likewise, pin heart appliqués to head or chest as desired and attach using sewing thread.
Using photo as a guide, sew on button eyes using strong sewing thread or dental floss.
Attach ears and tail using yarn ends. 
Embroider paw detail using E: beginning at the left hand edge of the paw, insert needle about ½” from tip of paw, bringing it straight through to the other side and pulling tightly to shape. Insert needle back into paw and out about ¼” from the first paw detail. Repeat one more time for a total of 3 paw details. Knot, weave in ends. Repeat for other 3 paws.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 316 Soft White A, 3942 Lagoon B, 512 Turqua C, 726 Coral D.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6], 5mm [US H-8] (for scarf and hat only)
Two ¾” (19mm) black faceted sew on rounds (for eyes)
Sewing needle and black sewing thread
Copy of mini Red Heart label
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Snowman measures about 13½” (34.5 cm) tall, not including pompom hat.
gauge: 20 sts = 4” (10 cm); 22 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet with smaller hook.
instructions:
Head
With smaller hook and A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral). Pull gently on tail to tighten ring. Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—54 sc.
Round 10: [Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—60 sc.
Round 11: [Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—66 sc.
Rounds 12-28: Sc in each sc around.
Round 29: [Sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—60 sc.
Round 30: [Sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—54 sc.
Round 31: [Sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 32: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 12 times—36 sc.
Rounds 33 and 34: Sc in each sc around.
Round 35: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 18 times—54 sc.
Stuff Head
Firmly stuff the toe of the knee-high stocking with polyester stuffing. Shape the toe it into a tight round ball. Insert ball into head to check for desired fullness. Adjust amount of stuffing, as needed. When satisfied with fullness and firmness, tie stocking in a knot close to the top of the ball. Insert ball into head. Leave the remaining part of the stocking unstuffed for mid-section and bottom section.
Mid-Section (Cardigan Sweater)
Note: Work now proceeds back and forth in rows.
Row 36 (wrong side): Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, [psc in next sc, sc in next sc] 26 times, sc in last sc—54 sts.
Row 37: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across, pushing chains of psc to right side.
Row 38: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, [psc in next sc, sc in next sc] 26 times, sc in last sc.
Rows 39-54: Repeat last 2 rows 8 times.
Button Band (wrong side): Ch 2, do not turn, working in ends of rows 36-54, work 20 hdc evenly spaced along front edge of sweater. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing front of sweater closed. Do not sew sweater closed until snowman is complete. You may use the opening to add additional stuffing as the bottom section is worked and completed.
Note: Work now resumes in rounds.
Round 55 (right side): With right side facing, leaving a long beginning tail to weave in later, join A with slip st in last sc of Row 54 immediately following the button band; working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in same sc as joining slip st, sc in each sc around (do not work in edge of button band), pushing chains of psc to right side; join with slip st in first sc—54 sc.
Stuff Mid-Section
Stuff next section of knee-high stocking in same manner as for head and insert into mid-section. Leave the remaining part of the stocking unstuffed for bottom section.
Bottom Section
Round 56: [Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—60 sc.
Round 57: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 12 times—72 sc.
Rounds 58-72: Sc in each sc around.
Round 73: [Sc in next 10 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—66 sc.
Round 74: [Sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—60 sc.
Round 75: [Sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—54 sc.
Round 76: [Sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 77: [Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—42 sc.
Stuff Bottom Section
Fill last section of knee-high stocking with about 1 cup of pellets (weighted stuffing) and tie a secure knot in the end of the stocking. Plump out the snowman, around this weighted area using polyester stuffing as needed. Stuffing can be added through front sweater opening or through the bottom of the piece. Continue adding stuffing, as needed, while working the remaining rounds of this section.
Round 78: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 79: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 80: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 81: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 82: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Round 83: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Finish stuffing snowman, then weave tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Knot securely, weave in and trim tail. Use yarn tail attached to button band to sew front of sweater closed.
ARMS (make 2)
With smaller hook and A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral). Pull gently on tail to tighten ring. Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 4-10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] twice—16 sc.
Round 12: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice—18 sc.
Note: Work now proceeds back and forth in rows.
Row 14 (wrong side): Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, [psc in next sc, sc in next sc] 8 times, sc in last sc.
Row 15: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across, pushing chains of psc to right side—18 sts.
Rows 16-35: Repeat last 2 rows 10 times.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Use tail to sew edges of Rows 14-35 together, stuffing arm moderately as you sew.
NOSE
With smaller hook and D, ch 8. Taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in same ch as joining and in each ch around—8 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] twice—6 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc2tog] 5 times—3 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Knot securely, then weave tail back through nose to beginning round, to be used later for sewing nose to snowman. Stuff nose with a small amount of same colored yarn.
SCARF
With larger hook and B, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Repeat last row until piece measures about 20” (51 cm) from beginning, or desired length. Fasten off, leaving a tail about 12” (30.5 cm) long for attaching to mini skein. Weave in and trim beginning yarn tail.
HAT
Ribbed Band
With larger hook and C, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—3 sc.
Rows 2-45: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across.
Do not fasten off.
Body
Note: Color is changed to form stripes. Do not cut colors not in use until instructed. Carry colors not in use carefully up inside of the hat when next needed.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 46 sc evenly spaced across long edge of band; join with slip st in first sc to begin working in rounds—46 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Change to B.
Rounds 3 and 4: With B, ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Change to D.
Round 5: With D, ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Change to C.
Round 6: With C, ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Change to B.
Round 7: With B, ch 1, sc in same st as joining and in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Change to D.
Rounds 8-13: Repeat Rounds 5-7 twice.
Round 14: With D, ch 1, *[sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 5 times, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * once more; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc. Change to B.
Round 15: With B, [sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc. Change to C.
Round 16: With C, [sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc. Change to D. Cut C.
Round 17: With D, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc. Change to B. Cut D.
Round 18: With B, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Round 19: With B, [sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Knot securely, weave in and trim tail. With beginning tail of ribbed band, sew ends of band together. Weave in and trim tail.
Pompoms
Cut 12” (30.5 cm) length of any color yarn and set aside. Hold three fingers extended and close together. Wrap D around fingers 40 times, then wrap C around fingers 40 times, and finally wrap B around fingers 40 times, for a total of 120 wraps.
While wraps are still on fingers, slip the 12” (30.5 cm) yarn length under the wraps and slip the wraps off your fingers. Tie 12” (30.5 cm) length tightly around wraps. Hold yarn wraps tightly in fist with 12” (30.5 cm) tie dangling from bottom of fist and the looped wraps extending over top of closed fist. Using sharp craft scissors, carefully trim loops to form pompom. Grasp pompom by 12” (30.5 cm) tie and shake to fluff out. Make another pompom identical to the first. With the 12” (30.5 cm) ties, tie the two pompoms together. Leaving ends of ties free, apply a moderate amount of craft glue to knot and let dry. With ties and yarn needle attach pompom to hat.
MINI SKEIN OF YARN
Cut two 12” (30.5 cm) lengths of any color yarn and set aside. Hold four fingers extended and slightly spread. Wrap yarn color of your choice around fingers 50 times. While wraps are still on fingers, slip one of the 12” (30.5 cm) length under the wraps and slip the wraps off your fingers. Knot 12” (30.5 cm) length tightly around wraps.
Hold wraps by tie and smooth out yarn so that it hangs straight. Slip second tie through opposite end of wraps and knot around wraps tightly. Apply a moderate amount of craft glue to knots and let dry. Weave ends through skein and trim. Set aside.
Label
Make a copy of the mini Red Heart label. If needed, reduce image size to fit mini skein. Then print image on color printer. To reinforce label use clear cellophane tape placed carefully over image or image can be laminated. Trim label width and length to fit skein, wrap around middle of skein and tape securely.
FINISHING
Note: Whenever possible, use yarn tails still attached to pieces to sew the pieces in place. Using photograph as a guide, sew arms to shoulders of snowman near beginning of cardigan sweater. Sew hat to head. Sew nose to lower portion of head. With sewing needle and black thread, sew eyes above nose, and sew four black buttons evenly spaced down the button band of the cardigan sweater. Place crochet hook in palm of one hand. Sew hand closed around the hook. Place small amount of glue where hand grips the hook for extra security. Tie scarf around neck, so that end of scarf with long yarn tail falls in front. Tack scarf in place using matching yarn, as desired. Insert plastic hook through a couple loops at end of scarf. Wrap the long yarn tail around throat of hook (as if making a yarn over) then tie the tail to one end of the mini skein and weave loose end into the skein. Glue the “stitches” wrapped around the hook in place using craft glue. Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Bread (make 2)
With MC, ch 16.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of 
chain. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to 
end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece from beg 
measures 3½” [9 cm], ending on a 
WS row.
Next row: (RS). *Skip next 3 sc.  
7 dc in next sc.** Skip next 3 sc.  
Sl st in next sc. Rep from * to ** 
once more. Skip next 2 sc. Sl st in 
last sc. Do not turn.
Edging: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd 
of sc evenly around Bread, having 
3 sc in each bottom corner. Join A 
with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. Work 1 sc 
in each sc around, having 3 sc in 
each corner. Join with sl st to first 
sc. Fasten off.

Lettuce
With B, ch 4. Join with sl st to form 
ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as 
hdc). 8 hdc in ring. Join with sl st 
to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as 
hdc). 2 hdc in each hdc around. 
Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as 
hdc). *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in 
next hdc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first hdc. 24 hdc.
4th rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as 
hdc). *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc.  
2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
32 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in 
first hdc. *2 dc in next hdc. 1 dc in 
next hdc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to top of ch 3. 48 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc 
in first dc. 3 dc in each dc around. 
Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten 
off. 144 dc.

Tomato
With C, ch 4. Join with sl st to form 
ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc 
in ring. (Ch 3. 3 dc) 3 times in ring.  
Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
2nd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc 
in first dc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc.  
(Ch 3. 2 dc in each of next 3 dc) 3 times. 
Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 
6 dc. 3 sc in next ch-3 sp) 4 times. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 

Cheese
With D, ch 17.
1st row: (RS) 1 dc in 4th ch from 
hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each 
ch to end of ch. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc).  
1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 2. Skip 
next 2 dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of 
row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc 
in each dc to ch-2 sp. 2 dc in ch-2 
sp. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. 
Turn.
4th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc 
in each of next 8 dc. Ch 2. Skip 
next 2 dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of 
row. Turn.
5th row: As 3rd row.
6th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc 
in each of next 3 dc. Ch 2. Skip 
next 2 dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of 
row. Turn.
8th row: As 3rd row. Do not turn. 
Edging: Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc 
evenly around outer edge of 
Cheese, having 3 sc in each corner. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ O’Go™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Milk and Honey (42005) 1 O’Go or approx 68 yds/62 m per shade
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Approx 3 yds/2.5 m of black worsted weight yarn to embroider eyes.
Approx 15 yds/14 m of pink worsted weight yarn for Cherry.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
CROCHET ICE CREAM TOY
ICE CREAM TOY
Top Scoop: With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th to 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
16th rnd: Working in front loops only, *Sl st in next sc. 3 hdc in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. Join.
17th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only of 15th rnd, *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Break B. Join C. 36 sc.
Bottom Scoop: 18th rnd: With C, ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
20th to 27th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
28th rnd: Working in front loops only, *Sl st in next sc. 3 hdc in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. Join.
29th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only of 27th rnd, *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Break C. Join A. 36 sc.
Embroidery: With black yarn, embroider eyes using Satin St on Scoops as shown in photo.
With pink yarn, embroider blush lines below each eye using straight st, as shown in photo.
Cone: 30th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in front loops only, *1 sc in next sc. Ch 1. Rep from * around. Join.
31st rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only of 29th rnd, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
32nd and 33rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
34th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
35th and 36th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Stuff Scoops and Cone firmly.
37th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
38th and 39th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
40th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
41st and 42nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
43rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
44th and 45th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Finish stuffing Cone firmly.
46th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sc.
47th and 48th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving long end. Drawn end tightly through rem sts.
Cherry: With smaller hook and pink yarn, ch 6.
1st rnd: Working into horizontal "bump" at back of ch, sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each of next 3 ch – Cherry Stem made. Working into front loop only, 6 sc in last ch. Hold Cherry Stem to front of work. Join last sc to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join. 30 sc.
6th to 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off, leaving long end.
Stuff Cherry firmly. Using long end, sew Cherry onto Top Scoop, as shown in photo.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz /70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Grape (00071) or Hot Orange (01628) 2 balls or 181 yds/165 m
Contrast A Black (00002) or Warm Brown (01130) 2 balls or 124 yds/116 m
Contrast B White (00001) 1 ball or 42 yds/38 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Head
With MC, ch 2.
**1st rnd:  7 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 7 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
14 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc 
in next sc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 21 sc.
4th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of 
next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
28 sc.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of 
next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
35 sc.
6th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of 
next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc.** 
42 sc.
7th and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each
sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of 
next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
49 sc.
10th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of 
next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
56 sc.
12th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of 
next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from 
* around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
63 sc.
13th to 17th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in 
each sc around. Join with sl st to 
first sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 
7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sts.
19th and 20th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in 
each sc around. Join with sl st to 
first sc.
