2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.
Rep last row 9 times more. Fasten off. Sew edge to opposite side of Sandal.
Back Strap: With A, ch 15. Fasten off. Sew Back Strap to Front Strap as shown in photo.
Flower (make 2)
With C and smaller hook, ch 6.
1st row: Sl st in 6th ch from hook. *Ch 6. Sl st in same sp as last sl st. Rep from * 3 times more. Fasten off. Attach Flower to front of Sandal.
FINISHING
Sew top of Legs closed. Sew Legs to bottom of Body. Attach Arms to sides of Body. With black embroidery floss, embroid eyelashes using straight stitch. Sew beads onto front of Head for eyes. With red embroidery floss, embroid mouth using straight stitch. Attach Head to body.
Hair fringe
Cut a piece of tape 11 ins [28 cm] long and secure onto a flat surface with sticky side up. Cut lengths of D 19 ins [48 cm] long and lay them across tape so strip of tape is in center of yarn. Holding tissue paper over top of yarn and using sewing machine, run a line of stitching along length of tape. Remove tape when hair is secure. Remove tissue paper after stitching.
Pin fringe to center of head. Using backstitch and D, sew hair into place along sewn line. Secure Hair into place with ribbon as shown.
DRESS
With larger hook and A, ch 24. Join with sl st to first ch taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 5 times more. Join C at end of last rnd. Break A.
Next rnd: With C, ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in same sp as last sl st. *1 hdc in next sc. 2 hdc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to top of ch 2. 36 hdc.
Next rnd: With B, ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join C with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: With C, ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join B with sl st to first hdc.
Rep last 2 rnds twice more.
Next rnd: With B, ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join C with sl st to first hdc.
Next rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sl st. Ch 3. 1 dc) in first sc. *Miss next sc. (Sl st. Ch 3. 1 dc) in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to same sp as first sl st. Fasten off.
Straps (make 2).
With A, ch 10. Fasten off.
Put Dress on Doll and mark position for Straps. Sew Straps to Dress.

pattern_name: Crochet Happy Little Car, Plane, and Truck
materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Contrast A, B, C, D, and E: Christmas (7196) 1 O’Go
Size U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
measurements: Car:  23/4" wide x 41/2" long [7 x 11.5 cm]. Plane:  8" long x 8" wide [20.5 x 20.5 cm], across wings. Truck:  23/4" wide x 7" long [7 x 18 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• Colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use.
• Designate each color A, B, C, D, E and F as indicated in pattern
• Start crocheting!  
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st. 
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. 
• To change color, work to last loop on hook of prev color. Yoh with new color, draw through loop, tighten prev color and proceed with new color.
CAR
Body
Beg at front of Car, with B, ch 8.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. Join. 16 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of first 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 22 sc.
3rd to 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Sc2tog 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog 3 times. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 16 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Roof
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th and 6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
Stuff firmly and sew Roof over 8th to 15th rnds of Body.
Front and Rear Windows (make 2 alike)
With A, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
With F and using straight st, embroider eyes over 3rd st in from each edge of 1st row of Front Window.
Sew Front Window over 5th and 6th rnds of front side of Roof. Sew Rear Window over 5th and 6th rnds of back side of Roof.
Side Window (make 2 alike)
With A, ch 2.
1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Sew Side Windows over 5th and 6th rnds of each side of Roof.
Bumper (make 2 alike)
With D, ch 15.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 14 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Headlights (make 2 alike)
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 5 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Tire Half (make 8 alike)
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Break D. Join with F. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: With F, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
To form Tire, holding WS tog, sew 2 Tire Halves tog around outer edges. Make 4.

Assembly
Sew Bumpers over lower front and back of Body, ensuring that each bumper is centered and wrapped slightly around each side.
With F, and using backstitch, embroider curved mouth on Front Bumper, as shown in photo.
Sew Headlights above ends of Front Bumper as shown in photo.
Allow half of each Tire to hang below Body and sew in place on lower sides between edges of Bumpers.

PLANE
Nose and Body
Note: Stuff firmly every few rnds.
Beg at Nose, with D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
6th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break D. Join with E.
7th rnd: With E, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
9th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
11th to 19th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
21st to 26th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
27th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
28th to 31st rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
32nd rnd:  Ch 1. Sc2tog around. Join. 6 sc.
33rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Draw end tightly through rem sts.
With E, and using backstitch, embroider curved mouth on underside of Nose between 3rd and 4th rnds as shown in photo.

Front Wings (make 2 alike)
Beg at outer tip of Wing, with C, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 9 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 11 sc.
6th to 13th rows: Rep 4th and 5th rows 4 times. 19 sc.
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Fold Wing in half lengthwise and sew outer edges tog.

Rear Wings (make 3 alike)
Beg at outer tip of Wing, with C, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 7 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 9 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Fold Wing in half lengthwise and sew outer edges tog.

Windshield
With A, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. 12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
With F and using straight st, embroider eyes 1 st apart in center of 1st row of Windshield.
Sew Windshield over 7th and 8th rnds of Body.

Front Tire Half (make 4 alike)
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Break D. Join with F. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: With F, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
To form Tire, holding WS tog, sew 2 Tire Halves tog around outer edges. Make 2.

Rear Tire Half (make 2 alike)
With F, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
To form Tire, holding WS tog, sew 2 Tire Halves tog around outer edges.


Assembly
Sew Front Wings on sides of Body over 14th to 20th rnds and 2 Rear Wings over 30th to 33rd rnds. Sew rem Rear Wing over top of Body over 30th to 33rd rnds, all as shown in photo.
Sew Front Tires to underside of Body slightly forward of Front Wings as shown in photo.
Sew Rear Tire to underside of Body centered between Rear Wings as shown in photo.

TRUCK
Cab Body
With E, ch 34.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 4th ch from hook (beg ch-3 counts as dc here and throughout). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 32 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. (1 dcbp around next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc) 3 times. 1 dcbp around next dc. 1 dc in each of last 3 dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. (1 dcfp around next dc. 1 dc in each of next 7 dc) 3 times. 1 dcfp around next dc. 1 dc in each of last 4 dc. Turn.
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows once more and then 2nd row once more.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Cab Top and Bottom  (make 2 alike)
With E, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 3 times. Join. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in next ch-2 sp.1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * twice. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * twice. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Front Bumper
With D, ch 15.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 14 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Grill
With D, ch 5.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

materials: Size 5.5 mm (U.S. I or 9) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn.
instructions:
BODY
Joining legs: 1st rnd: Join 2 strands of MC with sl st to any sc of first leg. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st and in each of next 8 sc. 1 sc in any sc of second leg and in each of next 17 sc. 1 sc in each of rem 9 sc of first leg. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.  
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
With A, rep last rnd once. 
With MC, rep last rnd twice. 
Rep last 3 rnds 3 times more.
With MC, rep last rnd until work from joining rnd measures 9 ins [23 cm]. 
Stuff body. 
Shape shoulders: Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last 2 rnds once more. 27 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Stuff remainder of Body. 
HEAD 
Muzzle: With A, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.  
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.  
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
9th rnd: As 7th rnd. 
10th rnd: With MC, as 7th rnd. 
11th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
12th rnd: As 7th rnd. 
13th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 54 sc.
14th rnd: As 7th rnd. 
Back of head: With MC, work as given for muzzle, omitting all references to color changes. 
Sew Back and Muzzle tog, leaving opening for stuffing. Stuff head. Sew opening closed. 
Sew Head to Body. 
ARMS (make 2).
Note: Stuff Arms as you work. 
With 2 strands of A, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.  
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
With MC rep last rnd twice. 
With A, rep last rnd once.  
With MC, rep last rnd until work from beg measures 16 ins [40.5 cm]. 
Shape top: Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. 
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc. Fasten off.
Sew Arms to body. 
TAIL
Note: Stuff Tail as you work.
With 2 strands of A, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.  
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.  
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd 5 times more. Join 2 strands of MC at end of last rnd. 
With MC, rep last rnd twice. 
With A, rep last rnd once. 
Rep last 3 rnds once more.
With MC, rep last rnd until work from beg measures 18 ins [45.5 cm]. 
Shape top: Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. 
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc. Fasten off. 
Sew Tail to body. 
EARS (make 2). 
With 2 strands of A, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.  
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join MC with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
Break A. 
4th rnd: With MC, ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join MC with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th row: (RS). Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
6th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Fasten off.
Sew ears to head. 
With MC, embroider mouth, nose and eyes.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™, Art. 805 available in solid 3.5 oz (100 g) 334 yd (305 m) and multi 3.5 oz (100 g) 272 yd (248 m) balls
Yarn needed for each puppet is listed here. Complete materials list and gauge information is given with each project.
FLYING MONKEY: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball each of 902 Ladybug A, 301 Teddy B and a small amount of 112 Night-Night C

GOOD WITCH: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball each of 702 Rosie A, 504 Robin B, 936 Rocking Horse C, and a small amount of 100 Lily D, 226 Bumble E, 801 Bluebell F, 764 Taffy G and 112 Night-Night H
MEAN WITCH: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball each of 691 Grass A, 112 Night-Night B, 261 Tangerine C, 556 Jam D, and 764 Taffy E.
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc = Colors A, B, C, etc
( ) = work instructions in parentheses as indicated
measurements: Finished Size: Flying Monkey 6½” (16.5 cm) circumference; Good Witch 6” (15 cm) circumference; Mean Witch 5” (12.5 cm) circumference.
gauge: 22 sc = 4” (10 cm); 26 rows = 4” (10 cm) for Flying Monkey and Mean Witch. 20 hdc = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) for Good Witch. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Body (FLYING MONKEY)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 8 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Round 2: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) around: 12 sc.
Round 3: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc) around: 16 sc.
Round 4: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 20 sc.
Round 5: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around: 24 sc.
Round 6: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc) around: 28 sc.
Rounds 7-13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: (Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog) around: 24 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around, join with slip st to first sc; fasten off.
Arm
With right side facing, join A with slip st in first ch of any arm opening.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, sc in same ch, sc in next 4 ch, next end of row, next 5 sc and in next end of row, do not join: 12 sc.
Rounds 2-6: Sc in each sc around, changing to B in last sc of Round 6.
Round 7: With B, sc in each sc around.
Round 8: (Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog) around: 10 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: Sc2tog around, fasten off leaving a long end for sewing: 5 sc.
Thread yarn needle with long end and weave through 5 remaining sc, draw up firmly and fasten securely.
Repeat for second arm opening.
Wing (Make 2)
With B and leaving a long end for sewing, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 8 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Round 2: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) around: 12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 15 sc.
Round 5: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around: 18 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 2 sc: 18 sc.
Round 8: Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 2 sc: 18 sc.
Round 9: Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 2 sc: 18 sc.
Round 10: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc) around: 21 sc.
Round 11: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc) around: 24 sc.
Round 12: Sc in each sc around to last 6 sc, sc2tog 3 times: 21 sc.
Round 13: Repeat Round 12: 18 sc.
Round 14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around to last 6 sc, sc2tog 3 times, fasten off leaving a long end for sewing: 15 sc.
Thread yarn needle with long end and weave through 15 remaining sc, fasten securely.
Ear (Make 2)
With B and leaving a long end for sewing, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 6 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Round 2: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc) around: 8 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
Face
With B, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 8 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Round 2: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) around: 12 sc.
Round 3: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc) around: 16 sc.
Round 4: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 20 sc.
Round 5: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around: 24 sc.
Round 6: (Sc in next sc, dc in next 2 sc, hdc in next sc, slip st in next sc) twice; fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
Tail
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 5 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Rounds 2- 23: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off leaving a long end for sewing. Cut pipe cleaner to fit Tail and insert in Tail. Thread yarn needle with the long end and weave through 5 remaining sc, draw up firmly and fasten securely.
FINISHING
Thread yarn needle with Wing long end. Using photo as a guide, sew Wing to Puppet. Repeat for second Wing. Thread yarn needle with Tail long end. Using photo as a guide, sew Tail to Puppet below Wings. Thread yarn needle with Face long end. Using photo as a guide, sew Face to opposite side of Puppet towards beginning rounds. Thread yarn needle with Ear long end. Using photo as a guide, sew Ear to side of Puppet toward beginning rounds. Repeat for second Ear. Thread yarn needle with a length of C. Using photo as a guide embroider eyes, nose and mouth on Face.
Good Witch Puppet
Finished Size: 6” (15 cm) circumference
GAUGE: 20 hdc = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
GOOD WITCH
Body
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 8 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Round 2: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) around: 12 sc.
Round 3: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc) around: 16 sc.
Round 4: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 20 sc.
Round 5: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around: 24 sc.
Round 6: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc) around: 28 sc.
Rounds 7-13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: (Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog) around: 24 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: (Sc in next 10 sc, sc2tog) around: 22 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc) around: 24 sc.
Round 19: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 11 sc) around: 26 sc.
Round 20: Sc in each sc around.
Round 21: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 12 sc) around: 28 sc.
Round 22: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc) around, changing to B in last sc: 32 sc.
Round 23: With B, sc in front loop only of each sc around.
Round 24: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc) around: 36 sc.
Round 25: Sc in next 7 sc, ch 5, skip next 5 sc (arm opening), sc in next 12 sc, ch 5, skip next 5 sc, sc in each sc around.
Round 26: Sc in each sc and ch around: 36 sc.
Rounds 27 and 28: Sc in each sc around, changing to C in last sc.
Round 29: With C, (2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next 2 sc) around: 48 hdc.
Round 30: Hdc in each hdc around.
Round 31: (2 hdc in next hdc, hdc in next 3 hdc) around: 60 hdc.
Rounds 32-39: Hdc in each hdc around.
Round 40: Hdc in each hdc around to last hdc, sc in last hdc changing to D.
Round 41: With D, *slip st in the back loop only of next st, sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in next st, hdc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st to first slip st, fasten off.
Sleeve (Make 2)
With right side facing, join C with slip st in first ch of any arm opening.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, sc in same ch, sc in next 4 chs, next end of row, next 5 sc and in next end of row, do not join: 12 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: (2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next hdc) around: 18 hdc.
Rounds 4 and 5: Hdc in each hdc around.
Round 6: (Sc in next hdc, sc2tog) around: 12 sc.
Round 7: Sc in each sc around, changing to A in last st.
Round 8: With A, (sc in back loops only of next 4 sc, sc2tog) around: 10 sc.
Rounds 9-11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: Sc2tog around, fasten off leaving a long end for sewing: 5 sc.
Thread yarn needle with long end and weave through 5 remaining sc, draw up firmly and fasten securely.
Repeat for second arm opening.
Hair
With E, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 8 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Round 2: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) around: 12 sc.
Round 3: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc) around: 16 sc.
Round 4: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 20 sc.
Round 5: *Ch 28, work 3 hdc in third ch from hook, (skip next ch, 3 hdc in next ch) twice, hdc in next 21 ch, skip next sc from previous round, slip st in next sc; repeat from * 7 times, (sc in next sc, 2 hdc in next sc, slip st in next sc) twice; fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
Tiara
With F and leaving a long end for sewing, ch 20; join with slip st to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, sc in same ch and in each ch around: 20 sc.
Rounds 2-4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: *Sc in next sc, dc in next sc, hdc in next sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around; fasten off.
FINISHING
Thread yarn needle with Hair long end. Using photo as a guide, sew Hair to Puppet. Thread yarn needle with Tiara long end. Using photo as a guide, sew Tiara to Puppet. Thread yarn needle with a length of G. Using photo as a guide embroider mouth. Thread yarn needle with a length of H. Using photo as a guide embroider eyes.
Mean Witch Puppet
Finished Size: 5” (12.5 cm) circumference.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6].
Stitch marker, yarn needle.
GAUGE: 22 sc = 4” (10 cm); 26 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
Notes
Puppet is worked in continuous rounds without joining, with the right side facing throughout. Place stitch marker to indicate beginning of round and move as rounds are worked.
Special Stitch
Sc2tog = (insert hook in next st, Yo and pull up a loop) twice, Yo and pull through 3 loops on hook. (1 stitch decrease).
MEAN WITCH
Body
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 8 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Round 2: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) around: 12 sc.
Round 3: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc) around: 16 sc.
Round 4: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 20 sc.
Round 5: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around: 24 sc.
Round 6: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc) around: 28 sc.
Rounds 7-13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: (Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog) around: 24 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: (Sc in next 10 sc, sc2tog) around: 22 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around, changing to B in last st.
Round 18: With B, (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc) around: 24 sc.
Round 19: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 11 sc) around: 26 sc.
Round 20: Sc in each sc around.
Round 21: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 12 sc) around: 28 sc.
Round 22: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc) around: 32 sc.
Round 23: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc) around: 36 sc.
Round 24: Sc in next 7 sc, ch 5, skip next 5 sc (arm opening), sc in next 12 sc, ch 5, skip next 5 sc, sc in each sc around.
Round 25: Sc in each sc and ch around: 36 sc.
Rounds 26-29: Sc in each sc around.
Round 30: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc) around: 40 sc.
Rounds 31-42: Sc in each sc around.
Round 43: *Ch 5, hdc in third ch from hook, dc in next 2 ch, skip next 3 sc from previous round, slip st in next sc) around; fasten off.
Arm (Make 2)
With right side facing, join B with slip st in first ch of any arm opening.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, sc in same ch, sc in next 4 chs, next end of row, next 5 sc and in next end of row, do not join: 12 sc.
Rounds 2-6: Sc in each sc around, changing to A in last st of Round 6.
Round 7: With A, sc in back loops only of each sc around.
Round 8: (Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog) around: 10 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: Sc2tog around, fasten off leaving a long end for sewing: 5 sc.
Thread yarn needle with long end and weave through 5 remaining sc, draw up firmly and fasten securely.
Repeat for second arm opening.
Sleeve
With right side facing, join B with slip st in front loop only in first st of Round 10 of Arm.
Round 1 (Right side): *Ch 3, slip st in second ch from hook, sc in next ch, skip next sc on Round 10, slip st in front loop only of next sc; repeat from * around; fasten off.
Repeat for second Arm.
Nose
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 4 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc) around: 6 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around, join with slip st to first sc; fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
Hair Strands (Make 10)
With C, ch 20.
Round 1 (Right side): 3 hdc in third ch from hook, (skip next ch, 3 hdc in next ch) around to last ch, slip st in last ch; fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
Hat
With B, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right side): 6 sc in second ch from hook, do not join.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc) around: 8 sc.
Rounds 5-8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 10 sc.
Round 10: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around: 12 sc.
Rounds 11-14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc) around: 16 sc.
Round 16: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 20 sc.
Round 17: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around, changing to D in last st: 24 sc.
Rounds 18 and 19: With D, sc in each sc around, changing to B in last st of Round 19.
Round 20: With B, sc in each sc around.
Round 21: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc) around: 30 sc.
Round 22: (2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc) around; fasten off leaving a long end for sewing: 36 sc.
FINISHING
Thread yarn needle with Nose long end. Using photo as a guide, sew Nose to Puppet. Thread yarn needle with Hair Strands long end. Using photo as a guide, sew Hair Strands to Puppet. Repeat for remaining Hair Strands. Thread yarn needle with a length of B. Using photo as a guide embroider eyes and eyebrows. Thread yarn needle with a length of E. Using photo as a guide embroider mouth. Thread yarn needle with a length of C. Using photo as a guide embroider square on Hat. Thread yarn needle with Hat long end. Using photo as a guide, sew Hat to Puppet.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Main Color (MC) Vapor Gray (32001) 1 ball or 172 yds/157 m
Contrast A Gray Orchid (32010) 1 ball or 13 yds/12 m
Contrast B Velveteal (32005) 1 ball or 13 yds/12 m
Contrast C Blackbird (32002) 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of white worsted weight yarn for embroidery
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
• To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color, yoh with new color and proceed.
• Carry color not in use along top of last row worked and work new sts around carried color, unless otherwise stated.
PIGEON
BODY
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
9th and 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. PM in last st for Leg placement. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. PM in last st for Leg placement. 1 sc in each of last 36 sc. Join.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
15th to 17th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 30 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sc2tog. * PM for Tail placement. Sc2tog. Rep from * to * once. Join. 56 sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 30 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 50 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 39 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. Join. 48 sc.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 27 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 3 times. Join. 45 sc.
24th to 26th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
28th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. PM in last st for Wing placement. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. PM in last st for Wing placement. 1 sc in each of last 14 sc. Join.
29th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. Join. 32 sc.
Stuff Body firmly. Cont stuffing as rem rnds are worked.
30th and 31st rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
32nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 27 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Join. 30 sc.
33rd and 34th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Break MC. Change to A.
35th to 37th rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
38th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. Change to B, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Change to A, 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. Join.
39th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. Change to B, 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. Change to A, 1 sc in each of last 7 sc. Join.
40th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. Change to B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Change to A, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Join. Break A. Change to B. 27 sc.
41st rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
42nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. Rejoin MC, 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Change to B, 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. Join.
43rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. Change to MC, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Change to B. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join.
44th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Change to MC, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) twice. Change to B, Sc2tog. Join. Break B. Cont with MC. 24 sc.
45th rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
46th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
47th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
48th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving long yarn end. Using long yarn end, weave through top of final sts and pull tightly to close.
TAIL
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 6 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. Join. 8 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join and change to MC. 18 sc.
9th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Change to C.
10th rnd: With C, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Break C. Change to MC.
11th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 21 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
14th and 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
17th and 18th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
19th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join. 36 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 18 sc. PM in last st for Tail placement. 1 sc in each of last 18 sc. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long yarn end. Stuff Tail firmly. Align marker on Tail with designated marker on Body. Keeping markers aligned and using long yarn end, sew last rnd of Tail evenly around last rnd to Body, working over approx 10 rnds below marker.
LEFT WING
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 8 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 10 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. Break MC. Change to B. 15 sc.
5th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 19 sc. Break B. Join A.
7th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. Rejoin MC. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Join.
9th rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Change to A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Break A. Change to MC. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 12 sc. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join. 21 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. 21 sc. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
13th rnd: Rep 11th rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 14 sc. Join. 20 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Change to C. Do not carry or break MC.
18th rnd: With C, rep 16th rnd. Change to MC. Do not carry or break C.
19th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Break MC. Change to C.
21st rnd: With C, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join.
Stuff Left Wing firmly. Cont stuffing as rem rnds are worked.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 10 sc.

RIGHT WING
Work from ** to ** as given for Left Wing.
8th rnd: Pick up MC. With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. Change to A. With A, 1 sc in each of last 9 sc. Change to MC. Join.
9th rnd: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 sc. Change to A, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Break A. Change to MC. With MC, 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 14 sc. Join. 21 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join. 21 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
13th rnd: Rep 11th rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join. 20 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Change to C. Do not carry or break MC.
18th rnd: With C, rep 16th rnd. Change to MC. Do not carry or break C.
19th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Break MC. Change to C.
21st rnd: With C, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join.
Stuff Right Wing firmly. Cont stuffing as rem rnds are worked.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 10 sc.
24th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 8 sc.
25th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. Join. 4 sc
Fasten off, leaving long yarn end. Using long yarn end, weave through final sts and pull tight to close. Weave in ends.
Wing Assembly
With length of MC, whipstitch first rnd of each Wing at designated markers of 28th rnd of Body. Wings should be oriented so rnd join is facing Body, and A sts in 9th, 10th and 11th rnds of Wings are at top, as shown in photo.
THIGHS (make 2 alike)
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 21 sc.
9th and 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off at end of 10th rnd, leaving long yarn end.
LEGS (make 2 alike)
With C, ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 6 sc.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. (Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times – Toes made. 1 sc in last sc. Join.
Fasten off, leaving long yarn end.
FEET (make 2 alike)
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd row: (Ch 5. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Sl st in next sc) 3 times. Fasten off, leave rem sts unworked.
Leg Assembly
Align Feet with last rnd of Legs, with WS tog. Using long yarn end, sew Feet to last rnd of Legs, keeping Toes aligned.
Stuff Leg firmly.
With length of C, sew 1st rnd of Legs evenly around 1st rnd of Thighs.
Stuff Thigh firmly.
Align top of each Thigh, so Toes point upwards, with designated markers in 11th rnd of Body. Using long yarn end sew last rnd of Thighs evenly around last rnd to Body, working over approx 6 rnds below markers.
BEAK
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off at end of 3rd rnd, leaving long yarn end.
Stuff Beak firmly.
Using long yarn end, sew Beak evenly around final sts of Body, working over 40th to 42nd rnds on side opposite to Tail, as shown in photo.
With small amount of white worsted weight yarn, satin stitch over bridge of Beak, as shown.
EYES (make 2 alike)
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join and fasten off, leaving long yarn end.
With small amount of white worsted weight yarn, satin stitch triangle highlights onto eyes, as shown.
Using long yarn end and working evenly around tops of sts, sew Eyes to Body over 41st to 43rd rnds, equally spaced on either side of Beak, as shown.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Yarn: 1 ball 9522 Leaf for Hat; 1 ball each 9779 Berry A and 9522 Leaf B for Bag.
RED HEART® Heart & Sole® with Aloe: 1 ball 3960 Spring Stripe.
Yarn needle, sewing needle and thread; three ½” flower shaped buttons for Hat; 2 stitch markers, one shank button for Bag.
Yarn needle, sewing needle and thread, three ½” flower shaped buttons in assorted colors.
abbreviations: V-st = (dc, ch 1, dc) in same space.
sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Hat circumference: 13”. Bag: 4½” wide x 4” high. Vest Chest Measurement: 11½”. Vest Length: 6”.
gauge: With larger hook and Soft Yarn: 6 V-sts = 4”; 8 rounds = 4” for Hat. 14 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in pattern for Bag. With smaller hook and Heart and Sole Yarn 17 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hooks to obtain the gauges.
instructions:
LACY LEAf HAT
Special Abbreviation
V-st = (dc, ch 1, dc) in same space.
Ch 3; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1 throughout), [dc in ring, ch 1] 7 times; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-4 – 8 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st in next ch-1 space, ch 1, (sc, ch 3, sc) in same space and in each ch-1 space around; join with a slip st in first sc – 8 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in next ch-3 space, ch 4, V-st in same space, [(dc, ch 1, V-st) in next ch-3 space] 7 times; join in 3rd ch of ch-4 – 16 ch-1 spaces.
Round 4: Repeat Round 2 – 16 ch-3 spaces.
Round 5: Slip st in next ch-3 space, ch 4, dc in same space, [V-st in next ch-3 space] 15 times; join in 3rd ch of ch-4 – 16 V-sts.
Round 6: Repeat Round 2.
Round 7: Slip st in next ch-3 space, ch 1, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-3 space and in each ch-3 space around; join.
Round 8: Slip st in next ch-3 space, ch 1, 2 sc in same space and in each ch-3 space around; join – 32 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Brim-Round 10: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, hdc in next sc, 2 hdc in next sc, dc in next sc, 2 dc in next 2 sc, dcc in next sc, 2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; TURN leaving remaining sts unworked.
Brim Edging
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first st, sc in next st, 2 sc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, 2 dc in next 2 sts, dc in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With sewing needle and thread, sew buttons to front of brim following photo as guide. Weave in ends.
VERY BERRY BAG
Row 1 (Right Side): With A, ch 24; sc in 2nd ch from hook, [hdc in next ch, sc in next ch] 11 times; turn – 23 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc throughout), working in front loops only, hdc in first st, [sc in next st, hdc in next st] 11 times; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first st, [hdc in next st, sc in next st] 11 times; turn.
Rows 4-9: Repeat Rows 2 and 3 three more times. Fasten off after Row 9.
Border
Round 1: With right side facing, join B with sc in first st on last row of bag; work 2 more sc in same st, sc in next 11 sts, mark last st made, sc in next 10 sts, 3 sc in last st; working over post of st at row ends, work 9 sc to next corner; working in remaining loops of beginning ch, 3 sc in first st, sc in next 11 sts, mark last st made, sc in next 10 sts, 3 sc in last st; working over post of st at row ends, work 9 sc to next corner; join in first sc. Fasten off.
Assembly
Row 1: With wrong sides together, fold bag in half at markers, join A with a slip st in first marked st at fold; working through both thicknesses at same time, [ch 1, slip st in next sc] 12 times; for strap [ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook] 16 times; taking care not to twist strap, working in st on opposite side of bag border and through both thicknesses at the same time, slip st in center sc of 3-sc group, [ch 1, slip st in next sc] to 2nd marker. Fasten off. Remove stitch markers.
Flap
Row 1 (Right Side): Join B with a slip st in center of side seam behind strap; working in back loops only in sc across top of bag, sc in next 2 sc, hdc in next 2 sc, dc in next sc, 3 dc in next sc, dc in next sc, hdc in next 2 sc, sc in next 2 sc, slip st in center of second side seam; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in front loops only, sc in first 2 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 3 sts, 3 dc in next st, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in last 2 sts, slip st in center of side seam; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in both loops, sc in first 2 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, dc in next 4 sts, for buttonhole (dc, ch 1, dc) in next st, dc in next 4 sts, hdc in next 2 sts, sc in next 2 sts, slip st in center of side seam. Fasten off.
Flap Trim
Row 1: With right side facing, join A with a slip st in center of side seam, [ch 1, slip st in next st] 9 times, slip st in ch-1 space, [ch 1, slip st in next st] 9 times, ch 1, slip st in center of side seam. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With sewing needle and matching thread, sew button to front of bag lined up with buttonhole. Weave in ends.
SPRING STRIPES VEST
Special Abbreviations
V-st = (dc, ch 3, dc) in same st or space.
sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Row 1 (Right Side): Beginning at lower edge, ch 49; sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 48 sc.
Rows 2-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc to last 2 sc; sc2tog; turn – 46 sc.
Rows 8 and 9: Repeat Row 2.
Row 10: Repeat Row 7 – 44 sc.
Rows 11-14: Repeat Row 2.
Divide for Left front
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sc; TURN leaving remaining sts unworked.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across; turn – 9 sc.
Rows 4-6: Repeat Row 2.
Rows 7-14: Repeat Rows 3-6 twice more – 7 sc. Fasten off.
Back
Row 1: With right side facing, skip next 2 sc of last long row, join yarn with sc in next sc, sc in next 19 sc; TURN – 20 sc.
Rows 2-14: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Right front
Row 1: With right side facing, skip next 2 sc of last long row, join yarn with sc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc; turn – 10 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, sc2tog; turn – 9 sc.
Rows 4-6: Repeat Row 2.
Rows 7-14: Repeat Rows 3-6 twice more – 7 sc. Fasten off.
Lower Border
Row 1: With right side facing, working in remaining loops of beginning ch, join yarn with sc in first st, * V-st in next st, skip next st, sc in next st **, skip next st; repeat from * across, end at **; turn – 12 V-sts.
Row 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), dc in first sc, [sc in ch-3 space of next V-st, V-st in next sc] 12 times; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, slip st in ch-3 space of first V-st, ch 1, sc in same space, [V-st in next sc, sc in ch-3 space of next V-st] 12 times; do not turn but pivot to work Front Edging.
Front Edging and Button Loops
With right side still facing, ch 1, working over post of st at row ends, sc in first row, 2 sc in next row, sc in next row; for button loops [(sc, ch 3, sc) in next row, sc in next 2 rows] 3 times; sc in each row to back neck, sc in each st across back, working in row ends of opposite side, sc in each row to last 2 rows on Lower Border, 2 sc in next row, sc in last row. Fasten off.
Armhole Edging
Round 1: With right side facing, join yarn with sc in first skipped sc at underarm, sc in next sc, working over post of st at row ends, sc in each row around armhole opening; join with a slip st in first sc – 30 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, skip next 2 sc, V-st in next sc, skip next 2 sc, [sc in next sc, skip next 2 sc, V-st in next sc, skip next 2 sc] 4 times; join in first sc.
Round 3: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), dc in same sc, sc in ch-3 space of next V-st, [V-st in next sc, sc in ch-3 space of next V-st] 4 times; join in 3rd ch of ch-6. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With sewing needle and matching thread, attach buttons to left front aligned with button loops. Weave in ends.
RED HEART® “Soft Yarn”, Art. E728 available in solid color 5 oz (140 g), 256 yd (234 m) and print 4 oz (113 g), 204 yd (187 m) balls.
RED HEART® “Heart & Sole® with Aloe”, Art. E745 available in solid color and multi color 1.76 oz (50 g), 213 yd (195 m) balls.
ABBREVIATIONS: A, B = color A, B; ch = chain; dc = double crochet; hdc = half double crochet; mm = millimeters; sc = single crochet; st(s) = stitch (es); tog = together; * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated; [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.

abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
First Half
**With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc 
in next sc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 
2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 
4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first s c. 2 0 sts. 
Fasten off.**
Second Half
Work from ** to ** as given for 
First Half.
Join Halves: Holding First and 
Second Half together, join A with  
sl st to any sc of 5th rnd. Ch 1. 
Working in back loops only of both

12 sc. Stuff Macaron lightly. 1 sc in

st to first sc. Fasten off.

Cat Main Color (MC) Light Gray (0341) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates™ Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.

abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] tall by 5" [12.5 cm] in diameter.
instructions:
WEEK 1 – BODY / HEAD
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Snout
With A, make magic loop. Video here.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in magic loop. Join 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in first sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 2 dc in next sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 2 hdc in next sc. Ch 2, join with sl st to first dc. Fasten off, leaving long tail.

WEEK 1 – BODY / HEAD (worked in one piece)
With MC, make magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in magic loop. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th to 13th rnds: As 4th rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sts.
15th rnd: As 4th rnd.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sts.
17th rnd: As 4th rnd.
18th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 28 sts.
19th rnd: As 4th rnd.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
21st rnd: As 4th rnd.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
23rd rnd: As 4th rnd.
24th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 40 sts.
25th to 32nd rnds: As 4th rnd.
33rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 35 sts.
34th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
35th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 25 sts.
Note from designer: Now is a good time to start stuffing Body, adding safety eyes, and stitching on Snout. Place safety eyes and Snout as shown in photo.
36th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
37th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sts.
38th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 10 sts.
39th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. 5 sts. Fasten off. Finish stuffing. Thread yarn through front loops of rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.

Cat Version only: With MC embroider whiskers using straight stitch
STRAIGHT STITCH
Week 1 Complete.

WEEK 2 – EARS, ARMS, FEET, TAIL
Note from designer: At this stage you can gradually start adding polyfill to the appendages while you work.
Cat Ears (make 2)
With MC, make magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in magic loop. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off at end of last rnd. Do not stuff. Stitch onto top sides of head.

Dog Ears (make 2)
With MC, make magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in magic loop. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
9th and 10th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
12th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Join. 8 sts.
18th rnds: As 3rd rnd. Fasten off at end of last rnd. Do not stuff. Stitch onto top sides of head.

Arms (make 2)
With A, make magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 12 sc in magic loop. Join. 12 sc.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sts.
7th and 8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join MC with sl st to first sc. Break A.
9th to 18th rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off and weave in ends.

Feet (make 2)
With A, make magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 12 sc in magic loop. Join. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 24 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join MC with sl st to first st. Break A. 12 sts.
8th to 11th rnds: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off.

Tail
With MC, make magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in magic loop. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sc.
4th to 14th rnds: As 2nd rnd. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

Week 2 Complete.

WEEK 3 – ASSEMBLY & ACCESSORIES
Assembly
• Stitch on ears on either side of top of head. Cat ears should stick up and dog ears should droop down.
• Finish stuffing Arms and stitch to Body as shown in photo, placed at approx 23rd rnd of Body/Head and spaced 5 sts apart.
• Finish stuffing Tail and stitch onto back bottom of toy as shown in photo.
• Finish Stuffing the feet and stitch onto either side of bottom of body about 4 rows up from bottom, leaving about 12 stitches in between them in the front of the body. They should stick outward for support so your cat and dog can sit upright.

Collar
With preferred color, ch 30 loosely.
1st row: 1 hdc in 5th ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.
First 4 ch skipped at beg of row will form loop for button closure. Attach button to opposite end of Collar.
Optional: A Round Metal Rim Key Tag makes the perfect tag that you can customize and write a name for your Toy. Attach key tag to the middle of the collar.

Week 3 Complete.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi Prints™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 242 yds/221 m) Snail (9652) 1 ball makes 2 Snails

abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 6½" [16.5 cm] from top of head to tip of tail.
instructions:
Notes: 
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work.
• Do not join at end of rnd. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
Boy Version 1:  Green is Color 1, Yellow is Color 2, Purple is Color 3.
Girl Version 2:  Purple is Color 1, Yellow is Color 2, Multi is Color 3.

BOY VERSION 1 
Outer Eye (Make 2).
With Color 3, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.

Head and Body
With Color 1, ch 2 (top of head).
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.

2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 
12 sc.
3rd rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
7th to 12th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. 
Place Outer Eye against head between 6th and 8th rnds, 3 sc apart. Following manufacturer’s instructions, attach safety eye through center of outer eye and through head. Snap in place inside head.
13th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 20 sts.
14th rnd: *1 sc in each st around. 
Stuff head.
15th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 15 sts.
16th to 44th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
Stuff Head lightly as you go.
45th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
46th to 49th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
50th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 10 sts.
51st to 57th rnds: 1 sc in each st around. 
Finish stuffing. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. 
Fasten securely. 
Cut long piece of pink from the multi yarn. Using Satin st, embroider Nose. Using Back st, embroider Smile. For Diagrams see page 3.

Antenna (make 2). 
With Color 1, ch 6. 
1st row:  Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew in place.

Shell
With Color 2, ch 2.
1st row: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. 
Turn. 9 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 12 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
7th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 16 sc.
8th to 10th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. (Sc2tog) 4 times. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Turn. 16 sc.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
13th to 48th rows:  As 11th and 12th rows 18 times more, stuffing lightly as you go. Fasten off. 
Beg with 1st row, roll up Shell tightly and sew tog as you roll. 
Sew Shell to Body with open end of Shell covering 26th to 29th rnds of Body. 

Hat 
With Color 3, ch 2 (top of hat).
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 
12 sc.
3rd rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th to 8th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to front loop of first sc.
9th rnd:  Ch 2 ( does not count as st). Working in front loops only, 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 2 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew Hat in place.

Bow Tie
With Color 3, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 
4 sc.
2nd to 10th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Do not fasten off at end of last row. 
Edging: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work in sc around Tie, having 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Wrap length of color 3 tightly around center of Tie 8 times to shape in a Bow and sew in place.

GIRL VERSION 2
Head and Body
With Color 1 work as given for Boy Version 1. 
Antenna
With Color 1 work as given for Boy Version 1.
Shell
With Color 3 work as given for Boy Version 1.
Eyes
With Color 2 work as given for Boy Version 1.
Nose and Mouth
Work as given for Boy Version 1.
Hat
With Color 2, ch 4.
1st rnd: 11 dc in 4th ch from hook. 
Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. 2 sc in next dc. *1 sc in each of next 3 dc. 2 sc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
4th rnd:  Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch 1). 1 dc in same sp as sl st. (1 dc. Ch 1. 1 dc) in each sc around. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 4. 
Fasten off, leaving long end. Sew Hat in place.

Flower
With Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 
12 sc.
3rd rnd:  *Working in front loops only, (Sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. 
6 petals.
4th rnd: Working in back loops of 2nd rnd, sl st in first sc. *(Ch 1. 2 dc. Ch 1) in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew Flower in place.

instructions:
Note: Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd.

CHICKEN
Body
With A, ch 2. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM on first st. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
7th and 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
9th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
10th and 11th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sc.

13th and 14th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
15th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
16th and 17th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Stuff Body firmly and attach safety eyes.
18th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
19th and 20th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
21st rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw end through rem sts.

Comb
With B, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. *Sl st in next ch. Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Sl st in same ch at last sl st. Rep from * twice more.
Fasten off. Sew Comb to top of head.

Wings and Tail (make 3 alike)
With A, ch 2.

3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in next sc. *(1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) all in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * once more. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) all in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc.

Legs (make 2)
With C, ch 7.

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6. oz;288 m/315 yds)
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Finished Measurements: Mama measures approximately 10"/25.5cm tall, including ears; Joey measures approximately 5"/12.5cm tall, including ears. Note: The ears add about 1/2"/1.5cm to height.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
NOTES 1. Pieces are worked in continuous rounds, with RS facing throughout. Do not turn and do not join at the end of rounds. Place a marker to indicate the end of the first round and move the marker up as work progresses. 2. Gauge is not critical. Work tightly, so stuffing will not show through stitches. 3. To reduce finishing time, weave in ends as work progresses.
MAMA
Head
Beginning at top of head, with larger hook, ch 2.
Round 1 (RS): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join and do not turn—6 sc. Place a marker to indicate the end of the round and move the marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Rounds 6–12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Neck
Rounds 16–20: Sc in each sc around.
Body
Round 21: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Rounds 22–24: Sc in each sc around.
Round 25: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Rounds 26–28: Sc in each sc around.
Round 29: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 30: Sc in each sc around.
Round 31: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 32: Sc in each sc around.
Round 33: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 10 times, sc in next 2 sc—52 sc.
Rounds 34 and 35: Sc in each sc around.
Round 36: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 10 times, sc in next 2 sc—62 sc.
Rounds 37 and 38: Sc in each sc around.
Round 39: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 10 times, sc in next 2 sc—72 sc.
Rounds 40 and 41: Sc in each sc around.
Round 42: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 12 times—60 sc.
Round 43: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 12 times—48 sc.
Stuff head and body. Continue to stuff piece as work progresses.
Round 44: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 12 times—36 sc.
Round 45: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 12 times—24 sc.
Round 46: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 8 times—16 sc.
Round 47: [Sc2tog] 8 times—8 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With yarn needle, weave tail through stitches of last round. Pull gently, but firmly, to close opening. Tie securely and weave in end.

MUZZLE
Beginning at center front of muzzle, with larger hook, ch 2.
Round 1 (RS): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join and do not turn—6 sc. Place a marker to indicate the end of the round and move the marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 6 and 7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff muzzle and sew to lower, center front of head.

EARS (make 2)
With larger hook, ch 11.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch counts as first dc), hdc in next 3 ch, sc in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; rotate piece to work across opposite side of foundation ch (do not turn piece over, keep same side facing you), sc in next 3 ch, hdc in next 3 ch, dc in last 2 ch, turn—19 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first 9 sts, 3 sc in next st (at tip), sc in last 9 sts—21 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew one ear to each side of head, toward the back.

ARMS (make 2)
Beginning at top of arm, with larger hook, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join and do not turn—7 sc. Place a marker to indicate the end of the round and move the marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—14 sc.
Rounds 3–8: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 9 and 10: Sl st in next 4 sc, hdc in next 6 sc, sl st in next 4 sts.
Round 11: Sc in next 4 sl sts, hdc in next 6 hdc, sc in next 4 sl sts.
Round 12: Sc in next 3 sc, [sc2tog] 4 times, sc in next 3 sc—10 sc.
Round 13: Sc in each sc around.
Stuff piece. Continue to stuff piece as work progresses.
Round 14: Sc in first 3 sc, [sc2tog] 2 times, sc in last 3 sc—8 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: Sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in last sc—10 sc.
Rounds 17 and 18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: [Sc2tog] 5 times—5 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With yarn needle, weave tail through stitches of last round. Pull gently, but firmly, to close opening. Tie securely. Using remaining long tail, sew one arm to each side of body, below neck.

LEGS (make 2)
Beginning at top of leg, with larger hook, ch 2.
Round 1 (RS): Work 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join and do not turn—8 sc. Place a marker to indicate the end of the round and move the marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—16 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times—24 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times—32 sc.
Rounds 6–10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 8 times—24 sc.
Round 12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 8 times—16 sc.
Rounds 14 and 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 4 times—12 sc.
Rounds 17 and 18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 20–23: Sc in each sc around.
Stuff piece lightly. Continue to stuff piece as work progresses.
Round 24: [Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times—20 sc.
Rounds 25–30: Sc in each sc around.
Round 31: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 5 times—15 sc.
Round 32: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 5 times—10 sc.
Round 33: [Sc2tog] 5 times—5 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a very long tail. With yarn needle, weave tail through stitches of last round. Pull gently, but firmly, to close opening. Tie securely, do not cut tail, use tail to shape and sew one leg to each side of body, as follows: Flatten top of leg (widest end) slightly and pin it to the side of the body, below the arm. Fold the legs slightly so the foot is positioned to the floor and tack the foot to the leg. Sew the leg to the body. With yarn needle and another length of yarn, sew 2 lines into each foot to form toes. Weave in ends.

TAIL
Beginning at tip of tail, with larger hook, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place a marker to indicate the end of the round and move the marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times—8 sc.
Rounds 8–10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times—10 sc.
Rounds 12–15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times—12 sc.
Rounds 17 and 18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times—14 sc.
Stuff piece. Continue to stuff piece as work progresses.
Rounds 20 and 21: Sc in each sc around.
Round 22: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times—16 sc.
Round 23: Sc in each sc around.
Round 24: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next sc—19 sc.
Rounds 25 and 26: Sc in each sc around.
Round 27: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next sc—22 sc.
Round 28: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. With yarn needle, sew tail to bottom back, centered between legs. Weave in end.

POUCH
Beginning at lower edge, with larger hook, ch 29.
Row 1: Working in back bars only, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—28 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—30 sc.
Rows 3–19: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a very long tail for sewing. With yarn needle, sew sides and bottom of pouch to front of body between legs, gather bottom of pouch to fit.

FINISHING (Mama)
With yarn needle and brown yarn, using photograph as a guide, embroider straight st eyes on face about 1/2"/1.5cm tall and about 3/4"/2cm apart, above muzzle. Embroider straight st nostrils about 1/4"/0.5cm apart and about 1"/2.5cm from end of muzzle. Embroider straight st mouth at end of muzzle.

JOEY
Head
Beginning at top of head, with smaller hook, ch 2.
Round 1 (RS): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join and do not turn—6 sc. Place a marker to indicate the end of the round and move the marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—16 sc.
Rounds 4–6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 4 times—12 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 4 times—8 sc.
Neck
Rounds 9–10: Sc in each sc around. Stuff head and neck. Do not continue to stuff.

Body
Round 11: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—12 sc.
Round 12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—16 sc.
Round 14: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—20 sc.
Rounds 15 and 16: Sc in each sc around.
Round 17: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—24 sc.
Rounds 18–27: Sc in each sc around. Place two jingle bells inside Easter egg. Insert egg into body.
Round 28: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 29: [Sc2tog] 9 times—9 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With yarn needle, weave tail through stitches of last round. Pull gently, but firmly, to close opening. Tie securely, and weave in end.

MUZZLE
Beginning at center front of muzzle, with smaller hook, ch 2.
Round 1 (RS): Work 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join and do not turn—4 sc. Place a marker to indicate the end of the round and move the marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—8 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff muzzle and sew to lower front of head.

EAR (make 2)
With smaller hook, ch 5.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch, 3 sc in last ch; rotate piece to work across opposite side of foundation ch (do not turn piece over, keep same side facing you), sc in next ch, hdc in last 2 ch—9 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew one ear to each side of head, toward the back.

ARMS (make 2)
Beginning at top of arm, with smaller hook, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join and do not turn—6 sc. Place a marker to indicate the end of the round and move the marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times—8 sc.
Rounds 6–8: Sc in each sc around.
Stuff piece lightly.
Round 9: [Sc2tog] 4 times—4 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With yarn needle and long tail, sew one arm to each side of body, below neck.

LEGS (make 2)
Beginning at top of leg, with smaller hook, ch 2.
Round 1 (RS): Work 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join and do not turn—8 sc. Place a marker to indicate the end of the round and move the marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—16 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—20 sc.
Stuff piece lightly. Continue to stuff piece as work progresses.
Rounds 4–6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times, sc in next 2 sc—14 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 4 times, sc in next 2 sc—10 sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 2 times—8 sc.
Rounds 10 and 11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times, sc in next 2 sc—10 sc.
Rounds 13 and 14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: [Sc2tog] 5 times—5 sc.
Round 16: [Sc2tog] 2 times, sc in next sc—3 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a very long tail. With yarn needle, weave tail through stitches of last round. Pull gently, but firmly, to close opening. Tie securely, do not cut tail, use tail to shape and sew one leg to each side of body, as follows: Flatten top of leg (widest end) slightly and pin it to the side of the body, below the arm. Fold the legs slightly so the foot is positioned to the floor and tack the foot to the leg. Sew the leg to the body. With yarn needle and another length of yarn, sew 2 lines into each foot to form toes. Weave in ends.
