materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi Textures™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 242 yds/221 m) Hedgehog (9375) 1 ball makes 2
Sizes U.S. B/1 crochet hook for smooth yarn
U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook for fur yarn or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook and smooth yarn.
instructions:
Version 1 and 2: Brown fur is Color 1. Beige is Color 2. Red is Color 3. Purple is Color 4. Note: Do not join at end of rnd. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
HEDGEHOG (make 2 alike)
Head
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
5th rnd: *1 sc in next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
6th to 12th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Inset eyes between rnds 6 and 7, with 3 sc between eyes.
13th rnd: *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts.

14th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Stuff head.
Snout
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 9 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 15 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Stuff Snout and sew in place.
With Color 1, using French Knot, embroider Nose. Using Straight st, embroider mouth as shown in picture. See Diagrams on page 3.

Front of Body
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 6.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 3 ch. 3 sc in last sc. Do not turn. Work in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in last ch. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. 18 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc. Fasten off.
Back of Body
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 6.
1st to 4th rnds: As 1st to 4th rnds of Front of Body. 30 sc.
5th to 7th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leave a long end for sewing. Sew front of Body to back of Body, easing to fit and stuff before closing.
Back of Head
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 2.
1st to 3rd rnd: As 1st to 3rd rnds of Head. 18 sc.
4th to 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Sew over back of Head and sew Head to top of Body.
Ear (make 2) 
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 2.
1st row: 6 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. Fasten off and sew in place.
Leg  (make 4) 
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd to 6th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Stuff Legs lightly and sew in place.

Clothes
Note: Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc. 
Cape
With smaller hook and Color 4, ch 19.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 18 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. 2 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 36 dc. 
3rd to 6th rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn. 
Edging: Ch 1. Work in sc around Cape, having 3 sc in corners. 
Ties
With smaller hook and Color 4, ch 28. 
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc across neck edge of Cape. Ch 28. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.

Stocking Cap
Note: Do not break color not in use. Carry color not in use up side of work. 
With smaller hook and Color 4, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd to 4th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Change to Color 3 at end of 4th rnd. Do not break Color 4.
5th to 6th rnds:  With Color 3, 1 sc in each sc around. Change to Color 4 at end of 6th rnd.
7th rnd: With Color 4, 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 8 sc.
9th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 10 sc. Change to Color 3.
11th rnd: With Color 3, 1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc. Change to color 4.
13th rnd: With Color 4, 1 sc in each sc around.
14th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 
15th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
16th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc. Change to Color 3.
17th rnd: With Color 3, 1 sc in each sc around.
18th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 21 sc. Change to Color 4.
19th rnd: With Color 4, 1 sc in each sc around.
20th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
21st rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
22nd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. Change to Color 3.
23rd rnd:  *With Color 3, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
24th to 27th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Sew Cap in place.
Tassel 
Hanger:  With smaller hook and Color 3, ch 6. 
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Attach to tip of hat. 
Tassels:  Wrap Color 3 around a 7” [18 cm] piece of cardboard 10 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. Wrap yarn 6 times around tassel ½” [1 cm] from tied end, and fasten securely. Trim tassel to desired length. Attach to hanger.

Scarf
With smaller hook and Color 3, ch 50.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 49 hdc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.

Hat
With smaller hook and Color 3, ch 10. 
Ribbing: 1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 9 sc.
2nd to 27th rows: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Do not fasten off. 
Top of Hat:  1st row:  Ch 1. Work 27 sc spaced evenly across side edge of Ribbing. Turn. 27 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * to end  of row. Turn. 20sts.
4th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 16 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 12 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * to end of row. 8 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. 
Thread yarn through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. Sew back seam.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Pixie Pink (12008) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Contrast B Bright Lime (12041) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Contrast C Busy Blue (12005) 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast D Vintage White (10006) 1 ball or 55 yds/50 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
1/4" [6 mm] pair of safety eyes for each Turtle
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Note: Rnds are worked continuously without joining unless otherwise instructed. Cont working in spiral, moving marker onto first st of each rnd for easier counting.
TURTLE
(make 1 each with A, B and C as Color 1).
Shell
See diagram on page 2.
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
4th and 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
6th rnd: Working in front loops only, *1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. (1 hdc. 1 sc) in last sc. Join with sl st to first hdc.
7th rnd: Join Color 2 with sl st to rem loop of first sc of 5th rnd. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 16 sts.
9th rnd: (Sc2tog) 8 times.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Stuff Shell.
Secure yarn tail through rem sts and pull closed.
With D, whip stitch around 7th rnd of shell and embroider spots on top of Shell as shown in photo.
Flippers (make 4)
With D, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of last 3 ch. Fasten off.
Sew Flippers to underside of Shell at color change rnd as shown in photo.
Head
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Attach pair of safety eyes as shown in photo.
5th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Stuff Head.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Sew Head to underside of Shell at color change rnd. Secure Head under rnd of hdc as well.
Attach key ring as shown in photo.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Misty Green (10878) or Moss (10803) 5 balls or 957 yds/875 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® Split-Lock Stitch Count Markers.
Approx 3 yds/2.5 m of pink worsted weight yarn for cheeks like Bernat® Super Value™ Baby Pink (07438).
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2togtbl = Working into back loops only, draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: Approx 24" [61cm] diameter x 10" [25.5 cm] tall (measured to tip of leaves).
instructions:
SUCCULENT
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
BODY
Beg at bottom of Body, ch 2.
See diagrams on page 5.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join, cont working in spiral as follows. PM (first marker) for beg of rnd. Move marker up on rnds as work progresses.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 36 sc.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
8th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. 48 sc.
9th to 13th rnds: Cont in this manner, inc 6 sc evenly around next 5 rnds (as established). 78 sc. PM (2nd marker) at end of last rnd.
14th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd until work from 2nd marker measures 4" [10 cm].
Top of Body
1st rnd: *Sc2togtbl. 1 scbl in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 72 sts.
2nd rnd: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. 66 sts.
3rd rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * around. 60 sts.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. 54 sts.
5th rnd: *Sc2togtbl. 1 scbl in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
6th rnd: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. 42 sts.
7th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
8th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. 30 sts.
9th rnd: *Sc2togtbl. 1 scbl in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
10th rnd: Working in both loops, 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. 18 sts.
11th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
Following manufacturer’s instructions, attach safety eyes to side of Body 1½" [4 cm] apart, 5 rounds down from first rnd at Top of Body (as shown).
Stuff Body firmly.
12th rnd: *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten off. Weaving in end.
LEAF (make 20)
Ch 26. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, being careful not to twist chain. PM for beg of rnd. Move marker up on rnds as work progresses. See diagrams on page 5.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each ch around. Do not join. 26 sc.
Cont working in a spiral as follows:
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
3rd rnd: 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in last sc. 30 sc.
4th to 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
9th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 26 sc.
10th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 22 sc.
11th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 18 sc.
12th to 14th rnds: Cont in this manner, dec 4 sc each rnd for next 3 rnds (as established). 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Draw end tightly through rem 6 sts at tip and fasten off. Weave in end.
ASSEMBLY
Outer 6-Leaf Ring
Stuff 6 Leaves loosely. Fold foundation chains of 6 leaves in half, having beg of row at join of foundation ch of each Leaf.
Joining 6 Leaves in rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to rem loop foundation ch at join of first Leaf. Ch 1. * Working through both thicknesses, work 13 sc in rem loops of foundation ch across bottom edge to “seam" Leaf closed. Rep from * across bottom edge of rem 5 Leaves. Join in rnd with sl st to first sc, being careful not to twist Leaves.
2nd rnd: Join Outer 6-Leaf ring to Body: Align Outer 6-Leaf Ring sts and rem front loops of 1st rnd of top of last round of Body, aligning space between Leaves over eyes (as shown in photo). Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Inner 6-Leaf Ring
Stuff 6 Leaves loosely. Fold foundation chains of 6 Leaves in half, having beg of row at join of foundation ch of each Leaf.
Joining 6 Leaves in rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to rem loop foundation ch at join of first Leaf. Ch 1. *Work through both thicknesses of rem loops of foundation ch as follows: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog (Total 9 sts). Rep from * across bottom edge of rem 5 Leaves. Join in rnd with sl st to first st, being careful not to twist Leaves.
2nd rnd: Join Inner 6-Leaf Ring to Body: Align Inner 6-Leaf Ring sts and rem front loops of 4th rnd of Top of Body so that Leaves are offset between Leaves of Outer Ring. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
5-Leaf Ring
Stuff 5 Leaves loosely. Fold foundation chains of 5 Leaves in half, having beg of row at join of foundation ch of each Leaf.
Joining 5 Leaves in rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st to rem loop foundation ch at join of first Leaf. Ch 1. * Working through both thicknesses of rem loops of foundation ch as follows: [(Sc2tog) 3 times. Sc3tog. (Sc2tog) twice] (Total 6 sts). Rep from * across bottom edge of rem 4 Leaves. Join in rnd with sl st to first sc, being careful not to twist Leaves.
Join 5-Leaf Ring to Body: Align 5-Leaf Ring sts and rem front loops of 8th rnd of Top of Body so that Leaves are offset between Leaves of Inner Ring. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Top 3-Leaves
Joining 3 Leaves in rnd: Work from ** to ** as for 1st rnd of 5-Leaf Ring, noting, there are 3 Leaves only. Fasten off.
Sew Top 3-Leaves ring to Top of Body in center of 5-Leaf Ring, adjusting and shaping as necessary to fit, as shown in photo.
Embroidery: With pink yarn, embroider blush lines below each eye using Satin St (as shown).

pattern_name: Red Heart Wedding Dress for Doll
materials: 1161 White 4mm pearl beads (741 for Dress, 270 for Flowers, 30 for Neck, 120 for Collar)
33 yd (30 m) white tulle fabric 6" (15 cm) wide
RED HEART® Classic Crochet Thread Size 10, Art. 144 available in white & natural 350 yd (320m), solids 300 yd (274m)
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Dress fits 18" (45.5 cm) tall doll. Dress from Neck to lower edge measures 13" (33 cm). Underskirt measures 9½" (24 cm) long.
gauge: (Dc, ch 2) 14 times = 4" (10 cm); 16 rows dc = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE.
instructions:
DRESS
Skirt
Row 1: Ch 5, slip st in 5th ch from hook (first ch-loops made) *ch 5, slip st in 5th ch from hook; repeat from * until you have a total of 38 ch-loops.
Hold strip of ch-spaces just made with the slip sts at the top.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in last ch-space made, [ch 3, sc in next ch-space] 37 times, turn—38 sc and 37 ch-3 spaces.
Row 3 (waistband): Ch 6 (counts as first dc and ch-3 space), skip first ch-3 space, dc in next sc, [ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, dc in next sc] 36 times—38 dc, 37 ch-3 spaces.
Note: The piece is now joined into a circle and work proceeds in rounds. Do not join at ends of rounds, work in continuous rounds (spiral), until instructed.
Round 4: Taking care not to twist piece, dc in 3rd ch of Row 3 beginning ch-6 to begin working in rounds, place a marker in dc just made for beginning of round, move marker up as each round is started ch 2, skip next ch-3 space, V-st in next dc, [ch 2, skip next ch-3 space, dc in next dc, ch 2, skip next ch-3 space, V-st in next dc] 18 times, ch 2—19 dc and 19 V-sts.
Round 5: [Dc in next dc, ch 2, V-st in next V-st, ch 2] 19 times.
Round 6: [Dc in next dc, ch 3, V-st in next V-st, ch 3] 19 times.
Round 7: [Dc in next dc, Shell in next V-st] 19 times—19 dc and 19 Shells.
Round 8: [Dc in next dc, Shell in Shell] 19 times.
Rounds 9 and 10: [Dc in next dc, ch 1, Shell in Shell, ch 1] 19 times.
Rounds 11–13: [Dc in next dc, ch 2, Shell in Shell, ch 2] 19 times.
Round 14: [Dc in next dc, ch 1, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, Shell in Shell, ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1] 19 times—57 dc and 19 Shells.
Round 15: [Dc in next dc, ch 2, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, Shell in Shell, ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, skip next ch-1 space] 19 times.
Round 16: *Dc in next dc, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] twice, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] twice; repeat from * 18 more times—95 dc and 19 Shells.
Round 17: *Dc in next dc, ch 1, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] twice, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] twice, ch 1, skip next dc; repeat from * 18 more times.
Round 18: *Dc in next dc, ch 2, skip next ch-1 space, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] twice, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] twice, ch 2; repeat from * 18 more times.
Round 19: *Dc in next dc, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] 3 times, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 3 times; repeat from * 18 more times—133 dc and 19 Shells.
Round 20: *Dc in next dc, ch 1, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] 3 times, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 3 times, ch 1, skip next dc; repeat from * 18 more times.
Round 21: *Dc in next dc, ch 2, skip next ch-1 space, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2, skip next dc] 3 times, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 3 times, ch 2, skip next ch-1 space; repeat from * 18 more times.
Round 22: *Dc in next dc, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] 4 times, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 4 times; repeat from * 18 more times—171 dc and 19 Shells.
Round 23: *Dc in next dc, ch 1, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] 4 times, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 4 times, ch 1, skip next dc; repeat from * 18 more times.
Round 24: *Dc in next dc, ch 2, skip next ch-1 space, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] 4 times, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 4 times, ch 2; repeat from * 18 more times.
Round 25: *Dc in next dc, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] 5 times, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 5 times; repeat from * 18 more times, join with slip st in first dc of this round—209 dc and 19 Shells.
Round 26: Ch 3, dc2tog over first 2 dc (beginning ch-3 and dc2tog count as first dc3tog here and at beginning of next round), *ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] 4 times, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 4 times, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space**, dc3tog over next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—152 dc, 19 Shells and 19 dc3tog.
Round 27: Ch 3, dc2tog over first dc3tog and next ch-2 space, *ch 2, [dc in next ch-2 space, ch 2] 4 times, Shell in Shell, [ch 2, dc in next ch-2 space] 4 times, ch 2**, dc3tog over next ch-2 space, next dc3tog, and next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—247 ch-2 spaces (including ch-2 spaces within the Shells). Fasten off.
Skirt Edging
String 741 beads.
With wrong side facing, join thread with sc in any ch-2 space, sc in same ch-2 space, bring up 3 beads, *ch 1, 2 sc in next ch-2 space, bring up 3 beads; repeat from * around, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—494 sc and 247 groups of 3 beads. Fasten off.
BODICE
String 120 beads. These beads will be used when making the collar.
With right side of skirt facing and Row 1 at top, join thread with slip st in first ch-loop.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), (dc, ch 1, dc) in same ch-loop as joining, *ch 1, dc in next ch-loop repeat from * to last ch-loop, ch 1, (dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in last ch-loop, turn—42 dc and 39 ch-1 spaces.
Row 2: Ch 3, V-st in first ch-1 space, *ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, V-st in next ch-1 space; repeat from * across; dc in top of beginning ch-3, turn—2 dc and 20 V-sts.
Rows 3-5: Ch 3, V-st in next V-st, *ch 1, V-st in next v-st; repeat from * across, dc in top of beginning ch-3, turn.
Row 6 (Shape Armholes): Ch 3, V-st in next V-st, [ch 1, V-st in next V-st] 3 times, ch 3, 2 sc in next V-st, 2 sc in next ch-1 space between V-sts, 2 sc in next V-st, ch 3, V-st in next V-st, [ch 1, V-st in next V-st] 7 times, ch 3, 2 sc in next V-st, 2 sc in next ch-1 space between V-sts, 2 sc in next V-st, ch 3, V-st in next V-st, [ch 1, V-st in next V-st] 3 times, dc in last dc, turn—2 dc, 16 V-sts, 12 sc, and 4 ch-3 spaces.
Row 7: Ch 3, V-st in next V-st, [ch 1, V-st in next V-st] 3 times, ch 15, skip next 2 ch-3 spaces, V-st in next V-st, [ch 1, V-st in next V-st] 7 times, ch 15, skip next 2 ch-3 spaces, V-st in next V-st, [ch 1, V-st in next V-st] 3 times, dc in last dc, turn—2 dc, 16 V-sts, and 2 ch-15 spaces.
Do not fasten off.
Collar
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first dc, [2 sc in next V-st, sc in next ch-1 space between V-sts] 3 times, 2 sc in next V-st, 17 sc in next ch-15 space, [2 sc in next V-st, sc in next ch-1 space between V-sts] 7 times, 2 sc in next V-st, 17 sc in next ch-15 space, [2 sc in next V-st, sc in next ch-1 space] 3 times, 2 sc in next V-st, sc in last dc, turn—81 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *ch 5, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—40 ch-5 spaces.
Row 3: Ch 7, sc in first ch-5 space, *ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * across, turn—40 ch-spaces (including the beginning ch-7 space).
Rows 4 and 5: Ch 8, sc in first ch-space, *ch 6, sc in next ch-space; repeat from * across, turn.
Rows 6 and 7: Ch 9, sc in first ch-space, *ch 7, sc in next ch-space; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 8: Ch 10, sc in first ch-space, *ch 8, sc in next ch-space; repeat from * across, turn.
Row 9: Ch 3, (3 dc, bring up 3 beads, ch 1, 3 dc) in each ch-space across—Forty 3-dc groups and 40 groups of 3 beads.
Fasten off.
NECK EDGING & BACK BANDS
Notes: Neck edging and back bands are worked at the same time. Round 1 is worked in one continuous round across the neck, down the right back edge then up the left back edge. Row 2 is worked across the neck only. The piece is then turned and Round 3 is worked across the neck, down the left back edge, and up the right back edge.
String 30 beads.
Fold collar down over bodice so that right side of collar is facing out.
Round 1 (right side): Working in the unworked sc sts of Row 1 of collar (these are the sc sts that were skipped when Row 2 of collar was worked), join thread with sc in first unworked sc, sc in same sc,*sc in next unworked sc, 2 sc in next unworked sc; repeat from * across to last unworked sc, 2 sc in last unworked sc; work 20 dc evenly spaced down right side edge of back opening, then 20 dc evenly spaced up left side edge of back opening; join with slip st in first sc, do not turn—61 sc and 40 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in next 61 sc across neck only, turn, leaving remaining sts unworked—61 sc.
Round 3 (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in first sc, [bring up bead, ch 1, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 30 times; ch 1, working down left side edge of back opening, slip st in end of Row 2, [ch 3, skip next 2 dc, slip st in next 6 dc] twice, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, slip st in next 2 dc; working up right side edge of back opening, slip st in next 2 dc, [ch 3, skip next 2 dc, slip st in next 6 dc] twice, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, slip st in end of Row 2; join with slip st in first sc.. Fasten off.
UNDERSKIRT
Band
Ch 8.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (3 skipped ch count as first dc), [skip next ch, 2 dc in next ch] twice, turn—Three 2-dc groups.
Rows 2–40: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in space between first 2 dc, skip next 2 dc, 2 dc in next space between sts, skip next 2 dc, 2 dc in space between last dc and beginning ch, turn.
Band should measure about 10½ (26.5 cm) without stretching.
Buttonhole Row: Ch 1, 2 sc in space between first 2 dc, ch 3, 2 sc in space between last dc and beginning ch. Fasten off.
Attach Tulle
Cut 40 lengths of tulle 22" (56 cm) long. Fold one length in half, forming a loop at folded end. Draw loop through one end of Row 1 of band, thread ends of tulle through loop and pull to tighten and secure. Repeat to attach a length of tulle to the same end of each row of band. Lay underskirt on table and trim ends to about 9" (23 cm).
VEIL
Band
Work veil band same as underskirt band.
Attach Tulle
Cut 10 lengths of tulle 24" (61 cm) long. Attach one length to center V-st of Rows 1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 32, 34, 36, 38, and 40.
BEADED FLOWERS (make 45—38 for dress, 7 for veil)
String 6 beads. Leaving a long tail to sew flower to dress, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, [sc in ring, bring up bead, ch 1] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc, turn—6 sc and 6 beads.
Round 2: [Ch 5, slip st in next sc] 5 times, ch 5; join with slip st in beginning slip st—6 ch-5 loops. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Attach Flowers: Referring to photos for placement, sew one flower about 1" (2.5 cm) above each point at lower edge of skirt. Sew 19 flowers evenly spaced around skirt about 3" (7.5 cm) below Row 3 (waist). Sew 7 flowers evenly spaced across front of veil.
Attach Buttons: Sew buttons over the 3 ch-3 spaces on one side of back band, use the ch-3 spaces on the other side of back band for button loops. Sew a button to end of underskirt band opposite buttonhole. Sew a button to end of veil band opposite buttonhole.
Waist Sash: Cut a piece of tulle 32" (81 cm) long and weave through spaces in Row 3 of skirt for waist sash.
Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver: 1 skein each 3620 Glowworm A, 0254 Pumpkin B, 0324 Bright Yellow C, 0316 Soft White D and 0312 Black E
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Crab measures 4.5” (11 cm) long x 3.5” (9 cm) tall
gauge: 14 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 20 rows sc = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Rounds 7-10: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, change color in pattern at end of each Round. Fasten off C. Round 11: Working in front loops only, ch 1, hdc in each sc around. Slip st in first hdc to join—36 hdc. Round 12: Slip st in each hdc around—36 slip sts. Fasten off and weave in ends. Underside Underside is worked in continuous Rounds without joining or turning. With A, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Round 2: [2 sc in next sc] 6 times—12 sc. Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc. Round 4: [Sc in each of the next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc. Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in each of the next 3 sc] 6 times—30 sc. Round 6: 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of the next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, [ch 7, turn, slip st in second ch from hook and next 5 chs, slip st in front loop of next sc (Leg formed)] 3 times, [sc in each of the next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times, [ch 7, turn, slip st in second ch from hook and next 5 chs, slip st in front loop of next sc] 3 times, sc in each of the next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of the next 3 sc —30 sc and 6 Legs. Do not fasten off. Attaching Shell to Underside Underside and Shell will be attached by slip stitching together through back loops of last Round of Underside and back loops of Round 11 of Shell. Align Shell and Underside with wrong sides together. *Insert hook through next back loop of Underside and next back loop of Shell, draw loop through both back loops and loop on hook (slip st made). Repeat from * around Shell, working through the back loop of each sc and the last st of each Leg on the Underside, stuffing as you close. Stuff firmly but do not overstuff or stretch stitches (this helps prevent stuffing showing through work). Fasten off and weave in ends. Front Claws (Make 2) With A, ch 2. Round 1 (Right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Round 2: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc. Round 3: Working in current st, [wrap yarn over hook, insert hook into st and pull up a loop] 3 times, yarn over and pull loop through all 7 loops on hook (Thumb made). Sc in each of the next 8 sc—1 Thumb and 8 sc. Round 4: Sc2tog 4 times, sc in last st—5 sc. Stuff lightly. Rounds 5-8: Sc in each st around. Continue stuffing lightly as work progresses. At the end of Round 8, fasten off, leaving 8” tail for sewing. Eyes Eye Whites (Right side): With D, *ch 6, turn, 3 hdc in 2nd ch from hook, 3 hdc in next ch, slip st in next ch, 3 hdc in each of the next 2 chs. Fasten off, leaving 8 “ tail for sewing. Eyelids: With A, work same as Eye Whites; do not fasten off. Ch 1 turn; matching wrong sides of Eye Whites and Eyelids, sc two pieces together working 1 sc in each of the next 6 matching hdc’s, slip st in the next matching slip sts, work 1 sc in each of the next 6 matching hdc’s. Fasten off, leaving 12” tail for sewing. Eyebrow With E, *ch 4 loosely, turn, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in the next 2 chs. Repeat from *, ending in middle of Eyebrow. Fasten off, leaving 8” tail for sewing. Assembly Using photograph as a guide, sew Front Claws to Underside in front of each set of Legs with Thumbs pointing inward. Lightly stuff Eyes and position on top of Shell, centered between Claws. Sew to Shell, matching colors. With E, add a French knot in the center of each Eye White for a Pupil. Attach center of Eyebrow between Eyes with 2 for 3 stitches. Embroider a sassy V-smile. Weave and hide any remaining ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) main Color (mC) (01004 Soft Ecru) 1 ball
Sizes 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) and 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of red embroidery floss for mouth
Small amount of black embroidery floss for eyelashes
3/8" [1 cm] light blue button for Dress
Assortment of seed and bugle beads
gauge: 17 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
note: When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
DOLL
head
With MC and smaller hook, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 10 times more.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Stuff Head.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sts. Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off.
Stuff Head.
Body
With MC and smaller hook, ch 30. Join in ring with sl st into first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm].
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm].
next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Sew bottom edge of Body closed. Stuff Body.
arms (make 2).
glove: With A and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm].
next rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. Ch 2. (1 sc. Ch 2) in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
next rnd: Join MC with sl st to rem back loop of any st of previous rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4" [10 cm]. Fasten off. Stuff Arms lightly.
Legs (make 2).
Shoe: With B and smaller hook, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join MC with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd. 21 sts.
6th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Leg from top of Shoe measures 5" [12.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Shoe strap: Join B with sl st to 6th sc of marked rnd. Ch 5. Join with sl st to 13th sc of marked rnd. Fasten off. Stuff Legs.
Finishing
Sew top of Legs closed using whip st. Sew Arms and Leg to Body. Attach Head to top of Body. With black embroidery floss, embroider eyelashes on Head. Sew beads for eyes to Head. With red embroidery floss, embroider mouth.
hair fringe
Cut a piece of tape 13" [33 cm] long and secure onto a flat surface with sticky side up. Cut lengths of D 14" [35.5 cm] long and lay them across tape so strip of tape is in center of yarn. Holding tissue paper over top of yarn and using sewing machine, run a line of stitching along length of tape. Remove tape when hair is secure. Remove tissue paper after stitching. Pin fringe to outside of head. Using backstitch and D, sew hair into place along sewn line. Fold hair up and secure at top of Head tightly.
CLothing
Dress
With larger hook and B, ch 22.
1st row: 1 sc in 5th ch from hook (button loop). 1 sc in each of next 17 ch. Turn. 18 sc.
2nd and 3rd rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 20 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Do not turn. Join with sl st to first sc. 22 sc.
Beg working rnds: 1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
6th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker on last st. 72 sc.
8th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 5½" [14 cm]. Join A. Break B.
next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 2. (1 sc. Ch 2) in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew button to back of Dress to correspond to button loop.
Snowflake (make 1).
With A and smaller hook, ch 3. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 dc in ring. Ch 2. *(Yoh and draw up a loop in ring. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – dc2tog made. Ch 2. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first dc.
2nd rnd: Sl st to first ch-2 sp. (Ch 3. 1 dc) in same ch-2 sp. Ch 2. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. *(2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 2. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Rep from * 4 times more. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. 1 dc in top of ch-3.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook – picot made. 1 sc. Ch 4. Sl st in 4th ch from hook. 1 sc. Picot) along side of previous dc. Ch 3. Miss next 2 dc and ch-2 sp. Sl st in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next 2 dc and ch-2 sp. *(1 sc. Picot. 1 sc. Ch 4. Sl st in 4th ch from hook. 1 sc. Picot) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Miss next 2 dc and ch-2 sp. Sl st in next sc. Ch 3. Miss next 2 dc and ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew Snowflake to front of Dress as shown in picture.
Cape
note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
With C and larger hook, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 2. (1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 2 hdc in next sc) twice. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 10 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Turn. 12 hdc.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Turn. 14 hdc.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Turn. 16 hdc.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc across. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Turn. 18 hdc.
8th row: As 6th row.
9th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Turn. 20 hdc.
10th and 11th rows: As 6th row.
12th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. Turn. 22 hdc.
13th and 14th rows: As 6th row.
15th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Turn. 24 hdc.
16th and 17th rows: As 6th row. Fasten off at end of 17th row.
Sew 6" [15 cm] lengths of C to each top corner of Cape for ties.
Crown
With A and smaller hook, ch 41. Join in ring with sl st into first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 16 ch. turn. Leave rem ch unworked.
2nd row: Miss first 2 sc. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Miss next 2 sc. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. Sl st in next sc. Turn.
3rd row: 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. (1 sc. Picot. 1 sc. Ch 4. Sl st in 4th ch from hook. 1 sc. Picot) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Place st marker on last st. Miss next 2 sc. (2 dc. Ch 2. 2 dc) in next sc. Miss next 2 sc. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off.
4th row: With RS facing, join A with sl st at marker. Ch 1. Miss first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 dc. (1 sc. Picot. 1 sc. Ch 4. Sl st in 4th ch from hook. 1 sc. Picot) in next ch-2 sp. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Rep from * once more. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew small beads in random pattern to Dress Front, Cape and Crown as shown in picture.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.25 mm [US B-1]
Optional: Knee high stocking and plastic pellets for weighted stuffing.
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Narwhal measures about 4" [10 cm] tall, not including tusk.
gauge: 32 sts = about 4" [10 cm]; 28 rounds = about 4" [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL TO THIS PROJECT. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SOLID COLOR BODY
Beginning at top of head with A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each of next 6 sts—12 sc.
Round 3: Work 2 sc in each of next 12 sts—24 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—32 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each st around.
Round 6: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—40 sc.
Rounds 7–19: Sc in each st around. Attach safety eyes between Rounds 10 and 11, about 8 stitches apart.

Round 20: [Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog] 8 times—32 sc.
Round 21: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 8 times—24 sc.
Begin stuffing piece with fiberfill or place optional knee high, filled with plastic pellets, into piece. Continue stuffing piece as work progresses.
Round 22: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] 8 times—16 sc.
Round 23: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 4 times—12 sc.
Rounds 24 and 25: Sc in each st around.
Round 26: Work 2 sc in each of next 12 sts—24 sc.
Round 27: [Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—30 sc.
Fasten off.

Tail
Flatten the last few rounds so that stitches at the back match stitches at the front, forming a double row of stitches. Working through both thicknesses, join A with a slip stitch in the center stitch. 
Note: When flattening the last few rounds, flatten them so that the ends of rounds are centered at the back of the piece.
First Tail Fin
Round 1: Sc in next 14 sts; leave remaining sts unworked—14 sc.
Working over these 14 sts only. Place a marker in the last sc made to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each st around.
Round 4: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts] twice—12 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] 4 times—8 sc.
Round 6: [Sc2tog] 4 times—4 sc.
Fasten off. Weave in and trim ends.

Second Tail Fin
Round 1: Join A with sc in first unworked st following center stitch, sc in next 13 sts—14 sc.
Rounds 2–6: Work same as Rounds 2–6 of first tail fin.
Fasten off. Weave in and trim ends.

STRIPED BODY
Beginning at top of head with C, make an adjustable ring.
Rounds 1–13: With C, work same as Rounds 1–13 of solid narwhal body and change to D in last st of Round 13—40 sc.
Rounds 14 and 15: With D, sc in each st around and change to B in last st of last round.
Rounds 16 and 17: With B, sc in each st around and change to D in last st of last round.
Rounds 18 and 19: Repeat Rounds 14 and 15.
Attach safety eyes between Rounds 10 and 11, about 8 stitches apart.
Round 20: With B, [sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog] 8 times—32 sc.
Round 21: With B, [sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 8 times and change to D in last st—24 sc. 
Begin stuffing piece with fiberfill or place optional knee high, filled with plastic pellets, into piece. Continue stuffing piece as work progresses. 
Fasten off B.
Round 22: With D, [sc in next st, sc2tog] 8 times—16 sc. 
Round 23: With D, [sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 4 times and change to C in last st—12 sc.
Fasten off D. Work remainder of piece with C only.
Rounds 24–27: With C, work same as Rounds 24–27 of solid narwhal body. 
Fasten off.

Tail
Flatten the last few rounds so that stitches at the back match stitches at the front, forming a double row of stitches. Working through both thicknesses, join C with a slip stitch in the center stitch.  
Note: When flattening the last few rounds, flatten them so that the color changes are centered at the back of the piece.
With C, work tail and tail fins same as for solid narwhal body.
Fasten off. Weave in and trim ends.

PECTORAL FINS (make 2 for each narwhal)
Note: If making solid narwhal, use yarn color A. If making striped narwhal, use yarn color C.
Make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] twice, sc in last 2 sts—8 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 4 times—12 sc.
Rounds 4 and 5: Sc in each st around. 
Round 6: [Sc in next st, sc2tog] 4 times—8 sc.
Round 7: Sc in each st around.
Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing fin to body. If needed, thread beginning yarn tail through stitches at beginning of piece and pull to close opening. 
Weave in and trim beginning tail only.

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, sew pectoral fins to sides of body, near Round 13.
With embroidery needle and 2 strands of black embroidery floss, embroider a smile in the middle of the face over Round 13, about 3 stitches wide. 
Cut two small circles from pink craft felt. Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, glue cheeks to face directly under and to the outside of the eyes.

Tusk
Generously coat about half of the wooden toothpick with strong craft glue. Beginning near the center of the toothpick, wrap B-colored yarn around the toothpick wrapping up to the point. Hold the wraps until the yarn adheres. Trim the yarn even when glue is dry.
After tusk is dry, place small amount of glue on unwrapped end of toothpick and insert it into Round 6 at the center of the narwhal's forehead. Allow glue to dry.
Weave in and trim any remaining ends.

materials: Aunt Lydia® Baby Shower™ (170 yds/155 m) Contrast A Shrimp (1440) 1 ball or 165 yds/150 m
Contrast B Stone (0630) 1 ball or 165 yds/150 m
Contrast C Faded Denim (4660) 1 ball or 165 yds/150 m
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook
Susan Bates® split-lock stitch count markers
Length of Anchor® Embroidery Floss Black (4735.0403)
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
instructions:
Notes:
• Project worked in continuous rnds. Do not join at end of rnds. 
• Move marker as work progresses.
• Head and Body are worked as one piece.
HEAD (Make with A for Kitty, With B for Puppy, With C for Bear)
See Diagram on page 4
Make magic ring. Video is here.
**1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc into magic ring. PM on first sc. Do not join.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.***
4th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 24 sc.****
5th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 30 sc.**
6th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. 36 sc.
7th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 6 times. 42 sc.
8th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 6 times. 48 sc.
9th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 6 times. 54 sc.
10th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc) 6 times. 60 sc.
11th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc) 6 times. 66 sc.
12th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc) 6 times. 72 sc.
13th to 24th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
Begin stuffing as you go along.
25th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc) 6 times. 66 sts.
26th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc) 6 times. 60 sts.
27th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc) 6 times. 54 sts.
28th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 6 times. 48 sts.
29th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 6 times. 42 sts.
30th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 6 times. 36 sts.
31st rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. 30 sts.
32nd rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 24 sts.
33rd rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
Do not fasten off.
BODY: (See Diagram on page 5)
1st rnd: 1 scbl in each sc around. 18 sts.
2nd rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 24 sc.
3rd rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 30 sc.
4th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. 36 sc.
5th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 6 times. 42 sc.
6th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 6 times. 48 sc.
7th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 6 times. 54 sc.
8th to 22nd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 54 sc.
23rd rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 6 times. 48 sts.
24th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 6 times. 42 sts.
25th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 6 times. 36 sts.
26th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. 30 sts.
Finish stuffing.
27th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 24 sts.
28th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
29th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 12 sts.
30th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. 
Fasten off.
 
LEGS: (Make 1 with B and 1 with C for Kitty, Make 1 with A and 1 with C for Puppy, Make 1 with A and 1 with B for Bear)
See Diagram on page 5.
Make Magic ring. 
Work from ** to ** as given for Head.
6th rnd: 1 scbl in each sc around. 30 sc.
7th and 8th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
9th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 24 sts.
10th and 11th rnds: As 7th rnd.
12th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
Stuff bottom of legs only.
13th to 16th rnds: 1 sc in each st around. 18 sts.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Fold sides tog and stitch closed. Stitch legs to body between 25th and 26th rnds, 6 sts apart.
 
ARMS: (Make 1 with B and 1 with C for Kitty, Make 1 with A and 1 with C for Puppy, Make 1 with A and 1 with B for Bear)
See Diagram on page 6.
Make Magic ring. 
Work from ** to *** as given for Head. 18 sc.
4th and 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
6th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 12 sts.
Stuff bottom of Arms only.
7th to 12th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc at end of last rnd.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Fold sides tog and sew closed. Sew Arms to Body between 6th and 7th rnds.
 
BEAR TAIL
See Diagram on page 6.
With B, make Magic ring. 
Work from ** to *** as given for Head. 18 sc.
4th and 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
6th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 12 sts.
7th and 8th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
Stuff lightly.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Fold sides tog and sew closed. Sew Tail to Body between 23rd and 24th rnds. 
 
KITTY TAIL
See Diagram on page 6.
With C, make Magic ring. 
Work from ** to *** as given for Head. 18 sc.
4th and 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
6th rnd: (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. 15 sts.
7th rnd: (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 13 sts. 
8th rnd: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 12 sts.
Stuff lightly.
9th to 15th rnds:  1 sc in each st around.
16th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc.  15 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Fold sides tog and sew closed. Sew Tail to Body between 22nd and 23rd rnds. Bend upwards and sew middle of Tail to Body for better shape.
 
PUPPY TAIL
See Diagram on page 6.
With A, make Magic ring. 
1st rnd:  3 sc in magic ring. 
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around.  
6 sc. 
3rd rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 9 sc.
4th rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 12 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Join C at end of last rnd. 
Break A
7th to 16th rnds: With A, 1 sc in each st around.
Stuff lightly.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Fold sides tog and sew closed. Sew Tail to Body between 22nd and 23rd rnds. 
 
BEAR EARS (Make 1 with A and 1 with B)
See Diagram on page 7.
Make Magic ring. 
Work from ** to **** as given for Head. 24 sc.
5th to 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Do not stuff. Fold sides tog and sew closed. Sew Ears to Head between 5th and 12th rnds.
 
KITTY EARS (Make 1 with B and 1 with C)
See Diagram on page 7.
Make Magic ring. 
1st rnd:  3 sc in magic ring. 
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around.  
6 sc. 
3rd rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 9 sc.
4th rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 12 sc.
5th rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 15 sc.
6th rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 18 sc.
7th rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 3 times. 21 sc.
8th rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 3 times. 24 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Do not stuff. Fold sides tog and sew closed. Sew Ears to Head between 3rd and 10th rnds.
 
PUPPY EARS (Make 1 with A and 1 with C)  See Diagram on page 7.
Make Magic ring. 
Work from ** to **** as given for Head. 24 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
7th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
8th to 11th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
12th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 12 sts.
13th to 18th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Do not stuff. Fold sides tog and sew closed. Sew Ears to Head between 5th and 8th rnds.
BEAR & PUPPY SNOUT (Make with A for Bear,  Make with B for Puppy) 
Work from ** to *** as given for Head. 18 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off with long tail for sewing. 
Stuff lightly as stitching. Sew Snout to Face between rounds 19 and 27.
FINISHING
With black floss, embroider eyelids and eyelashes using back stitch as shown in picture.
With black floss, embroider nose using satin stitch as shown in picture.

materials: Bernat® Maker Minis™ Kit includes 10 balls (1.75 oz/50 g; 61 yds/56 m each) (17.65 oz/500 g; 610 yds/560 m pack) (53001)
Version 1 Contrast A Yellow 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Version 1 Contrast B Green 1 ball or 27.5 yds/25 m
Version 1 Contrast C White 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Version 2 Contrast A Yellow 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Version 2 Contrast B Green 1 ball or 27.5 yds/25 m
Version 2 Contrast C Pink 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Version 3 Contrast A Yellow 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Version 3 Contrast B Green 1 ball or 27.5 yds/25 m
Version 3 Contrast C Purple 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 x 5/16" [1 cm] safety eyes for each Flower.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Note: Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd.

FLOWER
Center
With A, ch 2. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM on first st. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of nex 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Break A. Join B. 36 sc.
7th rnd: With B, working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
8th and 9th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts.

12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
Stuff Center firmly and attach safety eyes.
13th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
14th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.

Petals
Join C with sl st to first sc front loop of 6th rnd.
1st rnd: Working in front loops only, *(1 sc. 1 hdc) all in next sc after sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. (1 hdc. 1 sc) all in next sc. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. (1 sc. 1 hdc) in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc. 1 sc in next sc. Sl st in last sc. Do not join.
2nd rnd: Working in both loops, skip first sl st. *Sl st in next sc. (1 sc. 1 hdc) in next hdc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. (1 hdc. 1 sc) in next hdc. Sl st in next sc. Skip each of next 2 sl sts. Rep from * to last 7 sts. Sl st in next sc. (1 sc. 1 hdc) in next hdc. 2 dc in each of next 2 dc. (1 hdc. 1 sc) in next hdc. Sl st in next sc. Sl st in last sl st. Fasten off.
With length of black embroidery floss or yarn, embroider mouth as shown in photo.

Leaf (make 2)
With B, ch 8.
1st rnd: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in last ch. Ch 2. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, sl st in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in last ch. Fasten off.
Sew Leaves to Flower as shown in photo.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. H/5 [8 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] tall x 5" [12.5 cm] wide, including Legs.
instructions:
Notes:  
• All rnds are joined with sl st to first sc. 
• Where instructions indicate to leave a long tail when fastening off, this tail is to be used in seaming.
Snout
With A, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
With C, stitch on Mouth as shown in photo. Loop yarn between 2 sts approx 10 times to make Nose. 
Body/Head
Note: Body and Head are worked in one piece from the bottom up. 
With B, beg using magic loop method. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th to 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
12th rnd: As 4th rnd.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
14th rnd: As 4th rnd. 
15th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
16th rnd: As 4th rnd. 
17th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 24 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
19th to 26th rnds: As 4th rnd.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
28th rnd: As 4th rnd.
29th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
Before proceeding to complete Head, stitch Snout to Face between 20th and 24th rnds. Add safety eyes between 24th and 25th rnds, approx 6 sts apart and centered over Snout. Beg stuffing with polyfill. Cont stuffing with polyfill while working rest of Head.
30th rnd: As 4th rnd.
31st rnd: As 13th rnd. 18 sts.
32nd rnd: As 15th rnd. 12 sts.
33rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
Ears (make 2)
With C, beg using magic loop method. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in next st. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc. 
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts.
Do not stuff. Stitch Ears to Head as shown in photo, approx 4 rnds down from top. 
Tiger Head Stripes (make 3)
With C, ch 12. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st row: 1 sc in 3rd chain from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of last 5 ch. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
Stitch Stripes to top of Head as shown in photo, with point of Stripes facing towards Snout.
Feet (make 2)
With B, beg using magic loop method. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
6th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Stuff Feet with polyfill. Attach Feet to each side at bottom of Body. Note that Feet should stick out sideways to give Tiger support to sit up.
Arms (make 2)
With B, beg using magic loop method. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sc.
3rd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
8th to 9th rnds: As 3rd rnd. 
10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sc.
11th to 15th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
Stuff Arms with polyfill. Stitch to Tiger at Neck so Arms hang down in Front of Feet as shown in photo. 
Tail
With C, beg using magic loop method. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 4 sc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Join. 6 sc. 
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Break C. Join B.
6th to 12th rnds: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Do not stuff Tail.
Stitch tail to bottom of Body at back.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft™ (Solids: 6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m; Heathers: 5 oz/141.7 g; 250 yds/228 m)
Bernat® Pipsqueak™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 101 yds/92 m)
Sizes U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge
Pair of 8 mm Safety Eyes or 2 buttons for Eyes
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of the next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
gauge: Caron® Simply Soft™: 17 sc and 18 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. Bernat® Pipsqueak™: 9 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Body
With A and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc. Place marker on last rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 5" [12.5 cm].
Beg dec rnds: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sts.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sts.
7th to 10th rnds: As 2nd to 5th rnds.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
12th to 15th rnds: As 2nd to 5th rnds.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sts.
17th to 20th rnds: As 2nd to 5th rnds.
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Stuff Body.
Head
Nose: With B and smaller hook, ch 4.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Join D at end of last rnd.
5th rnd: With D, Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break D, join A with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 35 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
11th rnd: As 9th rnd.
Cont as established, inc 7 sc evenly spaced across every other rnd until there are 63 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 5 times more.
Beg dec rnds: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 49 sts
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sts.
6th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 35 sts.
8th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
Stuff Head.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sts.
10th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sts.
12th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 7 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem loops and pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Sew Head to top of Body.
Eye Patches (make 2)
With B and smaller hook, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each sc to last sc. 2 hdc in last sc. Turn. 9 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc) 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Break B. Join D. Turn. 10 hdc.
4th row: With D, ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Do not turn. Work 4 hdc evenly along side edge. Fasten off. Attach Safety Eyes or buttons to Eye Patches as shown in picture.
Sew Eye Patches to front of Head as shown in picture.
Ears (make 2 with A for Outer Ear and 2 with B for Inner Ear).
Note: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as hdc.
With smaller hook, ch 10.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
4th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
5th row: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) twice. 2 sts.
6th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. Fasten off.
Holding WS of Outer and Inner Ears tog, with smaller hook, join D with sl st to bottom right corner. Working through both thicknesses, ch 1. Work 1 row of sc evenly to top of Ear. Work 3 sc in tip of Ear. Work 1 row of sc evenly along left side edge. Fasten off.
Sew Ears to top of Head.
With B, embroider mouth.
Arms (make 2)
With B and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Rep last rnd 9 times more. Break B, join A.
Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Arm measures approx 6" [15 cm] from beg. Fasten off.
Stuff Arms lightly. Attach Arms to either side of Body.
Legs (make 2)
With B and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 9 times more. Break B, join A.
Next rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sts.
Next 10 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
Next 10 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.
Stuff Legs lightly. Attach Legs to bottom of Body.
Tail
With 2 strands of B held tog and larger hook, ch 20. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2. 20 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2.
3rd rnd: As 2nd rnd, join D with sl st to top of ch-2.
**4th and 5th rnds: With D, as 2nd rnd, join 2 strands of B at end of 5th rnd.
6th to 8th rnds: With B, as 2nd rnd. Join D with sl st to top of ch 2 at end of 8th rnd.**
Rep from ** to ** once more. Break B, join D.
Next rnd: With D, ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2. 16 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2tog. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2. 12 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Join with sl st to top of ch-2. 8 sts.
Next rnd: (Hdc2tog) 4 times. 4 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Draw end through rem loops and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.
Attach Tail to back of Body at center back.
Bandana
With C and larger hook, ch 2.
1st row: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc.
Rep last row 3 times more. 13 sc at end of last row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 15 sc.
Rep last 2 rows to 21 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 7. Turn.
Next row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 7. Turn.
Next row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Ch 1. Skip next ch (buttonhole). 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off.
Sew on button to correspond with buttonhole.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 360 Café Latte A, 312 Black B, 512 Turqua C, 385 Royal D, 254 Pumpkin E, 324 Bright Yellow F, and 319 Cherry Red G.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 12 sts = 3”; 14 rows = 3” in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BEAR
Head
Beginning at nose with A, ch 2.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 4–7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc, sc in last 9 sc—30 sc.
Rounds 11 and 12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 14 and 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 19: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 20: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Stuff head.
Round 21: Sc in each sc around.
Round 22: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through the stitches of last round and pull to gather. Weave in end securely.
Facial Features
With B, embroider satin stitch eyes and nose, and straight stitch mouth.

Ear (Make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of head—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 4 times—8 sc.
Fasten off. Do not stuff ear. Flatten and sew ears to head.

Headband
With C, ch 31.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—30 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off. Sew headband around head, in front of ears.

Bow
With C, ch 2.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of head; change to D in last st of Round 2—12 sc.
Round 3: With D, sc in each sc around; change to C in last st.
Round 4: With C, sc in each sc around; change to D in last st.
Round 5: With D, [skip next sc, slip st in next sc] 6 times—6 slip sts.
Round 6: With D, sc in each slip st around; change to C in last sc—6 sc.
Round 7: With C, 2 sc in each sc around; change to D in last sc—12 sc.
Rounds 8 and 9: Repeat Rounds 3 and 4; do NOT change to D in last st of Round 9.
Round 10: With C, [sc2tog] 6 times—6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through the stitches of last round and pull to gather. Weave in end securely.

Body
Beginning at top with A, ch 6; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, 2 sc in each ch around—12 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; change to C in last st—36 sc.

Bathing Suit
Round 8: With C, sc in each sc around; change to D in last st.
Round 9: With D, sc in each sc around; change to C in last st.
Rounds 10–17: Repeat last 2 rounds 4 more times.
Round 18: With C, sc in each sc around; change to D in last st. Stuff body and bathing suit.

Divide for Legs
First Leg
Round 19: With D, sc in next 18 sc; change to A in last sc, place a marker in the next st; leave the marked st and all remaining sts unworked—18 sc. Work in continuous rounds over the remaining 18 sc only, forming a circle for the first leg.
