Rounds 20–30: Sc in each sc around.

Shape Foot
Round 31: Work 2 sc in each of first 3 sc, sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in each of last 3 sc—24 sc.
Rounds 32–35: Sc in each sc around.
Round 36: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Stuff leg.
Round 37: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through the stitches of last round and pull to gather. Weave in end securely.

Second Leg
With Right Side facing, join D with sc in marked st following first leg.
Round 19: Sc in each remaining unworked st following first leg; change to A in last st.
Rounds 20–30: Sc in each sc around.

Shape Foot
Round 31: Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc, sc in last 7 sc—24 sc.
Rounds 32–37: Work same as Rounds 32–37 of first leg—12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through the stitches of last round and pull to gather. Weave in end securely.

Sew head to top of body.

Tie (for bathing suit top)
With C, ch 35, slip st in center top of bathing suit, ch 35. Fasten off and weave in ends. Tie both ends together behind neck.

Skirt
With D, ch 36; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around; change to C in last sc—36 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Carry color not in use up inside of work until next needed.
Round 2: With C, *sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; change to D in last sc—54 sc.
Round 3: With D, sc in each sc around; change to C in last st.
Round 4: With C, sc in each sc around; change to D in last st. Fasten off C.
Round 5: With D, *slip st in next sc, ch 3, skip next sc; repeat from * around. Fasten off. Wrap skirt around waist and sew beginning edge to waist.

Arm (Make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of head—12 sc.
Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc2tog] twice, sc in remaining 8 sc—10 sc.
Rounds 7–16: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off. Stuff arms and sew to body.

DUCKY INNER TUBE
With F, ch 42; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around—42 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—54 sc.
Rounds 4–6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Use tail to sew beginning edge to Round 9, stuffing piece as you go.

Ducky Head
With F, ch 2.
Rounds 1–4: Work same as Rounds 1–4 of bear head—18 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Rounds 6 and 7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: *Sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off.

Beak
With E, ch 2.
Round 1: Work same as Round 1 of bear head—6 sc.
Round 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice—8 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff very lightly. Use tail to sew beak to ducky head.

Facial Features
With B, embroider French knot eyes to ducky head. Sew ducky head to inner tube.

PAIL
With G, ch 2.
Rounds 1–3: Work same as Rounds 1–3 of head—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—27 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: [Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—30 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—33 sc.
Round 12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: Slip st in each sc around.

Handle
Ch 18, skip next 16 slip sts, slip st in next slip st, turn, skip the slip st just made, slip st in each of next 18 ch. Fasten off.

GOLD FISH
With E, ch 2.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of head—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 5–12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: *Sc2tog; repeat from * around—9 sc.
Stuff piece lightly.
Round 14: [Sc2tog] 4 times, sc in last sc—5 sc.
Row 15: Flatten last round, working through both thicknesses, work 3 sc evenly spaced across, turn—3 sc.
Row 16: Ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch (fin made), skip next sc of Row 15, slip st in next sc, ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch (fin made), slip st in last sc of Row 15, turn.

Edging
Ch 1, sc around edges of tail, working 3 sc in each tip and working a slip st in the slip st at center of tail (between fins). Fasten off.

Top Fin
With E, ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 1, sc in next ch; repeat from * across. Fasten off. Sew fin to back of gold fish.

Side Fin (Make 2)
With E, ch 4, hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, slip st in last ch. Fasten off. Sew one side fin to each side of gold fish.

Bottom Fin
With E, ch 7, hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, slip st in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, slip st in last ch. Fold fin in half and sew center to bottom of gold fish.

Facial Features
With B, embroider French knot eyes and straight st smile.

FINISHING
Weave in any remaining ends. Place accessories on bear.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Chunky™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 108 yds/99 m) Main Color (MC) White (28005) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ [6.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] tall x 10" [25.5 cm] wide.
instructions:
Notes :
• You can make both the Polar Bear and the Brown Bear using these 6 skeins of Bernat Softee Chunky.
• Head and body are worked top down.
• All rnds beg in first st of rnd.
• Rnds are joined with sl st to first st of rnd unless otherwise indicated.

Snout
With B, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for attaching.
With a long strand of E and tapestry needle, loop yarn approx 6 times around 3 stitches at top of the snout as demonstrated in video. Tie knot on WS of work to secure.

Ears (make 2)
With MC for Polar Bear or C for Brown Bear, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 10 sc.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 10 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long tail for attaching.

Head/Body
With MC for Polar Bear or C for Brown Bear, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: (RS) Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
6th to 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 36 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 30 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
Attach snout to head between rnds 8 and 13.
Using E, stitch eyes above either side of the top of the snout as demonstrated in video.
EYES: Stitch on a smiling eye as shown for Polar Bear or use your tapestry needle to weave the yarn around the two stitches between rounds 8 and 9 about 4 times, as shown for Brown Bear.
Stitch ears onto either side of head, 3 rounds down from top.
Stuff Head lightly with polyfill.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for seaming.
Pinch opening of Head closed. Working into 15th rnd, stitch front and back together with the tail and a tapestry needle so the polyfill stays in the head.

Join A for Polar Bear or D for Brown Bear to any st of 16th rnd.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 32 sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 32 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
21st and 22nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 40 sc.
23rd rnd: *Ch 2. Skip next 10 sts. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sc and 2 ch-2 sps. Do not work into skipped sts or chain - these are the armholes.
24th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 40 sc.
25th to 28th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 40 sc.
29th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
30th to 32nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 32 sc.
33rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
34th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 24 sc. Fasten off A or D. Join MC for Polar Bear or C for Brown Bear.
35th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 24 sc.

Divide for Legs: 36th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Skip next 12 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join. 12 sc.
Note: Leave skipped stitches unworked.

First Leg
1st to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sc.
9th to 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 9 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sc.
13th to 19th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 6 sc.
Fasten off MC or C. Join B.
20th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
Paw: 21st and 22nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sts.
24th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long tail. Weave tail tightly through remaining stitches to close Paw.

Second Leg
Join MC for Polar Bear or C for Brown Bear to any skipped sc along the edge of the 36th rnd.
Repeat 1st to 24th rnd of First Leg. Fasten off leaving a long tail. Weave tail tightly through remaining stitches to close Paw.
Knot Legs just above Paws.

Arms
Join A for Polar Bear or D for Brown Bear to any skipped sc along the edge of the 23rd rnd.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc and ch around. Join. 12 sc.
Repeat 1st to 19th rnds of First Leg. Fasten off A or D. Join B.
Repeat 20th to 24th rnds of First Leg.
Fasten off leaving a long tail. Weave tail tightly through remaining stitches to close Paw. Knot arm right before the Paw. Repeat for second Arm.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m) Wildflower (3955)  1 ball or 23.5 yds/21.5 m for Hat and 21 yds/19.5 m for Dress
Red Heart® Super Saver® Stripes™ (5 oz/141 g; 236 yds/215 m) Retro Stripe (4971) 1 ball or 23.5 yds/21.5 m for Hat and 21 yds/19.5 m for Dress
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbl = Double crochet in back loop only
Hdcbl = Half double crochet in back loop only
instructions:
Note: Join with sl st to first sc at end of rnds.
DRESS
Skirt
**Ch 20. Join with sl st to form a ring. See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 20 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 25 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.**
4th rnd: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). Working in back loops only,  2 hdcbl in first sc. 3 hdcbl in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch-2 (first hdc).
Fasten off.
Front Bib
Turn work upside down. With RS facing, join yarn with sc to rem loop of 5th ch of foundation ch.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Turn. 5 sc (including joining sc).
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Ch 6. Do not fasten off. Pull loop to make it larger so it will not unravel.
Break yarn leaving a 4” [10 cm] tail.
Back
With RS facing, skip next 5 ch of foundation chain.
Join yarn with sc to rem loop of next foundation ch.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Turn. 5 sc (including joining sc).
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Ch 6. Join with sl st to first sc of last row of Front Bib. 
Fasten off.
Insert hook back into loop of ch 6 of Front Bib. Join with sl st to first sc of last row of Back.
Fasten off.
HAT 
Work from ** to ** as given for Dress.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). Working in back loops only,  2 dcbl in first sc. 3 dcbl in each sc around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3 (first dc).
Fasten off.
HAT
1
2
3
4
5
STITCH KEY
= chain (ch)
= slip stitch (sl st)
= double crochet (dc)
= half double crochet (hdc)
= single crochet (sc)
= worked in back loop (blo)
DRESS/
SKIRT
1
1
1
2
2
Bib
Back

3
4

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 324 Bright yellow
Amethyst B, 254 Pumpkin C, 390 Hot Red D, Green E, 385 Royal F and 312 Black G.
gauge: 4 sts = 1”; 4 rounds = 1” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Body:
Begin at top of head with A, ch 2.
Round 1: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 10 sc.
Rounds 2-4: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 5-7: With B, repeat Round 2.
Round 8-9: With C, repeat Round 2.
Round 10: With C (sc, ch 3, sc) in each sc around – 10 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off.
Arms (make 2):
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 4 sc.
Rounds 2-3: With B, sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Bonnet:
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 10 sc.
Rounds 2-3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: With C (sc, ch 3, sc) in each sc around – 6 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off. Weave a strand of C through Round 3, tie under “chin” at front.
FINISHING
Sew arms to body. Sew hat to head. With D embroider curly hair around edge of bonnet. With D embroider a mouth. With G satin stitch eyes.

TOMMY
Body:
Begin at top of the head with A, ch 2.
Round 1: 10 sc in 2nd ch from the hook – 10 sc.
Rounds 2-4: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 5-7: With E, repeat Round 2.
Rounds 8-10: With D, repeat Round 2. Fasten off.
Arms (make 2):
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 4 sc.
Rounds 2-3: With E, sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Hat:
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 10 sc.
Rounds 2-3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: 2 sc in each of next 3 sc – 6 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew arms to body. With a double strand of C make a knot and sew to top of hat. Sew hat to head.
Suspender Straps: (Make 2)
With B, ch 12; fasten off, leaving a long strand for sewing. Sew to body, crossing straps at back. Make “buttons” with a knot of C at the front ends of straps. With D embroider a mouth. With G embroider satin stitch eyes.
These four quick-to-create little characters will inspire creative imaginations. Crochet them for children in bright colors that they will love.

KATIE
Body:
Begin at top of head with A, ch 2.
Round 1: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 10 sc.
Rounds 2-4: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 5-7: With D, repeat Round 2.
Rounds 8-9: With F, repeat Round 2.
Round 10: With F, (slip st, ch 10, slip st) in each sc around – 10 ch-10 loops. Fasten off.
Arms (make 2):
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 4 sc in 2nd ch from the hook – 4 sc.
Rounds 2-3: With D, sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Sun Hat:
With F, ch 2.
Round 1: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 10 sc.
Rounds 2-3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: Ch 3, dc in same sc, 3 dc in next sc, * 2 dc in next sc, 3 dc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st to top of ch-3 – 25 dc. Fasten off. Weave a contrast strand of yarn through Round 3, tie in a bow. Trim ends.
FINISHING
Sew arms to body. Sew hat to head. With D embroider a mouth. Cut 3”-long strands of C and sew around top of head for hair. With G embroider satin stitch eyes.

KYLE
Body:
Begin at top of the head with A, ch 2.
Round 1: 10 sc in 2nd ch from the hook – 10 sc.
Rounds 2-4: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 5-7: With F, repeat Round 2.
Rounds 8-10: With E, repeat Round 2.
Fasten off.
Arms:
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 4 sc.
Rounds 2-3: With F, sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Hat:
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: 10 sc in 2nd ch from the hook – 10 sc.
Rounds 2-4: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 5, 6: With F, repeat Round 2. Fasten off. Turn up last 2 rounds for brim. With E, make a tiny pompom and attach to top of hat.
Scarf:
With D, ch 25. Fasten off. Knot strands of E to each end for fringe. Tack scarf to neck area.
FINISHING
Sew arms to body. Sew hat to head. With G satin stitch eyes.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m / 120 yds)
Sizes 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) and 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of red embroidery floss for mouth.
Small amount of black embroidery floss for eyelashes.
gauge: 16 sc and 20 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with smaller hook.
instructions:
Head 
**With smaller hook and MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 10 times more. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2 tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts. 
Stuff Head. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2 tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts. Fasten off. 
Ears (make 2) 
With MC and smaller hook, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
16 sc. 
Shape Ears: 1st row: Ch 1. Sc2 tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2 tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2 tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2 tog. Fasten off. 
Sew Ears to side of Head. 
Body 
With MC and smaller hook, ch 30. Join with sl st to first ch. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 2 ins [5 cm]. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4 ins [10 cm]. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off. 
Sew bottom edge of Body closed. Stuff Body. 
Arms (make 2) 
With MC and smaller hook, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2 tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4 ins [10 cm]. 
Fasten off. 
Stuff Arms lightly. 
Legs (make 2) 
Shoe: With A and smaller hook, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc. 
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc. 
9th to 12th rnds: As 3rd rnd. 
Beg working in rows: Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 
Rep last row once more. Fasten off. 
Fold back of shoe in half to form Heel. Sew back Heel seam. 
Join A with sl st to back of Shoe. Ch 1. Work 14 sc evenly around top edge of Shoe. Join B with sl st to first sc. Break A. 
Stuff Shoe. 
Leg: 1st rnd: With B, working in back loops only, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join C with sl st to first sc. 
Cont even, working 2 rnds C, 2 rnds B, until Leg from top of Shoe measures 4 ins [10 cm]. Fasten off. 
Stuff Leg. 
Shoe edging: With smaller hook, join A with sl st to rem loop of top of Shoe. *Ch 3. 1 sc in 3rd ch from hook. Sl st in same sp as last sl st - picot made. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first picot. Fasten off. 
Finishing 
Sew top of Legs closed using whip st. Attach Jingle Bell to tip of Shoe. Sew Legs to bottom of Body. Sew Arms to sides of Body. With black embroidery floss, embroider eyelashes on Head. Sew Beads to Head. With red embroidery floss, embroider mouth. 
Hair fringe 
Cut a piece of tape 5 ins [12.5 cm] long and secure onto a flat surface with sticky side up. Cut lengths of D 11 ins [28 cm] long and lay them across tape so strip of tape is in center of yarn. Holding tissue paper over top of yarn and using sewing machine, run a line of stitching along length of tape. Remove tape when hair is secure. Remove tissue paper after stitching. Pin fringe to top of head. Using backstitch and D, sew hair into place along sewn line, being sure to get all lengths secured in sts. Trim evenly. 
Hat 
Note: Ch 2 does not count as hdc. 
With larger hook and A, ch 36. Join with sl st to first ch, being careful not to twist ch. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 
2nd rnd: With B, ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 
3rd rnd: With A, as 2nd rnd. Join B. 
4th rnd: With B, ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – hdc2 tog made. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 30 hdc. 
5th rnd: With A, ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join B with sl st to first hdc. 
6th rnd: With B, ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Hdc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 24 sts. 
7th rnd: As 5th rnd. 
8th rnd: With B, ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 18 sts. 
9th rnd: As 5th rnd. 
10th rnd: With B, ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. Hdc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first hdc. 12 sts. 
11th rnd: As 5th rnd. 
12th rnd: With B, ch 2, *Hdc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join A with sl st to first st. 6 sts. 
13th rnd: As 5th rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem loops. Pull tightly and fasten securely. 
Sew Jingle Bell to top of Hat. 
Attach Hat to Head, sewing through all thicknesses. 
Dress 
Note: Ch 2 does not count as hdc. 
With larger hook and B, ch 40. Join with sl st to first ch, being careful not to twist ch. 
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 40 hdc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Hdc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 32 sts. 
4th and 5th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2 tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 24 sts. 
7th and 8th rnds: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 
Beg working in rows: 1st row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 24 hdc. Turn. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc across. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 5. Sl st in first hdc. (button loop made). Ch 2. 1 hdc in same st as last sl st. 1 hdc in each hdc across. Fasten off. 
Edging: Join C with sl st to any rem loop of foundation ch at bottom of dress. *Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Miss next 2 ch. Sl st in next ch. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to same sp as first sl st. Fasten off. 
Straps (make 2) 
With larger hook and B, ch 9. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 
Rep last row once more. Fasten off. 
Belt 
With larger hook and C, ch 24. Join with sl st to first ch, being careful not to twist ch. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Put Dress on doll, mark position for Straps. Sew Straps to Dress. Sew Belt to Dress as shown in picture. Sew button to back of Dress to correspond to button loop.

materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 194 yds /177 m) Ficus (61036) 1 ball or 40 yds/36.5 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 4 hdc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first hdc of 4-hdc group. Pull dropped loop through st. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting. Ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. PM. 6 sc. Do not join, cont working in spiral as follows. PM (first marker) for beg of rnd. Move marker up on rnds as work progresses.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Popcorn in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 15 sc.
5th and alt rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
6th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Popcorn in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 9 sc.
8th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Popcorn in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc.
10th rnd: 1 sc in next sc. Popcorn in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 16 sc.
12th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Popcorn in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 11 sc.
14th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Popcorn in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc.
16th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Popcorn in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 13 sc.
18th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Popcorn in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc.
20th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
Fill Pickle firmly with stuffing and optional catnip. 21st rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. Fasten off leaving long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Sport”: 1 Skein each No. 904 Jockey Red MC, No. 230 Yellow CA, No. 687 Paddy Green CB, No. 254 Pumpkin CC, and No. 1 White CD [2 1/2 oz (70 g), 240 yd (219 m)].
Yarn needle, small amount stuffing material.
abbreviations: CA, CB, etc = color A, B, etc
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Pail is approximately 9” high and 11” across. Fish are approximately 6” long and 3” high.
gauge: 15 sts = 4”; 7 rows = 4” in dc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
FISH
(Make 2 pieces each CA, CB, CC, and CD): Ch 10.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 9 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1; [draw up a lp in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 lps on hook – sc dec made; sc in next 5 sc, sc dec over last 2 sc; turn – 7 sc.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc dec over first 2 sc, sc to last 2 sc; sc dec; turn – 3 sc at end of Row 4.
Row 5: Ch 2, hdc in first sc, 3 hdc in next sc, hdc in last sc; turn – 5 hdc.
Row 6: Ch 2, hdc in first 2 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc, hdc in last 2 hdc; turn – 7 hdc.
Row 7: Ch 2, working in back lps only, hdc in first 3 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc, hdc in last 3 hdc; turn – 9 hdc.
Row 8: Ch 2, working in front lps only, hdc in first 4 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc, hdc in last 4 hdc; turn – 11 hdc.
Row 9: Ch 2, working in back lps only, hdc in first 5 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc, hdc in last 5 hdc; turn – 13 hdc.
Row 10: Ch 2, working in front lps only, hdc in first 6 hdc, 3 hdc in next hdc, hdc in last 6 hdc; turn – 15 hdc.
Row 11: Ch 2, working in back lps only, skip first hdc; [yo and draw up a lp in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 5 lps on hook – hdc dec made; hdc in next 4 hdc, 3 dc in next hdc, hdc in next 4 hdc, skip next hdc, hdc dec over last 2 hdc – 13 sts; turn.
Row 12: Ch 2, working in front lps only, skip first hdc, hdc dec, hdc in next 3 sts, 3 dc in next dc, hdc in next 3 sts, skip next hdc, hdc dec; turn – 11 sts.
Row 13: Ch 2, working in back lps only, skip first hdc, hdc dec, hdc in next 2 sts, 3 dc in next dc, hdc in next 2 sts, skip next hdc, hdc dec; turn – 9 sts.
Row 14: Ch 2, working in front lps only, skip first hdc, hdc dec, hdc in next st, 3 dc in next dc, hdc in next st, skip next hdc, hdc dec; turn – 7 sts.
Row 15: Ch 1, working in back lps only, skip first st, sc dec, 3 sc in next dc, skip next st, sc dec; turn – 5 sts.
Row 16: Ch 1, skip first st, sl st in next sc, 3 sc in next sc, skip next st, sl st in last sc. Fasten off.
With wrong sides tog, sew 2 matching pieces tog, stuffing lightly before closing seam.
FISHING PAIL
With MC, ch 4; join with a sl st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 3, 15 dc in ring; join with a sl st in top of ch-3 – 16 sts.
Rnd 2: Working in back lps only, ch 3, dc in same st as joining, [2 dc in next dc] 15 times; join – 32 sts.
Rnd 3: Working in back lps only, ch 3, dc in same st as joining, dc in next st, [2 dc in next st, dc in next st] 15 times; join – 48 sts.
Rnd 4: Working in back lps only, ch 3, dc in same st, dc in next 2 dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next 2 dc] 15 times; join – 64 sts.
Rnd 5: Working in back lps only, ch 3, dc in each dc around; join.
Rnd 6: Ch 3, dc in each dc around inc 4 sts evenly spaced; join – 68 sts. Fasten off.
Rnd 7: With wrong side facing, attach CA in any st; ch 1, sc in each st around; join in first sc; TURN.
Rnd 8: Working in back lps only, ch 2, skip first sc, hdc in each sc around; join in top of ch-2; TURN.
Rnd 9: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join; TURN. Fasten off.
Rnds 10 and 11: With right side facing, join MC in any sc and rep Rnd 6 – 76 sts at end of Rnd 11. Fasten off.
Rnds 12-14: With CB, rep Rnds 7-9.
Rnds 15 and 16: With MC, rep Rnd 6 – 84 sts at end of Rnd 16. Fasten off
Rnds 17-19: With CC, rep Rnds 7-9.
Rnds 20 and 21: With MC, rep Rnd 6 – 92 sts at end of Rnd 21. TURN at end of Rnd 21; do not fasten off.
Rnds 22 and 23: Working in back lps only, ch 1, sc in each st around; join to first sc; TURN. Fasten off.
Handle
With MC, ch 56.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across changing to CA in last sc; turn – 55 sc.
Row 2: With CA, ch 1, working back lps only, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Rep Row 2 changing to MC in last sc.
Rows 4 and 5: With MC, rep Rows 2 and 3. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew each end of the handle to opposite sides of the pail. With CA and wrong side facing, sl st loosely in front lps across handle and top of pail. Rep for other side of handle and pail. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 440 yds/402 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Pair of safety eyes 12 mm in diameter.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• Rnds are joined with a sl st to first sc.
Snout:
With B, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 dc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each around. Join
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

Nose
With D, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 12 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
3rd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Fasten off, leaving long tail. Sew Nose onto Snout as shown in photo, stuffing as you seam.

Main Body and Head:
With A, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Join. 40 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sc.
7th to 24th rnds: As 5th rnd.
25th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * around. 45 sts.
26th and alt rnds: As 5th rnd.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
29th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Join. 35 sts.
31st rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
33rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. 25 sts.
35th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 50 sts.
37th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Join. 55 sts.
38th to 47th rnds: As 5th rnd.
48th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 44 sts.
49th rnd: As 5th rnd.
50th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Join. 33 sts.
51st rnd: As 5th rnd.
52nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 22 sts.
53rd rnd: As 5th rnd.
Stuff Body and Head. Add safety eyes as shown in photo, approx 8 rnds below final rnd. Sew Snout on Head as shown in photo, stuffing as you seam.
54th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through rem sts and pull tight to close.

Arms and Legs (make 4)
With C, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Break C. Join A.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Join. 16 sts.
8th rnd: As 6th rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Join. 12 sts.
Rep 6th rnd 10 times more (or until Arms and Legs measure desired length.)
Fasten off, leaving long tail. Stuff with polyfill. Fold last rnd of Arms in half and sew flat. Sew Arms along 33rd rnd of Body as shown in photo. Fold last rnd of Arms in half and sew flat. Sew Back Legs to sides of Body to make support for sitting position - see picture.

Antlers (make 2)
With C, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join.
2nd to 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Fasten off, and stuff with polyfill.

Antler Branches (make 2)
With C, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Fasten off, and stuff with polyfill. Sew to Antlers as shown in photo.

Ears
With A, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in last st. Turn. 6 sts.
4th to 5th rows: As 2nd row.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
7th row: As 2nd row.
8th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Ear. Join. Fasten off.
Sew Ears to Head as shown in photo.
Optional: Make a pompom tail.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 239 yds/219m)
1 ball of yarn will make 2 Puppies.
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Pair of ¼" [6 mm] safety eyes.
Black embroidery floss for nose and mouth.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Note: Before start, separate the different color sections of the yarn as follows: Push the rings of color out from center. Find the point where the color changes and cut the yarn. Rep this process for the rem yarn colors. Wind each color into a separate ball. To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work. Do not join at the end of rnd, work in continuous rnds. PM at end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
Version 1
MUZZLE 
**With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. 5 sc. PM at end of rnd. 
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each of next 5 sc. 10 sc. 
3rd rnd:  (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. 15 sc. 
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. 20 sc. 
5th and 6th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.** Join with sl st in first sc at end of last rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. 
With black floss, using Straight stitch, embroider nose and mouth onto muzzle as shown in picture. 
EARS (make 2)
With B, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. 5 sc. PM at end of rnd. 
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
3rd rnd:  2 sc in each of next 5 sc. 10 sc. 
4th and 5th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. 
6th rnd:  (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 5 times. 15 sc. 
7th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. 
HEAD
Beg at top of head, with B, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. 6 sc. PM at end of rnd. 
2nd rnd:  Work 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 12 sc. 
3rd rnd:  (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc. 
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 24 sc. 
5th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 30 sc. 
6th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 36 sc. 
7th to 11th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Break B at end of last rnd. Join A. 
12th to 17th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. 
18th rnd:  (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 30 sts. 
19th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
20th rnd:  (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 24 sts. 
21st rnd: 1 sc in each st around. 
Following manufacturer's instructions, attach safety eyes between 14th and 15th rnds, approx 10 sts apart. 
Lightly stuff muzzle and sew in place between eyes. 
Stuff head. 
22nd rnd:  (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 18 sts. 
23rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 12 sts. 
24th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. 
Finish stuffing Head. 
Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
Thread end through all sts of last rnd. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. 
BODY
Stripe Pat
With D – 2 rnds
With C – 2 rnds
These 4 rnds form Stripe Pat.
Beg at bottom of body, with D, ch 2.
Proceed in Stripe Pat as follows:
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook Do not join. 6 sc. PM at end of rnd. 
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 12 sc. 
3rd rnd:  (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc. 
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 24 sc. 
5th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 30 sc. 
6th to 12th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. 
13th rnd:  (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 24 sts. 
14th rnd: 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing body to head. 
FRONT LEGS (make 2)
First Leg: With B, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. 8 sc. PM at end of rnd. 
Next 9 rnds:  1 sc in each sc around, stuffing leg as you work. 
Join with sl st in first sc at end of last rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
Sew open end of leg closed. 
Second Leg:  Work as given for First Leg, working 4 rnds with A, then 5 rnds with B. 
BACK LEGS (make 2)
With B, ch 2. 
1st rnd:  10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not  join. 10 sc. PM at end of rnd. 
Next 9 rnds:  1 sc in each sc around, stuffing leg as you work. 
Join with sl st in first sc at end of last rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
TINY TAIL
With B, ch 2. 
1st rnd:  6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not  join. 10 sc. PM at end of rnd 
2nd and 3rd rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. 
Join with sl st in first sc at end of last rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
FINISHING
Referring to picture as a guide to placement, sew Ears to Head. 
Stuff Body and sew to Head. 
Sew Front Legs to upper front of Body. 
Sew Back Legs to lower front of Body. 
Sew Tail to center rear of Body. 
Version 2
MUZZLE: Work from ** to ** as given for Version 1. Turn at end of 6th rnd.
Forehead Stripe
Note: Work back and forth in rows.
7th row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
8th to 15th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.
Fasten off at end of last row, leaving a long end for sewing.
With black floss, embroider nose and mouth onto muzzle as shown in picture. 
EARS and HEAD:  With C, work as given for Version 1, omitting color changes.
BODY: With D, work as given for Version 1, omitting color changes.
FRONT LEGS:  With A, work as given for Version 1, omitting color changes.
BACK LEGS and TINY TAIL:  With C, work as given for Version 1.
FINISHING: Work as given for Version 1.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Tan Pink (10898) 1 ball or 215 yds/197 m
Contrast B Vintage White (10006) 1 ball or 48 yds/44 m
Bernat® Blanket™ (5.3 oz/150 g; 108 yds/98 m)
Contrast C Cranberry (00705) 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Bernat® Blanket™ Brights (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast D Go-Go Green (12004) 1 ball or 26 yds/24 m
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn for embroidery.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
instructions:
Notes: 
• Join with sl st to first sc at end of each rnd.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw loop of next color through 2 loops on hook to complete stitch and proceed in next color.
• When working rounds with color changes, carry color not in use loosely along top of previous round, towards WS of work and work stitches over yarn to prevent stranding.

HEAD
See diagram on page 5.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
7th to 10th rnds: As 3rd rnd.

CHEEKS
See diagram on page 5.
Note: When working following rnds, carry color not in use loosely along top of previous rnd, towards WS of work and work sts over yarn to prevent stranding.
1st rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. With B, (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 9 times. 2 sc in next sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 50 sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 29 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. With B, sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. Sc2tog. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 48 sts.
4th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. With B, sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Sc2tog. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 46 sts.
5th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. With B, (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. Sc2tog. With A, 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 40 sts.
6th rnd: With A, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Sc2tog. With B, sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. With A, sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 32 sts.
7th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Fasten off leaving a long end to sew Head to Body during Finishing.

EARS (make 2)
Outer Ear
See diagram on page 5.
With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts) twice. Join. 8 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts) twice. Join. 6 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 4 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Join. Fasten off.

Inner Ear
See diagram on page 5. 
With B, ch 5.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog.
Fasten off, leaving long tail.
Using long tail, sew Inner Ear to one side of Outer Ear.

BODY
See diagram on page 6.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 hdc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 hdc.
7th and 8th rnds: As 5th rnd.
9th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Join.
10th and 11th rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Join.
12th rnd: With A, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. With B, sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Sc2tog. With A, 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 46 sts.
13th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 18 sts. With A, 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. Join.
14th rnd: With A, ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) twice. With B, sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. With A, (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) twice. Join. 38 sts.
15th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. With A, 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Join.
16th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. With B, sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. With A, 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Join. 36 sts.
17th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. With A, 1 sc in each of next 12 sts. Join.
18th rnd: With A, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. With B, sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. With A, 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 32 sts.
19th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. With B, 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. With A, 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Join. Break B.
20th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.
Stuff Body.

TAIL
See diagram on page 6.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc) twice. Join. 18 sts.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
12th to 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
16th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) twice. Join. 16 sts.
17th to 26th rnds: As 11th rnd.
Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long tail to sew to Body during Finishing.
Stuff just end of Tail (approx 3" [7.5 cm]) lightly.
Sew Tail closed along last rnd.

ARMS (make 2)
See diagram on page 6.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long tail.
Stuff Arm very lightly.
Sew Arm closed along last rnd.

FINISHING
Notes:
• Safety eyes cannot be moved once they are properly attached. It’s best to make sure you’re happy with eye placement using stitch markers before inserting them.
• Eyes on sample are positioned along 1st row of Cheeks, approx 9 sc in from each side, with approx 6 sc between eyes.
Mark eye placement with stitch markers. Following manufacturer’s instructions, attach Safety Eyes at markers.
Stuff Head, placing slightly more stuffing in Cheeks.
With black worsted weight yarn, embroider nose and mouth as shown in photo.
Making sure front of Head is centered to front of Body, attach by sewing last rnd of Head to Body through front loops of 19th rnd.
Pin Ears into place at top of Head and sew into place.
Sew Arms to either side of Body, approx 1" [2.5 cm] from Belly, with top of Arm at Neck.
Pin Tail into place at center back. Sew into place along bottom and sides to neck allowing stuffed portion of Tail to be free and floppy, and sewing through just the bottom layer of Tail.

STRAWBERRY
See diagram on page 4.
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 8 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
8th rnd: As 6th rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
Fasten off.
With B, embroider ‘seeds’ using straight st around sides of Strawberry.

STRAWBERRY TOP
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 9 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 18 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *(Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc) – Leaf made. Rep from * around, ending with sl st in same sc as beg ch 3. Fasten off.

Stem
With D, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Fasten off, leaving a tail approx 5" [12.5 cm] long.
Thread tail end through center of Top and secure on WS.
Stuff Strawberry. Sew Top to Strawberry, aligning sts of 3rd rnd of Top to last rnd of Strawberry.
Attach Strawberry to ‘hands’ at front as shown in photo, bringing yarn through just bottom layer of Arms and through sides of Strawberry.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket Frosting™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Very Berry (61016) 1 ball or 218 yds/193 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
5 yds [4.5 m] of black worsted weight yarn for embroidery
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Bear is worked in continuous spiral. Do not join at end of rnds.
• Work in spiral in continuous rnds, moving marker onto first st for beg of each rnd.
FIRST LEG
**Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 7 sc in ring. Do not join.
Proceed working in spiral as follows:
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 14 sc. PM on first sc to mark beg of rnd.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd, working in continuous spiral, moving marker onto first st at beg of each rnd until Leg measures 7" [18 cm].**
Fasten off.
SECOND LEG
Work from ** to ** as given for First Leg. Do not fasten off at end of Second Leg.
Join Legs: 1st rnd: 2 sc in next sc of Second Leg (PM on first sc). 2 sc in first sc of First Leg to join. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc of First Leg. 2 sc in last sc of First Leg. 2 sc in next sc of Second Leg. 1 sc in each of rem 12 sc of Second Leg. 32 sc. Do not join rnd.
BODY
1st rnd: *2 sc in next sc (PM on first sc). 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc. Do not join. Work in spiral in continuous rnds.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd, working in spiral, until Body measures approx 6" [15 cm] from Leg join, stuffing lightly as you work.
1st rnd: (Dec rnd). *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
3rd rnd: (Dec rnd). *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
5th rnd: (Dec rnd). *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 20 sts.
6th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
Fasten off.
HEAD
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. PM on first sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 32 sc.
6th rnd: As 4th rnd.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
8th to 14th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
15th rnd: (Dec rnd). *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
16th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
17th rnd: (Dec rnd). *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
18th rnd: As 16th rnd.
19th rnd: (Dec rnd). *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 16 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail to sew Head to Body.
Stuff Head.
EARS (Make 2)
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. PM on first sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 14 sc.
3rd rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) twice. 16 sc.
4th and 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long tail for seaming.
Fold Ear in half and sew bottom edge closed using long tail.
ARMS (Make 2)
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. PM on first sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures approx 6" [15 cm].
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for seaming.
Stuff half the Arms lightly, leaving the top unstuffed.
Using long tail, attach Arms at top of Neck opening using Whipstitch, centering Arms with sides of Body.
FINISHING
Attach Head to Body using whipstitch, adding extra stuffing into neck to better stabilize Head.
Pin Ears into position at top of Head, with top of Ear aligned with 2nd rnd of Head.
Attach Ears to head, curving them slightly.
WHIPSTITCH
With Black worsted weight yarn, embroider Eyes and Nose using Satin Stitch. Embroider Mouth using Straight stitch as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® Shimmer®: 1 ball each 1012 Black A and 1929 Red B
RED HEART® Buttercup®: 1 ball 4270 White C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 3.75mm [US F-5], 4mm [US G-6], and 6.5mm [K-10.5]
1 yd (1 m) ½” (12.7 mm) wide white satin ribbon
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Clothes designed for 18” (45.5 cm) doll. Dress measures 12” circumference around bodice x 11” long (30.5 x 28 cm). Shrug measures: 15” across sleeves x 7” long (38 x 18 cm). Shoe measures: 3½” (9 cm) long. Purse measures: 2½” long by 3” wide (6.5 x 7.5 cm), closed and not including strap.
gauge: 15 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet with medium hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DRESS
Note: Work all sections of dress with medium hook.
Bodice
Working from lower edge up, with A, ch 44; join with slip st in first ch. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each ch around; join with slip st in first sc, turn—44 sc.
Rounds 2–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc, turn.
Right Back
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—10 sc.
Row 10–15: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Right Back Shoulder
Row 16: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—5 sc.
Row 17–20: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Fasten off.
Front
Row 9 (right side): With right side facing, skip next 2 sc of Row 8, join A with sc in next st, sc in each remaining sc, turn—20 sc.
Rows 10–13: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Left Front Shoulder 
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—5 sc.
Rows 15–20: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Fasten off.
Right Front Shoulder
Row 14: With wrong side facing, skip next 10 sc of Row 8, join A with sc in next st, sc in remaining 4 sc, turn—5 sc.
Rows 15–20: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Fasten off.
Left Back Shoulder
Row 9: With right side facing, skip next 2 sc of Row 8, join A with sc in next st, sc in each remaining sc, turn—10 sc.
Rows 10–15: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Fasten off.
Row 16: With wrong side facing, skip next 5 sc of Row 15, join A with sc in next st, sc in each remaining sc, turn—5 sc.
Notes
1. Doll set consists of dress, shrug, shoes, and purse.
2. Top of dress is made in rows and joined rounds; skirt is worked in joined rounds.
3. Shrug begins in continuous rounds to form first sleeve, body is worked in turned rows, and then second sleeve is worked in continuous rounds. You may find it helpful to place a stitch marker for beginning of round and move it up as each round is completed.
Neck Edging
Row 1: With right side of left back facing, join A with sc in first sc of Row 15, ch 6, slip st in 5th ch from hook (button loop made); working in each remaining st and across ends of rows, sc 44 sts evenly around. Fasten off.
Armhole Edging (work 2)
Round 1: With right side of bodice facing, join A with sc in any sc in Row 8; working in each remaining st and across ends of rows, sc 28 sts evenly around. Fasten off.
Skirt
Round 1 (right side): With right side facing and working across opposite side of foundation ch of bodice, join B with sc in first ch, sc in each remaining ch; join with slip st in first sc, turn—44 sc.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first sc, 2 dc in each sc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch, turn—88 dc.
Rounds 3–12: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
Round 13: Ch 1, (sc, ch 4) in each dc across; join with slip st in first sc—88 sc and 88 ch-4 spaces. Fasten off.
SHRUG
Note: Sleeves are worked in continuous rounds and body is worked back and forth in rows.
First Sleeve
With largest hook and C, ch 14; join with slip st in first ch. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in each ch around—14 sc. Do not join or turn. Optional: Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Repeat Round 2 until piece measures 3½” (9 cm), turn.
Body
Next Row (right side): Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Repeat last row until piece measures 10” (25.5 cm) from beginning edge.
Second Sleeve
Next Round: With same side as first sleeve facing, sc in each sc around. Do not join or turn. Optional: Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Repeat last round until piece measures 13½” (34.5 cm) from beginning edge. Fasten off.
Edging
Round 1: With right side facing of body facing, join C with sc in end of first row, sc in same row, working 2 sc in each st or in end of each row, sc 62 sts around body and sleeve edges; join with slip st in first sc, turn—64 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off. 
PURSE
With medium hook and A, ch 21. 
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 18 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working on opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in next 19 ch, turn—41 sc. Do not join. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 20 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 20 sc, turn—43 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 21 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 21 sc, turn—45 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 22 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 22 sc, turn—47 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 23 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 23 sc, turn—49 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 24 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last 24 sc—51 sc. Do not turn.
Last Row (strap): Ch 51, slip st in first sc of last row; Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Bring bottom edge with strap to 13th st from beginning edge and sew side edges together.
SHOES (make 2)
With smallest hook and A, ch 9.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 6 ch; working on opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in next 6 ch; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc. Optional: Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, 2 sc in next 2 sc, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in last 6 sc; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice, sc in next 6 sc, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, sc in next 6 sc; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Rounds 4 and 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 16 sc, [sc2tog] 4 times, sc in remaining 6 sc; join with slip st in first sc—26 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first 14 sc, [sc2tog] 4 times, sc in remaining 4 sc; join with slip st in first sc—22 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first 13 sc, ch 6 (shoe strap made), skip next 7 sc, sc in last 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc—22 sc and 1 strap). Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew button near top edge of right back with sewing thread. 
Tie ribbon around waist and trim ends as desired.
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Purple Grapes Main Color (MC) Black Currant (01318) 1 ball or 60 m/66 yds
Contrast A Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 6 m/7 yds
Green Grapes Main Color (MC) Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 60 m/66 yds
Contrast A Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball or 6 m/7 yds
Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 9½" (24 cm) long x 1¾" (4.5 cm) diameter.
instructions:
GRAPES (make 15).
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Draw up loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw loop through all loops on hook – sc2tog made) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Lightly stuff Grape. Thread end through rem sts and draw tightly.
STEM (make 1).
With A, ch 16.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 9 ch. Ch 7. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Grapes to Stem as shown in picture.

materials: lily® sugar’n cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4” [10 cm] with smaller hook. 15 sc and 16 rows = 4” [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Doll
First leg
note: Stuff Legs as you work.
**shoe: With smaller hook and A, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. 
Do not turn. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 
sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of 
next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 
4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join 
with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (Draw up a 
loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog 
made) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of 
next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of 
next 6 sc. Join B with sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
stocking: 8th rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each 
st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with 
sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Stocking from top of shoe measures 2½” [6 cm]. Fasten 
off. Stuff Shoe.
Breeches cuff: With A, ch 14 loosely. Join with sl st to first ch. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not 
break A.
attach Breeches cuff to stocking: 1st rnd: Align Breeches Cuff over 
Stocking, having Cuff on outside of Stocking. With A, ch 1. Working 
through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 14 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Leg from top of Shoe measures 6” [15 cm]. Fasten off. 
Stuff Leg.
second leg 
Work as given for First Leg. Do not fasten off.
Cont as follows for Body:
Body
Breeches: 1st rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc of Second Leg. 
1 sc in 14 sc of First Leg. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc of Second Leg. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 4 times more, joining mc at end of last rnd.
Body: next rnd: With mc, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first 
sc. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of last  
6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
next 5 rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join 
with sl st to first sc.
next rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 28 sts.
next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
next rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 24 sts.
next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
next rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 20 sc. Fasten off.
head 
With smaller hook and mc, ch 2.
**1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.**
6th to 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
17th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts. 
18th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Stuff Head.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 
8 sts. Fasten off.
arms (make 2).
With smaller hook and mc, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in 
each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 8 sts.
7th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4½” [11.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Stuff Arms lightly.
Finishing 
Attach Arms to sides of Body. Sew Head to Body. Sew beads to front of 
Head for eyes. With red embroidery floss, embroider mouth.
hair 
With smaller hook and C, ch 2.
Work from ** to ** as given for Head.
next 4 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 26 sc. turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 26 sc. Turn.
next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last row 4 times more. 16 sts at end of last row. Fasten off.
Sew Hair to Head.
clothing
top 
Front and Back (make 2 alike).
With larger hook and A, ch 18.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 
17 sc.
2nd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 
Turn. 16 sts.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 14 sts.
10th and 11th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
12th row: As 9th row. 12 sts.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
14th row: As 9th row. 10 sts.
15th row: Sl st in each of next 2 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc 
in each of next 7 sc. turn. Leave rem sc unworked. 8 sts.
16th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
17th and 18th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
shape neck: 19th row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 2 hdc in first sc. 1 sc in next 
sc. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 3 hdc in last sc. Fasten off.
sleeve (make 2).
With larger hook and A, ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 
11 sc.
2nd to 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
9th row: Sl st in first 2 sc. Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. 
turn. Leave rem st unworked. 7 sts.
10th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sts.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Leave rem st unworked. Fasten 
off.
collar (make 2 alike).
Beg at neckline with larger hook and B, ch 8.
1st row: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in next 
ch) twice. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 2 hdc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 
2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 3 hdc in last sc. 
Turn. 14 sts.
3rd row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in first hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc 
in each of next 2 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sl st in each of next 2 sts. 
1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in each of 
next 2 hdc. Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew Top side seams. Put Top on doll. Sew shoulder seams. Put Sleeves 
on Arms and mark placement on Top. Sew Sleeves to Top. Sew Collar at 
neckline as shown in picture.
hat
With smaller hook and A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join 
with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 
11 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 26 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of 
next 12 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 28 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc) twice. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of 
next 14 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 32 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc) twice. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 34 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of 
next 16 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 36 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc) twice. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 38 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of 
next 18 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 40 sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc) twice. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each 
of next 20 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 44 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc) twice. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 46 sc.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each 
of next 22 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 48 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc 
in next sc) 8 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (2 sc in 
next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 7 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of 
next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 8 times. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 72 sc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of 
next 8 sc) 7 times. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 80 sc. Fasten off.
Belt
With larger hook and A, ch 24. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring, 
taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 
Fasten off.
large buckle (make 2).
With smaller hook and d, ch 4. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (3 sc. Ch 1) 4 times into ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
small buckle (make 2).
With smaller hook and d, ch 2. 
1st rnd: (1 sc. Ch 1) 4 times in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first 
sc. Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew 1 Large Buckle to center of both Belt and Hat as shown in picture. 
Sew 1 Small Buckle to top of each Shoe as shown in picture.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m)
Contrast B Ever After Pink (86020) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Polyester fiberfill. Small amount of black embroidery floss for Eyes.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.

FIRST LEG
Beg at Feet: With B, ch 7.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 14 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join. 20 sc.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join. 26 sc.

4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break B. Join A.

5th rnd: With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

6th to 8th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (sc2tog) 6 times. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Join. 20 sts.

10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Join. 18 sts.

11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 18 sc.

12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until Leg measures approx 5" [12.5 cm] from 5th rnd. Fasten off.

SECOND LEG
Work as given for First Leg. Do not fasten off.
Stuff Legs.
Cont as follows for Body:

BODY
Join Legs: 1st rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 1 sc in first sc of First leg. 1 sc in each sc of First leg around. 1 sc in each of rem 11 sc of Second Leg. Join. 36 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 40 sc.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 42 sc.

5th to 16th rnds: As 3rd rnd.

17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 7 times. Join. 35 sts.

18th rnd: As 3rd rnd.

19th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 32 sts.

20th rnd: As 3rd rnd.

21st rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 28 sts.

22nd rnd: As 3rd rnd.

23rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 21 sts.

24th rnd: As 3rd rnd.

25th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 3 times. Join. 18 sts.

26th rnd: As 3rd rnd. Fasten off.

Stuff Body.

ARMS (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 18 sc.

4th to 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

9th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) twice. Join. 16 sts.

10th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.

13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.

14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 
Rep last rnd 10 times more. Fasten off.

Stuff Arms.

HEAD
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.

2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.

3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.

4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.

5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.

7th rnd: As 5th rnd. 
Rep last rnd 7 times more.

Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sts.

Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.

Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts. Fasten off.

Stuff Head.

OUTER EAR (make 2)
With A, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 4 sc.

2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc.

3rd and 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sc.

6th and 7th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows.

8th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc.

9th to 20th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

21st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 8 sts.

22nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.

23rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.

24th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Fasten off.

Edging: Join A with sl st to bottom right corner of Ear. Ch 1. Work sc evenly up right side of Ear, having 3 sc in tip of Ear, then down left side. Fasten off.
