measurements: Princess measures 6” tall. Frog measures 6½” high from top of eyes to bottom of body.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 20 rnds = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
PRINCESS
HEAD AND BODY: Begin at top of head with B, ch 2. Rnd 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc. Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc. Rnd 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc. Rnd 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 30 sc. Rnds 6-12: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 13: [Dec] 15 times – 15 sc. Neck-Rnd 14: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 3 times – 12 sc. Body-Rnd 15: [Inc] 12 times – 24 sc. Cut B. Stuff head. Rnds 16-24: With A, sc in each sc around. Stuff body. Rnd 25: [Dec] 12 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 26: [Dec] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off. Finish stuffing. Weave yarn tail through remaining 6 sc, draw up firmly to gather; fasten securely.
ARM (Make 2): With B, ch 2. Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook. Rnd 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] twice – 8 sc. Rnds 3-6: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Stuff lightly. Sew opening flat and sew in place.
HAIR: With D, ch 2. Rnds 1-3: Repeat Rnds 1-3 of Head – 18 sc. Rnd 4: Working in front lps only, slip st in first sc, * ch 10, 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across **, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join. Fasten off. Sew Rnds 1-3 to center top of head.
CROWN: With C, ch 13. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 12 sc. Row 2: [Ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times; bring beginning of this row around and join with a slip st to first sc. Fasten off. Sew to top center of hair.
EARS: With B, ch 2. Row 1: 3 Sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn. Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc. Fasten off. Sew ears in place.
Sew on button eyes with black pearl cotton. Embroider smile with red pearl cotton. Color cheeks with crayon.
SKIRT: With A, ch 25. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 24 sc. Row 2: Ch 3, dc in first sc, 2 dc in each sc across; turn – 48 sts. Row 3: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in each dc across and in top of ch-3; turn. Row 4: Ch 1, [sc in dc, skip next dc, 5 dc in next dc, skip next dc] 12 times. Fasten off. Sew to waist; sew back seam.
LEG (Make 2): With B, ch 2. Rnds 1 and 2: Repeat Rnds 1 and 2 of Head – 12 sc. Rnd 3: Sc in each sc around. Rnd 4: Sc in first sc, [dec] 3 times, sc in last 5 sc – 9 sc. Rnds 5-7: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Stuff. Sew in place.
FROG
HEAD AND BODY-Rnds 1-26: Work same as Princess Rnds 1-26 all with A.
EYE (Make 2): With A, ch 2. Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook. Rnd 2: [Sc in next sc, inc] 3 times – 9 sc.
Rnd 3: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Insert wiggle eye. Sew in place at top of head as pictured.
ARM (Make 2)-Rnds 1-3: Work same as Princess Rnds 1-3 with A. Row 4: Hold work flat and work 4 sc across through both thicknesses; turn – 4 sc. “Fingers”-Row 5: Ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, skip first sc on Row 4, slip st in next sc, [ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, slip st in next sc on Row 4] twice. Fasten off. Sew in place.
LEG (Make 2)-Rnds 1-3: Work same as Princess Rnds 1-3. Rnds 4 and 5: Sc in each sc around. Stuff. Row 6: Hold work flat and work 6 sc across through both thicknesses; turn – 6 sc. “Toes”-Row 7: Ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, skip first sc on Row 6, slip st in next sc, [ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] twice. Fasten off. Sew in place.
With B, stitch mouth as pictured. Weave in ends.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic Crochet Size 10 (400 yds; 365.76 m) Main Color (MC) Natural (0226) 1 ball
Aunt Lydia’s® Metallic Crochet Size 10 (100 yds; 91.4 m) Contrast A White/Silver (0015) 1 ball
Susan Bates® Steelite® crochet hook U.S. 7-8 (1.5-1.6 mm) or size needed to obtain gauge.
Beads or black floss for eyes.
Small amount of poly fiberfill to stuff.
abbreviations: Picot = Ch 3. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
instructions:
TIP from designer: 
Use the trick quilters use to bury their knots when hand quilting. Make a knot close to the surface of the work and pull the knot into the interior and out the other side. Trim thread close to exit point.
Notes:  
• Nose, head and body are worked in one piece.
• Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Beg at Nose, with A, make Magic Loop.
1st rnd: 6 sc in magic loop. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc. Fasten off A.
3rd rnd: Join MC with sl st to back loop of any sc. Ch 1. 1 scbl in same sp as sl st and each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 16 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 20 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 24 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 30 sc.
9th to 19th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 30 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 24 sts.
Stuff Body.
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Join. 18 sts. 
22nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Join. 12 sts. 
Finish stuffing. 
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sts. Fasten off, leaving an end 12-18" [30.5–45.5 cm] long. Thread end through front loops of rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely. 
TAIL
With MC, ch 9. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. 8 sc. 
Fasten off.
EARS (Make 2)
With MC, ch 5. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn. 3 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 2 sts.
4th row: Ch 2. Skip first sc. 1 hdc in next sc. Fasten off. 
Sew Ears to head as shown in picture. 
LEGS (make 4)
Note: Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as st.
Beg at bottom, with A, make Magic Loop.  
1st rnd:  8 sc in magic loop. Join. 8 sc. Fasten off A. 
2nd rnd: Join MC with sl st to back loop of any sc. Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in same sp as sl st and each sc around. Join. 8 hdc. 
Fasten off, leaving an end 12-18" [30.5–45.5 cm] long for sewing Legs to Body.   
Stuff Legs.
WINGS (make 2)
With A, ch 6, leaving a long end. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. Skip next sc. 5 dc in next sc. Skip next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 9 sts.   
3rd row: Picot. Skip first sc. *Sl st in next sc. Picot. Skip next st. Rep from * to last sc. Sl st in last sc. Fasten off. 
TIPS from designer: 
• Remove the metallic wrap from the Tail to make threading the needle and sewing easier.
FINISHING 
Sew Tail as shown in picture. 
Sew Legs as shown in picture.
Sew Wings to Back as shown in picture.
Sew on 2 black beads for eyes as shown in picture. 
Optional: With black embroidery floss embroider eyes using French Knot.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (454 g/16 oz; 742 m/812 yds) Sky Blue (10508) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Two safety eyes ¾" [2 cm] diameter (or buttons)
Scraps of pink yarn (for nose) and brown yarn (for mouth)
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook

Lp st = (Loop stitch). Wrap yarn around index finger twice and hold behind work, insert hook into indicated st and between yarn wrap and finger. Pull all loops through. Yoh and draw through all loops. Note: Loops form on WSof work
measurements: Approx 21" [53.5 cm] from head to toe. Approx 10" [25.5 cm] seated.
instructions:
NOTES:
Bunny is worked in continuous rnds. Do not join and do not turn at end of rnds. PM for beg of rnd. Move marker as each rnd is worked.
Stuff body, head, arms, and legs as work progresses. Do not stuff ears or tail.

BODY 
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
6 sc.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 
12 sc.
3rd rnd:  (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th rnd: (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 24 sc.
5th to 10th rnds:  Cont in same manner, inc 6 sc every rnd. 60 sc.
11th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in next sc). 66 sc.
13th to 18th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
19th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 60 sts.
20th to 23rd rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
24th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. 54 sts.
25th to 34th rnds:  Cont in same manner, dec 6 sc every following 5th rnd. 42 sts.
35th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
36th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog) 6 times. 36 sts.
37th to 40th rnds:  Cont in same manner, dec 6 sc every following alt rnd. 24 sts.
41st and 42nd rnds: 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

HEAD
Work 1st to 6th rnds as given for Body. 36 sts.
7th and 8th rnds:  1 sc in each st around.
9th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 17 sts. 2 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 17 sts. 38 sts.
10th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 14 sts. 40 sts.
11th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 19 sts. 2 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 19 sts. 42 sts.
12th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 18 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 18 sts. 44 sts.
13th rnd:  (1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 2 sc in next st) 4 times. 48 sts.
14th to 24th rnds:  1 sc in each st around.
Attach safety eyes at 11th rnd, 3 sts before and 3 sts after 2-sc incs.
25th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts) 6 times. 42 sts.
26th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog) 6 times. 36 sts.
27th to 31st rnds:  Cont in same manner, dec 6 sc every rnd. 6 sts. 
Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving long end.
Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.

ARMS 
Rep 1st to 4th rnds as given for Body. 24 sts.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
6th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 27 sts.
7th to 11th rnds:  1 sc in each st around.
12th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog) 3 times. 24 sts.
13th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts) 3 times. 21 sts.
14th and 15th rnds: Cont in same manner, dec 3 sc every rnd. 15 sts.
16th to 39th rnds:  1 sc in each st around. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

LEGS 
Rep 1st to 4th rnds as given for Body. 24 sts.
5th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 27 sts.
6th to 12th rnds:  1 sc in each st around.
Heel shaping: Proceed in rows as follows:
1st row: 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 8 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 9 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Hdc2tog over side edge of row and next unworked st of 12th rnd. Turn. 10 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Hdc2tog over side edge of row and next unworked st of 12th rnd. Turn. 11 sts.
5th and 6th rows: As 3rd and 4th rows. 13 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Hdc2tog over side edge of row and next unworked st of 12th rnd. Work across sts of 12th rnd as follows: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Sc2tog. Sc2tog over last st and side edge of beg of rnd. Do not turn. 25 sts.
8th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 9 sts. 1 sc in each of next 14 sts.
9th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 7 sts. 1 sc in each of next 15 sts.
10th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog) 5 times. 20 sts.
11th to 54th rnds:  1 sc in each st around. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

EARS 
Rep 1st and 2nd rnds as given for Body. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
4th rnd:  (1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st) 6 times. 18 sts.
5th to 8th rnds:  Cont in same manner, inc 6 sc every following alt rnd. 30 sts.
9th to 22nd rnds:  1 sc in each st around. 
23rd rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts) 3 times. 27 sts.
24th to 27th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
28th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog) 3 times. 24 sts.
29th to 43rd rnds:  Cont in same manner, dec 3 sc every following 5th rnd. 15 sts.
44th to 52nd rnds: 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

TAIL
Ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
6 sc.
2nd rnd: Lp st in each st around.
3rd rnd: 2 lp st in each st around. 
12 sts.
4th rnd: (Lp st in next st. 2 lp st in next st) 6 times. 18 sts. Fasten off.
Turn work inside out. 

FINISHING
Sew head to top of body. 
Sew ears to top of head. 
Sew arms to sides of body. Sew legs to bottom of body along 11th rnd.
Sew tail to back of body. 
Using photograph as a guide, with pink yarn embroider nose using Satin st. With brown yarn, embroider mouth using Straight st.

materials: 1 skein each of 360 Café Latte A, 506 Pool B, 324 Bright Yellow C, 3620 Glowworm D, and 312 Black E
Note: Only a small amounts of D and E are needed.
Yarn needle, stitch marker, stuffing, ½" [13 mm] button for cape (optional)
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, and E = Color A, B, C, D, and E
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 12 sts = 3"; 14 rows = 3" in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEAD
Beginning at nose with A, ch 2. 
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 4–7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc, sc in last 9 sc—30 sc.
Rounds 11 and 12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 14 and 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 19: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 20: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Stuff head.
Round 21: Sc in each sc around.
Round 22: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through the stitches of last round and pull to gather. Weave in end securely.
Facial Features: With E, embroider satin stitch eyes and nose, and straight stitch mouth.
RHC0334-016803M | LAST UPDATED: AUGUST 1, 2019
CROCHET  
SKILL LEVEL
EASY
SHOP KIT
SUPER HERO BEAR SET | CROCHET    1 of 3

EAR (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of head—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 4 times—8 sc.
Fasten off. Do not stuff ear. Flatten and sew ears to head.
BODY
Beginning at top with C, ch 6; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 2 sc in each ch around—12 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. 
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 8-18: Sc in each sc around.
Begin stuffing body and continue to stuff until piece is complete.
Divide for Legs
First Leg
Round 19: Sc in next 18 sc, place a marker in the next st; leave the marked st and all remaining sts unworked—18 sc. Work in continuous rounds over the 18 sc just made only, forming a circle for the first leg. 
Rounds 20–23: Sc in each sc around.
Round 24: Sc in each sc around; change to B in last st.
Boot
Rounds 25–30: With B, sc in each sc around.
Round 31: Work 2 sc in each of first 3 sc, sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in each of last 3 sc—24 sc.
Rounds 32–35: Sc in each sc around.
Round 36: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Stuff leg.
Round 37: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through the stitches of last round and pull to gather. Weave in end securely.
Second Leg
With right side facing, join A with sc in marked st following first leg.
Round 19: Sc in each remaining unworked st following first leg.
Rounds 20–23: Sc in each sc around.
Round 24: Sc in each sc around; change to B in last st.
Boot
Rounds 25–37: Work same as Rounds 25–37 of first leg.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through the stitches of last round and pull to gather. Weave in end securely. 
Sew head to top of body.
ARM (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of head—12 sc.
Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 6: [Sc2tog] twice, sc in remaining 8 sc—10 sc.
Rounds 7–16: Sc in each sc around. 
Fasten off. Stuff arms and sew to body.
SLEEVE (make 2)
With C, ch 15.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—14 sc. 
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Slip sleeve around upper part of arm and sew in place.
BOOT TOP (make 2)
Beginning at top of boot with B, ch 21. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—20 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Place boot top around top of boot and sew in place.
CAPE
Collar
With B, ch 21.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—20 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—25 sc. 
Row 3: Ch 1, *sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—30 sc. 
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. 
Fasten off.
Body of Cape
Row 1 (right side): Turn collar upside down to work in chains along opposite side of foundation ch, join B with slip st in first ch, ch 6, sc in same ch as last slip st (button loop made), sc in each remaining ch across, turn—20 sc and one ch-6 button loop.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in first sc, 2 dc in each remaining sc across, turn—40 dc. 
Rows 3–12: Ch 3, dc in each dc across, turn.
Fasten off. Sew button just below collar, opposite button loop. Button cape around neck.
STAR
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook—5 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—10 sc.
Round 3: *Slip st in next sc, ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, dc in next ch (point made), skip next sc of Round 2; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first slip st—5 points.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew star to center back of cape.
BELT
With D, ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—5 sc. 
Rows 2–38: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew belt around bear's waist.
Belt Buckle
With B, ch 6.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working along opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch—12 sc. 
Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of last 2 sc—18 sc. 
Round 3: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
With C, embroider a chain stitch "S" on buckle. Sew buckle to center of belt.
FINISHING
Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: 1 skein each 311 White A, 312 Black B, and 373 Petal Pink C for Moo-Cow Puppet
1 skein each 313 Aran, 400 Grey Heather, and 373 Petal Pink for Kitty Puppet
1 skein of 373 Petal Pink for Piglet Puppet
Small amounts of black, white, and pink felt
Small amounts of black, grey heather felt for Kitty Puppet
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 16 sts= 4”; 17 rnds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
MOO-COW PUPPET
NOSE: With C, ch 9.
Rnd 1: 2 Sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in each of next 7 ch; working along opposite side of ch, sc in next 8 sts – 24 sc. Do not join – see Note above.
Rnds 2-7: Work even in sc, changing to A in last sc on Rnd 7. Cut C.
Rnd 8: Work even in sc with A.
Rnd 9: [Sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 8 times – 16 sc.
Puppet-Rnd 10: [2 Sc in next sc] 4 times, changing to B in last sc, cut A, with B [2 sc in next sc] 4 times working over B beginning yarn tail and changing to A in last sc, drop B, with A [2 sc in next sc] 8 times working over A beginning yarn tail – 32 sc.
Rnd 11: With A [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice, working over the A tail left on previous rnd and changing to B in last sc by loosely drawing B across the B area, cut A, with B [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice working over the B strand and changing to A in last sc, drop B, with A [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times working over A beginning yarn tail – 40 sc.
Continue to add and drop colors and work over ends as on last rnd.
Rnds 12-25: With A sc in next 10 sc, with B sc in next 10 sc, with A sc in next 20 sc.
Rnd 26: With A sc in next 11 sc, with B sc in next 8 sc, with A sc in next 21 sc.
Rnd 27: With A sc in next 12 sc, with B sc in next 6 sc, with A sc in next 22 sc.
Rnd 28: With A sc in next 13 sc, with B sc in next 4 sc, with A sc in next 23 sc.
Rnd 29: With A sc in next 14 sc, with B sc in next 2 sc, with A sc in next 24 sc. Cut B.
Rnd 30: Work even with A; sc in next 8 sc; place new marker; remove old marker.
Thumb Opening-Rnd 31: Sc in next 22 sc, ch 12, skip next 12 sc, sc in next 6 sc.
Rnd 32: Sc in next 22 sc, sc in next 12 ch, sc in next 6 sc – 40 sc.
Rnds 33-46: Work even.
Tail-Rnd 47: Sc in next 11 sc, ch 9, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 7 ch, sc in same sc on Puppet, sc in next 28 sc; slip st in next sc. Fasten off.
THUMB: With A ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: 8 Sc in ring.
Rnd 2: [2 Sc in next sc] 8 times – 16 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Rnds 4-14: Work even.
Slip st in next sc. Fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
EAR (Make 2): With B ch 4; join to form a ring.
Rnd 1: 5 Sc in ring.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc – 6 sc.
Rnd 3: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc – 7 sc.
Rnd 4: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc – 8 sc.
Rnd 5: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc – 9 sc.
Rnd 6: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc – 10 sc.
Rnd 7: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc – 11 sc.
Rnd 8: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc – 12 sc.
Rnd 9: Work even.
Slip st in next sc. Fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
FINISHING: Sew thumb into opening matching stitch for stitch. With thumb centered and lying flat on underside of Puppet, fold nose towards top of Puppet and tack in place as pictured. Pinch sides of nose to form nostril indentations and tack in place. Cut four 5” pieces of B and knot into end of tail; trim. Slip st base of ear together. Cut eyes, nostrils, ear linings and horns from felt and glue in place, pinching center area of horns together as pictured. Sew base of ears in place near top of B area on Puppet. Weave in ends. Make liner and insert into Puppet.
KITTY PUPPET
NOSE/MUZZLE: With C, ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: 8 Sc in ring, changing to A in last sc. Cut C.
Rnd 2: With A, [2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 16 sc.
Rnd 3: [2 Sc in next sc] 16 times – 32 sc.
Rnds 4-6: Work even in sc.
Rnd 7: [Sc in next 2 sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 8: [Sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 8 times –16 sc.
PUPPET-Rnd 9: [2 Sc in next sc] 16 times – 32 sc.
Rnd 10: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 40 sc.
Rnds 11-12: Work even, changing to B in last sc of Rnd 12. Drop A.
Rnd 13: With B work 1 rnd even, changing to A in last sc by picking up dropped strand. Drop B.
Rnds 14-31: Repeat Rnds 11-13 6 more times.
Rnd 32: With A, work 1 rnd even.
Thumb Opening-Rnd 33: With A ch 12, skip next 12 sc, sc in next 28 sc, changing to B in last sc.
Rnd 34: With B, sc in next 12 ch, sc in next 28 sc, change to A in last sc.
Rnds 35-48: Repeat Rnds 11-13 4 more times, then repeat Rnds 11 and 12 once more. Cut A.
Tail-Rnd 49: With B, sc in next 30 sc, ch 11, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, tr in next 6 ch, sc in same sc on Puppet, sc in next 10 sc; slip st in next sc. Fasten off.
THUMB: With A, ch 4; join.
Rnd 1: 8 Sc in ring.
Rnd 2: [2 Sc in next sc] 8 times – 16 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Rnds 4-14: Work even. 
Slip st in next sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
EAR (Make 2): With A, ch 4; join.
Rnd 1: 5 Sc in ring.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc – 6 sc.
Rnd 3: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc – 7 sc.
Rnd 4: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc – 8 sc.
Rnd 5: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc – 9 sc.
Rnd 6: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc – 10 sc.
Rnd 7: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc – 11 sc.
Rnd 8: 2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc – 12 sc.
Slip st in next sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
PUPPET FINISHING: Sew thumb into opening, matching stitch for stitch. With thumb centered and lying flat on underside of Puppet, fold Nose/Muzzle towards top of Puppet as pictured and tack in place to front of face; fold lower part of muzzle to form mouth indentation; tack in place. Cut eyes, tongue, and mouth from felt and glue in place as pictured. With D, stitch whiskers on both sides of nose. Slip st base of ear together. Sew ears in place. Weave in ends. Make liner.
PIGLET PUPPET
SNOUT: Ch 4; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: 8 Sc in ring.
Rnd 2: [2 Sc in next sc] 8 times – 16 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 4: Work even in sc.
Rnd 5: Working tbl ONLY, sc in next 24 sc.
Rnd 6: Working in both loops, [sc in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc] 8 times – 16 sc.
Rnd 7: Repeat Rnd 4.
Rnd 8: [Sc in next sc, skip next sc] 8 times – 8 sc.
Rnd 9-10: Repeat Rnd 4.
PUPPET-Rnd 11: [2 Sc in next sc] 8 times – 16 sc.
Rnd 12: [2 Sc in next sc] 16 times – 32 sc.
Rnd 13: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 40 sc.
Rnds 14-34: Work even.
Thumb Opening-Rnd 35: Ch 12, skip next 12 sc, sc in next 28 sc.
Rnd 36: Sc in next 12 ch, sc in next 28 sc – 40 sc.
Rnds 37-50: Work even.
Tail-Rnd 51: Sc in next 29 sc, ch 5, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, [3 sc in next ch] 3 times, sc in same sc on Puppet, sc in next 10 sc; slip st in next sc. Fasten off.
THUMB: Ch 4; join.
Rnd 1: 8 Sc in ring.
Rnd 2: [2 Sc in next sc] 8 times – 16 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times – 24 sc.
Rnds 4-14: Work even.
Slip st in next sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
EAR (Make 2): Ch 4; join.
Rnd 1: 5 Sc in ring.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in next 4 sc – 6 sc.
Rnd 3: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in next 5 sc – 7 sc.
Rnd 4: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in next 6 sc – 8 sc.
Rnd 5: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in next 7 sc – 9 sc.
Rnd 6: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in next 8 sc – 10 sc.
Rnd 7: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in next 9 sc – 11 sc.
Rnd 8: 2 Sc in first sc, sc in next 10 sc – 12 sc.
Rnd 9: Work even.
Slip st in next sc. Fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.
PUPPET FINISHING: Sew thumb into opening matching stitch for stitch. With thumb centered and lying flat on underside of Puppet, fold Snout towards top of Puppet as pictured and tack in place in front of face. Cut facial features from felt and glue in place. Slip st base of ear together. Sew base of ears in place; fold tips forward and tack in place. Weave in ends. Make liner.
LINER (FOR ALL PUPPETS)
With A, ch 4; join.
Rnd 1: 12 Sc in ring.
Rnd 2: [2 Sc in next sc] 12 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 12 times – 36 sc.
Rnds 4-22: Work even.
Thumb Opening-Rnd 23: Ch 10, skip next 10 sc, sc in next 26 sc.
Rnd 24: Sc in next 10 ch, sc in next 26 sc – 36 sc.
Rnds 25-35: Work even.
Slip st in next sc. Fasten off.
THUMB: Ch 4; join.
Rnd 1: 8 Sc in ring.
Rnd 2: [2 Sc in next sc] 8 times – 16 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times – 20 sc.
Rnds 4-12: Work even.
Slip st in next sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
LINER FINISHING: Sew into thumb opening, matching stitch for stitch. Weave in ends. Insert into Puppet.
RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: Art. E300 available in Solid 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); Multi, Fleck and Print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m) skeins.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast A Vintage White (10006) 2 balls or 400 yds/366 m
Bernat® Blanket Brights™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Contrast B Carrot Orange (12002) 1 ball or 172 yds/157 m
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn for eye embroidery OR 1 set safety eyes 12 mm diameter.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 18" x 24" [45.5 x 61 cm], excluding legs.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc at end of each rnd.
Beg at top of Head: With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
7th to 12th rnds: As 3rd rnd.  
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Next rnd: (Neck Dec). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog) 10 times. Place split-lock stitch marker between 5th and 6th Sc2tog's just worked to mark center front. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join. 20 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Rep last rnd until neck measures 8" [20.5 cm]. Do not fasten off at end of last rnd.

BODY
See diagrams on page 4.
1st rnd: Ch 28. 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. (28 sc just worked into ch). 1 sc in each of next 20 sc of neck. Working into rem loop of foundation ch-28, 1 sc in each rem ch of next 26 ch. 2 sc in last ch (there will be a total of 4 sc in last ch). Join. 76 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 37 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 37 sc. Join. 78 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 38 sc. 2 sc in next sc. PM on last sc just worked to mark center front. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 38 sc. Join. 80 sc.
5th to 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Shape Tail: 1st rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 78 sts.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
3rd to 6th rnds:  Rep last 2 rnds twice more. 74 sts.

Shape Tail and Belly: 1st rnd:  Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 33 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 33 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 70 sts.
See diagram on page 5. 
2nd and alt rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 31 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 66 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 29 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 62 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 27 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 58 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 54 sts.
11th rnd:  Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. 50 sts.
12th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
Fasten off leaving a long end to sew bottom closed.

BEAK
With B, ch 5.
See diagram on page 5.
1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into rem loops of foundation chain, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in last ch (same ch as beg 2 sc). Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 14 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join. 18 sc.
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join. 20 sc.
7th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
Fasten off, leaving a long end to sew Beak to Head.

LEGS
With B, ch 12. Join with sl st to form a ring. See diagram on page 5.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. 12 sc. Do not join. PM for beg of rnd.
Working in spiral, 1 sc in each sc around until Leg measures approx 10" [25.5 cm]. Do not fasten off.
Close bottom of Leg: Fold Leg flat, having 1st sc at side of fold. Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Do not fasten off. Turn.
Foot: 1st row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc.
4th and 5th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows once more. 12 sc.
6th to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Note: Safety eyes cannot be moved once they are properly attached, so it’s best to make sure you like eye placement using stitch markers before inserting them.
Lay Head flat along center front. Place stitch markers on either side, approx 3½" [9 cm] down from top of Head and 3" [7.5 cm] in from center front to mark eye placement. Stuff Beak lightly. Pin Beak to front of Head, between eye markers to check eye placement. Adjust markers as desired. Following manufacturer’s instructions, attach Safety Eyes at markers. Stuff Head, Neck and Body, being sure not to overstuff. Sew Beak in position. Sew bottom seam of Body.
Stuff Legs lightly. Using yarn tail, sew top of Leg closed and attach to Body at center bottom. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Dark Gray (10044) 2 balls or 304 yds/278 m
Contrast B Pink Dust (10956) 1 ball or 30 yds/27 m
Size U.S. K/10½ [6.5 mm] Susan Bates®Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Optional: 1 yd of nylon wire for whiskers
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 22½" [57 cm] long x 10" [25.5 cm] wide.
instructions:
Note: Do not join at ends of rnds unless otherwise stated. Cont working in spiral, placing marker on first st of rnd for easier counting.
To ensure tight, neat stitches, this project is worked using a “yarn under” single crochet. The yarn under single crochet was worked for this project as follows: insert hook into next stitch. With the hook placed over the yarn (a “yarn under”), draw up a loop.

Head and Body
See diagram on page 4.
With B, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here .
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in magic loop.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. 9 sc. Break B. Join A.
4th rnd: With A, *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
6th rnd: As 4th rnd. 24 sc.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
9th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
12th to 15th rnds: As 9th rnd.
Note: Place safety eyes between 11th and 12th rnds, spaced 4" [10 cm] apart as shown in photo.
16th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
17th rnd: As 9th rnd.
18th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. 39 sc.
19th rnd: As 9th rnd.
20th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
21st and 22nd rnds: As 9th rnd.
23rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
Note: Stuff Head and Body as you work.
24th rnd: As 9th rnd.
25th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.
26th rnd: As 9th rnd.
27th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. 54 sc.
28th rnd: As 9th rnd.
29th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. 60 sc.
30th rnd: As 9th rnd.
31st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 66 sc.
32nd to 41st rnds: As 9th rnd.
42nd rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 60 sc.
43rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 54 sc.
44th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. 48 sts.
45th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
46th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
47th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
48th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
49th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
50th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
51st rnd: *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread through rem sts and cinch tightly.

Tail
See diagram on page 5.
With B, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 7 sc in ring.
2nd to 15th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
16th rnd: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. 6 sc.
17th to 22nd rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
23rd rnd: As 16th rnd. 5 sc.
24th to 30th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
31st rnd: As 16th rnd. 4 sc.
32nd to 41st rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
42nd rnd: As 16th rnd. 3 sc.
43rd and 44th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
45th row: Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 2 sc.
46th to 48th rows: 1 sc in each sc. Turn.
49th row: Sc2tog. Fasten off.
Sew Tail to back of Rat as shown in photo.

Feet (make 4)
See diagram on page 5.
With B, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 7 sc in ring.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Break C. Join B.
3rd rnd: With B, 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 14 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 21 sc. Fasten off.
Sew Feet to Body as shown in photo, stuffing lightly as you work.

Nose
See diagram on page 5.
With B, ch 2.
1st row: 5 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. Fasten off.
Seam Nose to Head as shown in photo.

Inner Ears (make 2)
See diagram on page 5.
With B, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 7 dc in ring. Join with sl st to first dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in each dc around. 14 dc. Fasten off.

Outer Ears (make 2)
See diagram on page 5.
With A, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 7 dc in ring. Join with sl st to first dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first dc. 14 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 21 dc. Fasten off.

Assemble Ears
Place Inner Ear on top of Outer Ear with WS facing tog and sew Inner Ear around circumference of 2nd rnd of Outer Ear. Sew Ears to sides of Head as shown in photo.

Optional Whiskers
Cut four 9" [23 cm] lengths of nylon wire. Using yarn needle, loop two lengths of nylon around sts on either side of nose. Knot into place. Trim to desired lengths.

materials: Bernat® Maker Minis™ Kit includes 10 balls (1.7 oz/50 g each; 17.65 oz/500 g total), (61 yds/56 m; 610 yds/560 m)
Sizes U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 black safety eyes ¼" [6 mm] for each toy.
abbreviations: Cross Sc = Single Crochet Cross Stitch. Insert hook in next stitch. Bring hook over yarn instead of yarn over hook and pull up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook.
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) sc. Yoh and draw through all 3(4) loops on hook.
instructions:
Back of eye (make 2). With C, ch 4.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.

VERSION 1
Head
See diagrams on page 3. Note: Do not join at end of rnd. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). Move marker up as each rnd is completed. Beg at tip of nose with A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd. 
2nd rnd: 2 sc in every sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in front loop of each sc around.
4th rnd: *1 sc in next unworked back loop of 3rd rnd. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sts.
6th to 8th rnds: 1 cross sc in each st around.
9th rnd: 2 cross sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
10th rnd: *1 cross sc in next sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
11th rnd: *1 cross sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
Note: At end of 16th rnd, sew back of eyes in place between 12th and 14th rnds with 8 sc between. Insert safety eyes in center of back of eye and thru head. Snap into place inside head.

12th to 18th rnds: 1 cross sc in each sc around.
HEAD
1st–18th RNDS
19th rnd: *1 cross sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
20th rnd: *1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
21st rnd: *1 cross sc in each sc around. Stuff nose and head.
22nd rnd: *1 cross sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
23rd rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. Finish stuffing. Fasten off, leaving a long for sewing. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.

BODY AND TAIL
See diagram on page 6. Stripe Pat 2 rows – B, 2 rows – A. These 4 rows form Stripe Pat.
Notes: • Do not break color not in use. • Carry color not in use up side of work. • To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.

Beg at neck edge proceed in Stripe Pat as follows: With B, ch 15.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 14 sc.
2nd and alt rows: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each sc to end of row. Join next Color. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each of first 5 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. 16 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc each of first 6 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of last 6 sc. Turn. 18 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each of first 7 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn. 20 sc.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc each of first 8 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 22 sc.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each of first 9 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 9 sc. Turn. 24 sc.

13th row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each of first 10 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 10 sc. Turn. 26 sc.
14th to 22nd rows: Cont in Stripe Pat, 1 cross sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
23rd row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in first sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in last sc. Turn. 26 sts.
24th to 27th rows: Cont in Stripe Pat, as 2nd and 23rd rows twice more.

28th row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each of first 10 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 10 sc. Turn. 24 sts.
29th row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in first sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 cross sc in next sc. 1 cross sc in last sc. Turn.

30th row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each of first 9 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 9 sc. Turn. 22 sts.
31st row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each of first 8 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 20 sts.
32nd row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each of first 7 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn. 18 sts.

33rd row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each of first 6 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 6 sc. Turn. 16 sts.
34th row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each of first 5 sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 5 sc. Turn. 14 sts.
35th row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in each of next 2 cross sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sts.

36th row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in next sc. 2 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 cross sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sts.
37th to 42nd rows: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
43rd row: As 36th row.
44th to 48th rows: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
49th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 cross sc in each of next 2 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 8 sts.

50th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 2 cross sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 10 sts.
51st row: Ch 1. 1 cross sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
52nd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Turn. 5 sts.
53rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 cross sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 3 sts.
54th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off, leaving along end for sewing. Sew back seam, stuffing as you go. Sew head firmly in place above neck. Curl up end of tail and secure.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.25 mm [US B-1]
Optional: Plastic pellets for weighted stuffing and thin bag to hold pellets
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Burger measures about 3¾" [9.5 cm] tall and 5" [12.5 cm] wide (at widest)
gauge: 26 sts = about 4" [10 cm]; 22 rounds = about 4" [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL TO THIS PROJECT. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LOWER HALF
Bottom Bun
With B, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each of next 6 sts—12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 7: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 9: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 6 times—54 sc.
Round 10: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times—60 sc.
Round 11: Sc in each st around, and change to A in last st.
Rounds 12-14: Sc in each st around. Slip st in next stitch and cut yarn. Weave in ends.

Patty
With right side of bottom bun facing, draw up a loop of B in back loop of any st of last round of bun.
Round 1: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Sc in each st around.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts] 6 times—66 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each st around.
Round 5: [Sc2tog, sc in next 9 sts] 6 times—60 sc.
Round 6: [Sc2tog, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times—54 sc.
Slip st in next stitch and cut yarn. Weave in ends.

Tomato
With right side of patty facing, draw up a loop of C in back loop of any st of last round of patty.
Round 1: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each st around.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times—60 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each st around. Slip st in next stitch and cut yarn, leaving a long tail for sewing.

LETTUCE
With D, ch 60; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in same ch as joining slip st and in each remaining ch around—60 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 15 sts] 3 times, sc in next 12 sts—63 sc. 
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 9 times—72 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next st, hdc in next st, dc in next 2 sts, hdc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 12 times—84 sts.
Slip st in next stitch and cut yarn. weave in ends. If desired, fill thin cloth bag with weighted pellets and place bag in lower half of burger.

TOP BUN
With B, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each of next 6 sts—12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 7: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 9: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 6 times—54 sc.
Round 10: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 6 times—60 sc.
Rounds 11–14: Sc in each st around. Slip st in next stitch and cut yarn, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, use yarn tails or yarn scraps to sew the following pieces together.
1. Using whipstitch, and holding wrong side of lettuce facing right side of tomato, sew Round 1 of lettuce to last round of tomato, sewing through front loops only of tomato stitches.
2. Sew top bun to lettuce, firmly stuffing burger before completing seam.
Shape Patty: Thread a long strand of A onto yarn needle. Working around outer edge of patty, insert needle through any st in first round of patty, then straight up through patty and out through the corresponding st of last round of patty. Insert needle in next st of last round of patty, then straight down through patty and out through the corresponding st of first round of patty. Pull on yarn to plump the patty. Repeat this process as needed to achieve a pleasing shape.
Weave in and trim any remaining ends.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A  Lemon Lime (04223) 1 ball or 169 yds/154 m
Contrast B  Mountain Mist (04826) 1 ball or 114 yds/104 m
Contrast C  White (04005) 1 ball or 29 yds/27 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Piece of cardboard cut into 10" [25.5 cm] diameter circle.
measurements: Approx 20½" [52 cm] diameter x 8" [20.5 cm] deep.
instructions:
Note: Do not join at end of rnds. Work rnds in continuous spiral, placing marker at first st and moving marker each subsequent rnd.
Back Piece
**With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 32 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc.**
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 64 sc.
9th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 72 sc.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 80 sc. Do not fasten off. Turn.
From this point on, work back and forth in rows:
See diagram on page 3.
Back Piece Frill: 1st row:  (WS). Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. [(1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc] 5 times. 2 sc in next sc. 62 sc and 11 ch-1 sps. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
***2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc to next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 10 more times. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. *1 sc in each st to next ch-1 sp. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each st to next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 4 more times. 1 sc in each st to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th and 5th rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows.
6th row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. *(2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 1. Skip next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 dc in last dc.
Fasten off.***
Head
With A, work from ** to ** as given for Back Piece. 
Cont with A, proceed as follows:
7th to 10th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 48 sc.
11th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 24 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around.  56 sc.
12th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 24 sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 64 sc. 
13th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 24 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 72 sc. 
14th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 24 sc. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 80 sc.
15th to 18th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
19th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Sl st in each of first 2 sc of prev rnd.
Do not fasten off. Turn.
From this point on, work back and forth in rows:
Head Frill: 1st row:  (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, work as 1st row of Back Piece Frill.
With A, work from *** to *** as given for Back Piece Frill.
Large Horns  (make 2).
With C, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 
9 sc. 
4th and 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
6th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc. 
7th and 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
9th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 15 sc. 
10th and 11th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Sl st in each of first 2 sc of prev rnd.
Fasten off.
Small Horn  (make 1).
With C, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 
9 sc. 
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc. 
4th to 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Sl st in each of next 2 sc. 
Fasten off. 
Eyes  (make 2).
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: (2 sc. 1 hdc. 2 dc. 1 hdc) in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Assembly  (See Diagram)
Place Head and Back piece tog with WS facing each other and Frills aligned. Join B with sl st in same sp as marked st of Head Frill. 
Join Back Piece and Head Frills: With Head facing and keeping yarn at back of work, sl st into each st at base of Frills through both thicknesses to join (working into same sps as first row of Frill). Do not fasten off. 
Insert cardboard circle, placing flush with Back Piece. Stuff Head. 
Cont with B and working through both thicknesses throughout, proceed as follows:
Join rem Head: Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each of next 20 sc (sts between ends of Frill to close bottom of Head). Work 6 sc evenly up side of Frill to corner. 3 sc in corner. Working along last row of Frills, 1 sc in each sc to next ch-1 sp. Sl st in next ch 1 sp. (Sl st in ch-1 sp 1 row below) 5 times. (Sl st in ch-1 sp 1 row above) 5 times. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each sc to next ch-1 sp. 3 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each sc to next ch-1 sp. Sl st in next ch 1 sp. (Sl st in ch-1 sp 1 row below) 5 times. (Sl st in ch-1 sp 1 row above) 5 times. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Rep from * 4 more times. 1 sc in each sc to last st of Frill. 3 sc in last st of Frill. Work 6 sc evenly down side of Frill. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
 
FINISHING
Sew Small and Large Horns and Eyes to Head as seen in photo. With B, embroider mouth with Chain st as seen in photo.

materials: Bernat® Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 315 yds/288 m) Main Color (MC) Terracotta Rose (32017) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
9mm safety eyes. Black safety nose. Stuffing. Tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
instructions:
Body
With MC, begin using magic loop method, demonstrated here. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in magic loop. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
5th – 11th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 25 sc.
13th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
15th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
17th – 19th rnds: As 3rd rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff, leaving top open.

Snout
With A, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in next ch. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Add safety nose, as pictured.

Head
With MC, begin using magic loop. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in magic loop. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first st. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th – 13th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st. around. Join with sl st to first sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
15th rnd: As 6th rnd.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
17th rnd: As 6th rnd. 
18th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
19th rnd: As 6th rnd. Sew on snout, stuffing lightly as you work. Attach safety eyes. 
20th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

Arms (make 2)
With MC, begin using magic loop. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in magic loop. Work in continuous rnds without joining with sl st, and omitting starting ch at beg of rnd.
2nd – 7th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. 
9th – 14th rnds: As 2nd – 7th rnds.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff.

Ears (make 2)
With MC, begin using magic loop. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 5 sc in magic loop. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Sew ears to head.

Feet (make 2)
With A, begin using magic loop. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in magic loop. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 dc in each of first 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. 2 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in last st. Join with sl st to first dc. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last st. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. Break A. Join MC.
4th – 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
8th – 9th rnds: As 4th and 5th rnds.
Fasten off. Stuff and sew to bottom of Body as pictured.

Tail
With MC, begin using magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in magic loop. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff and sew to back of Body as pictured.

Easy Heart Pattern
With A, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 6 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: As 2nd row.
4th - 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Do not turn.
Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around entire perimeter of heart, working (Sc. Ch 1. Sc) into bottom stitch, where slip knot is located. Join with sl st to first sc of 7th row. Fasten off. Sew to Body as pictured.

materials: RED HEART® Boutique Treasure™: 1 ball 1918 Abstract B
RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1252 Mango A and 1012 Black C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Owl measures 7½” wide from wingtip to wingtip x 2½” tall (19 cm x 6.5 cm).
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 20 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet.
instructions:
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * 5 times—24 sc.
Rounds 5–8: Sc in each st around. Insert post of safety eye in any st between Rounds 5 and 6 and attach washer to secure. Repeat for 2nd safety eye, leaving 1 or 2 stitches between posts so that washers, when locked in place, touch each other but do not overlap. 
Rounds 9–14: Sc in each st around. Stuff body firmly and continue to stuff as you work.
Round 15: *Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * 5 times—18 sc. Place marker on this round for placement of feet.
Round 16: *Sc2tog, sc in next st; repeat from * 5 times—12 sc.
Round 17: *Sc2tog; repeat from * 5 times—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving an 8” (20.5 cm) tail for sewing. Weave ending tail through stitches and pull gently until closed. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Foot (make 2)
With C, ch 4.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next 2 ch (first toe made), *ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next 2 ch (next toe made); working in opposite side of foundation ch, slip st in first ch of first toe (to form heel); repeat from * once. Fasten off.
Beak
With C, ch 2.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—1 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 3 sc in sc. Fasten off, leaving an 8” (20.5 cm) tail for sewing.
Wing (make 2)
Beginning at wing tip, with B, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in remaining st, turn—3 sc.
Rows 3–11: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in remaining sts, turn—12 sc.
Fold wing in half lengthwise into a triangle, matching row ends, and continue working through both thicknesses to close wing. 
Row 12: Working across ends of rows, 3 hdc in first row, slip st in next row, *3 hdc in next row, slip st in next row; repeat from * across to wing tip. Fasten off, leaving a 15” (38 cm) tail for sewing.
FINISHING
Optional: Make crocheted or felt circles for eyes instead of plastic animal eyes and sew firmly into center of eye circles with a small bit of stuffing inserted to give dimension.
Where eye circles meet at center of head, sew together with tail from one circle.
Sew wider end of beak between eyes. 
Flatten bottom of owl so it sits. Sew heel of each foot to marked round of body, aligning directly under each eye.
Thread tail of each wing to last row at wider end. Using photograph as a guide, sew wings to sides of body. Secure tightly. 
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 334 Buff A, 316 Soft White B, 718 Shocking Pink C, 847 Blue Tones D, 312 Black E, 365 Coffee F, 972 Pink Camo G.
Yarn needle, stuffing, assorted small beads (for earrings and bracelet), heavy-duty sewing thread, button (for pocketbook), red crayon (to shade cheeks).
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, F, and G = Color A, B, C, D, E, F, and G
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 20 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEAD AND BODY
Beginning at top of head, with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Rounds 8–15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc2tog] 15 times—15 sts.
Rounds 17–19: Sc in each sc around.
Round 20: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times, sc in last sc—22 sc.
Round 21: [Sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times; change to B in last sc—24 sc.
Undershirt
Rounds 22–27: With B, sc in each sc around; change to A in last sc of Round 27.
Waist
Rounds 28 and 29: With A, sc in each sc around; change to B in last sc of Round 29.
Begin Knickers
Rounds 30–35: With B, sc in each sc around. Do not fasten off. Stuff body firmly.
Joining Row: Flatten lower edging, matching stitches. Working through both thicknesses, sc across to close lower edge. Fasten off B.

HAIR
Long Strip (make 7)
Row 1: With F, *ch 23, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each remaining ch across; repeat from * 9 more times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Sew first strip, centered on back of head, across Round 13 (each side should end at hairline). [Sew next strip, centered on back of head, across next row above previous strip] 6 times.
Medium Strip (make 3)
Row 1: With F, *ch 23, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each remaining ch across; repeat from * 7 more times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Sew first strip, centered on back of head, across next row above last long strip. [Sew next strip, centered on back of head, across next row above previous strip] 2 times.
Small Strip (make 3)
Row 1: With F, *ch 23, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each remaining ch across; repeat from * 5 more times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Sew first strip, centered on back of head, across next row above last medium strip. [Sew next strip, centered on back of head, across next row above previous strip] 2 times. Note: The last strip should be at center top of head.

EAR (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Sew ears in place. 
Earrings (make 2): Thread three beads onto heavy-duty sewing thread and sew to ear. Repeat for 2nd earring.

LEG (make 2)
Beginning at foot, with E, ch 6.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch—12 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc—18 sc.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; change to A in last sc.
Round 4: With A, sc in next 6 sc, [sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 6 sc—15 sc.
Round 5: Sc in next 3 sc, [sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 6 sc—12 sc.
Round 6: Sc in next 3 sc, [sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 3 sc—9 sc.
Rounds 7 and 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: Work 2 sc in first sc, sc in each remaining sc around—10 sc.
Rounds 10–27: Sc in each sc around, stuffing leg as you go; change to B in last sc.
Round 28: With B, sc in each sc around.

ARM (make 2)
Beginning at top of arm, with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc.
Rounds 3–19: Sc in each sc, stuffing arm as you go.
Round 20: [Sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 3 sc—6 sc.
Round 21: Work 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in last 3 sc—9 sc.
Rounds 22–24: Sc in each sc around.
Round 25: [Sc2tog] 4 times, sc in last sc—5 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff arm. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull gently to close opening. Draw a strand of A through arm at elbow and pull to form elbow dimple. Sew arms to sides of body. With B, embroider a strap over each shoulder, from top front of undershirt to top back of undershirt.

JEANS (make 2)
Beginning at waist, with D, ch 14.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—13 sc.
Rows 2–6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 6 sc, turn—14 sc.
First Leg
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sc, turn; leave remaining sts unworked (for 2nd leg)—7 sc.
Rows 9–24: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off.
Second Leg
Row 8: Join D with sc in first unworked sc following Row 8 of first leg, sc in remaining 6 unworked sc, turn—7 sc.
Rows 9–24: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off. Sew side seams and inner leg seams.

APRON
Beginning at neck edge, with G, ch 16.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in each remaining ch across, turn—30 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times, turn—36 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc, sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc, sc in last 6 sc, turn—48 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in next 6 sc, ch 3, skip next 12 sc (for underarm), sc in next 12 sc, ch 3, skip next 12 sc (for underarm), sc in last 6 sc, turn—24 sc and 2 ch-3 spaces.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc and ch across, turn—30 sc.
Rows 6–11: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 12: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1 here and throughout), skip first sc, dc in next sc, *ch 1, dc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—30 dc and 29 ch-1 spaces.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch across, turn—59 sc.
Row 14: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1 here and throughout), skip first 2 sc, dc in next sc, *ch 1, skip next sc, dc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—30 dc and 29 ch-1 spaces.
Row 15: Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch across, turn—59 sc.
Rows 16–18: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 19–22: Repeat Rows 14 and 15 twice.
Fasten off.
Neck ties
With G, ch 35 (for first tie), join with slip st in top corner of apron, slip st in each ch across opposite side of apron foundation ch, ch 35 (for 2nd tie). Fasten off.
Waist ties
Join G with slip st on one side of apron at waist (Row 11), ch 35. Fasten off. Repeat on other side of waist.

FLOWER/HAT
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Working in front loops only, (slip st, ch 1, sc) in first st (petal made), *ch 1, (slip st, ch 1, sc) in next st; repeat from * around—6 petals.
Round 3: Ch 2, working behind petals into free back loops of Round 1, (slip st, ch 2, dc) in first sc, *ch 2, (slip st, ch 2, dc) in next sc; repeat from * around; slip st in first sc again.
Fasten off. Sew flower/hat to top of head.

BAG
With C, ch 12.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 9 ch, 2 sc in last ch—24 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in each of last 2 sc—30 sc.
Rounds 3–11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 13: Sc in next 3 sc, ch 35 (for strap), skip next 10 sc, slip st in next 2 sc, TURN; leave remaining sts unworked.
Strap: Ch 1, sc in each of the 35 ch, slip st in next sc; leave remaining sts unworked. Fasten off.
Flower
With C, ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, work 12 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Working in front loops only, ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, 2 sc in each remaining sc around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 3: Ch 3, working behind sts of Round 2 and into free back loops of Round 1, dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. Sew flower to front of bag.

FINISHING
Weave in ends. Place clothing and accessories on doll.
Embroider Face
With F, embroider satin stitch eyes and couched stitch eyebrows. With A, embroider satin stitch nose, With C, embroider a couched stitch smile. With red crayon, gently rub color onto face for cheeks.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. G/6 [4 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Pair of ¾" [15 mm] safety eyes.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] tall by 3" [7.5 cm] in diameter.
instructions:
Notes:
• Toy is worked in a spiral. Do not join rnds. There are no ch worked at beg of rnd unless otherwise indicated; simply work directly into the next st (noting marker to indicate end of rnd will move up each rnd).
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. PM on last st.
2nd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 15 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 20 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 25 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
7th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 35 sc.
9th to 12th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
13th rnd: *With A, 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd.
14th rnd: *With A, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. With B, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. With A, 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd.
15th rnd: As 14th rnd.
16th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
17th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 25 sts.
18th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 20 sts.
Stuff toy. Following manufacturer’s instructions, attach safety eyes, placing eyes in approx 9th rnd of work, with 4 sts between eyes.
Embroider nose with B in Satin stitch as shown in photo, and embroider whiskers using Straight stitch.
SATIN STITCH
STRAIGHT STITCH
19th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 15 sts.
20th rnd: *1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 10 sts.
21st rnd: *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 5 sts. Fasten off. Draw end tightly through rem sts and secure tightly.
Arms (make 2).
With A, ch 8.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.
Ears (make 2).
With A, ch 3. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st row: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Sl st in ring, Fasten off.
Attach Arms and Ears as shown in photo.

materials: Lily® Sugar n’ Cream® Solids (70 g/2.5 oz)
ANGEL VERSION: Main Color (MC) (01004 Soft Ecru) 1 ball or (20 m / 22 yrds), Contrast A (01130 Warm Brown) 1 ball or (6 m / 7 yrds), Contrast B (00010 Yellow) 1 ball or (1 m / 2 yrds)
SANTA VERSION: Main Color (MC) (01004 Soft Ecru) 1 ball or (20 m / 22 yrds), Contrast A (00001 White) 1 ball or (1.8 m / 2 yrds), Contrast B (00095 Red) 1 ball or (8 m / 9 yrds)
SNOWMAN VERSION: Main Color (MC) (00001 White) 1 ball or (20 m / 22 yrds), Contrast A (00002 Black) 1 ball or (17 m / 19 yrds)
MRS. CLAUS VERSION: Main Color (MC) (01004 Soft Ecru) 1 ball or (20 m / 22 yrds), Contrast A (00001 White) 1 ball or (8 m / 9 yrds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. Stuffing. Small amount of black and red yarn for embroidery. Ribbon for loops.
Snowman Version only: Small amount of orange yarn for nose.
Mrs. Claus Version only: Small amount of red ribbon for Hair bow.
instructions:
All Versions: Head
**With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first
sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from *
