around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep
from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep
from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.**
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd 6 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh
and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in
each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
24 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next
2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
Stuff Head.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep
from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Rep from * around.
Join with sl st to first st. Fasten off. 6 sc.
ANGEL VERSION
Hair
With A, work from ** to ** as given for Head.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to
first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *4 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. Sl st in next
sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 4 dc in next sc. Miss
last sc. Join with sl st to first dc. Fasten off.
Halo
With B, ch 21. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Join with sl st to
first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Attach Hair to Head as shown in picture. Sew Halo to top of
Hair. With black yarn, embroider eyes. With red yarn,
embroider mouth. Make loop with ribbon and attach to top of
ornament as shown in picture.
SANTA VERSION
Hat
With A, ch 30. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each ch
around. Join red with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each hdc
around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl
st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog over next
2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog over next
2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
9th rnd: As 7th rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. Rep
from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
11th rnd: As 7th rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. Rep from * around.
Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
13th to 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with
sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of last rnd. Draw through rem
sts tightly and fasten securely.
Pom Pom
Wrap A around 2 fingers 20 times. Remove from fingers and
tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a
smooth round shape. Attach pom-pom to end of Hat as shown
in picture.
Beard
With A, ch 16.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of
ch. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last
2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
Rep last row 5 times more. 3 sc at end of last row.
Next row:Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sts. Yoh
and draw through all loops on hook – sc3tog made. Fasten
off.
FINISHING
Sew Beard and Hat to Head as shown in picture. With Black
yarn, embroider eyes. With Red yarn, embroider mouth. Make
loop with ribbon and attach to top of ornament as shown in
picture.
SNOWMAN VERSION
Hat
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd:6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with
sl st to first sc. 24 sc at end of 3rd rnd.
4th rnd:Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc
around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th to 9th rnds:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl
st to first sc.
10th rnd:Ch 1. Working in front loops only, *2 sc in next sc.
1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to
first sc. 32 sc.
11th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc.
Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Stuff Hat lightly, sew to top of Head as shown in picture.
With Black yarn, embroider eyes and mouth. With Orange
yarn, embroider carrot nose. Make loop with ribbon and attach
to top of ornament as shown in picture.
MRS. CLAUS VERSION
Hair
With A, work as given for Angel Hair.
Bun
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first
sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from *
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl
st to first sc. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Stuff Bun lightly.
FINISHING
Sew Hair to Head. Sew Bun to top of Hair as shown in
picture. With black yarn, embroider eyes. With red yarn,
embroider mouth. Tie ribbon in a bow around bun as shown
in picture. Make loop with ribbon and attach to top of
ornament as shown in picture.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.5 mm [US E-4]
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 21 sts = about 4" [10 cm]; 25 rounds = about 4" [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL TO THIS PROJECT. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BODY/HEAD
With first color in chosen colorway, ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 8 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—8 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to indicate end of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 4 times—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st—16 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 4 times—20 sc.
Round 5: Sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 3 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts—24 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 4 times—28 sc.
Round 7: Sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 3 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts—32 sc.
Round 8: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts] 4 times—36 sc.
Round 9: Sc in next 4 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 8 sts] 3 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts—40 sc.
Round 10: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 9 sts] 4 times—44 sc.
Round 11: Sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 10 sts] 3 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts—48 sc.
Round 12: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 11 sts] 4 times—52 sc.
Round 13: Sc in next 6 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 12 sts] 3 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts—56 sc.
Round 14: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 13 sts] 4 times—60 sc.
Rounds 15–21: Sc in each st around.
Round 22: Sc in next 4 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next 8 sts] 5 times, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts—54 sc.
Round 23: [Sc2tog, sc in next 7 sts] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 24: Sc in next 3 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts] 5 times, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts—42 sc.
Round 25: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 26: Sc in next 2 sts, [sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts] 5 times, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts—30 sc.
Round 27: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 28: Sc in next st, [sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts] 5 times, sc2tog, sc in next st—18 sc.
Stuff body.
Round 29: [Sc2tog] 9 times—9 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Secure tail and weave to inside of body.

BEAK
With second color in chosen colorway, ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times; join with slip st in first sc—9 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] twice, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Rounds 4–6: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff lightly.

TAIL
With second color in chosen colorway, ch 3.
Row 1: Work 3 dc in 3rd ch from hook. 
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first st, [ch 7, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 ch, sc in next st] twice, ch 7, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

HEAD FEATHERS
Work with second color in chosen colorway.
Row 1: [Ch 11, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch] 3 times.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

EYES (make 2 for each bird)
With A, ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with sl st in first sc—12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Pupil: With D, embroider a pupil in center of eye.

EYEBROW
With D, ch 5.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

BELLY
With D, ch 3; slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. 
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 5 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in next st; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

WINGS/FEET (make 4 for each bird – 2 for wings and 2 for feet)
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in each st across—6 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. 
Row 5: Ch 2, turn, dc in first st, [ch 2, slip st in next st, ch 2, dc in next st] twice, ch 2, slip st in last st.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, use yarn tails or yarn scraps to sew the following pieces together.
1. Sew head feathers to top of head.
2. Sew eyes to front of head.
3. Sew eyebrow above eyes.
4. Sew beak below eyes.
5. Sew belly below beak.
6. Sew tail to lower back of body.
7. Sew wings to sides of body.
8. Sew feet to bottom of body.
Weave in and trim any remaining ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar ‘n Cream (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m / 120 yds)
Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of red embroidery floss for mouth.
instructions:
Head
** With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc at end of 3rd rnd.**
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 7 times more. Do not break A.
Next rnd: With B, working in front loops only, ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in same sp as last sl st. Sl st in next sc. *3 dc in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Break B.
Next rnd: With A, working in unused loops of rnd before last, ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Sc2tog made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
Stuff Head.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sc.
Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.

Beard
With B, ch 16.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. 15 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in first sc. *Sl st in next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Beard to Head as shown in photo.

Hat
*** With MC, work from *** to *** as given for Head.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.*****
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *(1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
8th to 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 35 sc. Fasten off.
Stuff Hat. Attach Hat to top of Head.

Body
With MC, work from *** to *** as given for Hat.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 6 times more.
Top shaping: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
2nd and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
Stuff Body.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts.
Fasten off leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.

Arms (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd once more, joining MC at end of rnd.
With MC, work 8 rnds even. Fasten off.

Boots (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off.

FINISHING
Attach Head to Body. Stuff Arms lightly. Stuff Boots. Attach Arms and Boots to Body as shown in picture. Attach beads for eyes. With red embroidery floss, embroider mouth.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 334 Buff A, 316 Soft White B, 312 Black C, 319 Cherry Red D, 368 Paddy Green E, and 718 Shocking Pink F
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6]
Yarn needle, pins, stuffing, two 1” (25mm) rings, assorted small beads (for necklace), heavy-duty sewing thread, red crayon (to shade cheeks)
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, and F = Color A, B, C, D, E, and F
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 20 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet
instructions:
Waist
Rounds 28 and 29: With A, sc in each sc around; change to B in last sc of Round 29.
Begin Knickers
Rounds 30–35: With B, sc in each sc around. Do not fasten off. Stuff body firmly.
Joining Row: Flatten lower edging, matching stitches. Working through both thicknesses, sc across to close lower edge. Fasten off B.
ARM (make 2)
Beginning at top of arm, with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc.
Rounds 3–19: Sc in each sc, stuffing arm as you go.
Round 20: [Sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 3 sc—6 sc.
Round 21: Work 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in last 3 sc—9 sc.
Rounds 22–24: Sc in each sc around.
Round 25: [Sc2tog] 4 times, sc in last sc—5 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff arm. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull gently to close opening. Draw a strand of A through arm at elbow and pull to form elbow dimple. Sew arms to sides of body.
LEG (make 2)
Beginning at foot, with C, ch 6.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch—12 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc—18 sc.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; change to A in last sc.
Round 4: With A, sc in next 6 sc, [sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 6 sc—15 sc.
Round 5: Sc in next 3 sc, [sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 6 sc—12 sc.
Round 6: Sc in next 3 sc, [sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 3 sc—9 sc.
Rounds 7 and 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: Work 2 sc in first sc, sc in each remaining sc around—10 sc.
Rounds 10–27: Sc in each sc around, stuffing leg as you go; change to B in last sc.
Round 28: With B, sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew legs to bottom of body.
HAIR
With C, ch 34.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—33 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, [sc in next 9 sc, sc2tog] 3 times, turn—30 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, [sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog] 3 times, turn—27 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] 3 times, turn—24 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 3 times, turn—21 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 3 times, turn—18 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 3 times, turn—15 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 3 times, turn—12 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 3 times, turn—9 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] 3 times, turn—6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through last 6 sts and pull to gather. Use remainder of tail to sew side edges together for back seam. Sew hair to head.
Braid: With C, [ch 42, hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across] 3 times. Fasten off. Braid the 3 strips together. Cut a length of D and tie around end of braid to secure, then wrap the length of D around end of braid for about 1” (2.5 cm), thread end of length to inside of wraps to secure. Sew braid to hair.
FLOWER
(make 3 – 1 with B and 2 with F)
Ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: (Slip st, ch 1, 2 hdc) in first sc (first petal made), *ch 1, (slip st ch 1, 2 hdc) in next sc; repeat from * across—6 petals.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With tail, sew side of first petal to side of last petal, then thread remainder of tail through bases of petals and pull to gather. Sew flower to top of hair.
EAR (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Sew ears in place. 
DRESS
Beginning at top, with B, ch 25.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—24 sc.
Rows 2–9: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 10: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), working in back loops only, 2 dc in first sc, 3 dc in each remaining sc across, turn—72 dc.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, turn.
Row 12: Ch 3, working in back loops only, dc in each sc across, turn.
Rows 13–22: Repeat last 2 rows 5 times.
Row 23: Repeat Row 11.
Row 24: Slip st in next sc, skip next sc, 3 hdc in next sc, *skip next sc, slip st in next sc, skip next sc, 3 hdc in next sc; repeat from * across to last sc, slip st in last sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing back seam (but, do not sew back seam until instructed).
Skirt Ruffle
Row 1: With right side facing, hold dress upside down, join E with slip st in first unworked front loop of Row 11, ch 3, dc in same st as joining, dc in next front loop, *2 dc in next front loop, dc in next front loop; repeat from * across, turn.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 3, dc in each dc across, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
With D, work another ruffle in unworked front loops of Row 15.
With E, work another ruffle in unworked front loops of Row 19.
Sew side edges of dress together for back seam. With tails, sew edges of ruffles together.
Collar Ruffle
With B, ch 37.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—36 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in first sc, 2 dc in each remaining sc across, turn—72 dc.
Row 3: *Ch 1, slip st in next dc; repeat from * across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
Note: You may find it easier to place the dress on the doll before attaching the collar ruffle.
With tail, sew short edges together for back seam of collar. Pin collar evenly to top of dress, matching back seams and center fronts. Sew center 6 stitches of collar ruffle to center 6 stitches of top of dress on the front and the back, leave remaining portion of collar ruffle unsewn for armholes.
WAIST TIE
With F, ch 50.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, do not fasten off; hold tie at left side of waist of dress to work in unworked front loops of Row 9, hdc in each unworked loop of Row; ch 50, hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across. Fasten off. Tie ends of waist tie into a large bow.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Sew rings to ears for earrings. 
Necklace: String about 12” (30.5 cm) of beads onto strong sewing thread and tie ends of thread together securely. Place on doll and sew a few stitches at back of neck to secure.
Place clothing and accessories on doll.
Embroider Face
With C, embroider satin stitch eyes and couched stitch eyebrows. With A, embroider satin stitch nose, With D, embroider a couched stitch smile. With red crayon, gently rub color onto face for cheeks.

materials: Bernat® Forever Fleece Finer™ (9.9 oz/280 g; 385 yds/352 m)
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of black Anchor® embroidery floss for eyes.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
HEAD
With A, ch 12.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, work 1 sc in each ch to end of row. Turn. 23 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 26 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 29 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 32 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 35 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 38 sc.
8th to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 36 sts.
12th and 13th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
14th row: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first sc, 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Top Inner Mouth
With B, ch 12.
Work from ** to ** as given for Head. Fasten off at end of 5th row. Join Head to Top Inner Mouth: Hold Head and Top Inner Mouth with WS tog and align sts. Join A with sl st to first sc. Join Underbite to Mouth by working row of sl st through back loop of Underbite and front loop of Mouth. Fasten off.
Underbite
With A, ch 7.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 5 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 13 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 16 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 19 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 22 sc.
5th to 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Bottom Inner Mouth
With B, ch 7.
Work from *** to *** as given for Underbite. Fasten off at end of 4th row.
Join Underbite to Bottom Inner Mouth: Hold Underbite and Bottom Inner Mouth with WS tog and align sts. Join A with sl st to first sc. Join Underbite to Mouth by working row of sl st through back loop of Underbite and front loop of Mouth. Fasten off.
Join Head and Underbite
Note: Work along straight bottom edges of Head and Underbite. Join A with sl st to right side edge of Head. Ch 1. Work 25 sc evenly along straight edge of Head. Work 15 sc evenly along straight edge of Underbite. Join in rnd with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
BODY
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 40 sc.
Rep last rnd until Puppet measures 10" [25.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Arms (make 2)
With A, ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 6 sc.
2nd to 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Using A, sew Arms to either side of Body. Using B, sew straight edges of Top and Bottom Inner mouths tog using whipstitch. WHIPSTITCH With Black embroidery floss, embroider eyes on either side of head using straight stitch. STRAIGHT STITCH Teeth With RS facing, join C with sl st to rem loop of first sc at bottom right of mouth. Working in rem loops of Inner Mouth, 1 dc. Sl st in same sc as sl st. *Sl st in each of next 2 sc. (Sl st. 1 dc. Sl st) in next sc. Rep from *, working into rem loops of Bottom Inner Mouth and then into rem loops of Top Inner Mouth. Sl st in last sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

pattern_name: Crochet Santa and Mrs Claus Dolls
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/71 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Santa Claus Main Color (MC) Black (00002) 1 ball or 44 yds/40 m
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball or 44 yds/40 m
Contrast B Red (00095) 2 balls or 220 yds/200 m
Contrast C Jute (00082) 1 ball or 44 yds/40 m
Contrast D Mod Green (01223) 1 ball or 5.5 yds/5 m
Contrast E Yellow (00010) 1 ball or 5.5 yds/5 m
Mrs. Claus Main Color (MC) Black (00002) 1 ball or 33 yds/30 m
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball or 110 yds/100 m
Contrast B Red (00095) 2 balls or 220 yds/200 m
Contrast C Jute (00082) 1 ball or 44 yds/40 m
Contrast D Mod Green (01223) 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Size U.S. F/5 [3.75 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Blush for cheeks (optional for Mrs. Claus)
abbreviations: Beg Cluster = Ch 2. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in next st. Yoh and draw through loops on hook.
Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in next st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Dc2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2 (3) times. Yoh and draw through all 3 (4) loops on hook
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Santa Claus: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] tall. Mrs. Claus: Approx 13" [33 cm] tall (without top bun)/approx. 15" [38 cm] tall with top bun.
gauge: 20 sc and 21 rnds = 4" [10 cm] before stuffing.
instructions:
Note
• Ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
• Key for all Diagrams
SANTA CLAUS
FOOT/LEG  (make 2 alike)
(See Diagram 1).
With MC, ch 7.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working on opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 dc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. (1 hdc in next dc. 2 dc in next st) 3 times. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. (1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 27 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. (1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. (1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 33 sts.
5th to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
(See Diagram 2).
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Dc2tog. 1 dc in each of next 4 sts. Dc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 29 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (Hdc2tog) 6 times. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 23 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. (Sc2tog) 5 times. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
11th and 12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Stuff firmly. Fasten off.
Join A with sl st to first sc.
13th and 14th rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Join B with sl st to first sc.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Do not join. Work in continuous rnds.
16th and 22nd rnds: 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off.

BODY
(See Diagrams 3 and 4).
Hold Legs with toes facing in same direction and mark inner sc on both Legs. Stuff firmly as you work.
1st rnd: Join B with sl st in inner sc of first Leg. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc in inner sc of second Leg. 1 sc in each of next 17 sts around same Leg. 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 17 sts around first Leg. Do not join with sl st to first sc. PM for beg of rnd. 37 sc.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in rem loop of next ch-1 sp. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. (1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. 44 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. 46 sc.
4th to 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc around. 45 sts.
8th rnd: 1 sc in each st around. 
9th to 11th rnds: Rep 7th and 8th rnds once more, then 7th rnd once. 43 sc.
12th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 21 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 41 sts. 
13th rnd: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st around. 40 sts.
14th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
15th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
16th and 17th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
18th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
19th and 20th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
21st rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. 28 sts.
22nd rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
23rd rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sts. 
24th and 25th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
26th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 20 sts.
27th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 16 sts. Fasten off. 
28th rnd: Join A with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off.

HEAD STABILIZER
See Diagram 5.
29th rnd: Join C with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
30th rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
31st and 32nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Stuff firmly.
33rd rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.

HEAD
See Diagram 6.
1st rnd: With RS facing, holding piece with Legs toward you and working in free loops of sc of 30th rnd of Head Stabilizer, join C with sl st at back center sc. Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. 30 sts. PM for beg of rnd.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
5th to 14th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Attach safety eyes between 11th and 12th rnds 4 sc apart.
Stuff firmly as you work.
15th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
16th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
17th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
18th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
19th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
20th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts. 
Fasten off.

NOSE
See Diagram 7.
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. 3 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.
Stuff lightly.
Using photo as a guide for placement, sew Nose on Head.

ARMS (make 2 alike)
See Diagram 8.
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. 4 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
Stuff firmly as you work, leaving last 4 rnds unstuffed.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 8 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 10 sc.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
6th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 8 sts. 
Fasten off. 
7th rnd: Join A with sl st to first sc. 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off. 
Join B with sl st to first sc. 
8th to 21st rnds: With B, 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.
Sew Arms on Body.

BEARD
See Diagram 9.
Beard Layer 1 (make 2 alike)
With A, ch 21.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. Sl st) in next ch. *(Sl st. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. Sl st) in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.

BEARD LAYER 2 (make 2 alike)
With A, ch 23.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. (Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. Sl st) in next ch. *(Sl st. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. Sl st) in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. (Sl st. Ch 1. 1 dc) in next ch. (1 dc. Ch 1. Sl st) in last ch. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.

HAT
See Diagrams 10 and 11.
With B, ch 4, join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: 6 sc in ring. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. 6 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 8 sc. 
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 10 sc.
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 14 sc.
6th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. 16 sc.
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
8th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. 20 sc.
9th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 22 sc.
10th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
11th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 26 sc.
12th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. 28 sc.
13th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
14th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 14 sc. Rep from * around. 32 sc.
15th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Rep from * around. 34 sc.
16th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 16 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
17th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 17 sc. Rep from * around. 38 sc.
18th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 18 sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
19th to 26th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off.

BRIM
With WS facing, join A with sl st to first sc.
27th rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
28th and 29th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Flip Brim up on RS. 
Pin Hat to Head approx 2 rnds above the Eyes.
Arrange Layers of Beard alternately and sew ends to middle of face.
Sew Mustache under nose.

HOLLY (make 2 alike)
See Diagram 12.
With D, ch 7.
1st rnd: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. (Sl st in next ch. Ch 2. Sl st in next ch) twice. (Sl st. Ch 3. Sl st) in last ch. Working on opposite side of ch, (Sl st in next ch. Ch 2. Sl st in next ch) twice. Sl st in last ch. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off. 

BERRY
See Diagram 13.
With C, ch 4. Join with sl st to first sc to form a ring.
1st rnd: Beg Cluster in ring. Ch 1. (3-dc cluster in ring. Ch 1) twice. Join with sl st to first cluster. Fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.

SANTA’S PANTS
See Diagram 14.
Note: Pants worked from waist down.
Belt: With MC, ch 48. Join in rnd with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sl st in each ch around. Join with sl st to back loop of first sl st. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each sl st around. Join with sl st to back loop of first sl st.
Rep last rnd 4 times more. Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long end. 
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Pants: 1st rnd: Join B with sl st to back loop of first sl st. Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sl st around. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd 6 times more. 
Shape crotch and legs: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 24 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 24 sc. Join. 24 sc and ch-2 sp. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 24 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Join. 26 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd 3 times more. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
With RS facing, join B with sl st to rem loop of 2nd ch of ch-2. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st and each st to 1st ch of ch-2. 1 sc in rem loop of ch-2. Join. 26 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd 4 times more. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Fur: Join A with sl st to back loop of first sc. 
1st rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each sc around. Join with sl st to back loop of first sl st.
2nd rnd: Working in back loops only, *1 tr in next sl st. 1 sl st in next sl st, pushing tr-post to front of work. Rep from * to last sl st. 1 tr in last sl st. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.

SANTA’S JACKET
See Diagram 15.
Note: Jacket is worked from neck down in one piece.
With B, ch 11. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *(1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in each of next 2 ch.* 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in last ch. Turn. 14 sc and 4 ch-2 sps.
2nd row: Ch 1. [1 sc in each sc to next ch-2 sp. (1 sc. Ch 2. 1 sc) in next ch-2 sp] 4 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 4 times more, ending on a WS row. 54 sc and 4 ch-2 sps.
1st–2nd rows: Rep from * to * for Left Front.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. (2 sc inc’d). 11 sc.
5th to 8th rows: As 4th row 4 times. 19 sc.
9th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first sc *(Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 dc in next sc). Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn. 21 sts. 
10th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first dc. 1 sc in each of next 19 sts (dc and ch-1 sps). 2 sc in last dc. Turn. 23 sc.
11th row: Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1). *(1 dc in next sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc). Rep from * to last sc. 1 dc in last sc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc and ch-1 sp to end of row. Turn.
13th and 14th row: As 11th and 12th rows once more. Fasten off.
Vest assembly: Sew shoulder seams using whip stitch. PM on sides of fronts and back 1" [2.5 cm] down from shoulder seams for armholes. Sew side seams to markers.
Trim: With RS facing, join A with sl st to left front bottom corner. Ch 1. Work in sc up left front edge, across back neck and down right front edge. Do not work across bottom of Vest. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Split MC into separate strands and using 1 strand, embroider eyebrows and mouth with Straight Stitch. (See Diagram).
Pompom: Wind A around 2 fingers approx 50 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Sew pompom to tip of Hat.

MRS. CLAUS
FOOT/LEG  (make 2 alike)
See Diagram 18.
With MC, ch 7.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working on opposite side of ch. 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
Note: Stuff firmly as you work.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 dc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in same sp as sl st. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. (1 hdc in next dc. 2 hdc in next dc) 3 times. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 27 sc.
4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Dc2tog) 7 times. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
Fasten off.
8th rnd: Join A with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
9th and 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Working in front loops only, sl st in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.
12th rnd: Join C with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. Working in back loops only of 10th rnd, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sl st.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sl st around. Do not join, work in continuous rnds.
14th to 17th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
18th rnd: Join C with sl st to first sc. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
19th to 20th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
21st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 20 sc.
22nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off.

BODY
See Diagram 19.
Hold Legs with toes facing in same direction and mark inner sc on both Legs. 
Note: Stuff firmly as you work.
1st rnd: With RS facing, join B with sc in inner sc of first Leg. Ch 1. 1 sc in inner sc of second Leg. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc around same Leg. 1 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc around first Leg. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd. 41 sc.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in rem loop of joining ch. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 24 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. 44 sc.
3rd to 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 10 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 10 sc. 42 sts.
8th to 14th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
15th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
16th and 17th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
18th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
19th and 20th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
21st rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. 28 sts.
22nd rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
23rd rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sts. 
24th and 25th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
26th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 20 sts.
27th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 16 sts. Fasten off. Join A.
28th rnd: With A, 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off. 

HEAD STABILIZER
See Diagram 20.
29th rnd: Join C with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sts.
30th rnd: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
31st and 32nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Stuff firmly.
33rd rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.

HEAD
See Diagram 21.
1st rnd: With RS facing, and working in free loops of sc of Rnd 30 of Head Stabilizer, join C with sl st at back center. Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. 30 sts. PM for beg of rnd.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
5th to 14th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Attach safety eyes between 11th and 12th rnds approx 4 sc apart.
Stuff firmly as you work.
15th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Rep from * around. 36 sts.
16th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
17th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
18th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
19th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
20th rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.
Fasten off.

HAIR BASE
See Diagram 22.
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. 6 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 36 sc.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc.
8th to 15th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
16th rnd: Sl st in next sc. (Ch 3. 1 tr) in same sp as last sl st. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each st to last 5 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. (1 tr. Ch 3) in last sc. Join with sl st in first sl st. Fasten off.

BUN
See Diagram 23.
With A, ch 2.
1st to 4th rnds: Rep 1st to 4th rnds of Hair Base.
5th and 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
8th rnd: *1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts. Fasten off. 
Stuff firmly.

HAIR TIE
With D, ch 15.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off leaving a long end for sewing.

BERRY
With B, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Beg Cluster. Ch 2. (3-dc cluster. Ch 2) twice in ring. Join with sl st to first cluster. Fasten off leaving a long end for sewing. 

PIN Hair Base to Head. Sew in place. Sew Bun on Head. Sew Hair Tie around Bun and then sew Berry over seam.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Solids 2.5 oz/70.9 g; Ombres 2 oz/56.7 g)
2 balls Main Color (MC) and small amount of Contrast A
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Ribbon 14 ins [35.5 cm] long, ¼ ins [1 cm] wide
measurements: Duck toy measures approximately 10 inches long.
instructions:
(Make 2 pieces alike). With MC, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Rep last row 3 times more.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Rep last row 6 times more.

Tail: Next row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Fasten off.

Head
With WS of work facing, join MC with ss to first st. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last ss. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 3 sc in first st. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each sc to last st. 2 sc in last st. 10 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 2. Turn.
Next row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep last 2 rows twice more.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sts. Sc3tog over next 3 sts. Fasten off.

Joining Back and Front: Place Back and Front tog. Join MC with ss to first ch of foundation ch, working through both thicknesses. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as first ss. 1 sc in each sp around, working 3 sc in top of Tail and point of nose. Stuff lightly before closing up duck. Join with ss to first sc.
Fasten off. With A, embroider eye as illustrated. Tie ribbon around neck.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 2 skeins 913 Calliope A, 1 skein each 235 Lemon B, 579 Pale Plum C, and 373 Petal Pink D
two ½” (12 mm) blue safety eyes
12” (30.5 cm) and 18” (45.5 cm) pieces of heavy cardboard
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Unicorn measures 13” (33 cm) from end of nose to hind end and 13” (33 cm) tall from top of head to bottom of front leg.
gauge: 8 sts = 2” (5 cm); 7 rows = 2” (5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Head
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Rounds 4–6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: *Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—15 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: *Sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc. Stuff head firmly.
Round 12: *Sc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Weave tail through last round and pull stitches closed.
Ear (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—9 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—12 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—15 sc.
Rounds 5 and 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: *Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Fold Round 7 in half and sew on side of head 2 or 3 rounds above eye.
Horn
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: Work 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc—7 sc.
Neck
Beginning at top of neck and with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Rounds 4–7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: Work 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 17 sc—19 sc.
Round 9: Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 13 sc—20 sc.
Round 10: Sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc—21 sc.
Round 11: 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 20 sc—22 sc.
Round 12: Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 15 sc—23 sc.
Round 13: Sc in next 11 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 11 sc—24 sc.
Round 14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: *Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—27 sc.
Round 16: *Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff neck. With beginning of neck held flat against back of head, sew pieces together joining in a circle.
Body
Beginning at top of neck and with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—36 sc.
Round 7: *Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—42 sc.
Rounds 8–18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: *Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * 5 times, sc in next 18 sc—36 sc.
Rounds 20–36: Sc in each sc around.
Round 37: *Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Round 38: *Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 39: *Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—18 sc. Stuff body.
Round 40: *Sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc.
Round 41: *Sc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Finish stuffing. Weave tail through last round and pull stitches closed. Using photograph as a guide, sew head and neck piece to front top of body.
Hind Leg (make 2)
Beginning at bottom of leg and with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: Working in front loops only, slip st in sc around—18 slip sts.
Round 5: Working in unworked back loops of Round 3, sc in each sc around—18 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—15 sc.
Round 7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: *Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc.
Rounds 9–14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: Sc in next sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in next 2 sc, *sc2tog; repeat from * twice—12 sc.
Round 16: Sc in each sc around.
Round 17: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—15 sc.
Round 18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: *Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc.
Round 20: Sc in each sc around.
Round 21: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 22: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 23: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—30 sc.
Rounds 24–30: Sc in each sc around.
Round 31: *Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 32: *Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—18 sc. Stuff leg firmly.
Round 33: *Sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Finish stuffing. Weave tail through last round and pull stitches closed. Holding top of leg firmly against back side of body, sew pieces together joining in a circle.
Front Leg (make 2)
Work Rounds 1–14 same as hind leg.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 16: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—15 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: *Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc.
Round 19: Sc in each sc around.
Round 20: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—15 sc.
Round 21: *Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Rounds 22–25: Sc in each sc around.
Round 26: *Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—15 sc.
Round 27: *Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc. Stuff leg firmly.
Round 28: *Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—9 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Finish stuffing. Weave tail through last round and pull stitches closed. Holding top of leg firmly against front side of body, sew pieces together joining in a circle.
Tail
Wrap a strand of C 60 times around a 12” (30.5 cm) piece of cardboard. Thread a 12” (30.5 cm) length of yarn under top of wraps and tie tightly in a knot; leave tails for sewing. Cut wraps at other end. Repeat with a strand of D, wrapping around cardboard 24 times. Place D-colored bundle on top of C-colored bundle and tie together at center knots. With D-colored bundle on top, sew tail securely to hind end. Separate 6 strands of D into three 2-strands hanks and braid to desired length, leaving a few inches for tying. Tie in an overhand knot and trim evenly. Repeat until all strands of D are braided.
Mane
Wrap a strand of D 70 times around a 12” (30.5 cm) piece of cardboard. Cut one end. Hold 3 strands together and fold in half forming a loop at folded end. Beginning at top of head between ears, draw loop through center stitch, thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten and secure. Repeat to attach each 3-strand hank, evenly spaced down center of head and neck. Wrap a strand of C 36 times around an 18” (45.5 cm) piece of cardboard. Cut one end. Attach 3-strand hanks randomly and in same manner as and between D-colored hanks. Braid each C-colored hank to desired length; tie and trim same as tail braids. For additional shorter braids, wrap a strand of C around 12” (30.5 cm) piece of cardboard 6 times, attach and braid same as longer hanks. Cut three 15” (38 cm) lengths of C, attach to forehead and braid same as longer hanks.

materials: small amount of red yarn or embroidery floss (for mouth)
two 20” (51cm) lengths of floral stem wire (for pose-able leprechaun – optional)
RED HEART® Super Saver: 1 skein each 368 Paddy Green A, 312 Black B, 321 Gold C, 672 Spring Green D, 512 Turqua E, 256 Carrot F, 316 Soft White G, 313 Aran H
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Leprechaun measures 14” (35.5 cm) tall, including hat
gauge: 13 sts = 4” (10 cm); 14 rows/rounds = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SHOES (make 2)
Beginning at bottom of shoe, with B, ch 8.
Round 1 (right side): Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 5 ch; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in same st as join, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 5 sc; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Top of Shoe
Identify 9 sts at center of one end of shoe (for toe end). Top of shoe is worked back and forth in rows.
Row 5 (right side): With right side facing, draw up a loop in the first of the 9 toe sts, ch 1, insert hook in same st, yarn over and pull up a loop, [insert hook in next st, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook, [sc3tog] twice, slip st in next st, turn; leave remaining sts unworked.
Row 6: Skip the slip st, sc3tog, slip st in end of Row 5, turn.


Ankle
Round 7 (right side): Ch 1, work 14 sc evenly spaced all the way around top opening of shoe; join with slip st in first sc—14 sc.
Round 8: Slip st in each st around.
Fasten off. With C, embroider a straight stitch square on the front of each shoe for buckle. Use a small amount of B to stuff the toe of each shoe and set aside.

LEGS (make 2)
Beginning at bottom of leg with G, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Rounds 3–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; change to D; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; change to G; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 8 and 9: Repeat Rounds 6 and 7. Fasten off D.
Round 10: With G, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 11: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; change to A; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off G.
Begin Knickers
Round 12: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Rounds 13 and 14: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 4 times; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc.
Rounds 16–18: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off first leg. Make 2nd leg but do not fasten off.
Join Legs
Round 1 (joining round): Beginning on 2nd leg, ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next st; beginning in any st on top of first leg, sc in next 16 sc of first leg, leave last 4 sc unworked and leave corresponding 4 sc of 2nd leg unworked, sc in remaining 14 sc of 2nd leg; join with slip st in first sc—32 sc. Working from wrong side, sew the matching unworked stitches between the legs together. Decide which side of the joined legs you would like to be the front. Place a small amount of stuffing in the bottom of each leg. Place one shoe on bottom of each leg taking care to place the toes facing forwards and sew in place. Place a marker in center back of top of each leg.
Round 2: Ch 1, [sc in each sc to 1 st before next marker, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc] twice, sc in each sc to end of round; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc. Remove markers.
Rounds 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

HEAD
Beginning at top of head with H, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in next sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 5 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 3 sc—36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Rounds 8–12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: Sc in next 21 sc, popcorn in next sc (for nose), sc in last 20 sc.
Rounds 14–16: Sc in each sc around.
Attach safety eyes about two rows above nose and spaced as desired.
Round 17: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 18: Sc in next sc, [sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] 5 times, sc2tog, sc in last 3 sc—30 sc.
Round 19: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 20: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 21: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Rounds 22–24: Sc in each sc around.
Slip st in next st. Fasten off. Stuff head. With yarn needle and F, embroider straight stitches across top of head for hair. Begin by sewing a long straight stitch from one side of top front of head to back center of head to define the part. Then embroider straight sts across the head from the part to the sides of the head. Keep working stitches between the part and sides of head, gradually working towards the back of the head. Keep the stitches very close together, even allowing them to overlap from time to time. Vary the length of the stitches to approximate the look of real hair. Work longer stitches over the top of the head and shorter stitches near the lower edges of the sides to add texture and make shaping the lower edges of the hair easier. Embroider shorter straight stitches near the front of the part for a cowlick and on either side of the front of the face for sideburns.

Notes: It is important to stuff the head before embroidering the hair to prevent the head from puckering as the stitches are worked. Pay attention to the tension of the stitches as you want them to be tight enough to sit smoothly on the head, but not so tight that they deform the head. Stuffing may stick to the needle as you embroider. Take care not to pull the stuffing all the way through to the outside.

EARS (make 2)
With H, ch 4.
Row 1: Working in back bars, slip st in first ch from hook sc in next ch, dc in next ch, slip st in last ch. Fasten off. Arrange ears on either side of head, behind the sideburns (spread some of the straight sts apart slightly for ear placement) and even with the nose. Sew ears in place.
With a small amount of red yarn or embroidery floss, embroider a straight stitch “V” for mouth.

HAT
Beginning at top of hat with A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Note: Work first stitch of each round in same stitch as join.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in next sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 5 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 3 sc; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Sc in next sc, [sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] 5 times, sc2tog, sc in last 3 sc; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Rounds 9–11: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Brim
Round 12: Ch 1, working in back loops only, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—32 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, working in both loops, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 8 times; join with slip st in first sc—40 sc.
Round 14: Slip st in each st around. Fasten off.

Hat Band
With B, ch 2.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—1 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in the sc.
Repeat Row 2 until piece is long enough to go around hat above brim. Fasten off, leaving a tail for sewing. Sew ends of hat band together and slip over top of hat and down to just above brim. With C embroider a straight st square on hat band for buckle.

JACKET
Beginning at lower edge with A, ch 33.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—32 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 18 sc, sc2tog, sc in last 5 sc, turn—30 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 13 sc, [sc2tog] twice, sc in last 13 sc, turn—28 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 14 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 6 sc, turn—30 sc. Do not fasten off.
First Front 
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc, turn; leave remaining sts unworked for back and second front—6 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off.
Back
Row 1: Skip 1 unworked st following first front (for underarm), join A with sc in next unworked st, sc in next 15 unworked sc, turn; leave remaining sts unworked for second front—16 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off.
Second Front
Row 1: Skip 1 unworked st following back (for underarm), join A with sc in next unworked st, sc in last 5 unworked sc, turn—6 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off. Fold fronts over back and sew shoulder seams.

Collar
Row 1: Join A with sc in edge of one front just before shoulder seam, work 13 more sc evenly spaced across back neck edge working last of these sc in edge of other front just following shoulder seam, turn—14 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in last sc—16 sc. Fasten off.

Sleeves (work 2)
Round 1: Join A with sc in skipped sc at underarm, work 11 more sc evenly spaced around armhole; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Rounds 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, sc2tog, sc in last 5 sc; join with slip st in first sc—11 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, sc2tog, sc in last 4 sc; join with slip st in first sc—10 sc.
Rounds 8 and 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off. Repeat for second sleeve.

Cuffs (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, turn—3 sc.
Rows 3–16: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 17: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, turn—2 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, sc2tog—1 sc.
Fasten off. Repeat for second cuff. Wrap one cuff around end of each sleeve. With sewing needle and thread, sew a tiny yellow button through the shaped ends of the cuff. With yarn needle and yarn, sew outer edge of cuff to outer edge of sleeve. Repeat for second cuff.

VEST
Notes: Vest is worked from side to side. Color is changed every row (except Row 6). Colors are joined and rows worked with right side facing at all times.
Beginning at one side of vest with C, ch 11.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—10 sc. Fasten off.
Row 2: With right side facing, join D with sc in first sc, sc in same sc (increase made), sc in each remaining sc across—11 sc. Fasten off.
Row 3: With right side facing, join C with sc in first sc, sc in same sc (increase made), sc in each remaining sc across—12 sc. Fasten off.
Row 4: With right side facing and slip knot of D on hook, draw up a loop in first sc, draw up a loop in next sc, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook (decrease made), sc in each remaining sc across—11 sc. Fasten off.
Row 5: With C, repeat Row 4—10 sc. Fasten off.
Row 6: With right side facing and working in back loops only, join C with sc in first sc, sc in each remaining sc across. Fasten off.
Rows 7–10: Repeat Rows 2–5.
Fasten off. With sewing needle and thread, sew 4 tiny green buttons evenly spaced across Row 6. Turn jacket inside out and sew edges of vest to inside of fronts of jacket. Sew edges of vest about ½” (1.5cm) in from front edges of jacket. After sewing vest in place, turn jacket right side out again.

HANDS (make 2)
With H, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Rounds 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in same sc as join, sc in next sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] twice; join with slip st in first sc—9 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first 8 sc, popcorn (for thumb); join with slip st in first sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in same sc as join, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] twice; join with slip st in first sc—7 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff hand. Weave tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Secure end and weave in. Repeat for second hand. Insert one hand in end of each sleeve, taking care to place thumb upwards, and sew in place.

BOWTIE
With E, ch 2.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—1 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in the sc, turn—2 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in next 2 sc, turn—4 sc.
Rows 4–6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, turn—2 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc2tog, turn—1 sc.
Rows 9 and 10: Ch 1, sc in the sc, turn.
Rows 11–18: Repeat Rows 2–9.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew ends of tie together and weave in ends. Flatten piece centering the narrow section.

Band
With E, ch 2.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—1 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in the sc, turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Wrap band around narrow center of tie and sew ends of band together. Weave in ends.

POT ‘O GOLD
Beginning at bottom of pot with B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in next sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 5 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 3 sc—36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: Sc in next 2 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] 5 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 4 sc—48 sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—54 sc.
Round 10: Sc in next 3 sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc] 5 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 5 sc—60 sc.
Round 11: [Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—66 sc.
Rounds 12–21: Sc in each sc around.
Round 22: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 11 times—55 sc.
Round 23: Sc in first sc, [sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 10 times, sc2tog, sc in last 2 sc—44 sc.
Rounds 24 and 25: Sc in each sc around.
Round 26: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 11 times—55 sc.
Round 27: Sc in first sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 10 times, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last 3 sc—66 sc.
Rounds 28 and 29: Sc in each sc around.
Round 30: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 22 times—44 sc.
Slip st in next st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Curl top edge to the right side (outside) of pot. With tail sew curled edge in place. Stuff pot.

COINS (make 24 or as many as desired)
With C, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: TURN, slip st in each st around. Fasten off.
Arrange coins, overlapping edges, into a circle a bit larger than the top opening of the pot. Sew coins together then sew edges of circle of coins to top edge of pot, allowing some coins to overlap with the edge and adding more stuffing as you sew to make the coins bulge upwards out of the pot.

FINISHING
When assembling leprechaun, add stuffing as you sew to ensure that leprechaun is well-padded. Do not stuff so firmly that stuffing shows through stitches.

Pose-able Leprechaun (optional)
Bend up the ends of each piece of floral stem wire about ½–1” (1.5–2.5cm). Wrap the bent ends with duct tape to secure and cover any sharp edges. Fold one piece of wire in half. Twist the top (fold) of the piece (this end will be inserted into the neck later). Insert one end of bent piece into each leg. Stuff the legs firmly, distributing the stuffing evenly around the wire. Twist the center of the second length of wire around the first length about 2” (5 cm) from the top (Hint: Hold jacket in place over legs to see where sleeves line up before twisting second length around first length). Wrap twist with duct tape to secure second length of wire to first. Insert one end of second length into each sleeve. Stuff sleeves firmly, distributing the stuffing evenly around the wire. Sew the jacket to the top of the legs. Sew under the lower edge of the jacket (about 3 rows up from lower edge) and sew to legs about 3 rows from top edge of legs. Stuff the body of the jacket firmly. Use your finger to make a hole in the stuffing of the neck. Insert the twisted end of the first length of wire into the opening and insert neck into top of jacket. Take care to keep collar on the outside. Sew neck into opening at top of jacket, sewing through second row of neck. Add more stuffing as you sew, distributing it evenly around the wire and ensuring that the neck is sturdy. Sew bowtie to front of neck. Stuff hat and sew to top of head.

Leprechaun Assembly (if not pose-able)
Stuff legs firmly. Stuff sleeves and jacket firmly. Sew the jacket to the top of the legs. Sew under the lower edge of the jacket (about 3 rows up from lower edge) and sew to legs about 3 rows from top edge of legs. Sew neck into opening at top of jacket, sewing through second row of neck. Add more stuffing as you go to ensure that the neck is sturdy (Hint: Insert a short length of wire or dowel to increase the sturdiness of the neck). Sew bowtie to front of neck. Stuff hat and sew to top of head.

Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein 256 Carrot A, small amount 312 Black B.
Split-lock stitch marker; yarn needle, stuffing, 2 small round black buttons (9mm).
abbreviations: dec (decrease) = draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Lobster measures 5½” tall; Mermaid measures 6¼” tall.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 20 rnds = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LITTLE LOBSTER INSTRUCTIONS
HEAD AND BODY: Begin at top of head with A, ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc. 
Rnd 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6times – 30 sc. 
Rnds 6-12: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 13: [Dec] 15 times – 15 sc.
Neck-Rnd 14: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 3 times – 12 sc. 
Body-Rnd 15: [Inc] 12 times – 24 sc.
Rnds 16-19: Sc in each sc around. Stuff head.
Rnds 20-24: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 25: [Dec] 12 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 26: [Dec] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off.
Finish stuffing. Weave yarn tail through remaining 6 sc, draw up firmly to gather; fasten securely.
CLAW (Make 4): With A, ch 2.
Row 1: 5 Sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, [inc] 5 times – 10 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, [inc] 10 times – 20 sc. Fasten off.
Fold piece in half. Sew through both thicknesses of Row 3 together through back loops. Stuff lightly, sew opening closed. Sew 2 claws together at bottom for each arm.
ARM (Make 2): With A, ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] twice – 8 sc.
Rnds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Stuff lightly. Sew Rnd 4 in place on body. Sew a pair of claws to top of Rnd 1.
LEGS (Make 8): With A, ch 6; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off.
Sew 4 on each side under arms.
FEELERS (Make 2): With A, ch 13; slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off.
Sew to top of head.
TAIL: With A, ch 18; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around – 18 sc.
Rnds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 4: [Sc in next 4 sc, dec] 3 times – 15 sc.
Rnd 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 3 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 6: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 3 times – 9 sc.
Rnd 7: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 8: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] 3 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 9: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] 4 times – 16 sc.
Rnds 10 and 11: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 12: [Sc in next 7 sc, inc] twice – 18 sc.
Rnd 13: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] 6 times – 24 sc. Fasten off.
Flatten Rnd 13 and sew together through both thicknesses. Sew through both thicknesses at Rnd 7 so stuffing won’t go beyond this point. Stuff Rnds 1-6. Sew tail in place.
Sew eyes in place. With B, embroider smile.

BABY MERMAID INSTRUCTIONS
HEAD AND BODY: Begin at top of head with A, ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc. 
Rnd 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6times – 30 sc. 
Rnds 6-12: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 13: [Dec] 15 times – 15 sc.
Neck-Rnd 14: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 3 times – 12 sc. 
Body-Rnd 15: [Inc] 12 times – 24 sc.
Rnds 16-19: Sc in each sc around. Cut A. Stuff head.
