Rnds 20-24: With B, sc in each sc around.
Rnd 25: [Dec] 12 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 26: [Dec] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off.
Finish stuffing. Weave yarn tail through remaining 6 sc, draw up firmly to gather; fasten securely.
TAIL: With B, ch 18; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, sc in each ch around – 18 sc.
Rnds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 4: [Dec] 9 times – 9 sc.
Rnd 5: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 6: [Inc] 9 times – 18 sc.
Fin-Rnd 7: [Slip st in first sc, sc in next sc, hdc in next sc, 2 hdc in each of next 3 sc, hdc in next sc, sc in next sc, slip st in next sc] twice. Fasten off. 
Sew fin seam. Stuff tail and sew in place on left side of body.
ARM (Make 2): With A, ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] twice – 8 sc.
Rnds 3-6: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off. 
Stuff lightly. Sew opening flat and sew in place.
FLOWER (Make 2): With D, ch 2.
Rnd 1: [Sc, ch 1] 6 times all in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st to first sc. Fasten off.
Sew in place.
EARS: With A, ch 2.
Row 1: 3 Sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc. Fasten off.
Sew ears in place.
HAIR: With C, [ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 3 ch] 5 times. Fasten off.
Gather slip st section together and sew to top of head. Tie bow around hair with ribbon.
Sew green buttons in place for eyes. With red pearl cotton embroider smile. Color cheeks lightly with crayon.

materials: Bernat® Blanket ™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/210 m)
Size U.S. K/10½ [6.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] tall by 11" [28 cm] wide
instructions:
Note: All rnds are joined with a sl st to first st unless otherwise indicated.
Beak
Note: Beak is not stuffed with polyfill
With B, ch 7.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Working into opposite side of chain, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. Join.14 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Fasten off, leaving long tail to stitch Beak onto Head of Duck.
Body/Head
With A, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here: https://www.yarnspirations.com/ca-en/video-y-crochet-magic-loop.html
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each sc around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sc.
7th to 14th rnds: As 5th rnd.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
16th rnd: As 5th rnd.
17th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
18th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
19th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 40 sc.
20th rnd: As 5th rnd.
21st rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
22nd to 29th rnds: As 5th rnd.
Note: Attach safety eyes between rnds 27 and 28 approx 10 sts apart.
Stitch Beak to Head between rnds 26 and 27 centred between safety eyes.
30th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sts.
31st rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sts.
32nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sts.
33rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sts.
Note: Stuff with polyfill before proceeding to following decrease rnds.
34th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Join. 30 sts.
35th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
36th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around until closed. Join. Fasten off.
Wings (make 2)
Note: Wings are not stuffed with polyfill.
With A, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 9 sc in ring. Join. 9 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
4th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sc.
6th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
8th rnd: As 2nd rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 9 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Sew to either side of Duck where head and body meet as shown in photo.
Feet (make 2)
With B, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. 3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 7 sts. Join. 26 sts.
4th rnd: Working in back loops only, work 1 sc in each of next 8 sts. Skip next dc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Skip next dc. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 23 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. (Sc2tog) to end of rnd. Join. 12 sts.
7th rnd: As 5th rnd.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff Feet with polyfill and sew to bottom of Duck approx 5 rnds from bottom and 15 sts apart.
Tail
With A, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 9 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 15 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to end of rnd. Join. 18 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in each of first 3 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 21 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of first 4 sts. 1 sc in each st to end of rnd. Join. 25 sc.
9th rnd: As 7th rnd.
Sew to back of Duck as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each of 313 Aran A, 312 Black B, 530 Orchid C, 718 Shocking Pink D, 356 Amethyst E, 256 Carrot F, 406 Medium Thyme G.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, F, and G = Color A, B, C, D, E, F, and G
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 20 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEAD AND BODY
Beginning at top of head, with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Rounds 8–15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc2tog] 15 times—15 sts.
Rounds 17–19: Sc in each sc around.
Round 20: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 7 times, sc in last sc—22 sc.
Round 21: [Sc in next 10 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times; change to B in last sc—24 sc.
Undershirt
Rounds 22–27: With B, sc in each sc around; change to A in last sc of Round 27.
Waist
Rounds 28 and 29: With A, sc in each sc around; change to B in last sc of Round 29.
Begin Knickers
Rounds 30–35: With B, sc in each sc around. Do not fasten off. Stuff body firmly.
Joining Row: Flatten lower edging, matching stitches. Working through both thicknesses, sc across to close lower edge. Fasten off B.
ARM (make 2)
Beginning at top of arm, with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc.
Rounds 3–19: Sc in each sc, stuffing arm as you go.
Round 20: [Sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 3 sc—6 sc.
Round 21: Work 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in last 3 sc—9 sc.
Rounds 22–24: Sc in each sc around.
Round 25: [Sc2tog] 4 times, sc in last sc—5 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff arm. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull gently to close opening. Draw a strand of A through arm at elbow and pull to form elbow dimple. Sew arms to sides of body. With B, embroider a strap over each shoulder, from top front of undershirt to top back of undershirt.
EAR (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Sew ears in place. 
Earrings (make 2)
Thread two beads onto heavy-duty sewing thread and sew to ear. Repeat for 2nd earring.
HAIR
Wrap F around 7” piece of heavy cardboard 150 times. Wrap E around same piece of cardboard 2 times. Cut one end of wraps. *Fold one strand in half, forming a loop at folded end. Insert hook around a stitch on head of doll at hairline. Place loop of folded strands on hook and draw through. Thread ends of strands through loop and pull to tighten; repeat from * around hairline, placing the E-colored strands on top of head on right side. Continue to repeat from * to fill in over back of head. Holding head firmly, brush hair with a hairbrush until desired texture is achieved. Trim ends to about shoulder length.
LEG (make 2)
Beginning at foot, with E, ch 6.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch—12 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc—18 sc.
Round 3: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; change to A in last sc.
Round 4: With A, sc in next 6 sc, [sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 6 sc—15 sc.
Round 5: Sc in next 3 sc, [sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 6 sc—12 sc.
Round 6: Sc in next 3 sc, [sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 3 sc—9 sc.
Rounds 7 and 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: Work 2 sc in first sc, sc in each remaining sc around—10 sc.
Rounds 10–27: Sc in each sc around, stuffing leg as you go; change to B in last sc.
Round 28: With B, sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Seam Toe
Flatten last row, matching stitches and ensuring that toe faces forward, sewing through both thicknesses, sew across.
Shoe Ties
With E, ch 50 (for first tie), slip st in top of shoe at center back, ch 50 (for 2nd tie). Fasten off. Criss-cross ties around leg and tie in a bow at front.
Sew legs to bottom of body.
MOBIUS SCARF
With C, ch 14.
Row 1: Work (sc, 2 dc) in 2nd ch from hook, *ch 2, skip next 3 ch, (sc, 2 dc) in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—4 (sc, 2 dc) groups.
Row 2: Ch 1, (sc, 2 dc) in first dc, *ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, (sc, 2 dc) in next dc; repeat from * across to last 2 sts, skip next dc, dc in last sc, turn.
Repeat last row until piece is long enough to wrap very loosely around dolls shoulders. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Place piece flat then flip one short edge over. Sew short edges together.
HAT
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in same st as join, 2 dc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—24 sc at the end of Round 3.
Round 4: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, [dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc] 11 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—36 sc.
Rounds 5–7: Ch 3, dc in each dc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch.
First Earflap
Note: Work now proceeds back and forth in rows.
Row 8: Ch 3, dc in next 7 dc, turn; leave remaining sts unworked—8 dc.
Row 9: Ch 3, dc in each dc across, turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 4 times, turn—4 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 2 times, turn—2 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc2tog, ch 12 (for tie). Fasten off.
Second Earflap
Row 8: Skip next 8 unworked dc following first earflap, join B with sl st in next dc, ch 3, dc in next 7 dc, turn—8 dc.
Repeat Rows 9–12 of first earflap. Fasten off.
DRESS
Bodice
With D, ch 10.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—9 sc.
Rows 2–26: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across, turn. Do not turn at end of Row 26. Do not fasten off.
Skirt
Row 1: Working in ends of rows across side of bodice, sc in end of each row across; change to E in last sc, turn—26 sc.
Row 2: With E, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in first sc (increase made), 2 dc in each remaining sc across, turn—52 dc.
Rows 3–7: Ch 3, dc in each dc across, turn; change to D in last st of Row 7.
Row 8 (Right Side): With D and working in front loops only, ch 3, dc in first dc (increase made), 2 dc in each remaining dc across, turn—104 dc.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in each dc across. Fasten off. 
Row 10: Working in free back loops of Row 7 (behind D-colored ruffle), join E with slip st in sc, ch 4 (counts as tr), tr in same sc (increase made), 2 tr in each remaining sc across, turn.
Row 11: Ch 3, dc in each tr across.
Fasten off. Sew back seam using matching yarn colors.
Neck Ties
With D, ch 35 (for first tie), slip st in center top of bodice, ch 35 (for 2nd tie). Fasten off.
BAG
With B, ch 17.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, *dc in each of next 2 ch, sc in next 4 ch; repeat from * across, turn—16 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, *dc in next 2 sts, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * across; change to G in last st, turn. Do not fasten off B. Carry color not in use up side of piece until next needed.
Rows 3 and 4: With G, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in next 3 sts, *sc in next 2 sts, dc in next 4 sts; repeat from * across, turn; change to B in last st of Row 4.
Rows 5 and 6: With B, work Row 2 twice; change to G in last sc of Row 6.
Rows 7–14: Repeat Rows 3–6 two times.
Rows 15–17: Repeat Rows 3–5.
Row 18: With B, ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, dc in next 2 dc, sc in next 2 sc, ch 4 (for button loop), sc in next 2 sc, dc in next 2 dc, sc in last 4 sc. Fasten off.
Fold bag in half. Working through both thicknesses, join B with sc in one lower corner (at fold), sc evenly spaced up side edge, ch 30 (for strap); working through both thicknesses, sc down other side edge. Fasten off. Sew button opposite buttonhole.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Place clothing and accessories on doll.
Embroider Face
With G, embroider satin stitch eyes. With F, embroider couched stitch eyebrows. With A, embroider satin stitch nose. With D, embroider a couched stitch smile. With red crayon, gently rub color onto face for cheeks.
Bracelet
With D, ch 10, sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next 3 ch, hdc in next ch, sc in last 2 ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Wrap bracelet around wrist of doll and sew ends together.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Lily Sugar’n Cream Denims (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Doll: Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. Stuffing. 2 small black beads for eyes. Small amount of red, black and brown embroidery floss for embroidery.
Skirt and Vest: Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge. Button.
gauge: Doll: 16 sc and 20 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]. Skirt and Vest: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
DOLL
Head
**With smaller hook and MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 10 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook– sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Stuff Head.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts. Fasten off.
Body
With smaller hook and MC, ch 30. Join with sl st to first ch taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 2 ins [5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4 ins [10 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Sew bottom edge of Body closed. Stuff Body.
Arms (make 2).
With smaller hook and MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4 ins [10 cm]. Fasten off.
Stuff Arms lightly.
Legs (make 2).
Boot: With smaller hook and A, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd:Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd:Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 21 sts.
6th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sts.
7th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
8th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 5 times more. Join MC at end of last rnd.
Next rnd:With MC, working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Leg from top of boot measures 2½ ins [6 cm].
Fasten off.
Stuff Legs.
Finishing
Sew top of Legs closed using whip st. Sew to bottom of Body as shown in picture. Attach Arms to sides of Body. With black embroidery floss, embroider eyelashes using straight stitch. Sew beads onto front of Head for eyes. With brown embroidery floss, make freckles using French knots. With red embroidery floss, embroider mouth using straight stitch.
Hair fringe
Cut a piece of tape 11 ins [28 cm] long and secure onto a flat surface with sticky side up. Cut lengths of B 19 ins [48 cm] long and lay them across tape so strip of tape is in center of yarn. Holding tissue paper over top of yarn and using sewing machine, run a line of stitching along length of tape. Remove tape when hair is secure. Remove tissue paper after stitching
Pin fringe to center of head. Using backstitch and B, sew hair into place along sewn line. Braid Hair and secure at side of Head.
Skirt
Note: Ch 2 for turning ch does not count as st.
With larger hook and C, ch 25.
1st row:(RS). 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 24 hdc.
2nd to 6th rows:Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in last hdc. Break C. Join D. Turn. 31 hdc.
8th row:With D, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first hdc.1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. (Yoh and draw up a loop in next hdc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times. Yoh and draw through all 4 loops on hook– dc3tog made. *1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. 3 dc in next hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. Dc3tog. Rep from * to last 4 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 dc in last hdc. Turn.
9th row:Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Dc3tog. *1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 3 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Dc3tog. Rep from * to last 4 dc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Fasten off.
Sew side seams.
Vest
Front (make 2 alike).
With larger hook and D, ch 2.
1st row:3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row:Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc.
4th row:As 3rd row. 9 sc.
5th to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
11th row: Sl st in each of first 3 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
12th row:Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 5 sts.
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
14th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sts.
15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Fasten off.
Back
With larger hook and D, ch 16.
1st row:1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. Turn. 15 sc.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
7th row: Sl st in each of first 3 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
8th and 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
10th row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sl st in each sc to last 2 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew side and shoulder seams of Vest. Put on Doll. Sew button to front of Vest through both thicknesses.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 0319 Cherry Red A, 0886 Blue B, 0312 Black C, 0334 Buff D, 0321 Gold E and 0313 Aran F.
Yarn needle, stitch marker, fiberfill, pins, one pair 18-20mm safety eyes.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, F = Color A, B, C, D, E, F
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 15 rows = 4” in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BODY
Legs (Make 1) Beginning at bottom of legs, with A, ch 70; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch around, do not turn, work in continuous rounds—70 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: Sc in each sc around. Repeat Round 2 until piece measures 5” from beginning. Slip st in next st. Fasten off.
Tunic
Beginning at bottom of tunic, with B, ch 80; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch around, do not turn, work in continuous rounds—80 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc in next 14 sc, sc2tog] 5 times—75 sc. Rounds 5 and 6: Sc in each sc around. Round 7: [Sc in next 13 sc, sc2tog] 5 times—70 sc. Do not fasten off.
Join Legs and Tunic
Place legs inside tunic, matching sts. Round 1: Working in both loops of tunic and front loop of legs, sc in each sc around. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around. Slip st in next st. Round 4: [Sc in next 12 sc, sc2tog] 5 times—65 sc. Slip st in next st. Fasten off.
Belt
Round 1: With Right Side facing, join C with sc in any sc, sc in each remaining sc around. Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around. Slip st in next st. Fasten off.
Top of Tunic
Round 1: With Right Side facing, join B with sc in any sc, sc in each remaining sc around. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around. Round 4: [Sc in next 11 sc, sc2tog] 5 times—60 sc. Rounds 5–7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—54 sc. Rounds 9–11: Sc in each sc around. Round 12: [Sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—48 sc. Round 13: Sc in each sc around. Round 14: [Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—42 sc. Round 15: Sc in each sc around. Round 16: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—36 sc. Round 17: Sc in each sc around. Round 18: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc. Round 19: Sc in each sc around. Round 20: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc. Round 21: Sc in each sc around. Slip st in next st. Fasten off.
Arms (Make 2)
Hand
With D, make an adjustable ring. Round 1 (Right Side): Work 8 sc in ring. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—16 sc. Round 3: Sc in each sc around. Round 4: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—20 sc. Round 5: Sc in each sc around. Round 6: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 5 times—15 sc. Round 7: Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in next sc, popcorn in next sc (for thumb), sc in next sc, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog—12 sc. Rounds 8 and 9: Sc in each sc around. Slip st in next st. Fasten off.
Arm
Round 1: With Right Side facing, join B with sc in any sc, sc in each remaining sc around. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—15 sc. Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around. Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—18 sc. Rounds 7–9: Sc in each sc around. Round 10: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—21 sc. Rounds 11–16: Sc in each sc around.
Shape Shoulder
Note: The shoulder is worked back and forth in rows, creating a tall triangle on top of the arm. One or two stitches are left unworked at the end of each row. When the shoulder triangle is complete, a round of sc is worked all the way around the edges of the triangle causing the top of the shoulder to curve slightly. Place a marker in last round worked, directly above thumb. Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in each sc to 1 sc before marker, turn. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in next 19 sc, turn; leave last 2 sc unworked—19 sc. Row 3: Sc in each sc to last sc, turn; leave last st unworked—18 sc. Rows 4–16: Repeat Row 3—5 sc. Round 17: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; working in the sts left unworked in previous row, sc in every sc all the way around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Head
Beginning at top of head, with D, make an adjustable ring. Round 1 (Right Side): Work 8 sc in ring. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—16 sc. Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times—24 sc. Round 4: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc. Round 5: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc. Round 6: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc. Round 7: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—48 sc. Rounds 8–13: Sc in each sc around. Round 14: Sc in first 24 sc, popcorn in next sc (for nose), sc in next 23 sc. Rounds 15–18: Sc in each sc around. Round 19: [Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—42 sc. Round 20: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—36 sc. Round 21: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc. Round 22: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc. Rounds 23–25: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Shoes (Make 2)
Beginning at back of shoe, with C, ch 28; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch around, do not turn, work in continuous rounds—28 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Rounds 2–6: Sc in each sc around. Round 7: Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc—24 sc. Round 8: Sc in each sc around. Round 9: Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc—20 sc. Round 10: Sc in each sc around. Round 11: Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 3 times, sc in next 3 sc—16 sc. Round 12: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog, sc in next sc, sc2tog] twice, sc in next 2 sc—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through stitches of last round. Pull tail gently, but firmly, to close opening. Secure end.
Belt Buckle
With E, ch 16; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Ch 1, 3 sc in same ch as join, sc in next 3 ch, [3 sc in next ch, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc. Fasten off.
Cap
Beginning at top of cap, with A, make an adjustable ring. Round 1 (Right Side): Work 5 sc in ring. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—10 sc. Round 3: Sc in each sc around. Round 4: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—15 sc. Round 5: Sc in each sc around. Round 6: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—20 sc. Round 7: Sc in each sc around. Round 8: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—25 sc. Round 9: Sc in each sc around. Round 10: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—30 sc. Round 11: Sc in each sc around. Round 12: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—35 sc. Round 13: Sc in each sc around. Round 14: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—40 sc. Round 15: Sc in each sc around. Round 16: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—45 sc. Round 17: Sc in each sc around. Round 18: [Sc in next 8 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times—50 sc. Rounds 19–25: Sc in each sc around. Round 26: Slip st in each sc around. Fasten off.
Front Curl
With F, ch 3. Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across—2 sc. Row 2: Turn, ch 5, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 hdc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch, skip next sc of Row 1, slip st in next sc. Fasten off.
Mustache
With F, make an adjustable ring. Round 1 (Right Side): Work 5 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc. Round 2: Ch 7, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 3 sc in next ch, 2 hdc in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in last ch, skip next sc of Round 1, slip st in next sc, ch 12, begin in 2nd ch from hook, [sc3tog] twice, hdc2tog, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in last ch, skip next sc of Round 1, slip st in next sc. Fasten off.
Eyebrows (Make 2)
With F, ch 4. Row 1 (Right Side): Working in back bumps, slip st in first ch from hook, [ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next ch of foundation ch] 3 times. Fasten off.
Beard and Hair
With F, ch 51. Round 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; join with slip st in first sc—50 sc. Round 2: [Ch 7, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 3 sc in next ch, 2 hdc in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in last ch, skip next sc of Round 1, slip st in next sc] 12 times; (center of beard), [ch 12, begin in 2nd ch from hook, [sc3tog] twice, hdc2tog, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in last ch, skip next sc of Round 1, slip st in next sc] 13 times. Fasten off.
Buttons (Make 3)
With C, make an adjustable ring. Round 1 (Right Side): Work 8 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
With C, sew a 3” line of back stitches from center lower edge of body upwards, to separate legs. With A, sew bottom 12 sts of each shoe to back edge of a leg. Stuff shoes. Gently curve remaining portion of each lower leg edge around sides and top of shoe and sew in place. With B, sew buttons evenly spaced up center of tunic, placing 2 buttons above belt and one below. With C, embroider a back stitch line, slightly to the left of the buttons, from lower edge to top edge of tunic. With E, sew belt buckle to center of belt. Stuff body. Stuff arms. With B, sew arms to sides of body. Arrange mustache and beard and hair on face. Place beard and hair around head and mustache beneath nose. Pin center of beard (where curls change direction) on chin directly below nose. Pin back of hair low on back of head, to allow for later placement of cap. Pin mustache above center of beard allowing space (for mouth). With F, sew mustache and beard and hair in place. Attach safety eyes above nose. With F, sew one eyebrow above each eye. Place cap on head, then pin front curl under front edge of cap. Remove cap. With F, sew front curl in place. Sew cap to head or leave unsewn, as desired. Stuff head. With B, sew head to top of body. Weave in ends.

pattern_name: Crochet Ollie the Owl Toy Trio
materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Terracotta Rose (10880) 1 ball or 220 yds/201 m
Contrast B Gold (10970) 1 ball or 220 yds/201 m
Contrast C Aquatic (10801) 1 ball or 220 yds/201 m
Size U.S. K/10.5 (6.5 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Pair of 5/8" (15 mm) safety eyes for each Owl
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] tall by 8" [20.5 cm] wide.
instructions:
Version 1: C as Color 1, B as Color 2, and A as Color 3.
Version 2: A as Color 1, C as Color 2, and B as Color 3.
Version 3: B as Color 1, A as Color 2, and C as Color 3.

Notes:
• Rnds are joined with a sl st to first sc.
• To join new color, work to last loops on hook of first color. Yoh with new color, draw through loops and proceed with new color.

Head and Body
With Color 1, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 20 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
6th to 12th rnds: As 4th rnd.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
14th rnd: As 4th rnd.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
Note: Before starting Head, stuff Body with polyfill.
16th rnd: As 4th rnd. Break Color 1. Join Color 2.
17th rnd: With Color 2, ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 40 sts. 
18th to 23rd rnds: As 4th rnd.
24th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
25th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.

Eyes (make 2)
With Color 1, beg using magic loop.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 20 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Add safety eyes to center of each Eye as shown in photo.

Beak
With Color 3, ch 4.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Turn. 3 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Turn. 1 st.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

Wings
With Color 2, beg using magic loop method. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 4 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st) twice. Join. 6 sts. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts) twice. Join. 8 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts) twice. Join. 10 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts) twice. Join. 12 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts) twice. Join. 14 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts) twice. Join. 16 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in first st. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts) twice. Join. 18 sts.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts) 3 times. 15 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

Feet (make 2)
With Color 3, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each st around. Join. 12 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Fold each foot in half and stitch together. Define webbed “toes” by making stitches as illustrated in diagram below.

FINISHING
Stitch Eyes to Head as shown in photo, noting that eyes should touch at the center. Stitch on Beak, with Beak slightly overlapping eyes. Stuff Head with polyfil. Sew top of Head shut with yarn needle by pinching the top edges together. Stitch Wings onto either side of Owl where Body and Neck meet. Stitch Feet to base of Owl Body.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi Prints™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 2242 yds/221 m)
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 black safety eyes 1/4" [6 mm] for each toy.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 4" [10 cm] tall, excluding comb and legs.
instructions:
Version 1: White as Color 1, Yellow as Color 2, and Red as Color 3. 
Version 2: Prints as Color 1, Yellow as Color 2, and Red as Color 3. 
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.

Body
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
6th and 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
9th and 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
12th and 13th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
15th to 21st rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sts.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
24th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
25th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
Secure safety eyes to Body as shown in photo. Stuff Body firmly.
26th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
27th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.

Beak
With Color 2, ch 6, leaving a long end for sewing. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join. 3 sts.
Fasten off. Draw end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Sew Beak to Body as shown in photo.

Comb (top of head): With Color 3, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from the hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in next ch of foundation ch. Rep from * 3 times more.
Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing. Sew Comb to top of Body as shown in photo.

Wattle
With Color 3, ch 11. 
1st row: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Sew Wattle around Beak as shown in photo.

Wings (make 2)
With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 dc in next sc) 3 times. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 18 sts.
Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing. Sew Wings to sides of Body as shown in photo.

Tail
With Color 1, ch 24, leaving a long end for sewing. Join.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 24 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
5th to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * around. Join.
Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing. Sew end of Tail closed at 7th rnd. Stuff Tail firmly. Sew tail to Body as shown in photo.

Legs (make 2)
With Color 2, ch 14.
1st row: 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 2 ch. *Ch 4. 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each of next 2 ch. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in next ch of foundation chain and each ch to end of chain.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Sew Legs to bottom of Body as shown in photo.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Grumpy - Contrast A Buff (0334) 1 ball or 28 yds/25.5 m
Contrast B Café Latte (0360) 1 ball or 32 yds/29 m
Contrast C Cherry Red (0319) 1 ball or 35 yds/32 m
Contrast D Gold (0321) 1 ball or 1 yd/1 m
Contrast E Black (0312) 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Contrast F Coffee (0365) 1 ball or 20 yds/19 m
Contrast G Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 3 yds/2.5 m
Happy - Contrast A Buff (0334) 1 ball or 28 yds/25.5 m
Contrast B Country Blue (0382) 1 ball or 25 yds/23.5 m
Contrast C Café Latte (0360) 1 ball or 25 yds/23.5 m
Contrast D Gold (0321) 1 ball or 25 yds/23.5 m
Contrast E Black (0312) 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Contrast F Coffee (0365) 1 ball or 20 yds/19 m
Contrast G Soft White (0316) 1 ball or 3 yds/2.5 m
Size U.S. 7 [4.5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Hdc bobble = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times all in next stitch. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Ch 1 tightly to close bobble.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Notes:
• Stuff pieces lightly. Do not over stuff.
• When fastening off at end of a rnd, you may wish to finish with an invisible join, as follows: Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. Pull up on last loop on hook until tail is drawn all the way through last stitch. Thread tail onto yarn needle. Insert yarn needle under both strands of 2nd st of round, then insert needle down through last stitch. This creates a loop that looks like the top of a stitch. Weave in the remaining tail.

LEGS (make 2).
Beg at Boot, with F, make a magic ring. 
1st rnd: (RS). Work (3 sc. 2 hdc. 3 sc) in ring. Join with sl st in first sc. 8 sts. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 2 hdc in each of next 2 hdc (toe). 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 10 sts. 
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st in first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. (Sc2tog] twice. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 8 sts. Fasten off. Boot complete.

Pants: 6th rnd: With RS facing, join B with sl st in first sc of 4th rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. 8 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed. 
7th to 9th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
10th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 10 sc. Sl st in first sc. Fasten off. 
Hold both Legs tog, with toes facing in same direction. Sew tops of Legs tog, sewing through 2 sts at inside of each Leg and leaving 8 sts on each Leg unsewn. Stuff Legs. 

Lower Tunic 
With C, ch 24. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist ch. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. 24 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd. Move marker up as work progresses. 
2nd rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 20 sts. 
3rd rnd: 1 sc in next sc. Place Tunic around top of Legs, beg at back of Legs. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each of 8 unsewn sts of first Leg. Working in Tunic only, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each of 8 unsewn sts of 2nd Leg. Working in tunic only, 1 sc in last sc. 20 sc. Fasten off. 

Belt rnd: With RS facing, join E with sc at center back of Tunic. 1 sc in each remaining sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 20 sc. Fasten off. 

Upper Tunic 
1st rnd: With RS facing, join C with sl st at center back of Belt. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each sc around. 20 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd. Move marker up as work progresses. 
2nd and 3rd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
4th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. 16 sts. 
5th rnd: (Sc2tog) 8 times. 8 sts. Stuff Tunic. Fasten off, leaving a long yarn tail for sewing Tunic to Head. 
With D, embroider a straight stitch square on center front of Belt for buckle (see photo and Diagram on page 4). 

ARMS (make 2) 
Beg at hand, with A, make a magic ring. 
1st rnd: (RS). Work 8 sc in ring. 8 sts. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd. Move marker up as work progresses. 
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
3rd rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) twice. 6 sts. Fasten off A. 
Sleeve: 4th rnd: With RS facing, join C for Grumpy or D for Happy with sl st in first sc of 3rd rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 6 sc.
5th to 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Do not stuff Arm. 
9th rnd: (Sc2tog) 3 times. 3 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long yarn tail for sewing Arm to Tunic.

HEAD
Beg at top of Head, with A, make a magic ring. 
1st rnd: (RS). Work 6 sc in ring. 6 sts. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd. Move marker up as work progresses. 
2nd rnd: Work 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc. 
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 18 sc. 
4th and 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
6th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Hdc bobble in next sc (nose). 1 sc in each of last 8 sc. 
7th rnd: 1 sc in each st around. 
Attach safety eyes, between 5th and 6th rnds, on either side of nose. 
Note: Push posts of safety eyes between strands of st, not in sp between sts, to avoid allowing safety eye to sink back into Head. 
8th rnd: (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 12 sts. 
9th rnd: (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. 8 sts. 
10th rnd: 1 sc in each st around. Fasten off. Stuff Head. 

CAP
Beg at top of Cap, with B for Grumpy or D for Happy, make a magic ring. 
1st rnd: (RS). 4 sc in ring. Do not join, work in continuous rnds. PM for beg of rnd. Move marker up as work progresses. 
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
3rd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 8 sc. 
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
5th rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 4 times. 12 sc. 
6th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
7th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 4 times. 16 sc. 
8th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
9th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 4 times. 20 sc. 
10th and 11th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
Fasten off. 

BEARD
1st row: With G, (Ch 3. Turn chain on its side and working into back ‘bump’, sl st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch) 3 times. (Ch 4. Turn chain on its side and working into back ‘bump’, sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 2 ch) 4 times. (Ch 5. Turn chain on its side and working into back ‘bump’, sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 3 ch) 3 times. (Ch 4. Turn chain on its side and working into back ‘bump’, sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 2 ch) 4 times. (Ch 3. Turn chain on its side and working into back ‘bump’, sl st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch) 3 times. 17 beard ‘chain pieces’ in total.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing Beard to face.

FINISHING
Sew Arms to sides of body, near top of Tunic. Sew Head to top of Tunic. Arrange Beard around chin and sides of face and sew in place. Place Cap on Head and sew in place. With E, embroider face details with straight stitches as shown in photo.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Fashion Crochet Thread size 3: 1 ball each 6 Scarlet A, 325 Tangerine B and 423 Maize C
Susan Bates® Crochet hook: Size 3.5 mm [E-4] crochet hook
11 oz [315g] of polyester pellets for three juggling balls
split ring stitch marker or small safety pin
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
With A (C), make an adjustable ring.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in ring, do not join, mark last st made with the safety pin; tighten ring.
Round 2: [2 sc in next st] 6 times—12 sts.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 6 times—18 sts.
Round 4: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times—24 sts.
Round 5: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times—30 sts.
Round 6: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times—36 sts.
Round 7: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times, changing to B (A)—42 sts.
Round 8: [2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts] 6 times—48 sts.
Rounds 9 and 10: Sc in each st around.
Round 11: Sc in each st around, changing to C (B).
Rounds 12–14: Repeat Round 9.
Round 15: Sc in each st around, changing to B (A).
Rounds 16–18: Repeat Round 9.
Round 19: [Sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts] 6 times, changing to A (C)—42 sts.
Round 20: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts] 6 times—36 sts.
Round 21: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times—30 sts.
Round 22: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times—24 sts.
Round 23: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times—18 sts. Stuff ball with pellets to desired fullness.
Round 24: [Sc2tog, sc in next st] 6 times—12 sts.
Round 25: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sts. Fasten off leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Add more pellets if desired. Thread tail in tapestry needle and weave through remaining sts. Pull tight to gather, fasten off securely. Weave in tail.
POLKA DOT JUGGLING BALL
Work as for Striped Ball, using A for background and B and C for polka dots. Each polka dot is worked over 3 rounds. On the first and 3rd rounds, the polka dot is 2 sts wide, on the 2nd round it’s 3 sts wide. Position polka dots as desired, taking care not to place them too close together for best results.

materials: Bernat® Softee® Baby™ (Solids: 5 oz/140 g; 362 yds/331 m; Ombres: 4.2 oz/120 g; 310 yds/283 m)
Contrast B Mint (02004) or Prettiest Pink (30205) or Lavender Lullaby Ombre (31320) 1 ball
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of dried rice or beans.
1 pair of 6 mm plastic Safety Eyes.
Small amount of black embroidery floss for mouth.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
CONE
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 
Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
4th and 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
7th and 8th rnds: As 4th and 5th rnds.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
10th and 11th rnds: As 4th and 5th rnds.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
13th and 14th rnds: As 4th and 5th rnds.

15th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
16th and 17th rnds: As 4th and 5th rnds.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
19th to 26th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Stuff Cone.

SCOOP
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
7th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
9th to 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
17th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not fasten off.
Attach Safety Eyes as shown in picture. With black embroidery floss, embroider mouth.
Fill plastic egg approx halfway with dried rice or beans. Secure egg opening with tape.
Stuff Scoop, inserting egg and stuff around egg.
Join Scoop to Cone: 1st rnd: With bottom edge of Scoop and top edge of Cone aligned, ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 1 rnd of sc in each ec around, inserting more stuffing as you go. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Skip first sc. *5 dc in next sc. Skip next sc. Sl st in next sc. Skip next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. Fasten off.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m) Main Color (MC) Cuddly Cloud (86018)  1 ball
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® split-lock stitch count markers.
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn for embroidery.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 10" x [25.5 cm] tall x 9" [23 cm] diameter, excluding limbs and horn.
instructions:
Notes:
• Stuffie is worked in a continuous spiral. Do not join at end of rnds. Place marker on first st of rnd and move marker each rnd to keep place. 
• To change colors, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed. 
BODY
With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook, placing marker on first st for beg of rnd. Do not join. 8 sc. 
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. 
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 32 sc.
5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc. 
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc. 
7th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc. 
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 64 sc. 
9th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 72 sc. 
10th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 80 sc. 
12th rnd: *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 88 sc. 
13th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
14th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 96 sc. 
15th rnd: *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 104 sc. 
16th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
17th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. 112 sc. 
18th rnd: *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. 120 sc. 
19th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
Place 2nd marker at end of rnd – do not move 2nd marker each rnd. Rep last rnd until work from 2nd marker measures 4" [10 cm]. 
Shape top as follows: 
1st rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Rep from * around. 112 sc. 
2nd to 4th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 
5th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc. Rep from * around. 104 sc. 
6th to 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
9th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. 96 sc. 
10th and 11th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
12th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Rep from * around. 88 sc. 
13th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
14th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. 80 sc. 
15th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
16th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. 72 sc. 
17th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
18th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. 64 sc. 
19th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
20th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc. 
21st rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
22nd rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 48 sc. 
23rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
24th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 40 sc. 
Insert Safety Eyes. Stuff Body and Head. 
25th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
26th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 32 sc. 
27th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. 
28th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 16 sc. 
29th rnd: *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sc. Fasten off leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts and fasten securely.
EARS (make 2 each with MC and A)
Ch 10. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 9 sc. Turn.
2nd and alt rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. 7 sc. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. 5 sc. Turn. 
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 3 sc. Turn. 
6th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off. 
Join Ears: Hold one MC Ear and one A Ear together with WS facing each other. Hold A side facing to work joining row. Join MC with sl st through both thicknesses to bottom right corner of Ears. 
1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, work 8 sc evenly up right side of Ear to corner. 3 sc in corner. Work 8 sc evenly down left side of Ear. Fasten off. 
SNOUT  
With MC, ch 5.  
Working in spiral as given for Body, proceed as follows:
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 22 sc. 
4th rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
5th to 7th rnds: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off. 
Stuff Snout lightly.
HOOVES (make 4)
With A, ch 2.
Working in spiral as for Body, proceed as follows: 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker on last st for beg of rnd. 8 sc. 
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 32 sc. 
5th rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. 
6th and 7th rnds: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. 
8th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. 
9th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Break A. 16 sc. 
Join MC with sl st to back loop only of any sc. 
11th rnd: With MC, and working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. 
12th to 15th rnds: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off. 
Stuff Hoof lightly.
Create cloven hoof: Thread yarn needle with length of A.  Draw yarn through center of hoof base (middle of 1st rnd) and up to top of 10th rnd (at color change). Cinch tightly to form cloven hoof.  Secure ends. Repeat for each Hoof.
HORN
With MC, ch 2.
Working in spiral as for Body, proceed as follows:
1st rnd: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 4 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around.  Rep from * around. 8 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd: *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 16 sc.
8th and 9th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 20 sc.
11th to 18th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off. Stuﬃng Horn lightly.
MANE
**With C, ch 32. 
1st row: With C, 2 dc in 4th ch from hook. 3 dc in each ch to end of chain, joining B to last st. 1 Curl made. Break C.
2nd row: With B, ch 32. 2 dc in 4th ch from hook. 3 dc in each ch to end of chain, joining A to last st. Break B.
3rd row: With A, ch 32. 2 dc in 4th ch from hook. 3 dc in each ch to end of chain, joining C to last st. Break B.**
Rep last 3 rows 3 times more. 12 Curls made. Fasten off. 
TAIL
Work from ** to ** as given for Mane. 3 Curls made. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Sew Ears, Snout, Hooves and Horn to Body as seen in photo. With MC, create nostrils by making 2 tight stitches in Snout, and tacking them to Body. Fold Mane in half, having 6 Curls on each side. Beg at center point behind Horn, sew Mane to Body in straight line down the back. Group ends of 3 Curls of Tail together and sew to back of Body as seen in photo. With black worsted weight yarn, embroider eyebrows and mouth using Stem Stitch.

materials: Bernat® Baby Blanket Calico™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m)
Contrast A Mossy Path (04930) 2 balls or 352 yds/322 m
Contrast B Leafy Greens (04928) 1 ball or 60 yds/55 m
Size U.S. L/11 (8 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Notes:
•  Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
•  Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as stitch.
Bottom of Pillow
With A, ch 31.
See diagram on page 2.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to last ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 62 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 68 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 74 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. Join. 80 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 5th rnd until work from beg measures 13" [33 cm].
Cont for Top of Pillow:
See diagram.
1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Rep from * once more. Join. 74 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. Rep from * once more. Join. 68 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 28 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Rep from * once more. Join. 62 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 25 sc. (Sc2tog) twice. Join. 56 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Stuff Body.
Note: Safety eyes cannot be moved once they are properly attached, so it’s best to make sure you like eye placement using stitch markers before inserting them.
Following manufacturer’s instructions, attach Safety Eyes at markers.
With long yarn end, sew top edge tog.
Stomach
With B, ch 3.
See diagram.
1st row: (WS). 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Turn. 5 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 2 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 10 hdc.
3rd row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 15 hdc.
4th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 20 hdc.
5th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 25 hdc.
6th row: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. Do not turn. 30 hdc.
Next row: Cont along flat edge, ch 2. Work 20 hdc evenly across edge. Turn.
Next 6 rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.
Sew Stomach to Body as shown in photo.
Arms and Legs (make 4 alike)
With A, ch 2.
See diagram.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 9" [23 cm]. Fasten off leaving a long end to sew to Body. Sew Arms and Legs to Body as shown in photo.
Eyelids (make 2)
With A, ch 3.
See diagram.
1st row: 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Fasten off.
Sew Eyelids over safety eyes as shown in photo.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Anchor® black embroidery floss for Eyes.
Anchor® pink embroidery floss for nose.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] long, excluding Ears and Legs.
instructions:
Front and Back (make 2 alike) 
With B, ch 21.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 20 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece measures 3½" [9 cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Next row: (RS). Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around next sc. Dcbp around next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 hdc in last sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 2 (counts as hdc).

CROCHET FUNNY BUNNY     2 of 2
*Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in top of ch 2. Break B, join A.
Head: 1st row:  With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Shape Head: Next row:  Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 18 sts.
Rep last row, dec 2 sts every row to 8 sts. Fasten off.
Arms (make 2)
**With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.  16 sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.**
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Break A, join B with sl st to first st. 12 sts.
7th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 6 times more, stuffing very lightly (to maintain floppiness of limbs) as you work. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Legs (make 2)
Work from ** to ** as given for Arms.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 12 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd 7 times more, stuffing very lightly as you work. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Ears (make 2)
With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
5th to 13th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
14th rnd:  Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) twice. 12 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.
FINISHING
With black embroidery floss, embroider eyes using French Knots. With pink embroidery floss, embroider nose and mouth using Satin Stitch.
With WS of Front and Back tog, sew edges tog, leaving opening for stuffing. Stuff Body. Sew rem edge closed.
Attach Arms and Legs. Sew Ears to top of Head.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein 1001 White A and small amounts of 1401 Pewter B and 1704 Bubblegum C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Colors A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 14 sc = 4" [10 cm]; 18 sc rows = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
LAMB
Body (make 2)
With A, ch 7.
Row 1: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in each ch across, turn – 12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice, turn – 19 sc.
Rows 3–17: Ch 1 (counts as first sc), (hdc, dc) in first st, skip 2 sts, *(sc, hdc, dc) in next st, skip 2 sts; repeat from * across, skip last st, sc in top of turning ch, turn – 6 (sc, hdc, dc) groups, 1 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, sc in first st, (sc2tog) across – 9 sc.
Fasten off.

Head (make 2)
With A, ch 7.
Row 1: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in each ch across, turn – 12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice, turn – 19 sc.
Rows 3–12: Ch 1 (counts as first sc), (hdc, dc) in first st, skip 2 sts, *(sc, hdc, dc) in next st, skip 2 sts; repeat from * across, skip last st, sc in top of turning ch, turn – 6 (sc, hdc, dc) groups, 1 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc in first st, (sc2tog) across – 9 sc.
Fasten off.

Ear (make 2)
With A, ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 5 ch, work 3 sc in last ch; working down opposite side of ch, sc in next 6 sts, turn – 15 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in next sc, hdc in next 5 sc, 3 hdc in next sc, hdc in next 5 sc, sc in last 2 sc, turn – 13 hdc, 4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each st across – 17 sc. 
Fasten off.

Arm (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, place st marker to mark beginning of round – 6 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 15 sc.
Rounds 4 -19: Sc in each sc around. 
Fasten off. 

Leg (make 2)
With A, ch 2. 
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, place st marker to mark beginning of round – 6 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 18 sc.
Rounds 4–22: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off.

Snout
With B, ch 2. 
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, place st marker to mark beginning of round – 6 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.

FINISHING
Sew side and bottom seams of Body, leaving neck open. Stuff. Sew Head pieces together, leaving neck open. Place Head over Body neck opening and push down slightly. Sew firmly in place. Fold long edges of Ear and sew together. Sew Ear in place on Head. Repeat for second Ear. Stuff Arms. Holding Round 19 flat, sew edge together. Sew in place on Body. Repeat for second Arm. Stuff Legs. Holding Round 22 flat, sew edge together. Sew in place on Body. Repeat for second Leg. With yarn needle and C, embroider satin sts for nose and straight sts for mouth. Sew snout in place. With B, embroider satin sts for eyes.
Optional: Cut a 16" (40.6 cm) length of ribbon. Tie around neck. Trim ribbon. With yarn needle, weave in all loose ends.

pattern_name: Squeeze a Peach Crochet Stress Ball
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A Tea Rose (00042) 1 ball or 34 yds/31 m
Contrast B Sage Green (00084) 1 ball or 6.5 yds/6 m
Size U.S H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Note: Join each rnd with sl st to first st.
PEACH
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Join. 3 sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 6 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
5th rnd:  Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sc. Ch 1. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of last 12 sc. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sc. Ch 1. Skip next ch. 1 sc in each of last 12 sc. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sc. 1 sc in skipped sc 3 rows below. 1 sc in each of last 12 sc. Join.
Rep 6th to 8th rnds once more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
Attach safety eyes following manufacturer’s directions. Stuff Peach firmly.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.
Optional: Use a small brush and apply blush to top of Peach.
LEAF (make 2):
With B, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Fasten off.
Sew Leaves onto Peach as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red A, 324 Bright Yellow B, 316 Soft White C, 312 Black D, 400 Grey Heather E, 505 Aruba Sea F, 672 Spring Green G, 254 Pumpkin H, and 886 Blue I
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Car measures 2¾” wide x 4½” long (7 x 11.5 cm). Plane measures 8” long x 8” wide (20.5 x 20.5 cm), across wings. Truck measures 2¾” wide x 7” long (7 x 18 cm).
gauge: 15 sts = 4” (10 cm) in pattern; 16 rows/rounds = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CAR
Body 
Beginning at front of car, with A, ch 8.
Round 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 5 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 5 ch; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first 3 sc, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in remaining sc; join with slip st in first sc—22 sc.
Rounds 3–16: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 17: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, sc2tog 3 times, sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog 3 times, sc in last 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Round 18: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, sc3tog, sc in next 5 sc, sc3tog, sc in last 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Stuff lightly and, holding edges together, sew last round closed.
Roof 
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Rounds 5 and 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Stuff lightly, then sew roof over Rounds 8–15 of body.
Front and Rear Window (make 2)
With C, ch 7.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. With D, embroider straight st eyes over 3rd st from each edge of Row 1 of front window. Sew front window over Rounds 5 and 6 of front side of roof. Sew rear window over Rounds 5 and 6 of back side of roof.
Side Window (make 2)
With C, ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Sew side windows over Rounds 5 and 6 of each side of roof.
Bumper (make 2)
With E, ch 15.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—14 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. 
Headlight (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—5 sc. Fasten off leaving long tail for sewing. 
Tire Half (make 8)
With E, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc; change to D—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc¬—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail on 4 tire halves for sewing. 
To form tire, *holding wrong sides together, whipstitch two tire halves around outer edges; repeat from * 3 times. 
ASSEMBLY
Sew bumpers over lower front and back of body, ensuring that each bumper is centered and wrapped slightly around each side. Using photograph as a guide, with D, backstitch curved mouth on front bumper.
Sew headlights above ends of front bumper. Allow half of each tire to hang below body and sew in place on lower sides between edges of bumpers.
FINISHING CAR
Weave in ends.
PLANE
Nose and Body 
Note: Insert stuffing every few rounds.
Beginning at nose, with F, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Rounds 5 and 6: Repeat Round 3; change to G at end of Round 6.
Round 7: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times, sc in remaining sc; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 9: Repeat Round 3. 
Round 10: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Rounds 11–19: Repeat Round 3 nine times.
Round 20: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 21–26: Repeat Round 3 six times.
Round 27: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Rounds 28–31: Repeat Round 3 four times.
Round 32: Ch 1, sc2tog around; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. 
Round 33: Repeat Round 3. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave end through last sts and pull tightly to close tail end of body. On underside of nose, with D, embroider curved smile with backstitches between Rounds 3 and 4.
Front Wing (make 2) 
Beginning at outer tip of wing, with H, ch 8.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—7 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in remaining sc, turn—9 sc.
