Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc to center st of 3-sc group, 3 sc in center st, sc in remaining sc, turn—11 sc. 
Rows 6–13: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 four times—19 sc.
Row 14: Repeat Row 4. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Fold wing in half lengthwise and whipstitch outer edges together. 
Rear Wing (make 3) 
Beginning at outer tip of wing, with H, ch 6.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in remaining sc, turn—7 sc.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in remaining sc, turn—9 sc.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Fold wing in half lengthwise and whipstitch outer edges together. 
Windshield
With C, ch 7.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc—12 sc. Fasten off leaving long tail. With D, embroider straight st eyes 1 stitch apart from center of Row 1 of windshield. Sew windshield over Rounds 7 and 8 of body. 
Front Tire Half (make 4)
With E, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc; change to D—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail on 2 tire halves for sewing. Holding wrong sides together, whipstitch two tire halves around outer edges; repeat for 2nd tire.
Rear Tire Half (make 2) 
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Fasten off leaving long tail on 1 tire half for sewing. Holding wrong sides together, whipstitch tire halves around outer edges. 
ASSEMBLY
Using photograph as a guide for placement, sew front wings on sides of body over Rounds 14–20 and 2 rear wings over Rounds 30–33. Sew remaining wing over top of body over Rounds 30–33. Sew front tires to underside of body slightly forward of front wings; sew rear tire to underside of body centered between rear wings.
FINISHING PLANE
Weave in ends.
TRUCK
Cab Body
With I, ch 34.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (beginning ch-3 counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in each ch across, turn—32 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, dc in first 3 dc, [bpdc around next dc, dc in next 7 dc] three times, bpdc around next dc, dc in next 3 dc, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in first 2 dc, [fpdc around next dc, dc in next 7 dc] three times, fpdc around next dc, dc in last 4 dc, turn.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Row 6: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Cab Top and Bottom (make 2)  
With I, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, (sc, ch 2, sc) in first sc, sc in next st, *(sc, ch 2, sc) in first sc, sc in next st; repeat from * 3 times; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc and 4 ch-2 sps.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *(sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * twice, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in last 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc and 4 ch-2 sps.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, *(sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in next 5 sc; repeat from * twice, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space, sc in last 3 sc; join with slip st in first sc—28 sc and 4 ch-2 sps. Fasten off leaving long tail for sewing.
Front Bumper
With E, ch 15.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—14 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. 
Grill
With E, ch 5.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—4 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Headlight (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Front Windshield
With C, ch 7.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. With D, embroider straight st eyes 1 stitch apart from center of Row 1 of front windshield. 
Side Window (make 2)
With C, ch 5.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Trailer Box Top And Bottom (make 2)
With E, ch 19.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—18 sc.
Rows 2–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn. 
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Trailer Box Side (make 2)
With E, ch 19.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn—18 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc; change to B, turn.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc; change to A at end of Row 4, turn.
Rows 5 and 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc; change to E at end of Row 6, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in each sc. Fasten off.
Trailer Back End
With E, work same as cab top.
Tire Half (make 12) 
With E, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; change to D; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next sc, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail on six of the tire halves. *Holding wrong sides together, whipstitch two tire halves around outer edges; repeat from * 5 times.
ASSEMBLY
Cab
With right side of cab body facing, gently fold cab body so post sts form outer corners; working across ends of rows, sew edges together to form back of cab body. Sew cab top and bottom to body and stuff body before closing edges. Center the bumper over lower front of cab body, wrapping slightly and evenly around each side and sew in place. Using photograph as a guide, with D, embroider curved smile with backstitches on bumper. Center grill over bumper and sew in place. Sew headlights on each side of grill. Align Row 1 of front windshield over Row 5 of cab body front and sew piece in place. Align Row 1 of each side windshield over Row 5 of cab body sides and sew in place. 
Trailer
Sew trailer box top to top edges of box sides and box bottom to bottom edges. Sew back end to back of trailer box. Stuff trailer box, then whipstitch to back of cab body. Using photograph as a guide, sew tires to lower sides of truck, allowing half of each tire to hang below cab body and trailer box.
FINISHING TRUCK
Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds)
1 ball each of: Lt Blue (MC); Yellow (A); White (B); Beige (D).
Small amounts of Black (C) and Green (E) for embroidery.
Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
BODY
With MC, ch 2.
**1st rnd:7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd:Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 14 sc.
3rd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in next sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 21 sc.
4th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 28 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 35 sc.
6th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join A with sl st in first sc. 42 sc.
7th rnd:With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 49 sc.**
8th and 9th rnds:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join MC with sl st in first sc at end of 9th rnd. 
10th and 11th rnds:With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
12th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook - Sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join A with sl st in first sc. 42 sts.
13th to 15th rnds:With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each st around. Join MC with sl st in first sc at end of 15th rnd. 
16th rnd:With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
17th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 35 sts.
18th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each st around. Join A with sl st in first sc.
19th to 21st rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join MC with sl st in first sc at end of 21st rnd.
22nd rnd:With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 28 sts.
23rd and 24th rnds:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each st around. Join A with sl st in first sc at end of 24th rnd. 
25th and 26th rnds:With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off.
HEAD
With B only, work from ** to ** as given for Body.  
8th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
9th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 56 sc.
10th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
11th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 63 sc.
12th to 17th rnds:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
18th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last 8 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 56 sts.
19th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each st around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
20th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 49 sts.
21st rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last 6 sts. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Join with sl st in first sc. 42 sts.
22nd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. *Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Rep from * to last 3 sts. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in last st. Join with sl st in first sc. 35 sts.
23rd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * to last 4 sts. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Join with sl st in first sc. 28 sts.
24th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next st. *Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Join with sl st in first sc. 21 sts. Fasten off. 
Arm (make 2). With B, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.  
2nd rnd:Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
Rep last rnd twice more, joining MC at end of last rnd. 
With MC, rep last rnd 12 times more.
Fasten off. 
Leg (make 2). With B, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.  
2nd rnd:Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
Rep last rnd twice more, joining MC at end of last rnd. 
With MC, rep last rnd 11 times more.
Fasten off. 
Ear (make 2). With B, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.  
2nd rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
3rd rnd:Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc.
4th rnd:As 2nd rnd. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 18 sc. 
6th rnd:As 2nd rnd. Fasten off. 
Tail: With B, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.  
2nd and 3rd rnds:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join MC with sl st in first sc at end of 3rd rnd. 
4th to 6th rnds:With MC, as 2nd rnd. Join A with sl st in first st at end of 6th rnd. 
7th to 9th rnds:With A, as 2nd rnd.  
Rep last 6 rnds 3 times more, then 4th to 6th rnds once more. Fasten off.
Cheeks: With B, ch 2. 
1st row: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. T urn. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc.  T urn. 4 sc. 
3rd row:Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. T urn. 6 sc. 
4th row:Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.  T urn. 
5th row:Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc.
T urn. 4 sts. 
6th row:Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 
Rep 2nd to 6th rows once more. Fasten off. 
Nose: With C, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
FINISHING
Stuff Body, Head, Arms, Legs and sew tog as illustrated. Sew Cheeks in position, placing stuffing as you sew. Sew on Nose. With C and E, embroider eyes and mouth. Cut 3 strands of C, 7 ins [18 cm] long and thread through Cheeks for whiskers. Insert pipe cleaner into Tail, shape it and sew at bottom back of Body. 
MOUSE
Body: With D, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.  
2nd rnd:Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 16 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. Join with sl st in first sc. 13 sts.
6th and 7th rnds:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
8th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. Join with sl st in first sc. 10 sts.
9th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each st around. Join with sl st in first sc.
10th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1sc in each of next 2 sc. Working in front loops only: 3 dc in next sc. Sl st in next sc. 3 dc in next sc. Working through both loops, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st in first sc.
11th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Working in back loops of 9th rnd only: 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each sc of 10th rnd to end of rnd. Join with sl st in first sc.
12th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join with sl st in first sc. 7 sc.
13th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st and each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
14th rnd:Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (Sc2tog over next 2 sc) 3 times. Join with sl st in first sc. 4 sc. Fasten off. 
Tail: With D, ch 30. Fasten off. Sew to Mouse.

materials: Bernat® Satin (100 g/3.5 oz; 149 m/163 yds)
Size 3.75 mm (U.S. F or 5) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
instructions:
Stripe Pat
With A, work 4 rnds.
With B, work 4 rnds.
These 8 rnds form Stripe Pat.

BODY
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
First 4 rnds of Stripe Pat are complete. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, work as established, inc 8 sc every rnd until there are 96 sc. Place marker on last rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 4 ins [10 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sts.
Next 4 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 5 rnds until there are 64 sc.
Work even in rnds until work from marked rnd measures approx 5½ ins [14 cm], ending with 4 rnds of A, and joining MC at end of last rnd.
Place marker at end of last rnd.
With MC, work even in rnds until work from last marker measures 3 ins [7.5 cm].
Shape head: Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog over next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Stuff Body. Sew top edge closed.

Eyes (make 2).
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join C with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: With C, ch 1. *4 dc in next sc. Miss next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Miss next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. Fasten off.

Eyelids (make 2).
With C, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog over first 2 sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Turn.
Rep last row twice more. 3 sc. Fasten off at end of last row.

Beak
With B, ch 2.
1st row: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 7 sc.
Rep last row twice more. 11 sc at end of last row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 3 times more. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Sew buttons to Eyes. Sew Eyelids onto Eyes. Attach Beak to front of Body. Sew on Eyes as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein 774 Lt. Raspberry or 905 Magenta.
abbreviations: Sc3tog = [draw up a loop in next sc] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops on hook – 2 sc decreased.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 9 sts = 2”; 10 rows = 2” in sc rnds. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEART: Ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: [3 Sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] twice—10 sc. Place a marker in the center stitch of each 3-sc group to indicate each side.
Rnd 3: Sc in next sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc—14 sc.
Rnd 4: Sc in next 2 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc—18 sc.
Rnd 5: Sc in next 3 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc—22 sc.
Rnd 6: Sc in next 4 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc—26 sc.
Rnd 7: Sc in next 5 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 12 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 7 sc—30 sc.
Rnd 8: Sc in next 6 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 14 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 8 sc—34 sc.
Rnd 9: Sc in next 7 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 16 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 9 sc—38 sc.
Rnd 10: Sc in next 8 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 18 sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 10 sc—42 sc.
Rnds 11-14: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 15: [Ch 1, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 8 sc, sc3tog, sc in next 8 sc] twice—38 sc.
Rnd 16: [Working over the ch-1 of rnd below, slip st in first skipped stitch on rnd below, sc in next 7 sc, sc3tog, sc in next 7 sc] twice—34 sc.
Rnd 17: [Slip st in same sc as before, sc in next 6 sc, sc3tog, sc in next 6 sc] twice—26 sc.
Rnd 18: [Slip st in 2nd skipped sc on Rnd 15, sc in next 5 sc, sc3tog, sc in next 5 sc] twice—22 sc.
Rnd 19: [Slip st in same sc as before, sc in next 4 sc, sc3tog, sc in next 4 sc] twice; slip st in next slip st—18 sc. Fasten off.
ARMS (Make 2): Ch 2.
Rnd 1: 5 Sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnds 2-8: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.
LEGS (Make 2): Ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnds 2-10: Sc in each sc around—6 sc.
Rnd 11: 2 Sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Rnd 12: Sc in each sc around—12 sc. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.
ASSEMBLY: Stuff Heart with poly fill. Weave top opening closed, matching stitches. Insert pipe cleaners into arms and legs for more stability; cut off excess pipe cleaner if necessary. Sew on arms and legs as desired (We attached the arms on Rnd 10).
Curly Hair (Optional): Join yarn in first stitch at top of Heart in the “seam”; * ch 15, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 3 sc in each ch to end, slip st in next st on Heart; repeat from * across. Fasten off. If desired, you can make the curly hair different lengths by more or less chains.
Eyes: Glue on buttons or google eyes or stitch with different color yarn. A mouth can also be stitched.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 312 Black A, 512 Turqua B, 358 Lavender C, 373 Petal Pink D, 324 Bright Yellow E, 706 Perfect Pink F, and 313 Aran G.
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, F, and G = Color A, B, C, D, E, F, and G
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Gracie measures 7½” tall, seated. Her dragon measures 15½” long.
instructions: HEAD Beginning at top of head, with G, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc. Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc. Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc. Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc. Round 6: Sc in each sc around. Round 7: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc. Round 8: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc. Rounds 9–16: Sc in each sc around. Round 17: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—36 sts. Round 18: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc. Round 19: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc. Stuff head. Round 20: [Sc2tog] 12 times—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Finish stuffing head. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull gently to close opening. HAIR With A, ch 2. Row 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—5 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—10 sc. Row 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times, turn—15 sc. Row 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times, turn—20 sc. Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Row 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times, turn—25 sc. Row 7: Sc in each sc across, turn. Row 8: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times, turn—30 sc. Rows 9–11: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Rows 12–14: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—24 sc at the end of Row 14. Row 15: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 12 times—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew hair in place on head. This playful little dragon loves to play with his friend Gracie. You’ll have fun crocheting these special characters that all ages will enjoy! PONYTAIL (make 2) Wrap A around 5” piece of heavy cardboard 20 times. Cut strands to make 20 lengths, each 10” long. Tie a piece of yarn tightly around center of strands. Pull them all together with the tie at top center. Tie another strand around, ½” from first tie. Trim and sew in place. FACIAL FEATURES: With F, embroider couched stitch smile. With A, embroider eyes, embroidering one straight stitch for each eye and then embroidering a French knot at the center of each straight stitch. With G, embroider about 4 satin stitches to sculpt a nose. Tint cheeks by rubbing gently with red crayon. See illustrations at end of pattern. FLOWER With E, ch 2. Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: Sc in each sc around; sl st in next st to join. Fasten off. Round 3: Join F with sc in back loop of any sc of Round 1, sc in each remaining back loop of Round 1—6 sc. Round 4: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc. Round 5: *(Slip st, ch 1, 2 dc) in next sc, 2 dc in next st, ch 1 (petal made); repeat from * around, slip st in same st as first slip st—6 petals. Fasten off. Round 6: With Right Side facing, working in free front loops of Round 2, join D with slip st in any loop, ch 1, 2 sc in same loop, ch 1, *(sl st, ch 1, 2 sc) in next loop, ch 1; repeat from * around. Fasten off. Sew flower to top of head. BODY Beginning at bottom of body with F, ch 2. Rounds 1–6: Work same as Rounds 1–5 of head—36 sc. Rounds 7–15: Sc in each sc around. Round 16: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc. Round 17: Sc in each sc around. Round 18: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc. Round 19: Sc in each sc around. Round 20: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc. Stuff body. Round 21: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew head to body. COLLAR With F, ch 19. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—18 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew collar around neck. EAR (make 2) With G, ch 2. Row 1: Work 6 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Sew ears in place. ARM (make 2) Beginning at top of arm, with F, ch 2. Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of head—12 sc. Rounds 3–12: Sc in each sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff arm. Do not close opening at end of arm. HAND (make 2) With G, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc. Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around. Stuff hand lightly. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull gently to close opening. Push one hand in each arm opening. With F-colored tail of Arm, sew hand in place. Sew Arms to side of Body. FOOT AND LEG (make 2) Beginning at foot, with G, ch 6. Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch—12 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: Work 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc—18 sc. Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around, Round 6: Sc in next 3 sc, [sc2tog] 6 times, sc in last 3 sc—12 sc. Rounds 7–12: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Stuff leg. PANT LEG (make 2) Beginning at top of leg with F, ch 2. Rounds 1–3: Work same as Rounds 1–3 of head—18 sc. Round 4: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around. Rounds 5–9: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Insert one leg in pant leg. With D, sew in place behind Round 4. Sew the front loops of Round 4 to body in sitting position. DRAGON HEAD Beginning at tip of mouth with B, ch 2. Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of Gracie’s head—12 sc. Round 3: Sc in each sc around. Round 4: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—15 sc. Round 5: Sc in each sc around. Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—18 sc. Round 7: Sc in each sc around. Round 8: Sc in next 3 sc, [sc2tog] 6 times, sc in last 3 sc—12 sc. Rounds 9 and 10: Sc in each sc around. Round 11: Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc, sc in last 3 sc—18 sc. Round 12: Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc, sc in last 6 sc—24 sc. Rounds 13 and 14: Sc in each sc around. Round 15: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc. Following package directions, attach small animal eyes on top of head between Rounds 13 and 14. Round 16: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc. Stuff head. Round 17: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull gently to close opening. FACIAL FEATURES: With A, embroider French knot nostrils and straight stitch smile. NECK AND BODY With B, ch 12; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Sc in each ch around—12 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Rounds 2–10: Sc in each sc around. Round 11: Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc, sc in last 3 sc—18 sc. Round 12: Sc in each sc around. Round 13: Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc, sc in last 6 sc—24 sc. Rounds 14–22: Sc in each sc around. Round 23: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc. Rounds 24 and 25: Sc in each sc around. Round 26: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc. Begin stuffing body. Continue to stuff and work progresses. Rounds 27–29: Sc in each sc around. Round 30: Sc2tog, sc in each remaining sc across—11 sc. Round 31: Sc in each sc around. Round 32: Repeat Round 30—10 sc. Rounds 33 and 34: Repeat last 2 rounds—9 sc. Rounds 35–38: Sc in each sc around. Round 39: Repeat Round 30—8 sc. Rounds 40–44: Sc in each sc around. Round 45: Repeat Round 30—7 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull gently to close opening. EAR (make 2) With B, ch 5, sl st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew one ear to each side of head, above the eyes. SPINE With E, [ch 4, hdc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in next ch] 16 times. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew spine in place across length of back. LEG (make 4) With B, ch 2. Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of Gracie’s head—12 sc. Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around. Round 5: [Sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 6 sc—9 sc. Rounds 6 and 7: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff leg and sew in place. WING (make 2) With C, ch 8. Note: Work in back loops only throughout wing. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch, hdc in next 2 ch, dc in last 2 ch, turn—7 sts. Row 2: Ch 3 (does not count as a st), dc in first 2 dc, hdc in next 2 hdc, sc in last 3 sc, turn. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, hdc in next 2 hdc, dc in last 2 dc, turn. Row 4: Repeat Row 2. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew wings to body, one on each side of spine. FINISHING Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Contrast A: Black (00002) 1 ball or 33 yds/30 m
Contrast B: Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 33 yds/30 m
Contrast C: Black Currant (01318) 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Sizes U.S. C/2 [2.75 mm] and U.S. G/6 [4 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 4" [10 cm] long x 3" [7.5 cm] wide, excluding Antennae and Legs.
gauge: 18 sc and 19 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Version 1: A as Color 1, B as Color 2, and C as Color 3.
Version 2: A as Color 1, C as Color 2, and B as Color 3.
Version 3: C as Color 1, B as Color 2, and A as Color 3.
Note: Head/Neck Flange and Body are worked in continuous rnds. Move marker as each rnd is completed.
Head/Neck Flange (see diagram on page 3).
With Color 1 and larger hook, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. PM on last sc.

2nd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 9 sc.
3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
5th rnd: Working in front loops only, *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
6th rnd: As 3rd rnd. 24 sc.
7th rnd: As 4th rnd.
8th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
9th rnd: As 4th rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Body (see diagram on page 3)
Join Color 2 with sl st to any unworked back loop of 4th rnd of Head/Neck Flange.
1st rnd: Working behind Neck Flange into back loops only, *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
2nd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
5th to 12th rnds: As 3rd rnd.
13th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
Note: Beg stuffing Beetle before working further decreases, cont to stuff as you work.
14th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
15th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sc.
16th rnd: *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail. Weave yarn tail through rem sts and cinch closed.
Wings (make 2) (see diagram on page 3)
With Color 3 and larger hook, ch 12.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 9 ch. 3 sc in next ch. PM on center sc of last group of 3 sc. Working into opposite side of ch, 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. Turn. 23 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to marked sc. 3 sc in marked sc. PM on center sc as before. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 25 sc.
3rd row: As 2nd row. 27 sc. Fasten off.
Antennae (make 2) (see diagram on page 3)
With Color 1 and smaller hook, ch 10.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each of next 8 ch. Fasten off.
Legs (make 3) (see diagram on page 3)
With Color 1 and smaller hook, ch 43.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 6 ch. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 22 ch. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 7 ch. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Antennae to sides of Head, placed at 4th rnd, as shown in photo.
Sew Legs to underside of Body as shown in photo.
With RS tog, beg at flat top edge of Wing, sew first 10 dc of Wings tog, working through back loops only. Pull back Neck/Flange from Body, and seam Wings around top of Body, gathering slightly as you work. Attach optional keyring.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi™ (3.5 oz /100 g; 239 yds/219 m) Cactus (9627) 1 ball
Size U.S. B/1 [2.25 mm] Susan Bates® crochet hook or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbl = Double crochet through back loop only
Hdcbl = Half double crochet through back loop only
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) sc. Yoh and draw through all 3(4) loops on hook
instructions:
Notes:
•  Before beg, separate different color sections of yarn as follows: Pop center color out by pushing gently on center of ball so that it comes out intact. Find point where the color changes and cut yarn. Rep this process for rem yarn colors by pushing rings of color out of the larger ring and cutting. Wind each color into a separate ball to prevent tangling. You may find that one color appears both in the center and on outside of the ball, wind tog or separately.
•  Each cactus is made from 5 pieces: Body, 2 arms and 2 legs.
•  Clothing is made separately and placed on completed cactus.

BODY
Notes:
• Body is worked from side to side in rows.
• All body stitches are worked into back loops only to form ridges.
• When body rows are complete, stitches are worked along one side edge, dec to gather the edge for top of cactus.
With A or B, ch 22.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 21 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 7 sc. 1 hdcbl in each of next 7 sc. 1 dcbl in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 3 (does not count as a st). 1 scbl in first sc. 1 dcbl in each of next 6 dc. 1 hdcbl in each of next 7 hdc. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc. Turn.
4th to 17th rows: As 2nd and 3rd rows 7 times more.
18th row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 7 sts. 1 hdcbl in each of next 7 sts. 1 dcbl in each of next 6 sts. 1 scbl in last st.
Gather Top of Head: Do not turn. Working in ends of rows along side edge, (sc2tog over ends of next rows) 9 times. 9 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long yarn tail. Weave tail through rem loops. Pull to gather top of Head. Sew side edges of first and last rows tog. Stuff body. Sew lower edges tog for bottom of cactus.
Facial features: With C embroider eyes using French knot as shown in picture. Embroider mouth using straight stitch as shown in picture.

ARMS (make 2 for each cactus)
Note: Arms worked from side to side in rows.
With same color as for Body, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Weave tail through ends of rows along one side edge. Pull to gather for hand end of arm. Sew edges of first and last rows tog. Stuff arm. Bend arm in middle and sew a few stitches to maintain the bend and make hand end point upwards.

LEGS (make 2 for each cactus)
Beg at bottom of foot, with C, ch 13.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 3 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 scbl in each of last 3 sc. Turn. 9 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each of first 3 sts. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Turn. 7 sts.
4th to 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Fold piece in half and sew side and lower edges tog. Stuff piece.

OVERALLS (make for cactus done with B)
Notes:
• Overalls are worked side to side - worked all the way across front then across back.
• At center of front and back, sts are left unworked to form crotch.
With A, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Crotch: 11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 7 sc.
12th row: Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Turn. 10 sc.
13th to 30th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
31st and 32nd rows: As 11th and 12th rows.
33rd to 40th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.

Waistband
1st row: Do not turn at end of last row. Working in ends of rows along long side edge (waist edge), work sc evenly spaced to end of row. Join C. Fasten off A, leaving long end.
2nd and 3rd rows: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long yarn tail for sewing. Sew side edges tog for side seam. Sew inseam and crotch seam.

Strap (make 2)
With A, ch 15.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. 14 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew ends of each Strap to front of waistband approx 1"  [2.5 cm] from side edges. Sew Straps to back.
With C, embroider a French knot button on front at end of each strap.

DRESS (make with A)
Notes:
• Dress is made from 3 pieces: Front, back and tie.
• Tie is attached to top of front edge. Ends of tie are crossed at back of dress and sewn to top of back edge.
Front
With D, ch 13.
Bib: 1st row:  1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc.
2nd to 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Skirt: 8th row: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 1 dc in first sc. 2 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 24 dc.
9th and 10th rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Back
With D, ch 13.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 12 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row.
Skirt: 3rd row: Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc. 2 dc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 24 dc. 
4th and 5th rows: Ch 3. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew side seams.
Tie
With D, ch 40. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain (first strap made). Do not turn or fasten off.
Attach tie to dress: With dress front facing, working along opposite side of front foundation ch, 1 sc in each ch to end of row. Ch 40. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off and weave in ends. Cross straps at back of dress and thread each end through a space between stitches at top of back, 2 sts from center back. Tie the ends into a bow.

FLOWER
With D, ch 4.
1st rnd: Work 11 dc in the 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st in top of beg ch. Turn. 12 dc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as a st). 3 hdc in next dc. (Sl st in next dc. 3 hdc in next dc) 5 times. Sl st in same st as joining slip st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, Sew arms to side of cactus. Sew legs to underside of cactus. For A-cactus, sew flower to top of side of head. Put dress or overalls on cactus. Weave in and trim any rem ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 356 Amethyst A, 722 Pretty ’n Pink B, 254 Pumpkin C and 312 Black D.
Notions: Yarn needle, Three ½” (12.7 mm) white buttons, Stitch markers, Sewing needle and white sewing thread
abbreviations: A, B, C, D = color A, B, C, D
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
instructions:
Now dolls can go to the party in their own colorful witch costume. This crocheted ensemble coordinates with the Little Witch Hat & Shawl for girls, LW3821.
Rows 16–26: Ch 3, dc in each dc across; turn.
Row 27: Ch 1, sc in each dc across; turn.
Points
Row 28: Ch 1, starting in first st, *sc in each of next 6 sc, ch 1, turn, sc2tog over first 2 sts, sc in each of next 2 sc, sc2tog over first 2 sts, ch 1, turn, sc in each of next 4 sc, ch 1, turn, [sc2tog over first 2 sts] twice, ch 1, turn, sc2tog over first 2 sts, working in row-end sts, work 3 sc evenly spaced across side edge of point; repeat from * across – 9 points. Fasten off, leaving a long sewing length.
ASSEMBLY
Sew back seam to 1” (2.5 cm) below waist. Sew Peplum seam. Evenly space 3 buttons on top left side of Back and sew in place with sewing needle and thread. Use spaces between sts on right Back for button holes.
HAT
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join – 6 sc. Work in a spiral, marking beginning of each round and moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 9 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: *Sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 12 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 18 sc.
Rounds 7–8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: *Sc in each of next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 24 sc.
Rounds 10–11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: *Sc in each of next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 30 sc.
Rounds 13–14: Sc in each sc around.
Dress fits: 18” (45.5 cm) doll
Special Abbreviations
Single crochet 2 together (sc2tog): [Insert hook in next st, yarn over, draw up a loop] twice, yarn over, draw through 3 loops on hook.
DRESS
Bodice
Starting at neck edge with A, ch 25.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn – 24 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in first sc, 2 dc in each sc across; turn – 48 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, 2 dc in next dc, *dc in next st, 2 dc next st; repeat from * across; turn – 72 dc.
Rows 4–6: Ch 3, dc in each dc across; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in first 9 dc, skip next 18 dc, sc in next 18 dc, skip next 18 dc, sc in last 9 dc; turn – 36 sc.
Rows 8–10: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Peplum
Row 11: Ch 3, working in back loops of sts, dc in very first sc, 2 dc in each st across; turn – 72 dc.
Row 12: Ch 1, starting in first st, *sc in next 2 dc, 2 sc in next dc; repeat from * across; turn – 96 sc.
Row 13: Ch 3, dc in each sc across; turn.
Row 14: *Ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, dc in next ch, skip next 2 dc in row 13, slip st in next dc; repeat from * across – 32 points. Fasten off.
Skirt
Row 15: With right side facing, working in remaining loops of sts in Row 10, join A with a slip st in front loop of first st, ch 3, dc in same st as joining, 2 dc in each st across; turn – 72 dc.
5 rows dc = 3” (7.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); multicolor, heather and print 5 oz (141 g), 244 yd (223 m), flecks 5 oz (141 g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins
Designed by Michele Wilcox
What you will need:
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 356 Amethyst A, 722 Pretty ’n Pink B, 254 Pumpkin C and 312 Black D.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4.25mm [US G-6]
Notions: Yarn needle, Three ½” (12.7 mm) white buttons, Stitch markers, Sewing needle and white sewing thread
GAUGE: 12 sts dc = 4” (10 cm);
Round 15: *Sc in each of next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 36 sc.
Rounds 16–18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: *Sc in each of next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 42 sc.
Rounds 20 & 21: Sc in each sc around.
Round 22: *Sc in each of next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around – 48 sc. Fasten off B, join A.
Rounds 23–25: With A, sc in each sc around. Fasten off A, join B with slip st in front loop of first sc.
Round 26: With B, ch 3, working in front loops of sts, dc in first st, 2 dc in each st around; join with a slip st in top of beginning ch-3 – 96 dc.
Round 27: Ch 1, sc in each dc around; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
CAPE
Starting at neck edge with C, ch 78.
Row 1: Dc in 6th ch from hook, (beginning ch-5 counts as ch 1, dc, ch 1), *skip next 2 ch, 5 dc in next ch, skip next 2 ch, dc in next ch, ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch, rep from * across; turn – 9 shells.
Row 2: Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc, *skip next 2 dc, 5 dc in next dc, skip next 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next ch-1 space, dc in next dc; repeat from * across, ending with last dc in top of turning ch; turn. Fasten off C, join B.
Rows 3–10: Repeat Row 2, working in the following color sequence: *2 rows B, 2 rows C; repeat from * once. Fasten off C, join A.
Row 11: With A, repeat Row 2, do not turn. Do not fasten off.
Edging
Round 1: Working in row-end sts on side edge of Cape, sc evenly across to next corner, working across opposite side of foundation ch of neck, sc in each ch across, ch 1, turn, *sc2tog over next 2 sc; repeat from * across neck edge to next corner, turn, ch 40 (for tie), slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in each ch across, sc in each st across neck edge to next corner, ch 40 (for tie), slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in each ch across, working in row-end sts on other side edge, sc evenly across to next corner; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3 of last row of cape. Fasten off.
PUMPKIN BAG
Starting at bottom edge with C, ch 12.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in each of next 9 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each of next 9 ch, 2 sc in last ch; do not join – 24 sc. Work in a spiral, marking beginning of each round, moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: 2 sc in next sc, sc in each of next 9 sc, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, sc in each of next 9 sc, 2 sc in each of last 2 sc – 30 sc.
Rounds 3–12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: *Sc in each of next 3 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sts; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 14: Sc in each of next 6 sc, ch 24 (for strap), skip next 6 sts, sc in each of next 6 sc, ch 24 (for strap), skip next 6 sts; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off C. With D and yarn needle, following photo, embroider 2 vertical satin st eyes, horizontal satin st nose and back st mouth.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi Prints™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 239 yds/219 m) Giraffe (9321) 1 ball makes 2
Size B/1 (2.25 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
4 black safety eyes ¼" [6 mm]. Stitch marker. Fiber/filling. Susan Bates® Steel Yarn Needle. Susan Bates® Split-Lock Stitch Count Markers.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] from top of ear to bottom of foot.
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook and smooth yarn.
instructions:
Version 1: Yellow as Color 1. Brown as Color 2. White as Color 3.
Version 2: Multi as Color 1. Brown as Color 2. White as Color 3.
Notes:
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work.
• Do not join at end of rnd. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). Move marker up as each rnd is completed.

VERSION 1 
Body
Beg at bottom of body, with Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. (12 sc).
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. (18 sc).
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around (24 sc).
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th to 14th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
15th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. (Sc2tog) 6 times. 1 sc in each of last 9 sc. 24 sts.
16th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
17th rnd: 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2tog) 6 times. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. 18 sts.
18th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around.
19th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog) 3 times. 15 sts. Stuff body.
20th to 30th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
31st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. (20 sc).
32nd to 37th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Stuff as you go.
38th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. (15 sts).
39th rnd: (Sc2tog) 7 times. 1 sc in last sc. (8 sts). Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Thread yarn through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely, leaving a long end.
Ear (make 2)
With Color 1, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 5 dc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc last ch. Turn. 11 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in each of next 3 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew Ears in place.
Horn (make 2)
With Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew Horn in place.
Snout
With Color 3, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. (9 sc).
3rd to 5th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew Snout in place stuffing as you sew. When Snout is sewn in place, embroider mouth and nostrils with Color 2, little straight sts. With Color 2 embroider satin st Eyes above Snout.
Leg (make 4)
With Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. (10 sc).
3rd rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join Color 1.
4th to 12th rnds: With Color 1, 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Stuff leg and sew in place.
Spot (make 5)
With Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing. Sew Legs in place.
Tail
With Color 2, ch 8. 
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Sew tail in place.
Cut 3 lengths of Color 3 7" [18 cm] long. Draw through end of tail. Fold in half. Tie 6 ends tightly together. Trim and brush.
VERSION 2
With Color 1, work as given for Version 1. For Snout - use Color 3.

materials: RED HEART® Soft Baby Steps®: 1 ball each of 9590 Lavender A and 9939 Tickle B
RED HEART® Super Saver®: small amount of 312 Black for facial features
Susan Bates® Steel Crochet Hook: 3.75mm [US F-5]
Yarn needle, polyester fiberfill, stitch markers
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Toy measures about 3½” (9 cm) long by 3½” (9 cm) tall.
gauge: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 20 rows = 4” (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc, do not join. Work in a spiral as before.
Round 2: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—9 sc.
Rounds 3-7: Sc in each st around.
Fasten off, leaving an 8” (20.5 cm) sewing length. Stuff firmly. 
Ear (make 2)
With A, ch 5.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook sc in each of the next 2 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each of the next 3 ch, turn—9 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across—9 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving an 8” (20.5 cm) sewing length. Fold ear lengthwise and sew short row ends together with whipstitch creating a tear-drop shape.  
Assembly
Sew legs on bottom of body so lamb is well-balanced and can stand. Place front legs behind round 6, about 2 sts apart and back legs about 2 rounds behind the front legs.  
Special Stitches
sc2tog = [Insert hook in back loop of next stitch, yarn over and draw up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
NOTE
1. Work in continuous rounds. Do not join and do not turn work, unless otherwise directed.
2. Place a marker for beginning of round and move marker up as work progresses.
3. Stuff body parts firmly but do not overstuff or stretch stitches (this helps prevent stuffing showing through work).
LAMB
Head
Work through both loops of each st unless otherwise instructed. Beginning at the nose, with A, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc, do not join. Work in a spiral, marking beginning of each round and moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each st around.
Round 4: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Rounds 5-7: Sc in each st around.
Round 8: *2 sc in next st, sc in each of next 2 sts; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each st around. 
Do not fasten off.
Body
Rounds 10-16: Work sc in back loop only of each st around. Stuff head and body firmly, creating egg-like shape. Continue to stuff and shape as you close body.
Fleece
Fleece is worked in remaining front loops of body, in back and forth rows, until the decrease rounds begin (Rounds 17-19). From that point, the fleece stitches are worked in a spiral, covering the lamb’s backside. Note: the number of fleece bumps per row will vary depending on where you stop and start – the exact count is not important – the goal is to generously cover the back with fleece so the lamb looks properly fluffy.
With nose of lamb facing you, join B with a slip st in the first st to left of the front right leg, on first row with unworked front loops.  
Row 1: Working from right leg, across the back to left leg, work 3 hdc in same st as joining slip st, slip st in next st on body, *3 hdc in next st, slip st in next st; repeat from * across, ending with last slip st in last st before left leg; turn body so nose is away from you—about 9-12 fleece bumps.
Row 2: Slip st in st behind last fleece bump in previous row, work 3 hdc in same st, slip st in next st on body. *3 hdc in next st, slip st in next st, repeat from * across, ending in the st behind the first fleece bump of the previous row; turn body so nose is pointing toward you.
Row 3: Slip st in st behind last fleece bump in previous row, work 3 hdc in same st, slip st in next st on body, *3 hdc in next st, slip st in next st; repeat * across, ending in the st behind the first fleece bump of the previous row; turn body so nose is away from you.
Rows 4-7: Repeat Rows 2-3 (twice). At end of Row 7, do not turn.
Rounds 8-10: Working in a spiral, using remaining front loops of Rounds 17-19 of body, *work 3 hdc in next st, slip st in next st; repeat from * around for 3 rounds, until backside is covered with fleece. Fasten off.
Top Knot (make 1)
With B, ch 4; join with a slip st in first ch. 
Work first round in front loop of chs and second round in back loops of chs.
Round 1: Working in front loops of ch sts, *work (3 hdc, slip st) in each ch around.
Round 2: Working in remaining back loops of center ring, slip st into back loop of first ch, *work (3 hdc, slip st) in each ch around.
Fasten off, leaving an 8” (20.5 cm) sewing length.
Finishing
Slightly flatten head vertically to achieve shape. Sew ears to sides of head, in front of fleece rounds. Sew top knot to forehead between ears. Weave in ends.
Using photograph as a guide and black yarn in yarn needle, embroider features.
Eyes 
Working over one or 2 stitches for each eye, embroider with satin stitches on the round that is midway between the ears and the nose, about 6 sts apart. Pull yarn tightly between eyes to indent slightly.
Nose 
Over Round 1 of the nose, embroider a simple V.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 360 Café Latte A, 334 Buff B, 319 Cherry Red C, 312 Black D
floral stem wire (optional – to stabilize neck and for pose-able tail)
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, B, C, and D
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com
©2012 Coats & Clark
Love Monkey
Show your love to sweethearts of all ages with a lovingly crocheted monkey! What a sweet gift that will make them smile for years!
Round 18: [Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 19: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 20: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 21: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 22: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing head to body.
FACE
Beginning at top of body, with B, ch 2.
Rounds 1–4: Work same as Rounds 1–4 of head—24 sc.
Round 5: Skip next 2 sc, 9 dc in next sc, skip next 2 sc, sc in next 3 sc, skip next 2 sc, 9 dc in next sc, skip next 2 sc, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] twice, sc in next 3 sc—34 sts.
Round 6: 2 sc in next sc, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 8 times, sc in last sc—43 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing face to head. Attach eyes at base of 9-dc groups on Round 5. With D and using photograph as a guide, embroider a straight stitch mouth and nose. Sew face to head, sewing around outer edges of face. Stuff head.
EARS (make 2)
Inner Ear
With B, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join, work back and forth in rows, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—10 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 5 times, turn—15 sc. Fasten off.
Outer Ear
With A, work same as inner ear through Row 3—15 sc. Do not fasten off.
Row 4: Ch 1, hold one inner ear and one outer ear together with stitches of last rows matching; working through both thicknesses, sc in each sc across, do not turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, reverse sc in each sc across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing ear to head. Using photograph as a guide for placement, sew one ear to each side of head.
BODY
Beginning at bottom of body, with A, ch 2.
Rounds 1–6: Work same as Rounds 1–6 of head—36 sc.
Rounds 7–14: Sc in each sc around.
Begin stuffing body. Continue to stuff as work progresses.
Rounds 15–18: Work same as Rounds 19–22 of head—12 sc.
Fasten off and weave in ends.
TUMMY HEART
With C, ch 2.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—1 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 3 sc in the sc, turn—3 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—5 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—7 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—9 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 8: Skip first 2 sc, 6 dc in next sc, skip next sc, slip st in next sc, skip next sc, 6 dc in next sc, skip last 2 sc, sl st in beginning ch-1—13 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing heart to tummy. Sew heart to front of body. Stuff body. For additional stability, cut a 10” (25.5 cm) length of floral stem wire and fold it in half. Insert wire into center of body, allowing about 2” (5 cm) to extend from top. Place head on top of body, inserting remainder of wire into center of neck. Sew head to top of body.
ARMS AND LEGS (make a total of 4 pieces – 2 for arms and 2 for legs)
Beginning at tip of tail, with A, ch 2.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of head—12 sc. No marker is needed for beginning of round.
Rounds 3–10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] twice—10 sc.
Round 12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] twice—8 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing limb to body. Stuff limbs lightly and sew to body.
TAIL
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join. Work in continuous rounds (spirals). No marker is needed for beginning of round.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Repeat Round 2 working until tail measures about 15” (38 cm) from beginning or desired length. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing tail to body. Stuff tail lightly and sew to back of body. Note: If a pose-able tail is desired, do not stuff tail. Wrap stuffing around wire, taking special care to wrap around tip of wire, and insert wrapped wire into tail. Leave about 2” (5 cm) of unwrapped wire extending out of open end of tail. Insert the 2” (5 cm) end into body before sewing tail in place.
FINISHING
Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds) - 1 ball each of: White (MC) and Lt Blue, Lilac or Aqua (A).

Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Ombres: 56.7 g/2 oz/86 m/95 yds) - 1 ball of Ombree (MC); 1 ball each of: White or Aqua (A); Blue or Yellow or Pink (B); Green or Peach or Yellow (C); Yellow or Lilac or Green (D).
Lily® Sugar ’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds) - 1 ball each of: Lilac (MC); Peach (A); Aqua (B) and Pink (C).
Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Note: When working from charts, wind small balls of the colors to be used, one for each separate area of color in the design. Start new color at appropriate points. To change colors, draw new color through last 2 loops on hook to complete a st, then proceed.
LARGE GRAPHIC BLOCKS
With MC, ch 14. With A, ch 15. With MC, ch 17. 
1st row: (RS). With MC, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 14 ch. With A, 1 sc in each of next 15 ch. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 15 ch. Ch 1. Turn. Ch 1. 45 sc. 
1st row of Chart II is completed. 
Cont in Chart I, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right, until 18th row of Chart II is completed. Break yarn.
Next row: (RS). Miss first 15 sc. Join MC with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 19th row of Chart I across next 14 sts. 
Cont in Chart I to end of chart. Fasten off. 
With contrast color and RS facing, crochet sides tog to form a cube, leaving one side open for stuffing. Stuff Block into cube shape. Crochet opening closed. 
SMALL GRAPHIC BLOCKS
With A, ch 10. With MC, ch 11. With A, ch 13. 
1st row: (RS). With A, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. With A, 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. Ch 1. Turn. 33 sc. 
2nd row: With A, 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. With A, 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Ch 1. Turn.
Rep last row 10 times more. Fasten off. 
**With RS of work facing, miss first 11 sc. Join A with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Ch 1. Turn. 
With A, work 11 rows even in sc, joining MC at end of last row. 
With MC, work 12 rows even in sc, joining A at end of last row. 
With A, work 12 rows even in sc. Fasten off.**
With contrast color and RS facing, crochet sides tog to form a cube, leaving one side open for stuffing. Stuff Block into cube shape. Crochet opening closed. 
LARGE STRIPEY BLOCKS
With B, ch 14. With MC, ch 15. With D, ch 17. 
1st row: (RS). With D, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 14 ch. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 15 ch. With B, 1 sc in each of next 15 ch. Ch 1. Turn. 45 sc. 
1st row of Chart II is completed. 
Cont in Chart II, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right, until 18th row of Chart II is completed. Break yarn. 
Next row: (RS). Miss first 15 sc. Join B with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 19th row of Chart II across next 14 sts. 
Cont in Chart II to end of chart. Fasten off. 
With A and RS facing, crochet sides tog to form a cube, leaving one side open for stuffing. Stuff Block into cube shape. Crochet opening closed. 
SMALL STRIPEY BLOCKS
With C, ch 10. With MC, ch 11. With D, ch 13. 
1st row: (RS). With D, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 10 ch. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. With C, 1 sc in each of next 11 ch. Ch 1. Turn. 33 sc. 
2nd row: With C, 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. With D, 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Ch 1. Turn. 
Rep last row 10 times more. Fasten off.
Work from ** to ** as given for Small Graphic Blocks.
With MC and RS facing, crochet sides tog to form a cube, leaving one side open for stuffing. Stuff Block into a cube shape. Crochet opening closed. 
LARGE FLOWER BLOCKS
With MC, ch 16. With A, ch 17. With B, ch 18. 
1st row: (RS). With B, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 16 ch. With A, 1 sc in each of next 17 ch. With MC, 1 sc in each of next 17 ch. Ch 1. Turn. 51 sc. 
1st row of Chart III is completed. 
Cont in Chart III, reading RS rows from right to left and WS rows from left to right, until 20th row of Chart III is completed. Break yarn. 
Next row: (RS). Miss first 17 sc. Join C with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. Work 21st row of Chart III across next 16 sts. 
Cont in Chart III to end of chart. Fasten off. 
With contrast color and RS facing, crochet sides tog to form a cube, leaving one side open for stuffing. Stuff Block into cube shape. Crochet opening closed. 
SMALL FLOWER BLOCKS
Work as given for Small Stripey Blocks, substituting B for C, A for D and C for B.

pattern_name: Brother and Sister Bears to Crochet
materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi Prints™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 242 yds/221 m) Teddy Bear (9833) 1 ball makes 2
Sizes B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook for smooth yarn, U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook for fur yarn or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 7½" [19 cm] from top of ear to bottom of foot.
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook and smooth yarn.
instructions:
Instructions
Boy Version 1: Beige Fur is Color 1. Royal blue is Color 2. Light blue is Color 3. Tan is Color 4.
Girl Version 2: The same numbers apply.
Notes:
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work.
• Do not join at end of rnd. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). Move marker up as each rnd is completed.

BOY VERSION 1
Outer Eye (Make 2).
With smaller hook and Color 4, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end.

Head
With larger hook and Color 1, beg at top of head, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th to 9th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd:  (Sc2tog) 9 times. 9 sts. Stuff head. Set aside.
Following manufacturer's instructions, attach safety eye through center of outer eye. Snap in place. Sew Outer Eye in place to Head pushing plastic point into head. With Color 4, using Satin st, embroider nose and a Straight st embroider underneath.

Leg (make 2) 
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 9 sc.
3rd to 8th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off at end of last row. Stuff leg.

Body
With smaller hook and Color 3, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th to 8th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Join Color 2 at end of last rnd.
9th to 11th rnds:  With Color 2, 1 sc in each sc around. Join Color 3 at end of last rnd.
12th to 13th rnds:  With Color 3, 1 sc in each sc around. Join Color 2 at end of last rnd.
14th to 16th rnds:  With Color 2, 1 sc in each sc around. Join Color 3 at end of last rnd.
17th to 19th rnds:  With Color 3, 1 sc in each sc around. Do not fasten off.
Stuff Body. Sew Head to top of Body, pushing neck down so it is sewn at 5th rnd of Body.
Centering Head, fold bottom of Body flat. Working through both thicknesses, work 12 sc across bottom of Body. Fasten off.
Flatten bottom of leg. With Color 1 sew legs in place across 12 sc of Body.

Ear (make 2) 
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 4.
1st row: 9 dc in 4th ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each dc to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew in place to Head.

Arm (make 2). 
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd to 12th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving long end of yarn. Stuff Arms.

Hand (make 2) 
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving long end of yarn. Stuff lightly and sew in place at end of Arm.

Turtle neck
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd to 30th rows:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row, leaving long end to sew center back seam. Sew turtle neck around neck.

Bottom edge of sweater:  With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd to 32nd rows: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off at end of last row, leaving long end. Sew in place around 17th rnd of Body. Sew back seam.

GIRL VERSION 2
Head 
With larger hook and Color 4 beg at top of head, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. 
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. (24 sc).
6th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. (30 sc).
7th to 12th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
13th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
14th rnd:  1 sc in each sc around. Insert eyes 5 sc apart between rnds 6 and 7.
15th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
16th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts. Fasten off. Stuff head.

Ear (make 2) 
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 2.
1st row: 6 sc in 2nd ch from Hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten off. Sew in place.

Snout
With larger hook and Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Sew in place and embroider same as for Boy’s Version.

Leg (make 2) 
With smaller hook and Color 4, ch 2 (bottom of leg).
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd to 16th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving long end of yarn. Stuff Legs.

Arm 
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join at end of rnd. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 10 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Join color 3 at end of 4th rnd.
5th to 13th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving long end of yarn. Stuff Arms. Flatten top of arm and sew in place.

Girl Body:  Follow directions for Boy’s Version Body with following color changes: 
1st to 14th rnds: Color 3.
15th to 19th rnds: Color 2. Finish same as Boy’s Version.

Collar
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 18.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain each. Turn. 17 sc.
2nd row: *Sl st in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. Sl st in last sc. Fasten off. Sew Collar around neck.

Flower
With smaller hook and Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: [(Sl st. Ch 2) 4 times. Sl st] in 2nd ch from hook. Fasten off. Pull beg strand to tighten and sew in place.

Skirt: (worked side to side) 
Notes: Ch 2 at beg of row does not count as st.
Do not break color not in use. Carry color not in use up side of work.

With smaller hook and Color 3, ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Turn.
2nd row:  Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join Color 2. Turn.
3rd row:  With Color 2, ch 1. Working in back loops only,  1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. Turn.
4th row:  Ch 2. Working in back loops only, 1 dc in each of first 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.
5th row: With Color 3, as 3rd row.
6th row: With Color 3, as 4th row.
7th to 28th rows:  Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep 3rd to 6th rows. Fasten off Color 3.
With Color 2, work in sc along waist, covering carry alongs. Sew center back seam. Put on bear. Sew to 11th rnd of Body.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver® – 1 skein each 3620 Glowworm, 0324 Bright Yellow, and 3934 of Dayglow or colors your choice
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook – 5.5 mm [US I-9]
measurements: One monster measures about 5½" [14 cm] tall and 3" [7.5 cm] in diameter.
gauge: 15 hdc = about 4" [10 cm]; 12 rounds = about 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Pattern Notes
1. Monster is made from two pieces: Body and base.
2. Base is crocheted to bottom of Body and piece is stuffed just before completing seam.
3. Work each monster using yarn color of your choice.
4. Monster face is made from pieces of felt.

MONSTER
Body (make 1 for each monster) 
With color of your choice, make an adjustable ring, as follows:
Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail between middle finger and thumb. 
Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop.

Round 1: Chain 2 (counts as first hdc), work 8 half double crochet (hdc) stitches in the ring; pull gently on tail to tighten ring; join with slip st in top of beginning chain-2 – you will have 9 hdc in this round (counting the beginning chain-2 as one hdc).
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in same st as joining slip st, 2 hdc in each of next 8 hdc; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 18 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining slip st, hdc in next st, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next st] 8 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 27 hdc.
Round 4: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining slip st, hdc in each of next 2 sts, [2 hdc in next st, hdc in next 2 sts] 8 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2 – 36 hdc.
Round 5: Ch 2, skip same st as joining slip st, hdc in each remaining st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2. Repeat Round 5 until the piece measures about 5½" [14 cm] tall.
Fasten off.

Base (make 1 for each monster)
Make an adjustable ring and work Rounds 1–4 of monster body.
Do not fasten off.

FINISHING
Hold the base and lower edge of body together with stitches matching.
Joining Round: With yarn still attached to base, ch 1; working through both thicknesses, sc in each st around, stuff the piece before completing the round, then join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off and weave in yarn tails.
Using photograph and your imagination as guides, cut out facial features from felt. With craft glue, glue features to monster. Hint: A quarter makes a great guide for cutting out the whites of eyes.

materials: Bernat® Blanket™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 220 yds/201 m) Main Color (MC) Weathered Red (10932) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 16½" [42 cm] tall x 11" [28 cm] at widest point.
instructions:
Notes: 
• Stuffie is made in several pieces that are sewn or crocheted together. 
• Rnds are worked in a spiral. Do not ch 1 at beg of rnd or join any rnds with a sl st unless specifically directed in the pattern.
• PM on first st of rnd as you work to keep track of your progress.
Mushroom Top:
With MC, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here. 
**1st rnd: (RS)  Ch 1. 1 sc in ring. 9 hdc in ring. 10 sts.
2nd rnd: 2 hdc in each st around. 20 sts. 
3rd rnd: *1 hdc in next st. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. 30 sts.
4th rnd:  * 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. 40 sts
5th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. 50 sts.**
6th rnd: *1 hdc in next st. 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 60 sts.
7th rnd: 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 2 hdc in next st. *1 hdc in each of next 9 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 4 sts. 66 sts.
8th rnd:  *2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 10 sts. Rep from * around. 72 sts.
9th rnd: 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. 2 hdc in next st. *1 hdc in each of next 17 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * to last 9 sts. 1 hdc in each of last 9 sts. 76 sts.
10th to 15th rnds:  1 hdc in each st around.
16th rnd:  1 sc in next st. Sl st in next st. Fasten off.  
Mushroom Top Spots (make 12)
With A, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: (RS)  Ch 1. 1 sc in ring. 9 hdc in ring.  10 sts.
2nd rnd: 1 sc in next st. Sl st in next st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Mushroom Stem:
With A, beg using magic loop method.
1st to 5th rnds: Work from ** to ** as given for Mushroom Top.
6th to 20th rnds: 1 hdc in each st around.
21st rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 4 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. 60 hdc.
