22nd rnd: *1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. 70 hdc.
23rd rnd: *(1 hdc in each of next 11 sts. 2 hdc in next st) twice. 1 hdc in each of next 10 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Rep from * around. 76 hdc. 
24rd rnd:  1 sc in next st. Sl st in next st. Fasten off.  
Assembly:
Sew Spots to the Mushroom Top using tails.
Add safety eyes to Stem as shown in photo. Backstitch smile on Stem using 12" [30.5 cm] of MC. 
Stuff Top and Stem with Fiberfill. 
1st joining rnd: With MC, join Top and Stem by working a sc through each st of last round of both layers. Join rnd with a sl st. 
2nd joining rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc and fasten off.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool DK Superwash™ (1.75 oz/50 g; 125 yds/114 m)
Contrast C Medium Grey Heather (12044) 1 ball
Size U.S. C/2 (3 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Large eyed blunt tip tapestry needle.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2(3)(7)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3)(7) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Note: When joining colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed.
Legs (make 2)
Beg at Sole of Shoe: With A, ch 6.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc . 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 2 hdc in each of next 6 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 38 sts.
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 15 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Join B with sl st to first sc. 34 sc.
6th rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join A with sl st to first sc.
7th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Shape Toe: 1st row: Join A with sl st to back loop of 9th sc of last rnd. Ch 1. Working in back loops, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Sc2tog) 5 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc7tog. Fasten off.
Shoe: 1st rnd: Join B with sl st in back loop of first st of 6th rnd. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Work 7 sc across edge of Toe. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 27 sc.
Head
Nose: With E, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 9 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
5th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Break E, join C at end of 6th rnd.
7th rnd: With C, ch 1. Working in back loops only, (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
8th rnd: Working in both loops, Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
9th to 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. join with sl st to first sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 50 sc.
15th rnd: As 13th rnd.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 60 sc.
17th to 24th rnds: As 13th rnd.
25th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 50 sts.
26th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 40 sts.
28th rnd: As 26th rnd.
Stuff Head.
29th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 30 sts.
30th rnd: As 26th rnd.
31st rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 20 sts.
Stuff Head and attach safety eyes in 9th rnd of Head, spaced as shown in photo.
32nd rnd: As 26th rnd.
33rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 10 sts.
34th rnd: As 33rd rnd. 5 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Complete stuffing Head. Draw end through rem sts and secure tightly.
Outer Ear (make 2).
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1 *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Inner Ear: (make 2) With D, work from ** to ** as given for Outer Ear. Fasten off.
With WS tog, sew Inner Ear to center of Outer Ear.
Arms (make 2).
With C, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd to 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. (sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first st. 14 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4½” [11.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Stuff Arm.
Sleeve 
With A, ch 18.  Join with sl st to first ch to form ring, taking care not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) twice. Join B with sl st to first st. 16 sts.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts) twice. Join with sl st to first st. 14 sts.
Join Sleeve to Arm: 1st rnd: Align Sleeve over Arm, having Sleeve on outside of Arm. With D, ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
2nd and 3rd rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first sc at end of 3rd rnd.
4th and 5th rnds: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of 5th rnd.
Sew top of Arm closed.
Attach Arms at either side of Body.
Sew Head to top of Body.
Vest
Lower Section: With B, ch 5.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece measures 9½” [24 cm], ending on a WS row. Do not turn at end of last row.
Top Section: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. Working across long side edge, work 48 sc evenly across to Lower Section. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc).  1 hdc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. (Hdc2tog) twice. 1 hdc in each of next 20 hdc. (Hdc2tog) twice. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 44 sts.
5th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last row 4 times more.
Divide for armholes: Right Front: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 9 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. 10 sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 9 sts.
4th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 8 sts.
5th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
6th row: As 5th row. 4 sts.
7th row: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) twice. Fasten off.
Back: With RS facing, skip next 4 hdc. Join B with sl st to next hdc. 
1st row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog (over same st as last sl st and next st). 1 hdc in each of next 10 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st across. Turn. 12 sts.
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 10 sts.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 8 sts.
6th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
7th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 4 sts. Fasten off.
Left Front: With RS facing, skip next 4 hdc. Join B with sl st to next hdc.
1st row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 10 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 9 sts.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 8 sts.
5th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each hdc to last 2 sts. Hdc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
6th row: As 5th row. 4 sts.
7th row: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) twice. Fasten off.
Sew shoulder seams.
Finishing
Sew Ears to Head as shown in picture. 
With B, embroider mouth using straight stitch. With A, embroider shoelaces using straight stitch.

materials: 6-strand embroidery floss in blue, red, yellow, and black
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Little Red Riding Hood and Wolf measure 6" (15 cm) tall. Grandmother measures 7" (18 cm) tall.
gauge: 4 sc = 1" (2.5 cm); 4 rows = 1" (2.5 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LITTLE RED RIDING HOOD
Head
Beginning at center of face, with A, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 4: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around; changing to B—24 sc.
Round 5: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: *Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—21 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: *Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 10: *Sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc. Stuff head with fiberfill. Place marker on last st of Round 4 for center of neck.
Round 11: [Sc2tog] around—6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through sts and pull gently to close. 
Hair 
Row 1: Working in back loops, join C with slip st in 3rd sc at right of marked st on Round 4, leave marker in place, *ch 2, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around; leave last 3 sc before marked st unworked. Fasten off.
Body
Beginning at bottom of feet, with D, ch 6.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch—12 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in last 2 sc—18 sc.
Rounds 3–13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: *Sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Stuff body with fiberfill.
Arm (make 2) 
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round and move up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around; change to D.
Rounds 3–7: Sc in each sc around. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Skirt
With E, ch 19.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—18 sc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), dc in first sc, 2 dc in each remaining sc across, turn—36 dc.
Row 3: Ch 3, dc in each dc across. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Apron 
With F, ch 7.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—12 sc.
Rows 3 and 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Fasten off. 
Cape 
With B, ch 25.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—24 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, [sc2tog] across, turn—12 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, 3 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last st, 3 sc in last sc; working down first side, sc in end of each row; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; working up other side, sc in end of each row; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING 
LITTLE RED RIDING HOOD 
Head
With blue embroidery floss, embroider 
French knot eyes; embroider smile 
with red embroidery floss and couched 
stitching. Color cheeks with red crayon. 
Legs
Flatten body slightly. With strand of 
D, back stitch through center sts of 
Rounds 1–5. 
Body 
With end tail of body, sew head in place 
on Round 14. 
Sew arms in place.
Clothing 
Place skirt around waist of doll and, 
working in ends of rows, sew back seam. 
With yellow embroidery floss, 
embroider 5 French knots evenly 
spaced between Rows 3 and 4 of apron. 
Sew apron over skirt.
Sew cape around neck.
Weave in ends. 
GRANDMOTHER
Head
Work same as Little Red Riding Hood 
head, changing to G at end of Round 4.
Hat Ruffle
Row 1: Working in back loops, join G 
with slip st in 3rd sc at right of marked 
st on Round 4, leave marker in place, *3 
sc in next sc, slip st in next sc; repeat 
from * around; leave last 3 sc before 
marked st unworked. Fasten off. 
Body
With G, work same as Little Red Riding 
Hood body. 
Arm (make 2) 
Work same as Little Red Riding Hood 
arm, changing to G at end of Round 2. 
Nightgown
With H, work Rows 1 and 2 same as Little 
Red Riding Hood skirt. 
Rows 3–5: Ch 3, dc in each dc across, 
turn.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING GRANDMOTHER
Head
Embroider facial features and color 
cheeks same as Little Red Riding Hood. 
With black embroidery floss, back stitch 
around eyes to make eyeglasses.
Join F with slip st in any sc at top of 
head, 3 loop sts in same sc. Fasten off. 
Braid 
Cut 7 strands of F each measuring 
14" (35.5 cm). Tie 1 strand tightly around 
center of remaining 6 strands. Tie center 
strand to side of head under ruffle. Fold 
over gathered strands and braid 12 
strands of yarn to desired length. Secure 
with another short strand of F and trim 
all strands. 
Legs
With G, shape same as Little Red 
Riding Hood.
Body
Sew head and arms to body.
Sew nightgown around body in same 
manner as Little Red Riding Hood skirt.
Weave in ends.
WOLF
Head
Beginning at tip of nose, with I, ch 2. 
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook—6 sc. Place marker for beginning 
of round and move up as each round is 
completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc 
around—12 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next 6 
sc, sc in remaining 3 sc—18 sc.
Round 6: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next 
sc; repeat from * around—24 sc.
Rounds 7–10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: *Sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog; 
repeat from * around—21 sc.
Round 12: *Sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog; 
repeat from * around—18 sc.
Round 13: *Sc in next sc, sc2tog; repeat 
from * around—12 sc. Stuff head  
with fiberfill.
Round 14: [Sc2tog] around—6 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail 
through sts and pull gently to close. 
Ear (make 2) 
With I, ch 4. 
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc 
in next ch, (2 hdc, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch 
from hook, 2 hdc) in last ch; working in 
opposite side of foundation ch, skip first 
ch, hdc in next ch, sc in last ch.  
Fasten off. 
Body
With I, work same as Little Red Riding 
Hood body. 
Arm (make 2)
With I, work same as Little Red Riding 
Hood arm, do not change color at end 
of Round 2.
Tummy
With F, ch 5.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and 
in next 2 ch, 3 sc in last ch; working in 
opposite side of foundation ch, skip first 
ch, sc in next 2 ch, 2 sc in last ch—10 sc. 
Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 
2 sc, 2 sc in next 3 sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 
sc in last 2 sc; join with slip st in first sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Tail
With I, ch 7. 
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc 
in next ch, hdc in next 4 ch. Fasten off, 
leaving a long tail for sewing. 
FINISHING WOLF
Head
With black embroidery floss, embroider 
satin stitch eyes and nose and 3 straight 
stitches for mouth.
Sew ears to top of head.
Legs
With I, shape same as Little Red 
Riding Hood.
Body
Sew head and arms to body.
Position tummy on front of body and 
sew in place. Sew tail to back of body.
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART Super Saver, 7oz/198g skeins, each approx 364yd/333m (acrylic)
1 skein each in: I #774 Light Raspberry (A)
I Size G/6 (4mm) crochet hook or any size to obtain the correct gauge
Red and black six-strand embroidery floss
abbreviations: [ ] Repeat the directions inside brackets as many times as indicated.
sc2tog  (sc 2 sts together) [Insert hook in next st, yarn over and draw up a loop twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.]
gauge: 20 sts and 16 rounds to 4"/10cm over sc using size G/6 (4mm) crochet hook. Remember to check gauge for best results!
instructions:
How to make a gauge swatch: Ch 21. Row 1 Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across—20 sts. Ch 1, turn. Row 2 Sc in each st across. Ch 1, turn. Repeat row 2 fourteen times more. Swatch should measure 4" x 4"/10 x 10cm. Adjust hook size if necessary to obtain the correct gauge.

Raspberry Doll
head
With A, make an adjustable ring. Round 1 Work 6 sc in ring, do not join, mark last st made with the safety pin; tighten ring. You will now be working in a spiral marking the last st made with the safety pin to indicate end of round.
Round 2 [Work 2 sc in next st] 6 times—12 sts.
Round 3 [Sc in next st, work 2 sc in next st] 6 times—18 sts.
Round 4 [Sc in next 2 sts, work 2 sc in next st] 6 times—24 sts.
Round 5 [Sc in next 3 sts, work 2 sc in next st] 6 times—30 sts.
Round 6 [Sc in next 4 sts, work 2 sc in next st] 6 times—36 sts.
Rounds 7 and 8 Sc in each st around.
Round 9 [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts] 6 times—30 sts.
Round 10 [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts] 6 times—24 sts.
Round 11 [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts] 6 times—18 sts.
Round 12 [Sc2tog, sc in next st] 6 times, end sl st in next st dropping safety pin—12 sts. Fasten off leaving a 10"/25.5cm tail.

body
With A, make an adjustable ring. Rounds 1-4 Work as for head—24 sts. Round 5 Working through back loops only, sc in each st around. Round 6 [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts] 4 times—20 sts. Round 7 Sc in each st around. Round 8 [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts] 4 times—16 sts. Round 9 Repeat round 7. Round 10 [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sts] 4 times, end sl st in next st dropping safety pin—12 sts. Fasten off leaving a 10"/25.5cm tail.

feet (make 2)
With B, make an adjustable ring. Rounds 1 and 2 Work as for head—12 sts. Round 3 Sc in each st around. Round 4 [Sc2tog] 6 times, end sl st in next st dropping safety pin—6 sts. Fasten off leaving a 10"/25.5cm tail.

arms (make 2)
Beginning at hand, with B, make an adjustable ring. Round 1 Work 5 sc in ring, do not join, mark last st made with the safety pin; tighten ring. You will now be working in a spiral marking the last st made with the safety pin to indicate end of round. Round 2 [Work 2 sc in next st] 5 times—10 sts. Round 3 Sc in each st around. Round 4 [Sc2tog] 5 times, changing to A—5 sts. Stuff hand with fiberfill. Rounds 5 and 6 Repeat round 3. Round 7 Repeat round 3, end sl st in next st dropping safety pin. Fasten off leaving a 10"/25.5cm tail.

ear (make 2)
With B, make an adjustable ring. Rounds 1 and 2 Work as for arms—10 sts. Rounds 3-6 Sc in each st around. Round 7 Repeat round 3, end sl st in next st dropping safety pin. Fasten off leaving a 10"/25.5cm tail.

scarf
With C, ch 32. Row 1 Turn to bottom loops of ch, hdc in 3rd loop from hook and in each loop across. Fasten off.

finishing
Weave in all loose ends, leaving tails for sewing. Stuff head, body and feet with fiberfill. Lining up the slip stitches of each piece, whipstitch head and body together, taking care to keep the stitches matched up. Whipstitch feet to body. Sew arms to top of body. Sew ears to top of head. Using thread doubled in sewing needle, sew on eyes. Using all six strands of red floss in embroidery needle, embroider a straight stitch mouth as shown. Tie scarf around neck.

GOLD DOLL
head
Work as for raspberry doll using D.
body
Work as for raspberry doll using E.
feet (make 2)
Work as for raspberry doll using D.
arms (make 2)
Work as for raspberry doll, working rounds 1–4 using D, then changing to E at end of round 4.
ears (make 2)
Work as for raspberry doll using D.
scarf
Work as for raspberry doll using F.
finishing
Work as for raspberry doll.

PUMPKIN DOLL
head
Work as for raspberry doll using G.
body
Work as for raspberry doll using H.
feet (make 2)
Work as for raspberry doll using J.
arms (make 2)
With J, make an adjustable ring. Round 1 Work 5 sc in ring, do not join, mark last st made with the safety pin; tighten ring. Round 2 [Work 2 sc in next st] 5 times—10 sts. Round 3 Sc in each st around, changing to H. Rounds 4-6 Sc in each st around. Round 7 Repeat round 4, end sl st in next st dropping safety pin. Fasten off leaving a 10"/25.5cm tail.
ears (make 2)
Work as for raspberry doll arms, working rounds 1–4 using J, then changing to H at end of round 4. 
finishing
Weave in all the loose ends, leaving tails for sewing. Stuff head, body, arms and feet with fiberfill. Assemble pieces as for raspberry doll. Using thread doubled in sewing needle, sew on eyes, then sew on buttons on center front of body. Using all six strands of floss in embroidery needle, embroider a red straight stitch mouth and a black eyebrow over left eye as shown.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 2.25 mm [US B-1]
regular sized drinking straw (for leg armatures)
Optional: Pins, knee high stocking and plastic pellets for weighted stuffing.
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, Color B, Color C, and Color D
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Llama measures about 5" [12.5 cm] tall and 4" [10 cm] wide (at widest).
gauge: 32 sts = about 4" [10 cm]; 28 rounds = about 4" [10 cm] in single crochet (sc). EXACT GAUGE IS NOT CRITICAL TO THIS PROJECT.
instructions:
BODY
With A or B, make an adjustable ring. 
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; 
do not join, work in continuous rounds 
(spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to 
indicate end of round. Move marker up 
as each round is completed.

Begin Fleece Rounds
Notes
1. Stitches in every other round of this
section are worked in back loops only.
This leaves free loops on the surface
of the body.
2. Fleece is worked later and attached
to the free loops.
Round 2: Working in back loops only, 
work 2 sc in each of next 6 sts—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 
times—18 sc.
Round 4: Working in back loops only, 
[sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each st around.
Make Neck Opening
Round 6: Working in back loops only, sc 
in next 18 sts, ch 6, skip last 6 sts (for 
neck opening)—18 sc and 1 ch-6 space.
Round 7: Sc in next 18 sts, sc in next 6 
ch—24 sc.
Round 8: Working in back loops only, sc 
in each st around.
Round 9: Sc in each st around.
Round 10: Repeat Round 8.
Round 11: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 6 
times—18 sc.
Round 12: Working in back loops only, 
[sc in next st, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Round 13: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc.
Tail: Ch 6, sc in 2nd ch from hook and 
next 4 ch.
Fasten off leaving a long yarn tail. 
Thread tail through stitches of Round 
13 and pull to close opening and anchor 
tail. Weave in and trim tail.
Stuff body with fiberfill, or insert pellet 
filled knee high, through neck opening.

HEAD/NECK
With same yarn color as used for body, 
make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; 
do not join, work in continuous rounds 
(spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to 
indicate end of round. Move marker up 
as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each of next 6 
sts—12 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each st around. 
Round 5: Work 2 sc in each of next 12 
sts—24 sc.
Rounds 6–8: Sc in each st around. 
Begin Fleece Rounds
Round 9: Working in back loops only, sc 
in next 18 sts, ch 6, skip last 6 sts (for 
neck opening)—18 sc and 1 ch-6 space. 
Round 10: Sc in next 18 sts, sc in next 6 
ch—24 sc.
Round 11: Working in back loops only, sc 
in each st around.
Round 12: [Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 6 
times—18 sc.
Attach safety eyes between Rounds 
7 and 8, about 10 or 11 stitches apart. 
Place both eyes an equal distance from 
the edges of neck opening just made 
so they will sit correctly when neck is 
added.
Begin stuffing head and continue 
stuffing as work progresses. Do not use 
weighted stuffing in head.
Round 13: Working in back loops only, 
[sc2tog] 9 times—9 sc.
Fasten off. Weave in and trim ends.
Neck
Join yarn with slip stitch in any st of 
neck opening. In the next round, stitches 
are worked into each stitch (including 
the chains of the ch-6) around the neck 
opening.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, in 
each st around, and in left and right side 
edges of opening—14 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to 
indicate end of round. Move marker up 
as each round is completed.
Round 2: Working in back loops only, sc 
in each st around
Round 3: Sc in each st around.
Round 4: Repeat Round 2.
Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing 
neck to neck opening of body. 

LEGS (make 4)
With same yarn color as used for body, 
make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; 
do not join, work in continuous rounds 
(spiral)—6 sc.
Place a marker in the last sc worked to 
indicate end of round. Move marker up 
as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–6: Sc in each st around. 
Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing 
leg to body. If needed, thread beginning 
yarn tail through stitches at beginning 
of piece and pull to close opening. 
Weave in and trim beginning tail only. 
Insert drinking straw into leg and cut to 
size. 

EARS (make 2)
With same yarn color as used for body, 
ch 12.
Row 1: Working in back bumps only, sc 
in each bump across.
Fasten off leaving a long tail. Fold the 
strip in half. With the tail, sew together 
the edges that make up the opposite 
side of the foundation chain. Do not 
trim the tail. It can be used later to sew 
ear to head.

FLEECE
Finish stuffing the head and neck firmly. 
Fleece Round: Join matching yarn with 
slip st in any free loop of head Round 9, 
ch 5, slip st in same st, slip st in next st, 
*(slip st, ch 5, slip st) in next st, slip st in 
next st; repeat from * around. Fasten off 
and weave in ends.
Repeat Fleece Round around Rounds 11 
and 13 of head, Rounds 2 and 4 of neck, 
and Rounds 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 of body.

BLANKET
With C, leaving a long beginning tail for 
fringe, ch 15.
Row 1: With C, Sc in 2nd ch from hook 
and in each remaining ch across and 
change to D in last st—14 sc.
Row 2: With D, ch 1, turn, sc in each st 
across and change to B in last st.
Row 3: With B, ch 1, turn, sc in each st 
across and change to A in last st.
Row 4: With A, ch 1, turn, sc in each st 
across and change to B in last st.
Row 5: With B, ch 1, turn, sc in each st 
across and change to D in last st.
Row 6: With D, ch 1, turn, sc in each st 
across and change to C in last st.
Row 7: With C, ch 1, turn, sc in each st 
across.
Fasten off C, leaving a long tail for 
fringe.
Hold all fringes along one side of 
blanket together and tie an overhand 
knot about ½" [1.5 cm] from edge of 
blanket. Trim ends even, about ½" [1.5 
cm] from knot. Repeat on other side of 
blanket.

FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to 
placement, use yarn tails or yarn scraps 
to sew the following pieces together.
1. Sew head/neck to body neck opening,
positioning the head facing forwards
relative to the chest (or position to
the side, if desired). Take care to sew
all the way around the neck opening
using a secure whipstitch.
2. Sew ears to top of head between the
first and second fleece rounds on
head, about 2 or 3 stitches apart.
3. Sew legs to bottom portion of body,
between fleece rounds. Position back
legs about ½" [1.5 cm] from front legs.
Place back legs very close together
(so they touch), place the front legs
very close together. To check for
balance, pin or baste legs in place
first then sew securely in place.
With embroidery needle and 2 strands 
of black embroidery floss, embroider 
a "Y" shape for nose. Embroider the "Y" 
beginning in tip of muzzle and about 3 
rows high. Weave the floss back through 
head and knot securely then bury yarn 
in head, trimming excess as needed.

Halter
Noseband: With C, ch 14; join with slip 
st in first ch to form a ring. Note: This 
part of the halter is placed around the 
llama's muzzle.
Head Strap: Ch 21. Note: This part of the 
halter forms the strap that fits around 
the llama's head. 
Try halter on for size and adjust as 
needed. Join the end of the head strap 
with a slip st in the opposite side of the 
noseband circle.
Fasten off, knotting the yarn end 
securely. Place halter on llama.

Tassels (make 3 – 1 each with B, C, D)
1. Cut 2 lengths of C, about 3" [7.5 cm]
long for ties.
2. Cut 3 strands of tassel color yarn,
about 2" [5 cm] long.
3. Hold the 3 strands together and fold
in half.
4. Thread one of the 3" [7.5 cm] ties
through the fold then tie into a knot
for top of tassel.
5. Tie remaining 3" [7.5 cm] tie around
the top of the tassel, about ⅛" [3
mm] below top of tassel, for tassel
neck. Trim ends even. Place a small
dot of glue on knot to secure.
Repeat this process to make all 3 
tassels. Using photograph as a guide 
to placement and using yarn tails or 
yarn scraps, tie two of the tassels to 
the halter, where noseband and head 
strap meet. Tie third tassel to one of the 
llama's ears.
Place blanket on back of llama and tack 
in place using same yarn color as used 
for body. 
Weave in and trim any remaining ends.

materials: Aunt Lydia® Baby Shower™ (170 yds/155 m) Dark Dogwood (8820) 3 balls or 500 yds/460 m
Size U.S. D/3 (3.25 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook
Susan Bates® split-lock stitch count markers
Length of Anchor® Embroidery Floss Pink (1021) and Black (0403)
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
instructions:
Notes:
• Project worked in continuous rnds. Do not join at end of rnds.
• Move marker as work progresses.
• Head and Body are worked as one piece.
HEAD
Make magic ring. Video is here. See Diagram on page 4.
**1st rnd:  Ch 1. 6 sc into magic ring. PM on first sc. Do not join.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around.
3rd rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 24 sc.***
5th rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 30 sc.
6th rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. 36 sc.**
7th rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 6 times. 42 sc.
8th rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 6 times. 48 sc.
9th rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 6 times. 54 sc.
10th rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc) 6 times. 60 sc.
11th rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc) 6 times. 66 sc.
12th rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc) 6 times. 72 sc.
13th rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc) 6 times. 78 sc.
14th rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc) 6 times. 84 sc.
15th to 28th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Begin stuffing as you go along.
29th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sc) 6 times. 78 sts.
30th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc) 6 times. 72 sts.
31st rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc) 6 times. 66 sts.
32nd rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc) 6 times. 60 sts.
33rd rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc) 6 times. 54 sts.
34th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 6 times. 48 sts.
35th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 6 times. 42 sts.
36th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 6 times. 36 sts.
37th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. 30 sts.
38th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 24 sts.
39th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
Do not fasten off.
BODY: See Diagram on page 5.
1st rnd: 1 scbl in each sc around. 18 sts.
2nd rnd:  (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 24 sts.
3rd rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 30 sts.
4th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. 36 sts.
5th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 6 times. 42 sts.
6th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 6 times. 48 sts.
7th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 6 times. 54 sts.
8th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc) 6 times. 60 sts.
9th to 23rd rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. 60 sts.
24th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc) 6 times. 54 sts.
25th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 6 times. 48 sts.
26th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 6 times. 42 sts.
27th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 6 times. 36 sts.
28th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. 30 sts.
Finish stuffing.
29th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 24 sts.
30th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
31st rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 12 sts.
32nd rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times 6 sts. Fasten off.
LEGS (Make 2)
See Diagram on page 6. Make Magic ring. Work from ** to ** as given for Head. 36 sc.
7th rnd: 1 scbl in each sc around.
8th and 9th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. 30 sts.
11th and 12th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
13th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 24 sts.
14th and 15th rnds: As 11th rnd.
16th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
Stuff bottom of Legs only.
17th to 22nd rnds: 1 sc in each st around. 18 sts.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Fold sides tog and stitch closed. Sew Legs to Body between 26th and 27th rnds.
ARMS (Make 2)
Make Magic ring. See Diagram on page 6. Work from ** to *** as given for Head. 24 sts.
5th and 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd:  (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
8th and 9th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
10th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 12 sts.
Stuff bottom of arms only.
11th to 16th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc at end of last rnd.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing. Fold sides tog and sew closed. Sew Arms to Body between 9th and 10th rnds.
TAIL
Make Magic ring. See Diagram on page 7. Work from ** to *** as given for Head. 24 sts.
5th and 6th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
7th rnd:  (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
8th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc) 6 times. 12 sts.
9th and 10th rnds: 1 sc in each st around. Stuff lightly.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Fold sides tog and sew closed. Sew Tail to Body between 24th and 25th rnds. Bend upwards and sew middle of Tail to Body for better shape.
EARS (Make 2)
Make Magic ring. See Diagram on page 7. Work from ** to ** as given for Head. 36 sc.
7th rnd: (2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 6 times. 42 sc.
8th and 9th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 6 times. 36 sts.
11th to 16th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
17th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 6 times. 30 sts.
18th to 29th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
30th rnd:  (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 6 times. 24 sts.
31st to 49th rnds:  1 sc in each st around.
50th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) 6 times. 18 sts.
51st to 63rd rnds:  1 sc in each st around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Do not stuff. Fold sides tog and sew closed. Sew Ears to Head between 9th and 10th rnds.
FINISHING
With black floss, embroider eyelids and eyelashes using back stitch as shown in picture.
With pink floss, embroider nose using satin stitch as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver: 1 skein each of 512 Turqua A, 316 Soft White B, 706 Perfect Pink C and 312 Black D
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Large Pony measures 9” (22 7/8 cm) tall, Small Pony measures 5 ½” (14 cm) tall
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
Mouth
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join.
Rounds 2–3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join.
Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times, sc in last sc, join.
Rounds 7–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join.
Round 9: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, join.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing in place.
Ears (Make 2)
With A, ch 4
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, do not join. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing in place.
Legs (Make 4)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join.
Rounds 2–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join. Fasten off.
Rounds 9–12: With A, ch 1, sc in each sc around, join. 
Round 13: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Round 14: Ch 1, [sc in each of next 2, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Row 15: Now working in rows, ch 1, sc in first sc and in next 7 sc, turn.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing in place.
LARGE PONY 
Body
With A, ch 2. 
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, join.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Rounds 5–18: Ch 1, sc in each st around, join.
Round 19: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] around, join.
Round 20: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, sc2tog] around, join.
Round 21: Ch 1, [sc2tog] around, join. Fasten off, and sew closed.
Neck
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, join.
Rounds 3–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join.
Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Rounds 7–12: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing in place.
FINISHING
Body Assembly
Referring to photo for placement, using long tails, sew Neck to Body, Mouth to Neck, Ears to Head and Legs to Body.  
Neck Fringe
With B, cut (34) 6-inch (15 ¼ cm) pieces of yarn for neck fringe. Attach two rows of single layer fringe, placing them side by side starting at bottom of back of neck, then attaching fringe upwards to ears. Fold strand in half. Insert hook through stitch, and draw folded end of strands through to form loop. Thread ends of strand through loop, and pull ends to tighten. Trim fringe lightly, if needed.
Tail fringe
With B, cut (12) 11-inch (28 cm) pieces of yarn for tail fringe. Attach one fringe using all 12 pieces of yarn. Fold strands in half. Insert hook through stitch, and draw folded end of strands through to form loop. Thread ends of strands through loop, and pull ends to tighten. Trim fringe lightly, if needed.
Eyes
With D, embroider eyes, using photo as placement. 
SMALL PONY
Body
With C, ch 2. 
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, join.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Rounds 4–15: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join.
Round 16: Ch 1 [sc in each of next 2 sc, sc2tog] around, join.
Round 17: Ch 1, [sc2tog] around, join. Fasten off, and sew closed.
Neck
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, join.
Rounds 3–4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Rounds 6–8: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing in place.
Mouth
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join.
Round 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around, join.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing in place.
Ears (Make 2)
With C, ch 4
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next 2 chs, do not join. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing in place.
Legs (Make 4)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join.
Rounds 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, join. Fasten off.
Rounds 6–7: With C, ch 1, sc in each sc around, join. 
Round 8: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Round 9: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around, join.
Row 15: Now working in rows, ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in next 6 sc, turn.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog, turn.
Row 17: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing in place.
FINISHING
Referring to photo for placement, using long tails, sew Neck to Body, Mouth to Neck, Ears to Head and Legs to Body.
Neck fringe
With B, cut (20) 5-inch (12 ¾ cm) pieces of yarn for neck fringe. Attach two rows of single layer fringe, placing them side by side starting at bottom of back of neck, then attaching fringe upwards to ears. Fold strand in half. Insert hook through stitch, and draw folded end of strands through to form loop. Thread ends of strand through loop, and pull ends to tighten. Trim fringe lightly, if needed.
Tail fringe
With B, cut nine 7-inch (1.8 cm) pieces of yarn for tail fringe. Attach one fringe using all 9 pieces of yarn. Fold strands in half. Insert hook through stitch, and draw folded end of strands through to form loop. Thread ends of strands through loop, and pull ends to tighten. Trim fringe lightly, if needed.
Eyes
With D, embroider eyes, using photo as placement.

materials: Lily® Sugar'n Cream® (2.5 oz /70.9 oz; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Soft Violet (00093), Wine (00015), Mod Green (01223), Hot Pink (01740), Hot orange (01628) 1 ball or 65 m/72 yds
Contrast A White (00001) 1 ball or 30 m/35 yds
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dtr = (Yoh) 4 times. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 5 times - Double treble crochet made.
instructions:
Note: Shell is worked in a spiral. Do not join new color at end of each rnd, rather, leave loop of color just worked ‘live’ & pick it up again when instructed.
Front 
With MC, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (3 sc. 3 hdc. 3 dc) in ring. Drop MC. Join A with sl st in ring. 2 sc in ring. 11 sts (9 sts MC, 2 sts A).
2nd rnd: With A, working in front loops only, sl st in each of next 9 sts made with MC. Drop A. Pick up MC. Working in back loops only, 2 dc in each of first 2 sc made with A. 2 dc in each of next 9 sts made with MC. Drop MC.
3rd rnd: Pick up A. Working in front loops only, sl st in each of next 22 sts made with MC. Drop A. Pick up MC. Working in back loops only, 2 tr in each of next 22 sts made with MC. Drop MC.
4th rnd: Pick up A. Working in front loops only, sl st in each of next 44 sts made with MC. Drop A. Pick up MC. Working in back loops only, 2 dtr in each of next 10 sts made with MC. Fasten off MC.
5th rnd: Pick up A. Working in front loops only, sl st in each of next 22 sts made with MC. Fasten off A.
Back
With MC, ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (3 sc. 3 hdc. 3 dc) in ring. Drop MC. Join A with sl st in ring. 2 sc in ring. 11 sts (9 sts MC, 2 sts A).
2nd rnd: With A, working in back loops only and inserting hook from back to front, sl st in each of next 9 sts made with MC. Drop A. Pick up MC. Working in front loops only, 2 dc in each of first 2 sc made with A. 2 dc in each of next 9 sts made with MC. Drop MC.
3rd rnd: Pick up A. Working in front loops only, sl st in each of next 22 sts made with MC. Drop A. Pick up MC. Working in back loops only, 2 tr in each of next 22 sts made with MC. Drop MC.
4th rnd: Pick up A. Working in front loops only, sl st in each of next 44 sts made with MC. Drop A. Pick up MC. Working in back loops only, 2 dtr in each of next 10 sts made with MC. Fasten off MC, leaving a long end.
5th rnd: Pick up A. Working in front loops only, sl st in each of next 22 sts made with MC. Fasten off A.
With rem length of MC sew Front and back tog leaving an opening to insert stuffing. Stuff lightly. Sew opening closed.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 13" [33 cm] wide x 18" [45.5 cm] tall.
instructions:
Note: All rnds are joined with a sl st to first st.
HEAD
With C, beg using magic loop method (demonstrated here).
**1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sc. **
7th to 10th rnds: As 4th rnd. Break C. Join A.
11th rnd: With A, as 4th rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
13th to 15th rnds: As 4th rnd.
Note: Add safety eyes in space between 13th and 14th rnds. Space eyes 8" [20.5 cm] apart as shown in photo. Start stuffing Head with polyfill at this stage.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
17th to 21st rnds: As 4th rnd.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 10 sts.
24th rnd: As 23rd rnd. 5 sts. Fasten off.
BODY
With A, beg using magic loop method.
Work from ** to ** as given for Head.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
9th to 13th rnds: As 7th rnd.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 50 sts.
15th to 18th rnds: As 7th rnd.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sts.
20th to 26th rnds: As 7th rnd.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
Note: Start stuffing Body with polyfill at this stage.
28th and 29th rnds: As 7th rnd.
30th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sts.
31st rnd: As 7th rnd.
32nd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 10 sts.
33rd rnd: As 32nd rnd. 5 sts. Fasten off.
Sew Head to Body, angling Head slightly down as shown in photo.
ARMS AND LEGS (make 4)
With D, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 12 sc in ring. Join. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
3rd to 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Break D. Join A.
9th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sts.
11th rnd: As 9th rnd.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join. 12 sts.
13th to 22nd rnds: As 9th rnd.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff with polyfill.
Stitch Arms to neck as shown in photo, spaced approx 5 sts apart.
Stitch Legs to bottom of Body as shown in photo, approx 7 rnds from base and spaced approx 15 sts apart.
 OUTER EARS
Note: Make one Outer Ear in A and one in B.
Beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.
INNER EARS (make 2)
With C, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off.
Line up edges of Inner and Outer Ears. Sew Inner Ear to Outer Ear. Stitch to Head as shown in Photo.
SPOTS (make 3)
With B, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc arund. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 hdc in each of next 2 sc. 2 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 2 dc in next sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 2 dc in next sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in last st Join. 30 sts.
Fasten off.
Stitch Spots to Body, placed as shown in photo. With B, embroider nostrils on snout with straight stitches as shown in photo.
HORNS (make 2)
With D, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sc.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Fasten off.
Stitch Horns to top of Head as shown in photo.
TAIL
Cut 6 strands of A and 3 strands of B, approx 15" [38 cm] long.
With all 9 strands held tog, wrap around st at center back of Body. Fold in half and divide into 3 groups of 6 strands. Braid tog as shown in diagram. Tie a knot and trim ends evenly.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes Baby™: 1 ball 936 Rocking Horse
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6] and 5mm [US H-8]
Three ½” (12mm) buttons, sewing thread, sewing needle, yarn needle, stitch markers
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Nightgown fits: 18” (45.5 cm) tall doll. Nightgown from shoulder to bottom edge measures: 12.5” (32 cm). Bed Sock foot length measures: 3” (7.5 cm). Headband measures: 21.5” (54.5 cm) long.
gauge: 17 sc and 20 rows sc = 4” (10 cm) with smaller hook; first 8 rows of Yoke in pattern = 2.5” (6.5 cm) long with smaller hook; 4 shells of (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) and 8 rows of shells = 4” (10 cm) with smaller hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NIGHTGOWN
Yoke
With smaller hook, ch 41.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn—40 sc.
Row 2 (Wrong Side): Ch 2 (counts as beginning hdc now and throughout), hdc in front loop only of each sc across; turn—40 hdc.
Row 3: Ch 2, 2 hdc in back loop only of next hdc, *hdc in back loop only of next hdc, 2 hdc in back loop only of next hdc; repeat from * across, working last 2 hdc in top of beginning ch-2; turn—60 hdc.
Row 4: Ch 2, hdc in front loop only of each hdc across, working last 2 hdc in top of beginning ch-2; turn.
Rows 5-6: Repeat Rows 3-4—90 hdc.
Row 7: Ch 2, hdc in back loop only of next hdc, 2 hdc in back loop only of next hdc, *hdc in back loop only of each of next 2 hdc, 2 hdc in back loop only of next hdc; repeat from * across, working last 2 hdc in top of beginning ch-2; turn—120 hdc.
Row 8: Repeat Row 4.
Body
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1 (does not count as a st), 18 sc in back loops only, ch 4, skip 26 hdc for Sleeve, 32 sc in back loops only, ch 4, skip 26 hdc for next Sleeve, 18 sc in back loops only, working last sc in top of ch-2; join with slip st in beginning sc—76 sts.
Round 2: Change to larger hook; (ch 3, 1 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in first sc, skip 3 sc, *(2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next sc, skip 3 sts; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3, being careful not to twist—19 shells.
Rounds 3-16: Slip st in next st and ch-1 space, (ch 3, 1 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in same space, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in ch-1 space of each shell around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—19 shells.
Round 17: Slip st in next st and ch-1 space, (ch 3, 2 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in same space, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in ch-1 space of each shell around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—19 large shells.
Rounds 18-19: Slip st in next 2 sts and ch-1 space, (ch 3, 2 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in same space, (3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc) in ch-1 space of each shell around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—19 large shells. At end of Round 19, fasten off and weave in ends.
Sleeves
Sleeves (Make 2)
Round 1 (Right Side): With smaller hook, attach yarn with slip st in chain space at center of underarm, (ch 3, 1 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in same space; continue working over 26 skipped hdc as follows: (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in first skipped hdc, [skip 3 hdc, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in next hdc] 6 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—8 shells.
Rounds 2-3: Slip st in next st and ch-1 space, (ch 3, 1 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in same space, (2 dc, ch 1, 2 dc) in ch-1 space of each shell around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—8 shells. At end of Round 3, fasten off and weave in ends.
Work second Sleeve in same manner.
Back Yoke Edging
Note: Work 12 sc evenly across each edge by working 3 sc in each pair of hdc row ends. Do not leave extra spaces between stitches and ch-3 loops.
With Right Side of the back of the Yoke facing, use smaller hook to attach yarn with slip st in row end of hdc at top right corner; ch 1, 12 sc across right edge. Rotate Yoke to work across left edge; work 12 sc and 3 ch-3 loops evenly across left edge as follows: 2 sc, ch 3, 4 sc, ch 3, 4 sc, ch 3, 2 sc, ending at top left corner. Fasten off and weave in ends. Sew Buttons on Edging under loops.
Gown Flower Tie
With smaller hook, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring; *[slip st, ch 2, 1 dc, ch 2] 5 times in ring; join with slip st in beginning slip st**; work a 30” (76 cm) long chain, join with slip st in 4th ch from hook to form a ring; repeat from * to **. Fasten off and weave in ends. Weave Tie through first round of shell pattern on Body.
BED SOCKS
BED SOCKS (Make 2)
Note: Toe and Sock Top are worked in continuous rounds without joining or turning. Place a stitch marker in the last st of each round and move up as rounds are completed.
Toe
With smaller hook, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1 (does not count as a st now and throughout), 10 sc in ring; do not join, place marker—10 sc.
Round 2: *[2 sc in back loop only of next sc, 1 sc in back loop only of next sc] twice**, 2 sc in back loop only of next 2 sc; repeat from * to **; move marker—16 sc.
Rounds 3-7: Work sc in back loop only of each sc around, moving marker at end of each Round—16 sc.
Heel
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in back loop only of each of next 10 sc; turn—10 sc.
Rows 2-3: Ch 1, sc in each sc; turn—10 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, 3 sc, sc2tog twice, 3 sc; turn—8 sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, 8 sc; turn—8 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, 2 sc, sc2tog twice, 2 sc; turn—6 sts.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc, sc2tog twice, sc; turn—4 sts.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc2tog twice; turn—2 sts.
Sock Top
Round 1: Ch 1, 2 sc, work 7 sc evenly across sc row ends of Heel side, at front work sc in back loop only of each of next 6 sc, work 7 sc evenly across sc row ends of other Heel side; do not join, place marker—22 sc.
Rounds 2-9: Sc in back loop only of each sc around, moving marker at end of each sc around. At end of Round 9, fasten off and weave in ends.
HEADBAND
HEADBAND
Work same as Gown Flower Tie, making the chain 18” (45.5 cm) long instead of 30” (76 cm) long.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. H/5 [8 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of worsted weight yarn in charcoal for Nose and Mouth.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 9" [23 cm] tall x 5" [12.5 cm] wide, including Legs.
instructions:
Notes:  
• All rnds are joined with sl st to first sc. 
• Where instructions indicate to leave a long tail when fastening off, this tail is to be used in seaming. 

Snout
With A, beg using magic loop method demonstrated here. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
With charcoal yarn, stitch on Mouth as shown in photo. Loop yarn between 2 sts approx 10 times to make Nose. 

Body/Head
Note: Body and Head are worked in one piece from the bottom up. 
With B, beg using magic loop method. ( See diagram on page 3)
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
4th to 10th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
11th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
12th rnd: As 4th rnd.
13th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sts.
14th rnd: As 4th rnd. 
15th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 12 sts.
16th rnd: As 4th rnd. 
17th rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 24 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
19th to 26th rnds: As 4th rnd.
27th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sts.
28th rnd: As 4th rnd.
29th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sts.
Before proceeding to complete Head, stitch Snout to Face between 20th and 24th rnds. Add safety eyes between 24th and 25th rnds, approx 6 sts apart and centered over Snout. Beg stuffing with polyfill. Cont stuffing with polyfill while working rest of Head.
30th rnd: As 4th rnd.
31st rnd: As 13th rnd. 18 sts.
32nd rnd: As 15th rnd. 12 sts.
33rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 

Ears  (make 2) ( See diagram on page 3)
With B, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc. 
3rd and 4th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts.
Do not stuff. Stitch Ears to Head as shown in photo, approx 4 rnds down from top. 

Feet (make 2) ( See diagram on page 3)
With B, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 20 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
6th rnd: As 3rd rnd.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Stuff Feet with polyfill.  Attach Feet to each side at bottom of Body. 
Note that Feet should stick out sideways to give Bear support to sit up.

Arms (make 2) ( See diagram on page 3)
With B, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sc.
3rd to 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
8th to 9th rnds: As 3rd rnd.

Tail ( See diagram shown right)
With B, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 10 sc in ring. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 10 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 5 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
Stuff with polyfill and stitch to center back of Body.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 0334 Buff A, 0706 Perfect Pink B, 0512 Turqua C, 0321 Gold D, 0312 Black E, 0311 White F, 0310 Cherry Red G
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Each gnome measures 7” (18 cm) tall, seated.
gauge:
CROCHET GAUGE: 14 sts = 4” (10 cm); 15 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
KNIT GAUGE: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 24 rows = 4” (10 cm) in Stockinette st (knit on Right Side, purl on Wrong Side). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
GNOELLA
Head
Beginning at top of head, with A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds—6 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Rounds 5–7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: Sc in next 5 sc, 3-hdc popcorn (for ear), sc in next 5 sc, 3-hdc popcorn (for nose), sc in next 5 sc, 3-hdc popcorn (for ear), sc in last 6 sc. 
Round 9 and 10: Sc in each sc around.
Round 11: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 12: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc. Do not fasten off.
Embroider Face: With E, embroider 2 French Knots on either side of nose. Cut a length of E and separate the plies. Using a single ply of E, embroider 3 eyelashes at the corner of each eye. With G, embroider a straight st mouth below the nose.
Round 13: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 3 times—9 sc.
Stuff head.
Body
Round 14: Work 2 sc in each sc around—18 sc.
Round 15: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Rounds 16–21: Sc in each sc around.
Special Crochet Stitches
3-hdc popcorn = 3 hdc in indicated stitch, remove hook from loop, insert hook from front to back in first hdc of 3-hdc group, place dropped loop back on hook and draw through.
sc2tog = [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Special Knit Stitches
Inc 1 to 5 = Work 5 stitches into one stitch – Knit into front of next st without removing from needle, then knit into back, front, back, and front again of same st.
M1 = Make 1 (Increase) – Lift strand between needles to left-hand needle and knit strand through the back loop, twisting it to prevent a hole.
Special Crochet Technique
Adjustable Ring = Holding the yarn a few inches from the end, wrap around your finger. Do not remove wrap from finger, insert hook into the wrap and draw up a loop of working yarn. Chain one to secure the loop, and remove ring from finger. Work stitches of first round in the ring. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Notes
1. Colors A, B, D, E, F, and G are needed for Gnoella. A, C, D, E, and G are needed for Gnoah. 
2. Gnoella is crocheted, and Gnoah is knit. Only small amounts of each color are needed. Many gnomes can be made from 1 skein of each color.
3. Head and body are made in one piece. Then arms and legs are worked separately and sewn to body. Bonnet, cap, diaper, and hair are worked separately and attached to finished gnome.
4. Stuff pieces lightly. Do not over stuff.
Round 22: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Stuff body.
Round 23: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Round 24: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through remaining stitches and pull to gather. Securely weave in end.
Legs (make 2)
Beginning at foot, with A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 8 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds—8 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: [Sc2tog, sc in next sc] 2 times, sc2tog—5 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times, sc in last sc—7 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around, TURN.
Note: Work now proceeds back and forth in rows, leaving one stitch unworked at the end of each row. This creates a bend in the leg.
Row 7 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc, turn; leave last sc unworked—6 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, turn; leave last sc unworked—5 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, turn; leave last sc unworked—4 sc.
Notes: Work now resumes in the round. Work into every stitch as instructed, including the stitches that were left unworked when working the leg bend. To help the leg bend and reduce gaps between stitches, a sc2tog is worked when each of the unworked stitches is worked into. Each sc2tog is worked by drawing up a loop in the edge of a row and in the unworked stitch.
Round 10 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc; do not turn, working down side edge, [insert hook in edge of row and draw up a loop, insert hook in next unworked st in row below and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook] 2 times, working up opposite side edge, insert hook in edge of row and draw up a loop, insert hook in next unworked st in row above and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook—7 sts.
Round 11: Insert hook in edge of Round 10 and draw up a loop, insert hook in first st of Round 10 and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook, sc in next 6 sc.
Slip st in next st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing leg to body.
Arms (make 2)
Beginning at hand, work same as leg through Round 5—7 sc.
Rounds 6–9: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing arm to body.
Diaper
With B, ch 21.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—20 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, skip first sc, slip st in next sc, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 4 sc, sc2tog, turn; leave last 2 sts unworked—14 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—12 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 2 times, sc2tog, sc in last sc, turn—9 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog, turn—7 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog, turn—5 sc.
Rows 9–14: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Round 15 (Right Side): Ch 1, slip st in each st across, do not turn, slip st evenly around entire outside edge; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
Bonnet
Beginning at top of bonnet, with B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 4 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds—4 sc. Place marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as work progresses.
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times—6 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 2 times—8 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—12 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—16 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—20 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—24 sc.
Rounds 8 and 9: Sc in each sc around; TURN at the end of Round 9.
Back of Bonnet
Row 10 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 12 sc, sc2tog, turn—14 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 10 sc, sc2tog, turn—12 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 8 sc, sc2tog, turn—10 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog, turn—8 sc.
Row 14: Sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off.
Lace Trim (Right Side): With Right Side facing and leaving a long tail (for bonnet tie), join F with slip st in end of Row 14 to work across front edge of bonnet; *ch 3, sc in front edge; repeat from * working evenly spaced across front edge; slip st in opposite end of Row 14. Fasten off, leaving a long tail (for bonnet tie).
Front Curl
With D, ch 5.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, [ch 2, slip st in next ch] 2 times, slip st in last ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing curl to head.
Finishing (Gnoella)
Using photograph as a guide, stuff arms and legs and sew to body. Legs can be sewn to body in a sitting or standing position, as desired.
Fold diaper, bringing Row 14 up to Row 1 and folding edges of Row 1 over ends of Row 14. With F, sew a cross stitch at each end of Row 1 to hold top of sides of diaper together. Place diaper on gnome.
Place bonnet on gnome’s head. With bonnet in place, determine location for front curl. Remove bonnet and sew front curl to head. Replace bonnet and tie a bow at chin. If desired, bonnet can be sewn to head with a few stitches. Weave in all ends.

GNOAH
Head and Body
Beginning at top of head, with A, cast on 8 sts.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Purl.
Row 2: K1, [M1, k1] 7 times—15 sts.
Row 3: Purl.
Row 4: K1, [M1, k2] 7 times—22 sts.
Row 5: Purl.
Row 6: K2, [M1, k3] 6 times, M1, k2—29 sts.
Rows 7–11: Work in St st (knit on Right Side, purl on Wrong Side) for 5 rows.
Row 12: K7, increase 1 to 5 (for ear), k6, increase 1 to 5 (for nose), k6, increase 1 to 5 (for ear), k7—41 sts.
Row 13: P7, p5tog, p6, p5tog, p6, p5tog, p7—29 sts.
Row 14: Knit.
Row 15: Purl.
Row 16: [K2, k2tog] 7 times, k1—22 sts.
Row 17: Purl.
Row 18: [K1, k2tog] 7 times, k1—15 sts.
Row 19: Purl.
Row 20: [K1, k2tog] 5 times—10 sts.
Embroider Face: With E, embroider 2 French Knots on either side of nose. With G, embroider a straight st mouth below the nose.
Body
Row 21: Purl.
Row 22: [K1, M1] 9 times, k1—19 sts.
Row 23: Purl.
Row 24: [K2, M1] 9 times, k1—28 sts.
Row 25: Purl.
Row 26: K14, M1, k14—29 sts.
Rows 27–37: Work in St st for 11 rows.
Row 38: [K2, k2tog] 7 times, k1—22 sts.
Row 39: Purl.
Row 40: [K1, k2tog] 7 times, k1—15 sts.
Row 41: Purl.
Row 42: [K2tog] 7 times, k1—8 sts.
Cut yarn, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through sts of last row and pull to gather. Use remaining tail to sew back seam. Stuff head and body before completing seam.
Arms (make 2)
Beginning at hand, leaving a long beginning tail, with A, cast on 5 sts.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Purl.
Row 2: [K1, M1] 4 times, k1—9 sts.
Rows 3–5: Work in St st for 3 rows.
Row 6: [K1, k2tog] 3 times—6 sts.
Row 7: Purl.
Row 8: [K2, M1] 2 times, k2—8 sts.
Row 9: Purl.
Row 10: K3, M1, k2, M1, k3—10 sts.
Rows 11–16: Work in St st for 6 rows.
Bind off. Cut yarn leaving a long tail. Weave beginning tail through cast-on sts and pull to gather. Securely weave in beginning tail. Use ending tail to sew side seam.
Legs (make 2)
Beginning at foot, work same as arm through Row 10—10 sts.
Row 11: Purl.
Note: Work now proceeds in short rows, leaving one stitch unworked at the end of each row. This creates a bend in the leg.
Row 12: K9, turn; leave last st unworked.
Row 13: P8, turn.
Row 14: K7, turn.
Row 15: P6, turn.
Row 16: Knit to end of row—10 sts.
Rows 17–20: Work in St st for 4 rows.
Bind off. Cut yarn leaving a long tail. Weave beginning tail through cast-on sts and pull to gather. Securely weave in beginning tail. Use ending tail to sew side seam.
Diaper
With C, cast on 24.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Purl.
Row 2: Knit.
Row 3: Purl.
Row 4: Bind off 2 sts, k2tog, knit to end of row—21 sts.
Row 5: Bind off 2 sts, p2tog, purl to end of row—18 sts.
Row 6: [K2tog] 2 times, knit to last 4 sts, [k2tog] 2 times—14 sts.
Row 7: Purl.
Row 8: K2tog, k4, k2tog, k4, k2tog—11 sts.
Row 9: Purl.
Row 10: K2tog, knit to last 2 sts, k2tog—9 sts.
Row 11: Purl.
Row 12: K2tog, knit to last 2 sts, k2tog—7 sts.
Rows 13–21: Work in St st for 9 rows.
Row 22: K1, M1, knit to last st, M1, k1—9 sts.
Row 23: Purl.
Row 24: Knit.
Bind off.
Cap
Beginning at tip of cap, leaving a long beginning tail, with A, cast on 4 sts.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Purl.
Row 2: [K1, M1] 3 times, k1—7 sts.
Row 3: Purl.
Row 4: [K2, M1] 3 times, k1—10 sts.
Row 5: Purl.
Row 6: [K3, M1] 3 times, k1—13 sts.
Row 7: Purl.
Row 8: [K2, M1] 6 times, k1—19 sts.
Row 9: Purl.
Row 10: [K3, M1] 6 times, k1—25 sts.
Row 11: Purl.
Row 12: [K4, M1] 6 times, k1—31 sts.
Rows 13–18: Work in St st for 6 rows.
Bind off.
Front Curl
With E, cast on 10 sts. Work no rows, bind off immediately. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave the tail through the bound-off edge and pull to form a curve. Secure end, but do not trim tail. Use tail later to sew curl to head.
Bind off.
Belt
With E, cast on 40 sts. Work no rows, bind off immediately.
Finishing (Gnoah)
Using photograph as a guide, stuff arms and legs and sew to body. Legs can be sewn to body in a sitting or standing position, as desired.
Fold diaper, bringing bind-off edge up to cast-on edge and folding edges of cast-on edge over ends of bind-off edge. With C, sew a cross stitch at each end of cast-on edge to hold top of sides of diaper together. Place diaper on gnome. Wrap belt around top of diaper, allowing ends to overlap at front. With E, sew belt to diaper. With D, embroider straight st belt buckle on belt.
Place cap on gnome’s head. With cap in place, determine location for front curl. Remove cap and sew front curl to head. Replace cap and sew to head. Weave in all ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® O’Go™ (5 oz /141 g; 236 yds/215 m)
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Black embroidery floss for eyes and mouth.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
instructions:
Notes:
• To begin working with the O’Go format, carefully cut plastic tie where the ends of the O’Go meet.
• Pull tie to remove.
• For this pattern, colors can be easily separated by gently pulling apart and cutting at the color transition. Each color is ready to use. Follow color guide shown in Materials section for each O’Go (Contrast A, B, C, D and E). You may find it helpful to place each color section in its own resealable (zip lock) bag and label each bag A, B, C, D and E
HEAD
Note: Head of Octopus is worked with MC only in continuous rnds. Do not join at end of rnds. PM to indicate beg of rnds and move marker as each rnd is worked.
With MC, ch 2.
**1st rnd:  7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 7 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 14 sc.
3rd rnd:  *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 21 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 28 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 35 sc.
6th and 7th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
8th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 42 sc.
9th and 10th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 49 sc.
12th and 13th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
14th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 56 sc.
15th to 18th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
19th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 49 sts.
20th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
21st rnd: *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 42 sts.
22nd rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
23rd rnd: *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 35 sts.
24th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
25th rnd: 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Rep from * around. 32 sts.
26th rnd:  Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around.
27th rnd:  Working in both loops, *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from around. 24 sts.
Stuff Head.
28th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from around. 16 sts.
29th rnd:  *Sc2tog. Rep from around. 8 sts. Cut yarn, leaving a long end. Fasten off. Thread end of yarn through rem 8 sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
TENTACLES
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
Divide for 8 tentacles:
Make 2 Tentacles each with A, B, C. 
Make 1 each with D and E.
Join A with sl st to any rem front loop of 27th rnd of Head.
1st Tentacle: Ch 38. 4 dc in 4th ch from hook. *5 dc in next ch. Rep from * to end of chain.
2nd to 8th Tentacles:  Skip next 3 sc of 27th rnd of Head. Alternating colors B, C, D, E, A, B, C for 2nd to 8th Tentacles, sl st in next sc to begin next Tentacle. Work as 1st Tentacle. Fasten off at end of 8th Tentacle.
Note:  If you run out of corresponding color before Tentacle is complete, cont with MC to end of row.
With black embroidery floss, embroider mouth using back stitch. Embroider eyes, using French knot.

pattern_name: LILY FUN IN THE SUN DOLL WITH DRESS
materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream Solids (70 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds) Main Color (MC) (01004 Soft Ecru) 1 ball
Lily Sugar’n Cream Ombres (56.7 g/2 oz; 86 m/95 yds) Contrast B (51445 Lava Lamp) 1 ball
Doll: Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of red and black embroidery floss.
Dress: Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
gauge: Doll: 16 sc and 20 rows = 4 ins [10 cm]. Dress: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
DOLL
Head: **With MC and smaller hook, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd 10 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts. 
Stuff Head.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Stuff rem of Head. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts. Fasten off. 
Body: 
With MC and smaller hook, ch 30. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 2 ins [5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts,
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4 ins [10 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Sew bottom edge of Body closed. 
Stuff Body. 
Arms (make 2).
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
