2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in each of last 5 sc.
Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog over next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4 ins [10 cm]. Fasten off.
Stuff arms lightly.
Legs (make 2).
Shoe: With A and smaller hook, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch.
Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc.
Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc.
Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc.
(Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join MC with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd. 21 sts.
6th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc.
(Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc.
Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc.
(Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd until Leg from top of Shoe measures 5 ins [12.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Shoe strap: Join A with sl st to 6th sc of marked rnd. Ch 5. Join with sl st to 13th sc of marked rnd. Fasten off.
Stuff Legs.

Flower (make 2): With B and smaller hook, ch 6. 
1st row: Sl st in 6th ch from hook. *Ch 6. Sl st in same sp as last sl st. Rep from * 3 times more. Fasten off. 

FINISHING
Sew top of Legs closed. Sew to bottom of Body. Attach Arms to sides of Body. With MC, make Belly Button using French Knot.
Hair fringe
Cut a piece of tape 11 ins [28 cm] long and secure onto a flat surface with sticky side up. Cut lengths of A 14 ins [35.5 cm] long and lay them across tape so strip of tape is in center of yarn.  Holding tissue paper over top of yarn and using sewing machine, run a line of stitching along length of tape. Remove tape when hair is secure. Remove tissue paper after stitching
Pin fringe to outside of head. Using backstitch and A, sew hair into place along sewn line.
Fold hair up and secure at top of Head tightly. Attach Flower to ponytail as shown in picture. 
With red embroidery floss, embroider mouth. With black embroidery floss, embroider eyelashes using straight stitch. Attach beads to Head for eyes. Sew Head to body.

DRESS
Note: Dress is worked from top down.
With B and larger hook, ch 24. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd 5 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *2 dc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 48 dc. 
Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first dc.
Next rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *2 dc in next dc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc. 96 dc. 
Next 2 rnds: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first dc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, sl st in back loop of same sp as last sl st. *Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook– picot made. Ch 1. Miss next 2 sts. Sl st in next st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.
Straps:(make 2). With B and larger hook, ch 7. Fasten off.
Try dress on. Attach each strap at top edge.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 2 balls 5142 Cherry Red A
RED HEART Boutique® Sassy Fabric™: 1 hank 9947 Red Leopard B
abbreviations: A, B = Color A, Color B
( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Dress fits 18” (45.5 cm) tall doll. Dress from Neck to bottom edge measures 15” (38 cm). Skirt circumference measures 30” (76 cm).
gauge: 17 hdc = 4” (10 cm); Rows GAUGE. Use any size to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DRESS
Yoke
With A, ch 34.
Row 1 (Right Side): Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, [2 hdc in next ch, hdc in next 2 ch] 10 times, 2 hdc in last ch; turn—44 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each hdc across; turn—44 sc.
Row 3: Ch 2, dc in next 3 sc, 2 dc in next sc, [dc in next 4 sc, 2 dc in next sc] 7 times, dc in last 4 sc; turn—52 dc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, working last sc in top of ch-2; turn—52 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, [hdc in next 7 sc, 2 hdc in next sc] 6 times, hdc in last 4 sc; turn—58 hdc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each hdc across; turn—58 sc.
Shape Armholes
Row 7: Ch 2, dc in next 8 sc, ch 7, skip next 11 sc, dc in next 18 sc, ch 7, skip next 11 sc, dc in last 9 sc; turn—36 dc, 2 ch-7 spaces.
Bodice
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in each dc and ch across, working last sc in top of ch-2; turn—50 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, hdc in each sc across; turn—50 hdc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in each hdc across; turn—50 sc.
Row 11: Ch 2, dc in next sc and each sc across; turn—50 dc.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, working last sc in top of ch-2; turn—50 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, [hdc in next 5 sc, 2 hdc in next sc] 8 times, hdc in last 2 sc; turn—58 hdc.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in each hdc across; turn—58 sc.
Row 15 (Right Side): Ch 2, dc in same first sc, [dc in next 5 sc, 2 dc in next sc] 9 times, d...last round; join with slip st in top of ch-2; turn—99 dc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in each hdc around; join with slip st in first sc; turn—99 sc.
Round 8: Ch 2, dc in each sc around; join with slip st in top of ch-2; turn—99 dc.
Rounds 9-15: Repeat Rounds 5-8 consecutively; repeat Rounds 5-7 consecutively.
Round 16: Ch 2, dc in next 9 sc, 2 dc in next sc [dc in next 10 sc, 2 dc in next sc] 8 times; join with slip st in top of ch-2; turn—108 dc.
Round 17: Ch 1, sc in each dc around; join with slip st in first sc; turn—108 sc.
Round 18: Ch 1, hdc in each sc around; join with slip st in first hdc; turn—108 hdc.
Round 19: Ch 1, sc in each hdc around; join with slip st in first sc; turn—108 sc.
Round 20: Ch 2, dc in each sc around; join with slip st in top of ch-2; turn—108 dc.
Round 21: Repeat Round 17.
Round 22: Ch 1, [hdc in next 8 sc, 2 hdc in next sc] around; join with slip st in first hdc; turn—120 hdc.
Round 23: Ch 1, sc in each hdc around; join with slip st in first sc; turn—120 sc.
Round 24: Ch 2, dc in each sc around; join with slip st in top of ch-2; turn—120 dc. Fasten off A.
Back Overlap
With Right Side facing, join A in top right corner of opening; ch 2, working down side of opening, dc evenly across this side only; fasten off.
RUFFLES
Note: Ruffles are worked into the spaces between the vertical posts of stitches with the Right Side of the Dress facing, holding the Yoke at the top, and with the Right Side of B facing.
Neck Ruffle
Leave a 3” (7.5 cm) tail on B; insert hook in next hole on B and between sts of top left corner of Row 1 of the Yoke; holding a new strand of A underneath, pull loop of A through both layers to top, [insert hook in next loop of B and through next space between sts of Row 1, pull loop of A through all layers] across; fasten off A. Cut B, leaving a 3” (7.5 cm) tail.
Skirt Ruffles (Make 4)
With stitch markers, mark Round 22, Round 18, Round 14, and Round 10 of the Skirt.
Leave a 3” (7.5 cm) tail on B, insert hook in next hole on B and between sts of Round 22; holding a new strand of A underneath, pull loop of A through both layers to top, [insert hook in next loop of B, skip 2 sts of Round 22, insert hook through next space between sts of Round 22, pull loop of A loosely through all layers] across; fasten off A. Cut B, leaving a 3” (7.5 cm) tail.
Repeat on marked rounds, working from the bottom up.
FINISHING 
Roll under each end of B and tack down with needle and thread. Weave in all ends of A. Evenly space 3 buttons under Overlap on left side of opening, using spaces between stitches of Overlap as buttonholes; sew buttons in place. Block, stretching skirt lengthwise.

materials: Yarn needle, stitch marker, Polyester fiberfill, two 6mm black buttons for eyes/or safety eyes, sewing needle and thread.
abbreviations: [] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 18 sts = 4” (10 cm); 22 rounds = 4” (10 cm) in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Body
Work 6 sc in adjustable ring. Do not join but work in continuous rounds. Place marker in first st of round and move it up as your work progresses.
Round 1: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 2: [Inc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 4: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 5: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Rounds 6-15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Dec] 18 times – 18 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 18: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff firmly.
Head and Trunk
Work 6 sc in Adjustable ring.
Rounds 1-10: Work same as for body – 36 sc.
Round 11: [Sc in next 4 sc, dec] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 12: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 13: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 14: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc. Add stuffing.
Round 15: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 3 times – 9 sc. Start stuffing as you go.
Rounds 16-29: Sc in each sc around.
Round 30: [Sc in next sc, dec] 3 times – 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through remaining sc and pull tight.
Feet (Make 4)
Work 6 sc in Adjustable ring. Work in continuous rounds as before.
Round 1: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Rounds 2-7: Sc in each sc around. Add stuffing firmly.
Round 8: [Dec] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Weave tail through remaining sc and pull tight.
Ears (Make 2)
Row 1: Leaving a long tail before beginning, ch 5; 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook, hdc in next 2 ch; turn.
Row 2: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 3 hdc; turn.
Row 3: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 4 hdc; turn.
Row 4: Ch 2, 2 hdc in first hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc, sc in next hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc. Fasten off.
Finishing
Sew feet, ears and head to body as pictured. Sew eyes in place. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (70.9 g/2.5 oz; 109 m/120 yds)
Doll: Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of red embroidery floss for mouth
Small amount of black embroidery floss for eyelashes
Clothing: Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Approx 48" [122 cm] of red satin ribbon ¼" [6 mm] wide
gauge: Doll: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. Clothing: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
DoLL
head: With MC and smaller hook, ch 2.
**1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from 
*around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.**
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 10 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw 
through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 
Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Stuff Head.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 
Stuff rem of Head. Fasten off.
Body: With MC and smaller hook, ch 30. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from beg measures 4" [10 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep
from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd twice more. Fasten off.
Sew bottom edge of Body closed. Stuff Body.
Arms (make 2).
With MC and smaller hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc 
in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 8 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4" [10 cm]. Fasten off. 
Stuff Arms lightly.
Legs (make 2).
***With MC and smaller hook, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in 
last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in 
each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of 
next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of 
next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with 
sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join
with sl st to first sc.***
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each 
sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. Place marker at end of rnd. 
21 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each 
sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog over last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each 
sc to end of rnd. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until leg from marker at top of Shoe measures 
5" [12.5 cm]. Fasten off.
hair
With D and smaller hook, ch 2. 
Work from ** to ** as given for Head.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 30 sc. turn.
Next row: *Ch 25. 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 2 hdc in each ch to end 
chain. Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Fasten 
off.
tie ribbon into bows at each side of hair.
Shoes (make 2).
With A and larger hook, work from *** to *** as given for legs. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. [(Yoh and 
draw up a loop in next st. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 
twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – dc2tog made]
3 times. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 10 sc. Join with sl st to 
first sc. Fasten off.
thread ribbon through center back stitch at top edge of shoe. tie 
ribbon around ankle.
FINIShING
Stuff legs. Sew top of legs closed using whip st. Sew to bottom of 
Body. Attach Arms to sides of Body.
With red and black embroidery floss, embroider mouth and 
eyelashes using straight stitch. Attach beads to Head for Eyes. Sew 
Head to Body.
Dress
With A and larger hook, ch 24. Join with sl st to first ch taking care 
not to twist ch.
Bodice: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 24 sc.
2nd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to 
first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next 
sc. Sc2tog. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 
Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next sc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 3 dc in next 
dc. 1 hdc in next hdc. Sl st in next sc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 3 dc in next 
dc. 1 hdc in next hdc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Fasten off.
Skirt: With RS facing and working in rem loops of opposite side of 
foundation ch, join B with sl st to last st of 1st rnd of Bodice. 
First heart: 1st row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each of next 5 ch. 
turn.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in first dc. 1 dc in each dc 
to last dc. 2 dc in last dc. 12 dc at end of last row.
5th row: (Miss next 2 dc. 7 tr in next dc. Miss next 2 dc. Sl st in next 
dc) twice. 
Fasten off.
Second heart: Join C with sl st to next ch of foundation ch. Work as 
for First Heart.
third heart: Join B, with sl st to next ch of foundation ch. Work as 
for First Heart.
Fourth heart: Join C, with sl st to next ch of foundation ch. Work as 
for First Heart.
Sew sides of Hearts tog using a flat seam.
Straps (make 2).
With A and larger hook, ch 25. Fasten off.
Put Dress on Doll and mark position for Straps. Sew Straps to front 
of Dress and tie at back of neck.
heart
With smaller hook and A, ch 8. 
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next sc. Draw up a loop in 
each of next 3 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – Sc3tog 
made. 1 sc in next ch. 5 sc in last ch. Working in rem loops of 
foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each 
of next 2 ch. 4 sc in last ch. Join B with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 2 (counts as hdc). 1 hdc in first sc. Sc3tog. Yoh 
and draw up a loop in each of next 3 sts. Yoh and draw through all 
loops on hook – hdc3tog made. 2 hdc in next sc. 2 dc in each of next 
3 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (1 sc. Ch 1. 1 sc) in next 
sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 hdc in next sc. 2 dc in each of next 
3 sc. Join with sl st to to of ch 2. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein 319 Cherry A, 2 skeins 312 Black B.
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 8 sts = 2.5”, 14 rows = 4” CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
GAME
Strip 1 (make 4)
With A ch 9.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, and in each ch across; turn – 8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until there are 8 rows, change to B repeat row 2 with B until there are 8 rows, change to A, change colors every 8 rows until there are 8 blocks.
Strip 2 (make 4)
With B ch 9.
Row 1 (right side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook, and in each ch across; turn – 8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn.
Repeat Row 2 until there are 8 rows, change to A repeat row 2 with A until there are 8 rows, change to B, change colors every 8 rows until there are 8 blocks.
Sew strips together alternately, sc in each st and row end around working 3 sc in each corner.
BACK
With B, ch 65. Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across.
Row 2: ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Repeat row 2 until there are 32 rows.
Next Row: ch 1, sc in first 16 sts, ch 32, skip next 32 sts, sc in last 16 sts; turn.
Next Row: ch 1, sc in first 16 sts, sc in each of next 32 ch, sc in last 16 sts; turn.
Repeat row 2 for 30 more rows. Sc in each st and row end around working 3 sc in each corner for same number of sts as board.
FINISHING
Holding front and back pieces with wrong sides together, and working through all 4 loops, sc in each st around working 3 sc in each corner for two rnds.
CHECKERS (make 12 with A and 12 with B)
Ch 4, work 13 dc in 1st ch, join with a slip st to top of beginning ch-4, Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g ; 120 yds/109 m) Main Color (MC) Soft Ecru (01004) 1 ball
Lily Sugar’n Cream Denims (2.5 oz/70.9 g ; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast D Indigo (01114) 1 ball
Size U.S. E or 4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of red embroidery floss for mouth.
Small amount of black embroidery floss for shirt buttons.
Small amount of Contrast E (00084 Sage Green) for Flower stems.
instructions:
First Leg
Note: Stuff Legs as you work.
**Shoe: With A, ch 5.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first s c. 1 s c in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first s c. 1 s c in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. (Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Y oh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. 21 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. 17 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog) 3 times. 1 sc in each sc to end of rnd. Join MC with sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
8th rnd: With MC, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Stuff Shoe.
Pant Cuff: With D, ch 21. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Do not break D.
Attach Pant Cuff to Leg: 1st rnd: Align Pant Cuff over Leg, having Cuff on outside of Leg. With D, ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Leg from top of Shoe measures 6" [15 cm]. Fasten off. Stuff Leg.
Second Leg
Work as given for First Leg. Do not fasten off. Cont as follows for Body:
BODY
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc of Second Leg. 1 sc in 14 sc of First Leg. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc of Second Leg. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join B with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until Arm from beg measures 4½" [11.5 cm]. Fasten off. Stuff Arms lightly.
HAIR
With A, work from ** to ** as given for Head.
Work 3 rnds even.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 26 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 26 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 2 sts. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last row 4 times more. 16 sts at end of last row. Fasten off.
Sew Hair to Head. With A, embroider ‘bangs’.
BOW TIE
With C, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Turn. 1 st.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. Turn. 2 sc.
5th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.
Sew Bow Tie to front of Body as shown in picture.
FINISHING
Attach Arms to sides of Body. Sew beads to front of Head for eyes. With red embroidery floss, embroider mouth. With black embroidery floss, embroider shirt buttons using bullion st.
FLOWERS (make 3).
Stem: With E, ch 9. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch to end of ch. Fasten off.
Flower: With C, *Ch 6. Sl st in 6th ch from hook. Rep from * 4 times more. Fasten off. Attach Flower to Stem.
Tie Flowers into a bouquet and attach to hand as shown in picture.
ABBREVIATIONS: www.yarnspirations.com
Rep last rnd 4 times more, joining A at end of last rnd.
Belt: Next rnd: With A, ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each sc around. Join B with sl st to first hdc.
Shirt: Next rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 2 sc in first hdc. *1 sc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 sc in next hdc. Rep from * to last 6 hdc. 1 sc in each of last 6 hdc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 4 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sts.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. Fasten off.
HEAD
**With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.**
Rep last rnd 10 times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sts.
Stuff Head.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sts.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 8 sts. Fasten off.
ARMS (make 2).
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 tr in next sc (thumb). 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.

materials: Bernat® Maker™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 317 yds/290 m) Main Color (MC) Cream (06003) 1 ball or 93 yds/85 m
Bernat® Maker Minis™ Kit includes 10 balls (1.7 oz/50 g each; 17.65 oz/500 g total), (61 yds/56 m; 610 yds/560 m)
Contrast A Pink 1 ball or 11 yds/10 m
Contrast B Blue 1 ball or 8 yds/7 m
Contrast C Yellow 1 ball or 19 yds/17 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Notes: • Do not join at end of rnds. • Work in spiral in continuous rnds, unless otherwise stated. • Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd.
Body
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. PM on first st. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 20 sc.
5th to 13th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Stuff Body firmly. Cont stuffing while working rest of Body.
14th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
15th and 16th rnds: *1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sts at end of 16th rnd.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.

Legs (Make 4 alike).
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off C.
3rd rnd: Join MC with sl st to first sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. PM in first st. Do not join. Cont working in spiral in continuous rnds.
4th to 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Stuff Leg firmly.

Head
With MC, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. PM in first st. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th to 12th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
Attach safety eyes between 9th and 10th rnds, approx 11 sts apart.
Stuff Head firmly. Cont stuffing while working rest of Head.
13th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
14th and 15th rnds: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 8 sts at end of 15th rnd.
Fasten off, leaving long tail. Draw tail through rem sts and pull tight to close.

Neck
With MC, and leaving a long tail for sewing, ch 14. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.

Ears (Make 2 alike).
With MC, ch 7.
1st row: Working in ‘bumps’ on back of chains, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of last 2 ch.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.

Mane
Front Piece: With A, ch 6.
1st row: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc in each ch to end of chain. 15 sc.
Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Short Piece: With C, ch 10.
1st row: Work as given for Front Piece. 27 sc.
Medium Piece: With A, ch 12.
1st row: Work as given for Front Piece. 33 sc.
Long Piece: With B, ch 14.
1st row: Work as given for Front Piece. 39 sc.

Tail (Make 1 each in A, B, and C).
Ch 27.
1st row: Working in ‘bump’ at back of chains, sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain.
Fasten off.

Horn
With C, leaving long beg tail for sewing, ch 4. Sl st in first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 4 sc in ring. Do not join. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. PM on first st.
2nd and 3rd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sts.
5th rnd: Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sts.
Fasten off. Do not stuff Horn.

FINISHING
With long tails, assemble pieces as follows:
Fold Ears in half so tops of sts and ch face front. Stitch through base of ear to secure fold. Sew Ears to top of Head in 14th rnd, approx 3 sts apart.
Sew Horn to top of head, centered between and just in front of Ears.
Sew Neck to underside of Head, over 9th to 14th rnds.
Stuff Neck firmly. Sew Neck and Head to Body, beg at 4th rnd of Body, with Head facing forward.
Sew Legs to bottom of Body, with back Legs beg at 10th rnd of Body and front Legs beg at 6th rnd, with 1 rnd between front and back Legs. Note: Both front and back Legs should touch.
Sew Front Piece of Mane to top of Head, between Ears.
Sew rem Mane pieces to back of Head, with Short Piece at the top and Long Piece at bottom.
Hold all three Tail pieces tog and fold in half. With tail from Body, sew Tail pieces to rear of Body at fold.

materials: RED HEART® Baby Hugs™ Light: 1 ball 3258 Peachie
3” [8 cm] Natural Beeswax Maple Wooden Ring
abbreviations: hdc3tog: [Yarn over, insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up loop] 3 times, yarn over and draw through all loops on hook.
sc2tog: [Draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Lovey measures 10” [25.5 cm] from top of wooden ring to lower edge.
gauge: 15 sc = 4” [10 cm]; 18 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Ch 42, slip st in first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist sts. 
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as hdc here and throughout), hdc in each st around, slip st in top of ch-2 to join – 42 hdc. 
Round 2: Ch 1 (does not count as stitch here and throughout), *hdc3tog, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in first st – 14 hdc3tog.
Round 3: Ch 1, *sc in hdc3tog, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc – 14 sc.
Rounds 4-15: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc – 14 sc.
Round 16: Ch 1, sc2tog, ch 1, *sc in next sc, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc – 13 sc.
Round 17: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc – 13 sc.
Rounds 18-19: Repeat Rounds 16-17 – 12 sc.
Rounds 20-21: Repeat Rounds 16-17 – 11 sc.
Round 22: Repeat Round 16 – 10 sc. 
Round 23: Repeat Round 16 – 9 sc. 
Rounds 24-39: Ch 1, sc in each sc around, slip st in first sc.
Round 40: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, ch 1, *sc in next sc, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc – 10 sc.
Round 41: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc – 10 sc.
Rounds 42-43: Repeat Rounds 40-41 – 11 sc.
Rounds 44-45: Repeat Rounds 40-41 – 12 sc.
Rounds 46-47: Repeat Rounds 40-41 – 13 sc.
Rounds 48-49: Repeat Rounds 40-41 – 14 sc.
Rounds 50-62: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in first sc – 14 sc.
Round 63: Ch 2, 2 hdc in same st, *3 hdc in each sc around, slip st in top of ch-2 – 42 sts.
Round 64: Ch 2, hdc in each st around, slip st in top of ch-2 – 42 hdc.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.
Fold piece in half, lining up short ends, and insert folded end through center of wooden ring. Pull short ends through folded end and pull to tighten, securing piece around ring. 
Remove ring for washing.

materials: Bernat® Baby Velvet™ (10.5 oz/300 g; 492 yds/450 m)
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
instructions:
Front and Back  (make 2 alike)
With B, ch 21.
1st row:  (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 20 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row until piece measures 3½" [9 cm], ending on a WS row. Do not fasten off.
Next row:  (RS). Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around next sc. Dcbp around next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 hdc in last sc. Turn.
Next row:  Ch 2 (counts as hdc). *Dcfp around next st. Dcbp around next st. Rep from * to last hdc. 1 hdc in top of ch 2. Break B, join A.
Head: 1st row:  With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only , 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
2nd to 6th rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Shape Head: Next row:  Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 18 sts.
Rep last row, dec 2 sts every row to 8 sts. Fasten off.
Arms (make 2)
**With A, ch 2.
1st rnd:  8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.  16 sc.
3rd to 5th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.**
6th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Break A, join B with sl st to first st. 12 sts.
7th rnd:  With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 6 times more, stuffing very lightly (to maintain floppiness of limbs) as you work. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Legs  (make 2)
Work from ** to ** as given for Arms.
6th rnd:  Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first st. 12 sts.
7th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 7 times more, stuffing very lightly as you work. Fasten off at end of last rnd.
Ears (make 2)
With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first ch.
1st rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 14 sc.
5th to 13th rnds:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
14th rnd:  Ch 1. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) twice. 12 sts.
15th rnd:  Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving long end. Thread end through rem sts and draw up tightly. Fasten securely.
FINISHING
Mark position of Eyes on Front piece. Insert Safety Eyes following manufacturer’s instructions. With pink embroidery floss, embroider nose and mouth using satin stitch.  
Satin Stitch
With WS of Front and Back tog, sew edges tog, leaving opening for stuffing. Stuff Body. Sew rem edge closed.
Attach Arms and Legs.
Sew Ears to top of Head.

materials: Bernat® Maker Minis™ Kit includes: 10 balls (1.7 oz/50 g each; 17.6 oz/500 g total), (61 yds/ 56 m each; 610 yds/560 m total)
Contrast A Yellow 1 ball or 25 yds/23 m
Contrast B Brown 1 ball or 10 yds/9 m
Contrast C Green 1 ball or 23 yds/21 m
Small amount of red for Mouth embroidery.
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Three 5" [12.5 cm] lengths of green pipe cleaner (can be cut from 2 full-length pipe cleaners).
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] tall (With Leaves fully extended).
instructions: Note: Do not join at end of rnds. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. Move marker onto first st at beg of each rnd. POT With A, **ch 2. See diagram on page 3. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. Work in spiral in continuous rnds. 6 sc. 2nd rnd: 2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc. 3rd rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc. 4th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. 5th rnd: *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. 28 sc.** Make sides: Working through back loop and horizontal bar at back of each st, 1 hdc in each hdc around. 6th to 9th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. 10th rnd: *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Sl st in next st. 24 sts. Do not fasten off. Insert Safety Eyes according to manufacturer’s instructions. Eyes on sample are placed 4 rows down from top edge, 2 sts apart. With Red, embroider a mouth using straight st. STRAIGHT ST Dirt See Diagram on page 3. With B, work from ** to ** as for Pot. Sl st in next sc. Fasten off. FRONDS (Make 3). See Diagram on page 3. Leaf Ch 2, leaving a tail approx 4" [10 cm] long. 1st rnd: 7 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 3. 2 dc in first sc (counts as 3 dc). 2 dc in each of next 2 sc. (1 dc. 1 tr. Ch 2. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 tr. 1 dc) all in next sc. 2 dc in each of next 2 sc. 3 dc in last sc. Join with sl st to center of ring. Do not fasten off. Stem: Hold Pipe cleaner at WS of Leaf, approx ¾" [2 cm]. Working around Pipe cleaner, work 10 sc evenly spaced along length. Fasten off, leaving a tail approx 4" [10 cm]. Cut pipe cleaner leaving a tail approx 2" [5 cm]. Note: A contrast color of pipe cleaner is used for demonstration purposes. It is best to match the shade of yarn as best as possible. FINISHING Using tail, sew around end of pipe cleaner on WS of Leaf and fold end to secure. Sew Stems tog for 1" [2.5 cm] at bottom. Push bottom of stems through center of Dirt, twisting ends of pipe cleaner around each other to secure into place. Join dirt to Pot 1st rnd: With sts of Dirt and last rnd of Pot aligned, join with A by working sl st through back loop of Pot and front loop of Dirt, stuffing Pot before joining with sl st to first sl st. Fasten off.

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6. oz;288 m/315 yds) B White (9701) 1
Simply Soft (170 g/6. oz;288 m/315 yds) A Grape (9610) 1
Simply Soft Paints (113 g/4. oz;190 m/208 yds) MC Oceana (0006) 2
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project, however the tighter your stitches, the less stuffing will show through.
instructions:
Notes:  The body of the fish is worked in rounds.  At the end of each row, move a stitch marker.  The fins are worked in rows.  Stuff the fish as your work progresses.
Round 1:  Ch 2, 6sc in 2nd ch from hook (6)
Round 2:  2sc around  (12)
Round 3:  (Sc, 2sc) around  (18)
Round 4:  (2sc, sc in 2) around  (24)
Round 5-6:  Sc around
Round 7:  (sc in 5, 2sc) around  (28)
Round 8:  Sc around
Round 9:  (sc in 6, 2sc) around  (32)
Round 10:  Sc around
Round 11:  (Sc in 7, 2sc) around  (36)
Round 12:  Sc around
Round 13:  (sc in 8, 2sc) around  (40)
Round 14:  Sc around
Round 15:  (sc in 9, 2sc) around  (44)
Round 16:  Sc around
Round 17:  (sc in 10, 2sc) around (48)
Round 18-21:  Sc around
Round 22:  (Sc in 5, 2sc) around  (56)
Round 23-24:  Sc around
Round 25:  (sc in 6, 2sc) around  (64)
Round 26-27:  Sc around
Round 28:  (sc in 7, 2sc) around  (72)
Round 29-33:  Sc around
Round 34:  (sc in 8, 2sc) around  (80)
Round 35-50: Sc around
Round 51:  (sc in 8, sc2tog) around  (72)
Round 52:  Sc around
Round 53:  (sc in 7, sc2tog) around  (64)
Round 54:  Sc around
Round 55:  (sc in 6, sc2tog) around  (56)
Round 56:  Sc around
Round 57:  (sc in 5, sc2tog) around  (48)
Round 58:  Sc around
Round 59:  (sc in 4, sc2tog) around  (40)
Round 60:  Sc around
Round 61:  (sc in 3, sc2tog) around  (32)
Round 62:  Sc around
Round 63:  (sc in 2, sc2tog) around  (24)
Round 64-68: Sc around
Round 69:  (sc, sc2tog) around  (16)
Round 70:  Sc around
Round 71:  Fold in half, sc through both thicknesses.  Finish off MC  (8)
Row 72:  Working in blo, join A with a sc, sc in same, sc in next 6, 3sc in both loops, working in flo, sc in next 6, 2sc in last. Turn.
Row 73:  ch 1, 2sc, sc in 8, 3sc, sc in 8, 2sc, turn.  (23)
Row 74:  Ch 1, 2sc, sc in 10, 3sc, sc in 10, 2sc. Turn.  (27)
Row 75:  Ch 2 (counts as 1st dc) 2dc in same, dc in 12, 5dc, dc in 12, 3dc.  Turn  (33)
Row 76:  Ch 2 (counts as 1st dc) 2dc in same, dc in 16, 5dc, dc in 16, 3dc. Turn.  (43)
Row 77:  Ch 2 (counts as 1st dc) 2dc in same, dc in 19, 5dc, dc in 19, 3dc. Turn.  (49)
Row 78:  Ch 2 (counts as 1st dc) 2dc in same, (dc in 22, 3dc) 2 times.  Turn  (51)
Row 79:  (Skip I, 5dc, skip 1, slip in next) across. Finish off.
Side fins: Make 2:
Row 1:  With A, ch 7, sc in 2nd chain from hook and across. Turn (6)
Row 2-7:  Ch 2, dc in same, dc across, 2dc in last.  (18)
Row 8:  Ch 2, dc across, dc2tog last two stitches.  (17)
Row 9:  (Skip I, 5dc, skip 1, slip in next) across.  Finish off.
Top Fin: Make 1:
Row 1: With A, ch 30, sc in 2nd ch from hook and across. Turn.  (29)
Row 2:  ch 1, sc in 7, hdc in 15, sc in 7. Turn.
Row 3:  (skip 1, 5dc, skip 1, slip in next) across.  Finish off.
Eyes: Eyes are worked in rounds. At the end of each round, move a stitch marker.  Make 2.
Round 1-6:  With B, repeat rounds 1-6 of body. Finish off.
Center of eyes:  Make 2:
Round 1-3:   With C, repeat rounds 1-3 of body. Finish off. Sew to front of eyes.
Finishing:  Sew top fin to top of body,  Sew eyes to front of body, stuffing as you sew.  Sew fins to side of body.
Fish Lips
Round 1: Ch 6, join to form a ring. Ch 1, sc around (6)
Rounds 2-36: Sc around. At the end of round 36, join and finish off. Join the two ends together to form a circle and sew together. Sew to front of fish's head.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 313 Aran A, 886 Blue B, 672 Spring Green C, 324 Bright Yellow D, 334 Buff E, 718 Shocking Pink F, 254 Pumpkin G, and 512 Turqua H, and small amount of 312 Black I.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6]
Stuffing, red crayon (to color girl’s cheeks), yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc.
() = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 16 sts = 4” (10 cm); 16 rows = 4” (10 cm) in single crochet.
instructions:
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc. Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc. Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc. Round 6: Sc in each sc around. Round 7: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc. Rounds 8–14: Sc in each sc around. Round 15: [Sc2tog] 18 times—18 sts. Rounds 16 and 17: Sc in each sc around; change to C in last sc of Round 17.
Shirt
Round 18: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 9 times—27 sc.
Rounds 19–25: Sc in each sc around; change to D in last sc of Round 25.
Belt
Rounds 26 and 27: Sc in each sc around; change to B in last sc of Round 27.
Shorts
Rounds 28–31: Sc in each sc around. Round 32: [Sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] 3 times—24 sc. Stuff head and body. Flatten the last round, matching stitches of both halves. Row 33 (joining row): Working through both thicknesses, sc in each st across to close lower edge of body—12 sc.
LEG (make 2)
Shoe
Beginning at sole of shoe, with B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc. Round 3: Working in back loops only, 2 sc in next 3 sc (for toe), sc in last 9 sc—15 sc. Round 4: Sc in each sc around. Round 5: [Sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last 9 sc—12 sc. Rounds 6 and 7: Sc in each sc around; change to C in last sc of Round 7.
Leg
Rounds 8–12: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff leg. With tail, sew Round 12 flat with toe facing forward. Sew legs to bottom of body.
ARM (make 2)
Hand
Beginning at hand, with B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc. Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around; change to C in last sc of Round 4. Arm Rounds 5–14: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff arm. With tail, sew Round 14 flat. Sew arms to sides of body.
EMBLEM
Center
With D, ch 2. Row 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—3 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—4 sc. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in last sc, turn—6 sc. Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off. Edging: Join B with sc anywhere in outer edge of emblem, sc evenly spaced all the way around, working 2 sc in each corner. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Embroidery: With 2 strands of C held together, embroider a “B” in the center of the emblem. With tail, sew emblem to front of shirt.
HAIR
With B, ch 2.
Rounds 1–5: With B, work same as Rounds 1–5 of head—30 sc. Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc. Rounds 7 and 8: Sc in each sc around. Round 9: Sc in next 10 sc, hdc in next sc, (dc, ch 2, slip st) in next sc, sc in next 5 sc, slip st in next sc, ch 3, 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in next ch (curl made), sc in next 7 sc, (slip st, ch 2, dc) in next sc, hdc in next sc, sc in last 9 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With tail, sew hair to head with curl at center front. Embroider Face: With strand of I, embroider satin stitch eyes, and couched stitch mouth on face.
EAR (make 2)
With A, ch 3. Row 1: Work 5 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With tail, sew ear to side of head.
CAPE
Leaving a long beginning tail, with D, ch 21. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—20 sc. Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—40 sc. Row 3: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 10 times, turn—50 sc. Rows 4–20: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off. With beginning tail, sew Row 1 of cape around neck.
GIRL
HEAD AND BODY
Work same as head and body of boy super hero, using the following colors: Head (Rounds 1–17): E. Shirt (Rounds 18–25): G. Belt (Rounds 26 and 27): D. Shorts (Rounds 28–33): H.
LEG (make 2)
Work same as leg of boy super hero using the following colors: Shoe (Rounds 1–7): H. Leg (Rounds 8–12): G.
ARM (make 2)
Work same as arm of boy super hero using the following colors: Hand (Rounds 1–4): H. Arm (Rounds 5–14): G.
EMBLEM
Work same as emblem of boy super hero using the following colors: Center (Rows 1–4): D. Edging: H. Embroidery: With 2 strands of F held together, embroider a “G” in the center of the emblem.
HAIR
With F, ch 2. Rounds 1–8: With F, work same as Rounds 1–8 of hair for boy super hero—36 sc. Round 9: Sc in next 12 sc, (ch 4, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next 2 ch, slip st in next sc) 12 times (bangs made), sc in last 12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Ponytails
Join F with slip st in 10th sc of Round 9. First Ponytail: (Ch 15, slip st in same st as joining slip st) 5 times. Fasten off. Second Ponytail: Join F with slip st in 3rd sc following bangs of Round 9, and work same as first ponytail. With tail, sew hair to head with bangs at front. Ties (make 2)
With H, ch 30. Fasten off. Tie one tie into a bow around each ponytail.
Embroider Face: With strand of I, embroider satin stitch eyes, and couched stitch mouth on face. With red crayon, gently rub color onto face for cheeks.
EAR (make 2)
With E, work same as ear of boy super hero.
SKIRT
With F, ch 30. Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—29 sc. Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in first sc, 2 dc in each remaining sc across, turn—58 dc. Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. With tail, sew short edges together and sew skirt around waist, under belt.
CAPE
With H, work same as cape of boy super hero.

materials: 4 cardboard disks: one each 2" (5 cm) in diameter and 3" (7.5 cm) in diameter; two 4" (10cm) in diameter
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 12 sc = 4" (10 cm); 15 rows = 4" (10 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first st, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—54 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in first 8 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—60 sc.
Round 11: Ch 1, sc in first 9 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 9 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—66 sc.
Round 12: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 10 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—72 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, sc in first 11 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 11 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—78 sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, sc in first 12 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 12 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—84 sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in first 13 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 13 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—90 sc.
Round 16: Ch 1, sc in first 14 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 14 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—96 sc.
Round 17: Ch 1, sc in first 15 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 15 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—102 sc.
Round 18: Ch 1, sc in first 16 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 16 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—108 sc.
Round 19: Ch 1, [sc3tog] around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Rounds 20–26: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
APRON
With A, ch 19. 
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch, turn—18 sc. 
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each st across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—24 sc. 
Rows 5–15: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 16: Ch 1, [sc2tog] twice, sc in each st across to last 4 sts, [sc2tog] twice, turn—20 sc. 
Row 17: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Rows 18–21: Repeat Rows 16 and 17 twice—12 sc.
Row 22: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each st across to last 2 sts, sc2tog, turn—10 sc. 
Rows 23–27: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. Do not turn at end of last row.
Row 28: **Ch 35, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across (neck strap made)**; working in ends of rows of first side, sc evenly spaced across Rows 27–16, *ch 45, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across (waist strap made)*, sc evenly spaced across Rows 15–2, 3 sc in Row 1; working in opposite side of foundation ch, sc in each ch across; working in ends of rows of other side, 3 sc in Row 1, sc evenly spaced across Rows 2–15; repeat from * to *, sc evenly spaced across Rows 16–27; repeat from ** to **, slip st in first sc of Row 27. Fasten off.
Heart
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 3, 3 dc in first sc, 2 hdc in next sc, (2 sc, dc) in next sc, (dc, 2 sc) in next sc, 2 hdc in next sc, (3 dc, ch 3, slip st) in last sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Sew heart to apron.
Pocket
With B, ch 7. 
Row 1: Ch 1, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in ch across, turn—6 sc.
Row 2–5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each st across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—14 sc.
Rows 6–11: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Whipstitch pocket to apron.
BOWL
First Bottom Half
With C, work same as Rounds 1–4 of hat—24 sc. Fasten off.
2nd Bottom Half
Rounds 1–4: Work same as first bottom half. At end of Round 4, do not fasten off. Holding first half on top of 2nd bottom half, place 2" (5 cm) disk between halves.
Round 5: Working through both thicknesses, repeat Round 5 of hat—30 sc.
Rounds 6 and 7: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. 
Round 8: Repeat Round 6 of hat—36 sc. 
Rounds 9 and 10: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. 
Round 11: Repeat Round 7 of hat—42 sc. 
Rounds 12–14: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc.
CHERRY PIE
Crust
With D, ch 12.
Row 1 (wrong side): Dc in 6th ch from hook (beginning skipped ch count as first dc, ch 1, skipped ch), *ch 1, skip next ch, dc in next ch; repeat from * across, turn—5 dc and 4 ch-1 spaces. 
Row 2 (right side): Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1 here and throughout), dc in first dc, (ch 1, dc) in each dc across to beginning ch, [ch 1, dc] twice in 4th ch of beginning ch, turn—7 dc.
Row 3: Ch 4, dc in first dc, (ch 1, dc) in each dc across to beginning ch, [ch 1, dc] twice in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—9 dc.
Row 4: Ch 4, dc in next dc, (ch 1, dc) in each ch across to beginning ch, ch 1, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn.
Row 5: Ch 4, skip next dc, dc in next dc, (ch 1, dc) in next 4 dc, ch 1, skip last dc, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch, turn—7 dc. 
Row 6: Ch 4, skip next dc, dc in next dc, (ch 1, dc) in next 2 dc, ch 1, skip last dc, dc in 3rd ch of beginning ch—5 dc and 4 ch-1 spaces. Do not turn. 
Border round: Ch 1, working in ends of rows of first side, 3 sc in each row; working across opposite side of foundation ch, skip first ch-1 space, 3 sc in next 2 ch-1 spaces, skip last ch-1 space; working in ends of rows of other side, 3 sc in each row; working across top row, skip first ch-1 space, 3 sc in next 2 ch-1 spaces, skip last ch-1 space; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc. Fasten off.
Pie Filling
With E, work same as Rounds 1–8 of hat. 
Fasten off.
Pie Tin
First Bottom Half
With F, work same as Rounds 1–5 of hat—30 sc. Fasten off.
2nd Bottom Half
Rounds 1–5: Work same as first bottom half. At end of Round 5, do not fasten off. 
Hold first bottom half on top of 2nd bottom half, place 3" (7.5 cm) disk between halves. 
Round 6: Working through both thicknesses, repeat Round 6 of hat—36 sc.
Rounds 7 and 8: Repeat Rounds 7 and 8 of hat—48 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Crust Edge
Place pie filling between pie tin and crust. Stuff with fiberfill between filling and tin as work progresses. 
Round 1: Working through all 3 thicknesses, join D with sc in any st, (ch 5, sc) in each st around, ch 5; join with slip st in first st. Fasten off.
CAKE
Disk Cover (make 4)
With B, ch 2.
Rounds 1–6: Work same as Rounds 1–6 of hat—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, *sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; change to G; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Sides
Place 4" (10 cm) disk between 2 disk covers 
Round 1: Working through both thicknesses, join G with sc in any st, Cl in same st, (sc, cl) in each st around; change to C; join with slip st in first sc, turn—42 sc and 42 Cls.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; change to B; join with slip st in first sc —42 sc. 
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. 
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in each st around; change to C; join with slip st in first sc.
Rounds 5–7: Repeats Rounds 2–4.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in each st around; change to G; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, (sc, cl) in each st around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Bottom of Cake
Stuff cake with fiberfill, then place last disk between remaining disk covers. 
Position covers on lower edge of sides. With G and working through all 3 thicknesses, whipstitch in each st around. Fasten off.
Candle
With G, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook—5 sc. Do not join until instructed. 
Place marker for beginning of round and move marker up as each round is completed.
Rounds 2–5: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 6: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in next st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Flame
With C, ch 2.
Row 1: (Sc, ch 1, dc, ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, ch 1, sc) in 2nd ch from hook. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
Sew flame to Round 1 of candle. 
Sew candle to center of cake.
POT HOLDER (make 2)
With G, ch 15.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across, turn—14 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sts, Cl in next st, sc in last 6 sts, turn—13 sc and 1 Cl. 
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sts, skip next st, sc in last 6 sts, turn—13 sc.
Rows 7 and 8: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in first st, [sc2tog] 6 times—7 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Fold pot holder lengthwise and working through ends of rows and in sts last row, whipstitch edges together.
FINISHING
Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each of 4600 White A and 5142 Cherry Red B, and 2 balls of 9520 Seafoam C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 4mm [US G-6] and 5.5mm [US I-9]
Four ½” [13 mm] buttons, sewing needle and thread, yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, Color B, and Color C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
gauge: 12 sts = 4” [10 cm]; 15 rows = 4” [10 cm] in single crochet with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With smaller hook and A, ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Work 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook—8 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in each st across—16 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—24 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—32 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—40 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, [sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st] 8 times—48 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Repeat Row 7 until piece measures about 3½” [9 cm] from beginning. Fasten off.
Front Flap
Row 1: Turn piece, skip first 6 sts, join A with Fpsc around next st, Fpsc around each of next 35 sts; leave remaining 6 sts unworked—36 Fpsc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each st across. Repeat Row 2 until front flap measures about 2½” [6.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Fold flap back. With a double strand of B, embroider a straight stitch cross in middle of flap, sewing through both thicknesses to tack flap to hat. With A, sew back seam.
DRESS
Bodice
Beginning at waist, with larger hook and C, ch 40.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (3 skipped ch count as first dc) and in each ch across—38 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), turn, dc in each st across.
Row 3 (button loop row): Ch 6 (button loop), turn, slip st in first dc, ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each remaining st across—38 dc and 1 ch-6 button loop.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3.
Right Back
Row 6 (wrong side): Ch 3, turn, dc in next 6 sts; leave remaining 31 sts unworked—7 dc. Rows 7–9: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 6 sts. Fasten off.
Front
Row 6 (wrong side): With wrong side facing, skip next 5 unworked sts of Row 5 following right back for underarm, draw up a loop of C in next st, ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in next 13 sts; leave remaining 12 sts unworked—14 sts.
Rows 7–10: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 3 sts, hdc in next st, sc in next 4 sts, hdc in next st, dc in last 4 sts. Fasten off.
Left Back
Row 6 (wrong side): With wrong side facing, skip next 5 unworked sts of Row 5 following front for underarm, draw up a loop of C in next st, ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in remaining 6 sts—7 dc.
Row 7 (button loop row): Ch 6 (button loop), turn, slip st in first dc, ch 3 (counts as dc), dc in each remaining st across—7 dc and 1 ch-6 button loop.
Row 8: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st across.
Row 9: Repeat Row 7. Fasten off.
Shoulder Seams
Fold right back and left back over front. With C, sew shoulder seams, sewing tops of 4 double crochet stitches at each shoulder together.
Skirt
With right side of bodice facing and larger hook, working across opposite side of bodice foundation chain, draw up a loop of C in first ch.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in same ch as joining, 2 dc in each remaining ch across; join with slip st in top of beginning ch to begin working in rounds—76 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, turn, 2 dc in next st, *dc in next st, 2 dc in next st; repeat from * around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—114 dc.
Round 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Repeat Round 3 until skirt measures about 9 in. [23 cm]. Fasten off.
Sleeves (work 2)
With right side of bodice facing and larger hook, draw up a loop of C in center dc of one underarm.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), dc in next 2 sts; 2 dc in end of each of 9 rows around side edges of armhole, dc in remaining 2 sts of underarm; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—23 dc.
Rounds 2 and 3: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off.
Cuff
With wrong side facing, draw up a loop of A in same st as joining.
Round 4 (wrong side): Ch 3, *dc in next st, dc2tog; repeat from * to last st, dc in last st; join with slip st in top of beginning ch—16 dc.
Round 5: Ch 3, dc in each st around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch. Fasten off. Repeat for 2nd sleeve.
Collar
With right side facing and larger hook, draw up a loop of A at beginning of neck edge.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 3, work dc evenly spaced across neck edge. Fasten off.
APRON
Skirt
With larger hook and A, ch 59.
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (3 skipped ch count as first dc) and in each ch across—57 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in each st across. Repeat Row 2 until piece measures about 7 in. (18 cm) from beginning,
Bib
Row 1: Ch 3, turn, *dc2tog; repeat from * across—29 dc.
Row 2: Ch 3, turn, [dc2tog] 14 times—15 dc.
Rows 3–9: Ch 3, turn, dc in each st across. Fasten off.
Ties (make 2)
With larger hook, join A with sc in one end of Row 2 of bib, ch 71.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; slip st in end of Row 2 near joining sc. Fasten off. Repeat for 2nd Tie, beginning at other end of Row 2 of bib.
Front Cross 
With smaller hook and B, ch 5.
Center Bar
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook (3 skipped ch count as first dc) and in last ch—3 dc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), turn, dc in next 2 sts. Fasten off.
Cross Bar
Draw up a loop of B in one end of Row 3 of center bar.
Next Row: Ch 3, 2 dc in same end of Row 3—3 dc.
Next 2 rows: Ch 3, turn, dc in next 2 sts. Fasten off. Repeat to work 2nd half of cross bar, beginning on other end of Row 3 of center bar. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING
With B, embroider a straight stitch cross in middle of each sleeve cuff. With sewing needle and thread, sew buttons opposite button loops. With yarn tails, sew front cross to center of Apron bib. Sew Apron bib to front bodice of Dress. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® Amigurumit™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 239 yds/219 m) Sushi (9126) 1 ball makes 5 toys total
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) sc. Yoh and draw through all 3(4) loops on hook
instructions:
White as A, Coral as B, Light Green as C, Dark Green as D. 
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Nigiri
Rice: With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 26 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
7th to 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 26 sts.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog 2 times. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 22 sts.

Secure safety eyes as shown in picture. Using B, embroider blushed cheeks under eyes.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog 3 times. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
Stuff Rice firmly.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts.
Fasten off, leaving long tail. Draw end tightly through rem sts.

Salmon: With B, ch 11.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until piece from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm].
Fasten off.

Seaweed: With D, ch 7.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook. 1 dc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 dc.
2nd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each dc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until piece measures long enough to wrap around middle of Rice and Salmon as shown in picture.
Fasten off.

Wrap Seaweed around Salmon and Rice as shown in picture. Seam ends of Seaweed in place.

Maki Roll
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Break C. Join with A. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: With A, ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Break A. Join with D. 32 sc.
5th rnd: With D, ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
6th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break D. Join with A.
14th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Break A. Join with C. 24 sts.

Secure safety eyes as shown in picture.
16th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sts.
17th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sts. 
Fasten off, leaving long tail.
Stuff Maki Roll firmly.
Draw end tightly through rem sts.
With B, embroider blushed cheeks below eyes and matching triangles on top and bottom of Maki Roll.

Onigiri
Rice: With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 3 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 3 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 3 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 13 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 3 sc in next sc. *1 sc in each of next 15 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc. Join. 54 sc.
10th to 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

Secure safety eyes as shown in picture.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc3tog. *1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc3tog. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc. Join. 48 sts.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc3tog. *1 sc in each of next 13 sc. Sc3tog. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join. 42 sts.
18th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc3tog. *1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Sc3tog. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join. 36 sts.
19th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc3tog. *1 sc in each of next 9 sc.  Sc3tog. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join. 30 sts.
20th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc3tog. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc3tog. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 24 sts.
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc3tog. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc3tog. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 18 sts.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc3tog. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc3tog. Rep from * once more. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 12 sts.

Stuff Rice firmly.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc3tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sts.
Fasten off leaving long tail. Draw end tightly through rem sts.

Seaweed: With D, ch 9.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 7 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 2¾" [7 cm].
Fasten off.
Sew Seaweed to Rice as shown in picture. With B, embroider eyebrows as shown in picture.

Uramaki Roll
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Break C. Join with B. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. working in both loops, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Break B. Join with D. 24 sc.
4th rnd: With D, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Break D. Join with A. 32 sc.

5th rnd: With A, ch 1. working in both loops, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join. 48 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th to 13th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.

Secure safety eyes as shown in picture.
14th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. *Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * to last 7 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join. 40 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Break A. Join with D. 32 sts.
16th rnd: With D, ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Break D. Join with B. 24 sts.
17th rnd: With B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 16 sts.

Stuff Uramaki Roll.
18th rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in next sc. *Sc3tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. Sc3tog. Break B. Join with C. 8 sts.
19th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog around.
Join.
Fasten off leaving long tail. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
With C, embroider eyebrows as shown in picture.

Wasabi
With C, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th and 8th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
9th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
10th and 11th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.

Secure safety eyes to Wasabi as shown in picture.
13th and 14th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
15th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
16th and 17th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Stuff Wasabi firmly.
18th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join.
Fasten off leaving long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Contrast A Gold (0321) 1 ball or 129 yds/118 m
Contrast B Light Periwinkle (0347) 1 ball or 83 yds/76 m
Contrast C Aran (0313) 1 ball or 37 yds/34 m
Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Two 1/2" [1.5 cm] safety eyes and safety nose
abbreviations: Hdcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Notes: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Ch 2 at beg of rnd does not count as hdc.

HEAD
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.

5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
10th to 20th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
21st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
23rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 19 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * once more. Join. 40 sc.
Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.
Stuff Head firmly.

EARS (make 2 alike)
Inner Ear: With C, ch 4.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog.
Fasten off.
Outer Ear: With B, ch 4.
Rep from 1st row to 8th row as given for Inner Ear.
Hold Inner Ear and Outer Ear tog with WS facing each other. Join A with sl st to bottom right corner of Ear. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around Ear, leaving bottom edge unworked.
Sew Ears to Head as shown in photo.

ANTLERS (make 2 alike)
