With C, ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 6 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 3. Skip each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc or ch around. Join. 6 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through remaining stitches.
Join C with sl st to first skipped stitch of 3rd rnd. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc or ch around. Join. 6 sc.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through remaining stitches.
Stuff Antlers firmly and sew to Head as shown in photo.

FOREHEAD SECTION
With A, ch 8.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from the hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 6 hdc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
5th row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. Hdc2tog. Turn. 4 hdc.
6th row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 2. (Hdc2tog) twice. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing.
With C, embroider spots on Forehead Section.
Sew Forehead Section to Head as shown in photo.
Attach safety nose.
Attach safety eyes.
With A, make a stitch to cinch eyes closer together as shown in photo.

BODY
With B, ch 40. Join with sl st to first ch, making sure not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join. 40 hdc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. *1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Rep from * around. Join.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 19 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * once more. Join. 42 sc.
6th to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 dc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 sc.
14th to 20th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
21st rnd: Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 1 hdc in each sc around. Join.
22nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.
With A, join with sl st to first st of 20th rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 60 sc.
Next 3 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through remaining stitches.
Stuff Body firmly.
With yarn end from Head, sew Head to Body through back loops only of 3rd rnd.

TAIL
Inner Tail: With C, ch 4.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of last 2 ch. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd to 5th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Outer Tail: With B, ch 4.
Rep from 1st row to 8th row as given for Inner Tail.
Hold Inner Tail and Outer Tail tog. Join A with sl st to bottom right corner of Tail. Working through both thicknesses, work sc evenly around Tail, leaving bottom edge unworked.
Sew Tail to back side of Body as shown in photo.

ARMS (make 2 alike)
With B, ch 12. Join with sl st to first ch, making sure not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 31/2" [9 cm].
Next rnd: Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 1 hdc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 hdcfp around next hdc. 1 hdcbp around next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.
Join A with sl st to 1st st of 3rd last rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join last rnd with C. Break A.
Next 3 rnds: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through remaining stitches.
Stuff Arms firmly.
Sew Arms to Body as shown in photo.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein each 320 Cornmeal A, 321 Gold B, 256 Carrot C, 312 Black D.
Split-lock stitch marker; yarn needle, stuffing; two 3/8” buttons for eyes.
abbreviations: dec (decrease) = draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 20 rnds = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEAD AND BODY: Begin at top of head with A, ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rnd 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Rnds 6-12: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 13: [Dec] 15 times – 15 sc.
Neck-Rnd 14: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 3 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 15: Sc in each sc around. Stuff head.
Rnd 16: [Sc in next 5 sc, inc] twice – 14 sc.
Rnd 17: [Sc in next 6 sc, inc] twice – 16 sc.
Rnd 18: [Sc in next 7 sc, inc] twice – 18 sc.
Rnds 19 and 20: Sc in each sc around.
Body-Rnd 21: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rnds 22-30: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 31: [Dec] 12 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 32: [Dec] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off. Finish stuffing.
Weave yarn tail through remaining 6 sc, draw up firmly to gather; fasten securely.
LEG (Make 4): With A, ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: [Sc in next sc, inc] 3 times – 9 sc.
Rnds 3-10: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Stuff. Sew in place.
HORN (Make 2): With C, ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] twice – 8 sc.
Rnd 3: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 4: Working in back lps on this rnd only, [dec] 4 times – 4 sc.
Rnd 5: Slip st in each sc around. Fasten off.
Do not stuff. Sew in place.
EAR (Make 2): With A, ch 2.
Row 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, [inc] 6 times; turn – 12 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, [inc] twice, sc in last 5 sc – 14 sc. Fasten off.
Fold ear in half at ends of rows and sew in place.
SNOUT: With A, ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] twice – 8 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next 3 sc, inc] twice – 10 sc.
Rnd 4: [Sc in next 4 sc, inc] twice – 12 sc. Fasten off.
Stuff lightly and sew in place. Embroider straight sts nose and mouth with D. Sew eyes in place.
MANE: With C, ch 15.
Row 1: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next ch, [ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next ch, slip st in next ch of beginning ch] 12 times. Fasten off.
Sew to center back of head.
TAIL: With A, ch 7; slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across. Fasten off.
End of Tail: With C, [ch 6, slip st in 6th ch from hook] 5 times. Fasten off.
Weave yarn tail through slip st section; draw up tightly to gather; fasten securely. Sew to end of tail.
SPOTS (Make 10): With B, ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Sew one spot on each side of face for cheeks. Scatter remaining spots around front and back of body.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® Super Craft Kit Brights™ (Set includes 12 balls, 1.7 oz/50 g each; 21 oz/600 g total, 93 yds/85 m each; 1116 yds/1020 m total)
Rabbit: Day Glow Yellow and Light Jasmine
Cat: Day Glow Orange and Day Glow
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 4" [10 cm] tall, excluding legs and ears.
instructions:
Notes: • Join all rnds with sl st to first sc. • Use whichever shades you like. This project is completely customizable.

All Versions: Body:
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th to 15th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc. Stuff Body firmly.
17th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
18th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.

All Versions: Legs (make 2)
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten off, leaving a long end for joining. Sew Legs to bottom of Body as shown in photo.

All Versions: Arms (make 2)
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd to 5th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long end for joining. Sew Arms to side of Body as shown in photo.

Rabbit Ears (make 2)
Ch 10.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 7 ch. 4 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 8 ch. Fasten off. Sew Ears to top of Body as shown in photo.

Mouse Ears (make 2)
Ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc. Fasten off. Sew Ears to top of Body as shown in photo.

Cat Ears (make 2)
Ch 4.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of row. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off. Sew Ears to top of Body as shown in photo.

All Versions: Face: With small amount of black worsted weight yarn, embroider Eyes using French Knot and Nose using Satin Stitch as shown in photo.

Rabbit Tail:
Wrap yarn around your thumb 10 times. Do not break yarn. Carefully slide yarn off of thumb and pinch yarn bundle in center. Wrap yarn around center of bundle, pull tight and tie. Cut yarn leaving long tail. Using long tail sew bundle to lower-back of Body. Fluff up loops of bundle.

Mouse Tail:
Join yarn with sl st to lower-back of Body. Ch 9. Fasten off, weave in ends.

Cat Tail:
Join yarn with sl st to lower-back of Body. Ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of last 7 ch. Fasten off, weave in ends.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Classic™ Crochet Thread Size 10 (White: 400 yds/366 m; Colors: 350 yds/320 m)
Hot Pink (0332) 1 ball or 25 yds/22 m
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) Susan Bates® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit doll chest measurement: 5" [12.5 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Cardigan is worked top down.
• Ch 2 at beg of rows does not count as st.
Ch 23 loosely. See Diagram on page 2.
1st row: (RS). 1 hdc in 7th ch from hook (counts as button loop). 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first hdc. 3 dc in next hdc. *[Ch 1. Skip next hdc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next hdc] twice.* (Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 3 dc in next hdc) twice. Rep from * to * once more. Ch 1. Skip next hdc. 3 dc in next hdc. 1 dc in last hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 3 dc in first dc. [Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] twice. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp] twice. Ch 1. Skip next 3 dc. 3 dc in last dc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first dc. Skip next 2 dc. [(3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) twice. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp] twice. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 4 times. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice] twice. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
Shape armholes and Body: 1st row: (RS). Ch 2. 3 dc in first dc. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. PM to ch-2 sp just made. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. Sl st to marked ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 5 times. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. PM to ch-2 sp just made. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. Sl st to last marked ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) twice. Ch 1. Skip next 2 dc. 3 dc in last dc. Turn.
Body: 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 dc in first dc. Skip next 2 dc. [(3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) 3 times. 3 dc in next sl st. Skip next 3 dc. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 6 times. Ch 1. 3 dc in next sl st. Skip next 3 dc. (Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp) 3 times. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in last dc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. 3 dc in first dc. *3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last dc. 3 dc in last dc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each dc across bottom of Cardigan. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Sew button to correspond to buttonhole.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 360 Café Latte A, 722 Pretty in Pink B, 373 Petal Pink C, 520 Minty D, 324 Bright Yellow E, and 312 Black F
Note: Only small amounts of E and F are needed
abbreviations: A, B, C, D, E, and F = Color A, B, C, D, E, and F
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
*= repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
gauge: 12 sts = 3"; 14 rows = 3" in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEAD
Beginning at nose with A, ch 2. 
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 4–7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: Sc in next 9 sc, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc, sc in last 9 sc—30 sc.
Rounds 11 and 12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 14 and 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 19: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 20: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Stuff head.
Round 21: Sc in each sc around.
Round 22: [Sc2tog] 6 times—6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through the stitches of last round and pull to gather. Weave in end securely.
Facial Features: With F, embroider satin stitch eyes and nose, and straight stitch mouth.

EAR (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of head—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 4 times—8 sc.
Fasten off. Do not stuff ear. Flatten and sew ears to head.

BODY
Beginning at top with A, ch 6; taking care not to twist ch, join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 2 sc in each ch around—12 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed. 
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; change to B in last st—36 sc.
Rounds 8-18: With B, sc in each sc around.
Begin stuffing body and continue to stuff until piece is complete.
Divide for Legs

First Leg
Round 19: With B, sc in next 18 sc, place a marker in the next st; leave the marked st and all remaining sts unworked—18 sc. Work in continuous rounds over the 18 sc just worked only, forming a circle for the first leg. 
Round 20: Sc in each sc around.
Round 21: Sc in each sc around; change to A in last st.
Rounds 22–30: With A, sc in each sc around.
Shape foot
Round 31: Work 2 sc in each of the first 3 sc, sc in next 12 sc, 2 sc in each of last 3 sc—24 sc.
Rounds 32–35: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 36: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Stuff leg.
Round 37: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through the stitches of last round and pull to gather. Weave in end securely.

Second Leg
With right side facing, join B with sc in marked st following first leg.
Round 19: Sc in each remaining unworked st following first leg.
Round 20: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 21: Sc in each sc around; change to A in last st.
Rounds 22–30: With A, sc in each sc around.
Shape foot
Round 31: Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc, sc in last 7 sc—24 sc.
Rounds 32–37: Work same as Rounds 32–37 of first leg—12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through the stitches of last round and pull to gather. Weave in end securely. 
Sew head to top of body.

ARM (make 2)
With A, ch 2.
Rounds 1 and 2: Work same as Rounds 1 and 2 of head—12 sc.
Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 6: [Sc2tog] twice, sc in remaining 8 sc—10 sc.
Rounds 7–16: Sc in each sc around. 
Fasten off. Stuff arms and sew to body.

CROWN
With E, ch 32.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 9 ch, *slip st in next ch; ch 4, working in ch-4 just made, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch; working in foundation ch, skip next 2 ch, slip st in next ch; ch 5, working in ch-5 just made, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch; working in foundation ch, skip next 3 ch, slip st in next ch; ch 4, working in ch-4 just made, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch; working in foundation ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in each remaining ch across. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Sew ends of crown together and place crown on head in front of ears. 
If desired, sew crown permanently in place.

TOP RUFFLE
With D, ch 25.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across, turn—24 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 2, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in first sc, *skip next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 2, (dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next sc; repeat from * to last 2 sc, skip next sc, slip st in last sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Sew ruffle around neck of bear.

FLOWER
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals).
Round 2: Working in back loops only, slip st in first sc, *ch 2, hdc in 2nd ch from hook (petal made), slip st in next sc; repeat from * around—6 petals. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Sew flower in place at center of top ruffle.

SKIRT
Beginning at waist, with C, ch 37.
Row 1 (right side): Dc in 4th ch from hook (3 skipped ch count as first dc), 2 dc in each remaining ch across, turn—68 dc. 
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as first dc here and throughout), working in front loops only, dc in each dc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 3, working in back loops only, dc in each dc across, turn.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Rows 2 and 3. 
Row 6: Ch 3, working in front loops only, dc in each dc across and change to D in last st, turn.
Row 7: With D, ch 4 (counts as first tr), tr in first dc, *ch 1, 2 tr in next dc; repeat from * across working last 2 tr in top of beginning ch-3, turn.
Row 8: Ch 3, dc in each tr and ch-1 space across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Pink Scallops: Hold skirt with lower edge (Row 8) at top and with right side facing you. Working in the unworked loops of Row 5, join C with sc in first unworked loop, *skip next 2 loops, 7 tr in next loop, skip next 2 loops, sc in next loop; repeat from * across. Fasten off. 
Green Frill: Hold skirt with waist (Row 1) at top and with right side facing you. Working in the unworked loops of Row 4, join D with slip st in first unworked loop, *dc in next loop, slip st in next loop; repeat from * across. Fasten off. 
Waistband: Hold skirt with waist (Row 1) at top and right side facing you. With B, ch 25 (for first tie), working in opposite side of foundation ch at top of skirt, sc in first 2 ch, sc2tog, *sc in next 3 ch, sc2tog; repeat from * across, ch 25 (for 2nd tie). Fasten off.
Sew lower half of side edges of skirt together for back seam, leaving top half of side edges unsewn so that skirt is removable. Use the ties to tie skirt around waist of bear. Alternately, the skirt can be permanently sewn to waist.

FINISHING
Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: Simply Soft (170 g/6 oz; 288 m/315 yds)
One crochet hook size US G-6 (4.25 mm), or size to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions: HEAD & BODY  With MC, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in second ch from hook—6 sts. Round 2: 2 sc in each st around—12 sts. Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sts. Round 4: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around—24 sts. Round 5: Sc in each st around. Round 6: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—30 sts. Round 7: *Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—36 sts. Rounds 8 and 9: Sc in each st around. Round 10: *Sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—42 sts. Round 11: Sc in each st around. Round 12: *Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—48 sts. Rounds 13–16: Sc in each st around. Round 17: *Sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—42 sts. Round 18: Sc in each st around. Round 19: *Sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—36 sts. Round 20: Sc in each st around. Begin firmly stuffing head and body and continue to stuff as you go. Round 21: *Sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—30 sts. Round 22: *Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—24 sts. Rounds 23 and 24: Sc in each st around. Round 25: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—30 sts. Rounds 26 and 27: Sc in each st around. Round 28: *Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—36 sts. Rounds 29–32: Sc in each st around. Round 33: *Sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—42 sts. Rounds 34–36: Sc in each st around. Round 37: *Sc in next 6 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—48 sts. Rounds 38 and 39: Sc in each st around. Round 40: *Sc in next 7 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * 2 more times, sc in next 24 sts—51 sts. Rounds 41 and 42: Sc in each st around. Round 43: *Sc in next 8 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * 2 more times, sc in next 24 sts—54 sts. Rounds 44 and 45: Sc in each st around. Round 46: *Sc in next 8 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * 2 more times, sc in next 24 sts—51 sts. Round 47: Sc in each st around. Round 48: *Sc in next 7 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * 2 more times, sc in next 24 sts—48 sts. Rounds 49 and 50: Sc in each st around. Round 51: *Sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—42 sts. Round 52: *Sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—36 sts. Round 53: *Sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—30 sts. Round 54: *Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—24 sts. Round 55: *Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—18 sts. Round 56: *Sc in next st, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sts. Round 57: (Sc2tog) around—6 sts. Round 58: *Skip next st, slip st in next st; repeat from * around. Fasten off. FACE  With A, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in second ch from hook—6 sts. Round 2: 2 sc in each st around—12 sts. Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sts. Round 4: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around—24 sts. Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—30 sts. Rounds 6 and 7: Sc in each st around. Round 8: Sc in next 15 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * 2 more times—33 sts. Round 9: Sc in next 15 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * 2 more times—36 sts. Round 10: Sc in next 18 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts; repeat from * 1 more time; sc in last 4 sts—38 sts. Round 11: Sc in next 18 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 7 sts; repeat from * 1 more time; sc in last 4 sts—40 sts. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. INNER EAR (make 2)  With A, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in second ch from hook—6 sts. Round 2: 2 sc in each st around—12 sts. Fasten off. OUTER EAR (make 2)  With MC, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in second ch from hook—6 sts. Round 2: 2 sc in each st around—12 sts. Lay inner ear on top of outer ear. Round 3: Working through both thicknesses (inner and outer ear), ch 1, (dc, hdc) in next st, sc in next 7 sts, (hdc, dc) in next st; leave remaining sts unworked. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. ARM (make 2)  With A, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in second ch from hook—6 sts. Round 2: 2 sc in each st around—12 sts. Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sts. Rounds 4 and 5: Sc in each st around. Round 6: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around—24 sts. Rounds 7 and 8: Sc in each st around. Round 9: *Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—18 sts. Rounds 10 and 11: Sc in each st around. Fasten off A. Begin firmly stuffing arm and continue to stuff as you go. Round 12: Join MC with sc in any st of last round, sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog, *sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * 1 more time—15 sts. Rounds 13–16: Sc in each st around. Round 17: *Sc in next 4 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sts. Rounds 18–34: Sc in each st around. Round 35: *Sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—15 sts. Round 36: Sc in each st around. Round 37: *Sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sts. Round 38: Sc in each st around. Round 39: *Sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—9 sts. Round 40: Flatten opening; working through both thicknesses, sc in each st across. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. LEG (make 2)  With A, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in second ch from hook—6 sts. Round 2: 2 sc in each st around—12 sts. Round 3: *Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—18 sts. Round 4: *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * around—24 sts. Round 5: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around—30 sts. Round 6: Sc in next 6 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, sc in next 6 sts—33 sts. Round 7: Sc in next 6 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 6 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, sc in next 6 sts—36 sts. Round 8: Sc in next 6 sts, *sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, sc in next 6 sts—33 sts. Round 9: Sc in next 6 sts, *sc2tog, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, sc in next 6 sts—30 sts. Round 10: Sc in next 6 sts, *sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, sc in next 6 sts—27 sts. Round 11: Sc in next 6 sts, *sc2tog, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * 2 more times, sc in next 6 sts—24 sts. Round 12: Sc in each st around. Fasten off A. Begin firmly stuffing leg and continue to stuff as you go. Round 13: Join MC with sc in any st of last round, sc in each remaining st around. Rounds 14–37: Sc in each st around. Round 38: *Sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—21 sts. Rounds 39 and 40: Sc in each st around. Round 41: *Sc in next 5 sts, sc2tog; repeat from * around—18 sts. Round 42: Sc in each st around. Round 43: Flatten opening; working through both thicknesses, sc in each st across. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. TAIL  With MC, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in second ch from hook—6 sts. Round 2: 2 sc in each st around—12 sts. Round 3: Sc in each st around. Round 4: *Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st—15 sts. Round 5: Sc in each st around. Rounds 6–15: Sc in next 8 sts, hdc in next 7 sts. Begin firmly stuffing tail and continue to stuff as you go. Rounds 16–21: Sc in each st around. Rounds 22–30: Hdc in next 7 sts, sc in next 8 sts. Rounds 31–39: Sc in each st around. Round 40: Flatten opening; working through both thicknesses, sc in each st across. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. EYE (make 2)  With C, ch 2. Round 1: Work 6 sc in second ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sts. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. FINISHING  Sew arms to sides of body. Sew legs to bottom of body. Sew tail to lower back of body. Using photograph as a guide, with B and yarn needle, embroider a mouth onto the face. With C and yarn needle, sew eyes to face and embroider nostrils. Sew face to front of head. Sew ears to side of head. Using yarn needle, weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 239 yds/219 m)
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
instructions:
Version 1: Light Grey as Color 1, Dark Grey as Color 2, Light Green as Color 3.
Version 2: Dark Grey as Color 1, Light Grey as Color 2, Orange as Color 3.
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to /f_i rst st.
Ears (make 2 alike): With Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
Fasten oﬀ leaving long end for sewing.
Eye Piece: With Color 2, ch 7.
1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to last sc. 5 sc in last ch. Working in opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Join. 18 sc.
Fasten oﬀ leaving long end for sewing.
Head: With Color 1, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 32 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 40 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
7th to 12th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
13th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 32 sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 24 sc.
Sew Eye Piece and Ears onto Head. Secure safety eyes as shown in picture.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *Sc3tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last 4 sc. Sc3tog. 1 sc in last sc. Break Color 1. Join with Color 3. 16 sc.
Stuﬀ Head /f_i rmly.
Neck: 16th rnd: With Color 3, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break Color 3. Join with Color 1.
Body: 18th rnd: With Color 1, ch 1. Working in front loops only, *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
19th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
20th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
22nd to 30th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
31st rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc.
32nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
33rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc.
Stuﬀ Neck and Body /f_i rmly.
34th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 8 sc.
Fasten oﬀ leaving long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Arms (make 2 alike): With Color 3, ch 6. Join with sl st to /f_i rst ch making sure not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 6 sc.
2nd to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break Color 3. Join with Color 1.
9th rnd: With Color 1, ch 1. Working in front loops only, *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 9 sc.
10th and 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Fasten oﬀ leaving long end. Stuﬀ end of Arms (hands) only. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Sew Arms to Body as shown in photo.
Legs (make 2 alike):  With Color 3, ch 6. Join with sl st to /f_i rst ch making sure not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join. 6 sc.
2nd to 8th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Break Color 3. Join with Color 1.
10th rnd: With Color 1, ch 1. Working in front loops only, 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 6 sc.
Fasten oﬀ leaving long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts. Do not stuﬀ Legs.
Sew Legs to Body as shown in photo.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
instructions:
Body and Head (all Versions make alike).
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join C 
with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With C, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc 
around. Join B with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
around. Join C with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
around. Join B with sl st to first sc.
5th and 6th rnds: As 3rd and 4th rnds.
Stuff Body.
7th rnd: With B, ch 1. *Draw up a loop in 
each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 
3 loops on hook - Sc2tog made. Rep from 
* around. Join A with sl st to first sc. 5 sts. 
Break B and C.
8th rnd: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in each st 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next 
sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 15 sc.
10th and 11th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. 
Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 10 sts.
Stuff Head.
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * 
around. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 sts. 
Fasten off. Draw yarn through rem sts and 
fasten securely.
Wacky
Hair: Wind C around 4 fingers 6 times. 
Remove from fingers and tie tightly in 
center. Sew to top of Head. Cut loops 
unevenly.
Sew 2 beads to Head for eyes. Embroider 
mouth with straight stitch as seen in 
picture. Sew key-ring to top of Head.
Stingy
Wings (make 2).
With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc. 1 hdc. 5 dc. 1 hdc. 2 sc) 
in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Fasten off.
Sew Wings to back of Body as seen in 
picture.
Antennae: Cut length of A 4" [10 cm] 
long. Thread through top of Head and 
knot each end.
Sew 2 beads to Head for eyes. Embroider 
mouth with straight stitch as seen in 
picture. Sew key-ring to top of Head.
Punky
Mohawk: Cut 8 lengths of B 4" [10 cm] 
long. Draw each length of yarn through 
Head in a line from top of Head to base of 
Head at back. Knot through each length 
of yarn close to Head to form Mohawk. 
Trim evenly.
Sew 2 beads to Head for eyes. Embroider 
mouth and eyebrows with straight stitch 
as seen in picture. Sew key-ring to top of 
Head.

materials: RED HEART® Super Tweed™: 1 skein 7819 Landshark A.
RED HEART® Super Saver®: Small amounts 316 Soft White B, 320 Cornmeal C, and 312 Black D.
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
dec (decrease) = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
gauge: 20 sts = 4”; 16 rounds = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Body (worked from bottom upwards)
With A, work 6 sc in adjustable ring; do not join but work in continuous rounds. Place a marker in last st of round and move up each round.
Round 1: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, inc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 3 sc, inc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 4 sc, inc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 5 sc, inc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Rounds 7-11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Sc in next 5 sc, dec] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 13: [Sc in next 4 sc, dec] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 16: Sc in each sc around.
Round 17: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 6 times – 18 sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for attaching head. Do not weave opening closed.

Head (worked from back of head downwards)
With A, work 6 sc in adjustable ring.
Rounds 1-10: Work same as for body.
Ear Placement-Round 11: Sc in next 6 sc, sc in back loops of next 8 sc, sc in both loops of next 14 sc, sc in back loops of next 8 sc, sc in both loops of last 6 sc.
Rounds 12-14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: [Sc in next 5 sc, dec] 6 times – 36 sc.
Rounds 16, 18, 20 and 22: Sc in each sc around.
Round 17: [Sc in next 4 sc, dec] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 19: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 21: [Sc in next 2 sc, dec] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 23: [Dec, sc in next 7 sc] twice – 16 sc.
Trunk-Round 24: Work in back loops only for the remaining rounds. [Dec, sc in next 6 sc] twice – 14 sc.
Stuff head firmly and continue to stuff head and trunk as rounds are completed.
Round 25: [Dec, sc in next 5 sc] twice – 12 sc.
Rounds 26-28: Sc in each sc around.
Round 29: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] twice – 10 sc.
Round 30: [Dec, sc in next 3 sc] twice – 8 sc. Fasten off weaving yarn tail through sts to close hole. Trim excess yarn.

Ears (Make 1 on each side of Head)
Row 1: Attach A in first free loop of 8 free loops on Head Round 11; ch 1, sc in same loop and next 7 loops; turn – 8 sc.
Round 2: Working in back loops only ch 1, sc in 8 sc, turn and work in the 8 loops on other side; do not join but work in continuous rounds – 16 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 3 sc, inc] 4 times – 20 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 4 sc, inc] 4 times – 24 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: Flatten ear to work through 2 layers; ch 1, sc through both layers of 12 sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

Arms and Legs (Make 4)
With A, work 6 sc in adjustable ring.
Round 1: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, inc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Dec, sc in next sc] 6 times – 12 sc. Lightly stuff bottom only, leave top portion un-stuffed.
Round 6: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] twice – 10 sc.
Round 7: [Dec, sc in next 3 sc] twice – 8 sc.
Rounds 8 and 9: Sc in each sc around.
Flatten leg to work through 2 layers; ch 1, sc through both layers of 4 sc. Fasten off.

Baby Bonnet
With B, work 6 sc in adjustable ring; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 1: Ch 2, (counts as hdc now and though out), hdc in same st as joining, [2 hdc in next sc] 5 times; join in top of ch-2 – 12 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2, 2 hdc in next hdc, [hdc in next hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 5 times; join – 18 hdc.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in next hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc, [hdc in next 2 hdc, 2 hdc in next hdc] 5 times; join – 24 hdc.

materials: RED HEART® Amigurumi™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 239 yds/219 m) Sloth (9336) 1 ball makes 2 toys
Sizes U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) and E/4 (3.5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook. 20 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Version 1: Cream as Color 1, Tan as Color 2, Brown as Color 3. Green as Color 4.
Version 2: Cream as Color 1, Brown as Color 2, Tan as Color 3. Green as Color 4.
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Face: With Color 1 and smaller hook, ch 6. 
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation chain, 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join. 12 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Join. 20 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join. 28 sc.
Fasten off.
Eye Patches (make 2): With Color 2 and smaller hook, ch 5.
1st rnd: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 5 sc in last ch. Working into opposite side of foundation chain, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Join. 14 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 3 sc in last sc. Join. 18 sc.
Fasten off.
Body: With Color 3 and larger hook, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th to 14th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
15th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
16th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
17th to 24th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
25th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
26th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
25th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
26th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
27th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
Sew Face onto Body as shown in picture. Sew Eye Patches onto Face as shown in picture. Secure safety eyes to Eye Patches as shown in picture. Stuff Body firmly.
28th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 12 sc.
29th rnd: Ch 1. Sc2tog around. Join. 6 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Arms and Legs (make 4): With Color 3 and larger hook, ch 17.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row twice more. Do not fasten off.
Fold piece in half lengthwise. Sl st through both thicknesses along edge. Fasten off.
Toes: With smaller hook, join Color 1 with sl st to end of Arm or Leg. *Ch 4. 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each of next 2 ch. 1 sl st in end of Arm or Leg. Rep from * twice more. Fasten off.
Sew Arms and Legs to Body as shown in picture.
Branch: With Color 4 and smaller hook, ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch making sure not to twist chain.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep 2nd rnd until work from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm]. Fasten off leaving long tail. Draw end tightly through rem sts.
Leaves (make 2): With Color 4 and smaller hook, ch 8.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. Fasten off.
Sew Leaves onto Branch as shown in picture.

materials: Patons® Classic Wool WorstedTM (3.5 oz/100 g; 210 yds/192 m)
Main Color (MC) Dark Grey Marl (77252) 1 ball
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
Small amount of black yarn for embroidery of nostrils and eyes
instructions:
Note: When joining new color, work to 
last 2 loops on hook of last st. Draw new 
color through 2 loops, then proceed in a 
new color.

FIRST LEG
Note: Stuff Legs as you work.
**With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join 
with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next 
sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 9 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 
2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 
2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 15 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc.  
2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 18 sc.**
6th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 
2 sc in next sc) 3 times. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 21 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join 
with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 5 times more, joining MC at 
end of last rnd.
With MC, rep 7th rnd until work from beg 
measures 8" [20.5 cm]. Fasten off. 
Stuff Leg.

SECOND LEG
Work as for First Leg. Do not fasten off. 
Cont as follows for Body:

BODY
Join Second Leg to First Leg by working  
sl st into last sc of First Leg.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around First 
Leg, then 1 sc in each sc around Second 
Leg. Join with sl st to first sc. 42 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join 
with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from joining rnd 
measures 8" [20.5 cm], joining A at end of 
last rnd.
With A, rep last rnd 6 times.
Note: Stuff Body and Head as you work.

Shape Head: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each 
of next 5 sc. Draw up a loop in each of next 
2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on 
hook – sc2tog made. Rep from * around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.

BASIC CROCHET SOCK MONKEY | CROCHET      1 of 2

ABBREVIATIONS:

2nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 
Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 30 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 
Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 24 sc.
Cont as established, dec 6 sts evenly 
around each rnd until 6 sc rem (stuffing 
Head as you work). Fasten off, leaving a 
long end. Thread end through rem sts 
and draw tightly. Fasten securely.

ARMS (make 2).
Work from ** to ** as given for First Leg. 
18 sc.

6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd 6 times more, joining MC at 
end of last rnd.
With MC, rep last rnd until work from beg 
measures 8" [20.5 cm]. Fasten off. 
Stuff Arm.

MUZZLE
With B, ch 7.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in 
each of next 4 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working 
into opposite side of ch, work 1 sc in each 
of next 4 ch. 2 sc in last ch. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 14 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc.  
3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 3 
sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 7 sc.  
3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 8 sc.  
3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st 
to first sc. 22 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 8 sc. 
3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 10 
sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last  
2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 26 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sc. 
3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 12 
sc. 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last  
3 sc. Join A with sl st to first sc. 30 sc. 
6th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd 3 times more. Fasten off.

TAIL (make 1).
Work as given for Arms.

EARS (make 4).
With MC, ch 6.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook.  
1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each 
sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of 
row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows once more. 9 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of 
row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to 
last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn.
Rep last row once more. 5 sc. Fasten off.

Joining Ears: With WS facing each other, 
place 2 Ears tog. Join MC with sl st at 
lower edge and work 1 rnd of sc through 
all thicknesses around outer edge to join. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Stuff M uzzle lightly and sew to front of 
Monkey. Attach Ears to either side of 
Head. Sew Arms and Tail in position as 
shown. With black yarn, embroider Eyes 
and Nostrils. 

BASIC CROCHET SOCK MONKEY  | CROCHET
BASIC CROCHET SOCK MONKEY | CROCHET      2 of 2

materials: Simply Soft Party (85 g/3 oz; 150 m/164 yds)
One size US G-8 (5.5mm) crochet hook (for Wand, ties and last row of top of Tiara); and US H-8 (5mm) (for body of Tiara), or sizes to obtain gauge.
For Tiara: Safety pins or small stitch holder, 3 iridescent beads (ensure hole in beads is large enough for yarn needle to pass through), yarn needle.

For Wand: One dowel—12"/30.5cm long, low-temperature hot glue gun, glue sticks, iridescent beads (any number, size and color of beads may be used. One 1/2"/1cm diameter bead is recommended for bottom of wand stem; ensure hole in beads is large enough for yarn needle to pass through), yarn needle.
abbreviations: Picot = Ch 3, sl st in top of sc just made.
measurements: Finished measurements: Tiara measures approximately 6"/15cm wide by 1/2"/9cm tall (at center). Star on wand measures approximately 4"/10cm across (from tip to tip).
instructions:
TIES
With smaller hook and 1 strand of yarn coming from outside of ball, make an adjustable ring. Tie #1: [Ch 7, sc in ring] 5 times (flower made), ch 125. Place final lp on a safety pin. Do not fasten off. Tie #2: With 1 strand of yarn coming from inside of ball, work same as Tie #1, do not place final lp on holder. Join ends of ties: Place final lp of Tie #1 and Tie #2 together on larger hook. 
TIARA
With larger hook, holding 2 strands of yarn together (the 2 strands coming from the 2 ties). Headband: Ch 8, dc in 8th ch from hook (first box made), [turn, ch 5, sk next 2 ch of previous box, dc in next ch] 7 times—8 boxes. Top of Tiara (RS): Do not turn, working across long side of headband, ch 1, sk first box, 7 dc in next box, sc in next box, 3 dc in next box, 3 tr in next dc, 3 dc in next box, sc in next box, 7 dc in next box, sc in last box, turn. Remove one lp from hook, place lp on a safety pin. Keep the other lp on hook. Next Row (WS): With larger hook and 1 strand of yarn, working in front loops only (to create ridge on RS), ch 1, sl st in first sc, *sc in next dc, hdc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, tr in next dc, ch 5, sl st in last tr made (picot made), 2 dc in next dc, hdc in next dc, sc in next dc*; ch 1, sl st in next sc, ch 1; sc in next dc, hdc in next dc, dc in next 2 sts, (2 tr, picot, 2 tr) in next tr, dc in next 2 sts, hdc in next dc, sc in next dc, ch 1, sl st in next sc; rep from * to * once more; sl st in next ch-1 sp; working across short, side edge of headband, sl st in next 3 ch. Do not fasten off. 
TIES AND LOWER EDGING
Tie #3: Change to smaller hook, ch 129, sl st in 4th ch from hook to create a ring at end of ch, [ch 7, sc in ring] 5 times. Fasten off. Lower Edging: With RS of tiara facing, place lp on safety pin back onto larger hook. Working across short side edge of headband, sl st in next 3 ch, move Ties #1 and #2 out of the way; ch 1, [work 3 sc in next box, picot] 7 times, 3 sc in next box. Do not fasten off. Tie #4: Work same as Tie #3. 
FINISHING
Beads (optional) should not be used on tiaras for young children. Cut a 10"/25.5cm length of yarn and split the length into 2 strands, each strand should be thin enough to sew the beads to the tiara. Sew one bead to RS of each point of tiara (optional).

WAND
Stitches Used: Chain (ch), half double crochet (hdc), single crochet (sc), slip stitch (sl st)
Special Technique: Adjustable-ring method
Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that tail falls behind working yarn. Between finger and thumb, grip ring and tail firmly. Insert hook through center of ring, yo (with working yarn) and draw up a lp. Yo and draw through lp on hook (first ch made). Work sts of first rnd into ring. After first rnd of sts is worked, pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring. 
Notes: Beads are optional and should not be used on wands for young children. Star is crocheted with size G-6 (4mm) hook to create a dense fabric. To make sturdy star, take care to work with a tight tension. 
STEM
Thread yarn into yarn needle. Take needle through a 1/2"/1cm diameter bead. Draw yarn end through about 2"/5cm and glue end along side of one end of dowel. Glue bead to end of dowel. Wrap yarn around dowel, placing each wrap against previous wrap and glue in place as you wrap, until dowel is completely covered. Cut the end of the yarn and glue end to top of dowel. 
STAR (make 2)
Center Circle
Leaving a long beginning tail (for sewing beads to star), make an adjustable ring. 
Rnd 1: Work 10 sc in ring; do not join and do not turn—10 sc.
Rnd 2: Working in back loops only, 2 sc in each sc around—20 sc.
First Point—Row 1: Ch 1, working in back loops only, hdc in next 4 sc, turn. Row 2: Ch 2, sk first hdc, hdc in next 3 hdc, turn. Row 3: Ch 2, sk first hdc, hdc in next 2 hdc, turn. Row 4: Ch 2, sk first hdc, hdc in next hdc, turn. Row 5: Ch 1, sl st in first hdc, sl st evenly down side of point to top of Row 1. 
Second Point—Row 1: Working in back loops only, hdc in next 4 sc of center circle. Rows 2–5: Rep Rows 2–5 of first point.
Third and Fourth Points—Work same as Second Point.
Fifth Point—Row 1: Working in back loops only, hdc in next 4 sc of center circle; sl st in top of beginning ch of Row 1 of first point, turn. Rows 2–4: Rep Rows 2–4 of first point. Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sl st in first hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing two stars together around outer edges. 
FINISHING
Embellish Stars: Arrange beads on RS of star, as desired, and sew in place. Assemble Wand: Place top of dowel (end without bead) on WS of one star and glue to secure. Place second star on top of first star, matching the edges, and glue to dowel. Thread yarn tail into yarn needle and whipstitch the edges of the stars together. Weave in ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Stripes™”: 1 ball 942 Cancun Stripe MC or 944 Breezy Stripe MC.
RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 311 White A and 312 Black B.
Yarn needle, polyester stuffing, two black 1/8” (5mm) buttons, sewing needle, black thread, plastic pellets (optional).
abbreviations: * = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 16 rnds = 4” in sc with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
PONY
Body-Rnd 1: With larger hook and MC, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Rnd 3: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rnd 4: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 5: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Rnds 6 and 7: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 8: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rnds 9-14: Repeat Rnd 6.
Rnd 15: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rnd 16: [Sc2tog, sc in next sc] 6 times – 12 sc. Stuff firmly with polyester filler (and plastic pellets, as desired).
Rnd 17: [Sc2tog] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off. Weave yarn tail through last 6 sc, draw up firmly; fasten securely. Weave in ends.
Head-Rnds 1-4: Work same as Body Rnds 1-4.
Rnd 5: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 6: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rnd 7: Repeat Rnd 5.
Rnd 8: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 9: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Rnd 10: [2 Sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Rnd 11: Repeat Rnd 5.
Rnd 12: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Rnd 13: Repeat Rnd 5.
Rnd 14: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 15: Repeat Rnd 5.
Rnd 16: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rnd 17: [Sc2tog, sc in next sc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Stuff head firmly with polyester.
Rnd 18: [Sc2tog] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off. Weave yarn tail through last 6 sc, draw up firmly; fasten securely. Weave in ends.

AMIGURUMI PONIES | CROCHET
CROCHET  I  SKILL LEVEL: INTERMEDIATE

Legs (Make 4)-Rnd 1: With larger hook and MC, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc.
Rnd 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join –12 sc.
Rnd 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; join.
Rnds 4 and 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Rnd 6: Ch 1, [sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] twice, sc2tog; join – 9 sc.
Rnds 7-11: Repeat Rnd 4. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff legs.

Eyes (Make 2)-Rnds 1 and 2: With smaller hook and A, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: 2 Sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] twice, sc2tog – 9 sc.
Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. Stuff lightly. Weave yarn tail through last 9 sc, draw up firmly; fasten securely.

Eyelids (Make 2)-Row 1: With smaller hook and MC, ch 13; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, hdc in next 3 sc, slip st in next 2 sc, hdc in next 3 sc, sc in last 2 sc. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing.

Ears (Make 2)-Rnd 1: With smaller hook and MC, ch 2; 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 3: 2 Sc in each sc around – 8 sc.
Rnd 4: Repeat Rnd 2.
Rnd 5: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] twice – 6 sc.
Rnd 6: [Skip first sc, sc in next sc] 3 times – 3 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Tail: With smaller hook and MC, ch 5. Fasten off leaving a long tail for sewing. Cut three 4” strands of yarn. Fold strands in half forming a loop; insert the crochet hook into the end of the chain and draw the loop through, then draw the yarn ends through the loop and tighten. Pull plies apart to fluff and trim to about 1”.

Finishing
Sew all 4 legs to each other at the top of the legs, using the un-trimmed yarn ends. Tack the legs as needed to keep them from flailing out.
Attach the 4 joined legs by sewing securely to the bottom of the body, positioning them more towards the back to offset the weight of the head. Attach tail at the very back of the body. 
Pin head to body as pictured. Attach by sewing with yarn tail. Sew on eyes. Sew buttons to eyeball with needle and black thread. Pin eyelid on with the curved edge over the top of the eyes; sew in place, tacking down in a few places in the middle of the 2 eyes.
Using B and sharp yarn needle, embroider the mouth using an outline or running st. Make the nostrils using a French knot st. Outline eyelids with B using a running or outline st. Weave in ends.
Mane: Cut ten 4” strands of yarn. Fold 2 strands in half forming a loop; insert the crochet hook into a loop on the back of the head and draw the loop through, then draw the yarn ends through the loop and tighten. Repeat with remaining cut strands. Pull plies apart to fluff and trim to about 1”.

Ollie the Owl
Designed by Michele Wilcox
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 885 Delft Blue A, 
629 Green Tones B, 320 Cornmeal C, and 312 Black D.
Crochet Hook: 4mm [US G-6].
Split-ring stitch marker, fiberfill, yarn needle.
GAUGE: 16 sts and 16 rows sc = 4” (10 cm). CHECK 
YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
Special Stitches 
sc2tog: [Insert hook in next st, yo, draw yarn through st] 
twice, yo, draw yarn through 3 loops on hook.
OWL
Starting at bottom with A, ch 2.
Row 1 (wrong side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—12 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] across, turn—18 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] across, turn—
24 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] across, turn—
30 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, work in back loops only, sc in each sc across, 
turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] across, turn—
36 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] across, turn—
42 sc.
Row 9: sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, [sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] across, 
turn—48 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, [sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] across, 
turn—54 sc.
Rows 12-20: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off A 
end of Row 20.
Row 21: With right side facing, join B with a sc in first sc, sc in 
each remaining sc across, turn.
Rows 22-29: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 30: ch 1, [sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc] across, 
turn—48 sc.
Row 31: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Row 32: Ch 1, [sc in next 6 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc] across, 
turn—42 sc.
Row 33: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc] across, 
turn—36 sc.
Row 34: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 35: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc] across, 
turn—30 sc.
Row 36: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc] across, 
turn—24 sc.
Row 37: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc] across, 
turn—18 sc.
Row 38: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc] across, 
turn—12 sc.
Row 39: Ch 1, [sc2tog over next 2 sc] across—6 sts. Fasten 
off leaving a sewing length. With yarn needle, weave sewing 
length through the sts of last row, gather tightly and secure. 
Whipstitch center back seam, stuffing before closing. 
Trim Round: With right side facing, join A in remaining front 
loop of any st in row 6, slip st in remaining loop of each st 
around, join with a slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
Head Feathers
This friendly fellow will encourage hours of 
imaginary play for a child or put the smile on the 
face of us older children. Crochet him in any colors 
you desire for yourself or someone you love.

With B, [ch 6, hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch 
across] 3 times. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length. Sew in 
place on top of head.
Wing (make 2) 
With B, [ch 10, dc in 4th ch from hook and each ch across] 
3 times. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length. Sew one to 
each side of body.
Eye Back (make 2) 
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), work 11 
dc in ring, slip st in top of beg ch-3—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 3, dc in first st, 2 dc in each dc around, slip st in 
top of beg ch-3—24 dc. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.
Iris (make 2) 
With C, ch 3, work 7 hdc in 3rd ch from hook, join with a 
slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off, leaving a sewing 
length. Sew one iris to center of each eye back.
Pupil (make 2)
With D, ch 2, work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join with a slip 
st in top of beginning ch-2. Fasten off, leaving a sewing 
length. Sew one pupil to center of each eye back. With yarn 
needle, weave sewing length through sts of last round, 
gather tightly and secure. Sew one pupil to center of each 
iris. Sew eyes in place on owl as pictured.
Beak
With C, leaving a sewing length, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, do not join. Work in a 
spiral, marking last st in each round and move marker up 
each round.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc] 
around—10 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc] around—8 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around. Begin stuffing lightly.
Round 7: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog over next 2 sc] around—6 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each sc around, slip st in next sc to join. 
Fasten off. With yarn needle, weave sewing length through 
sts of last round, gather tightly and secure. Sew beak in 
place between eyes.
